title: Highly Recommended
text: Excellent service (I especially would like to lift up Ari at the front desk, who was super helpful), great location, spacious room (for Manhattan standard), and reasonably priced.  The only complaint I had was that they could add one more elevator, as the waiting time was a bit too long during the busy hours.

title: Great location and service
text: Stayed 2 nights.   Lady at check in was fantastically nice and professional.   Location was close to metro and a short walk to battery park.   Elevators might have been a little slow sometimes, but otherwise all positive.

title: Great room, good location, terrible restaurant.
text: A cosy, clean room in a good location. However the connecting restaurant was very poor indeed. $58 for a poorly cooked fillet steak; the staff were not concerned in finding out why the steak was not up to scratch and were more interesting in still receiving their tip. This put a dampener on an otherwise brilliant trip.

title: Elevator disaster
text: Can't get to your room. This hotel only has three elevators that service 44 floors. Each floor has ten rooms. Assuming two guest per room you get to approximately one thousand guests trying to squeeze into three elevators. Give yourself at least 15 minutes to wait in line for an elevator.

title: Great location, rooms OK, elevators terrible
text:
Great location with an excellent Italian restaurant connected where I had dinner my first night, and then breakfast my first morning.  Hotel itself was just ok.

Room was very cramped - I couldn't fit my suitcase in the closet with the safe and the ironing board and the awkward doors so I kept it on my desk.
The bathroom was very small with zero counter space, just a little shelf above the toilet. I had to move the toilet paper roll to the back of the toilet because if it was on the holder it interfered with the seat lid. 

View from Room 1107 was looking into another building. I thought Floor 11 would give me some kind of view, but disappointed that I looked at and into buildings. The only good thing was I was low enough that I didn't have to wait on the elevators very long on Wednesday and Thursday, but Friday morning was insane. Every car that came down was completely full. Three small elevators for 40+ floors is not enough, or they need a more efficient elevator system as I have seen in other high rises.  City noises were very loud which I was mostly able to drown out with my white noise app. I'd go higher if you are sensitive to noise at night. I could also hear doors slamming and talking/tv/music from other rooms well into the night. Definitely not a quiet hotel.

I left for meetings at 9am and when I returned at 5pm, my room still had not been made up.  They showed up a few minutes later and I told them just to give me towels and she did empty trash cans too. Would have been nice to have come back to this vs. trying to get ready for dinner while they serviced my room.  Coffee maker in the room - I went to put water in the tank, and it was dirty/dusty. I ran water through it a few times and tried to wipe out with a washcloth. Ew.  

Shopping and dining/bar options within walking distance. The sign in the elevator said there was a lobby bar, but I never saw it. Plenty of bar options easy walking distance or in the restaurant on the bottom level.

Hilton, you really should give your members free water every day like Marriott does. The front desk staff were ok but not overly friendly.

It wasn't terrible, but I might look at other nearby options next time.

title: Quick Trip
text:
We had to travel to NY for a quick overnight and found this hotel 400ft from the location of where we were going. In general, the location was fabulous as it's central to so much in the financial district. 
Upon check in, I thought there was a valet and became very flustered. We were told to go to the 2nd floor to check in and I was overwhelmed as there was no one to help me get a lot of stuff upstairs. There were carts, but they were horrible to navigate. The elevators were packed and took a ton of time while I waited to get to the second floor. My fiance took the car to look for parking and it was very stressful.
Once I got to the second floor to check in, I was greeted by the nicest man. I was having a bit of a meltdown and he was kind, patient and generous with me. He apologized for the misunderstanding and gave me directions to the closest garage (which I texted my partner). He gave me a bottle of water and helped me relax. 
Once I unloaded everything in my room I was much better, but the experience was not fun alone. I wish they had bellhops or someone to help. The issue is that the space is small, there's 44 floors and not enough room in the 3 elevators. 
Room was great. Small but clean, charming and comfortable. Had a great view! 
I would actually stay again now that we know what to expect. The only downside is the elevators. When we checked out (and they did give us a late checkout which was nice) - we had to wait 30 minutes to get from the 42nd floor down to 2nd floor lobby. It was so bad they had to send someone up on the service elevator to come get us. 
If you aren't in a rush, don't have a ton of stuff to take to your room and it's a quick trip - this hotel really is worth the money.

title: Weekend workout
text: Upon our arrival at this establishment I was still fuming about being forced to slum it across the Atlantic (in club world) and I was eager to get to a comfy bed. The first inconvenience occurred when we were directed to use a lift to reach the salle d'attente on the second floor, cue the PA struggling to fit my 15 piece matching set of Louis Vuitton luggage (and his back pack) into the rather tight elevator. I left the PA to carry out all the check in formalities, however I was rather flabbergasted to see him spinning a wheel as if he was some kind of game show host. It was then back to the elevator to reach our room on the 23rd floor, this is where problems started as all the lifts were full of other patrons; I instructed the PA that he would have to take the stairs with my 15 piece matching set of Louis Vuitton luggage. I eventually managed to get myself into an elevator after being told to go in sideways and not touch the sides. Obscenities began to be shouted towards the PA when he finally showed up to the 23rd floor because he hadn’t left me the room key, he then ushered me into the room which was rather diminutive. First thing I noticed was how cold the room was and I had visions of having to sleep in my morning dress, the PA found the thermoregulator and turned up the temperature; what a mistake that was at it sounded like the PA had started a diesel generator. For a quick dinner I allowed the PA fetch something called a “takeout” however he hadn’t picked up any silverware, I found some coffee stirrers in the room and we had to make do with those to eat the Mac’n’cheese (pasta and a cheese sauce). The beds were incredibly comfortable which resulted in both of us feeling very refreshed come dawn, this came in handy for the PA as due to the popularity of the lifts there was a wait so I demanded to be carried down the stairs (I don’t like burning calories unnecessarily). The gentleman on the ground floor was always very courteous and I tipped my top hat each time we passed. It was a little disappointing to find the housekeeper hadn’t cleared any of our detritus we’d left beside the receptacle, likewise the coffee stirrers weren’t replenished which resulted in the PA having a mac’n’cheese flavoured coffee. For our early flight from JFK I requested the PA to request a station wagon from reception, this was met with blank stares resulting in us vulnerable gentleman having to brave the conditions at an ungodly hour trying to flag down a cabriolet. Ultimately despite the few negatives our weekend retreat at the DoubleTree New York Downtown was pleasant and enjoyable, if the PA booked this boarding house again I would be fine with it.

title: It was Ok
text: It is an ok location, bit rough on the street the hotel is located on. The hotel rooms are very very small although the bed was very comfy.  We wouldnt return to this hotel. The wait for the lifts are a bit much also.

title: Deposit
text: Nice enough hotel , lifts were rubbish but didn’t affect our stay , only negative for me is that I still haven’t received my deposit back and no one knows anything when u speak to people ………………………………………….  ………………………………………………………………………………..

title: Great location but small....
text:
Booked this hotel as it seemed centrally located for our NY plans.
And it was a great choice, subway is less then half a block away! Restaurants all over, Wall Street bull 5 mins away, pier to catch the ferry for the Statue of Liberty less then a 5 minute walk, WTC about a 8 minute Uber.  It fit all our needs except the cost, wow, WAY expensive, but again, this is New York...
The room was also very small for 2 people with the bathroom even smaller....
It was clean, had a decent bed but did I say small.....
The elevators were at times slow but never had to wait longer than 5 minutes.
Warm cookies whenever you wanted...👍
We would stay again if we could find a lower rate, overall a good mini vacation...

title: Fabulous stay during busy holiday time
text:
Have just returned from a 4 night stay here as a family of 4 in a suite. Before our visit I communicated with Karl as my son has  mobility issues and I was concerned with the reviews about the wait for lifts. Karl was very accommodating and gave us a room on 4th floor. 
The room was great, very spacious with a corner sofa bed in sitting room area and huge bed in bedroom area. We had 2 large TVs and a fridge. The bed was so comfy and room very clean. We loved the location, so many things so close to hotel and in a quiet street -  Wall Street, raging bull, Battery park, Staten Island Ferry all a short walk away. We got the subway to everywhere else, the station was at the bottom of the street. 
Our children loved the warm cookies at reception, this was a lovely touch especially during the holidays.

We will definitely be returning to this lovely hotel on our next visit and thoroughly recommend it. Thank you for a great stay :)

title: Perfect in all ways
text: From checkin to checkout the experience was fantastic,the staff on the front desk ladies and gentlemen were so welcoming and helpful,we stayed on the 44th floor and had some spectacular views of the city,we have stayed in New York a good few times and this hotel was one of the best tbh,the location and experience was perfect,the room was cleaned spotlessly everyday and all amenities refilled without asking,ignore reviews about the wait for the lifts as the longest we waited was 5 mins max and this was a Christmas time too,zero noise and overall a great family experience

title: Pleasant and very clean.
text:
Great hotel, close to Staten island ferry terminal, state of liberty and Ellis Islands ferry. Great for the subway to uptown New York is only a few stops away from time square. Central terminal and also walking distance to 9/11 museum and memorial sites.
The only issue with the hotel is the slow lifts and the drinks facilities in the room,  apart from that we had an excellent time and a very clean hotel. Would highly recommend it.

title: Good location and staff, tight rooms with very little bathroom storage
text: The service was good, and location was great; logistics and infrastructure were hard to overcome. The rooms were tiny - luckily we booked two for two adults due to our long stay, which was something we were fortunate to do, but would have made it a challenge otherwise just to unpack and store luggage, clothing, etc. The bathroom would benefit from better storage and surfaces - as a woman with a lot of products, I found my mornings stressful as I ran to and from the main room to use toiletries / makeup / etc, since there was nowhere to put things other than a narrow edge next to the pedestal sink, the top of the toilet (ew) or a very narrow glass shelf above the toilet that was installed at an angle. I learned this when I put a bottle of sparkling water there (they are sold at reception but without access to a bottle opener in any room - we had to buy one), and the bottle slid off a moment later when I turned away, leaving a giant mess to clean up. These are seemingly minor details but make a huge difference when it comes to getting ready in the morning or evening! As others have noted, elevators took a long time since there were only two (or three? A third in the corner rarely seemed to be operating) for 44 floors. The staff was great and did everything they could have done to make the stay great - thank you!

title: Nice staff, postage stamp room, strong smell of smoke/pot right outside & in lobby stairwell.
text:
Don’t stay here unless you are a pothead & like to inhale smoke fumes. Or if you want a postage stamp room & like loud street noise.
I am no stranger to NYC & have probably been here 25x. I have stayed in Midtown, the Village, upper east, upper west sides & have never had such a small room. Not enough room for 2 people. 
Stayed here due to a wedding in the area. Have been in NY in Dec. before  & it is extremely crowded. Once or twice is enough. 
Strong smell of pot outside that follows you into the hotel no matter what time of day or night (even @ 9 AM). People smoking in stairwell between ground level & lobby level. 
The slowest elevators ever. It was quicker walking up/down 15 flights of stairs.
After constant inhaling of smoke/vapes I woke up with physical symptoms. Nauseating odors & did not feel well during the wedding-scratchy throat, symptoms of inhaling smoke. No, it was not Covid. 
The street noise kept us up. Never had that happen on previous trips. 
The room size was not what was advertised & no larger rooms were available (I am an Honors member). 
The only positive is very nice staff. We did not complain about the smoking just tolerated it.  
It was a 3 night trip & we were not in our room a lot. I will never stay here again & resent that I ended up with physical issues due to other idiots smoking/vaping. 
Area is walking distance to WTC/Wall Street. Not an area I would ever stay in except the wedding venue was nearby. Could not wait to leave & I usually love NY.

title: Decent hotel
text:
Decent room. Small but that’s to be expected. It cost roughly £200 a night, which was reasonable for NYC around Thanksgiving and compared well with other hotels at the same time.  A last minute booking would have been even cheaper, down to £125 per night.  The bed was comfortable and the aircon/heating worked well. 

It is true you can be kept waiting a while for lifts/elevators but we didn’t find it too bad.  One afternoon we found that our room still hadn’t been serviced by 4.30, but a call to reception quickly sorted it.  The check in guy seemed nice and we got a free cookie!  

I liked the location of this hotel. It’s close to at least 3 subway stations, giving you good connections to pretty much everywhere. Whitehall Street is the very closest, literally 100 yards away.  Take the R or W trains uptown to Times Square and other destinations.  Bowling Green and South Ferry are also close by. You’re also close to the ferries for Liberty Island and Staten Island.  It’s round the corner from the NYC transit shop which I loved.  There’s loads of eating places around.  I liked that we weren’t right in the middle of everything - Times Square would be too noisy and busy I think.  

Overall I’d recommend the hotel.  However it is high rise (44 storeys) so it might be one to avoid if you don’t like being on a high floor.  I’ve never been in a lift with so many buttons - but noticed that strangely, there’s no 13th floor!  

One final thing.  It is possible to get to JFK from here on the subway from Bowling Green station (use the elevator in front of the American Indian museum) and changing at Fulton Street to the A train, then getting the Airtrain to JFK at Howard Beach.  No steps involved at any point.  It costs $10 each and took us just under two hours from hotel lobby to check in desk.  The hotel can arrange a taxi but this will set you back around $100.

title: Fabulous they were so welcoming we asked for a low floor and got one so there was no waiting around for lifts.
text:
Amazing so friendly. The room was fab loved everything about it. Right near Battery Park. Very clean nothing was too much trouble, I'll be booking for next year.
Great they have aircon that heats up the room too.

title: Pessima struttura e pessimo lo staff
text: Pessima struttura,  stanE sporche . In fase di pagamento i loro sistemi non sono compatibili con nessuna carta di credito e dopo vari tentativi non andati a buon fine ci hanno pure bloccato le carte di credito. Un odissea aspettare le ascensori. Non consigliato

title: Séjour suite au marathon
text:
J’ai passé un excellent séjour dans ce chouette hôtel.
Chambré assez spacieuse personnel au top petit déjeuner très complet.
Staff très aimable avec un petit coup de cœur pour le sosie de Spike Lee hyper sympa.
Je remercie également giovani pour ses conseils de club de jazz.
Emplacement au sud de manhattan plusieurs lignes de métro à disposition et commerces et resto.
A recommander sans pb.

title: Elevator situation is terrible
text:
I would never stay here again due to the elevators.  I’ve stayed in many hotels in NYC and worked in Manhattan office buildings where elevators are busy.  This is something else.  It’s unsafe.  I hated waiting for an elevator by myself in a narrow hallway for 10+ minutes to have to shove myself on an elevator like it’s a NYC subway car.  The elevator situation is so bad that you could spend up to 30 minutes a day trying to get to and from your room.  Good luck taking the stairs since the rooms start on 11 or 12 and go to 44. 

The room was clean.  Check in was easy.

title: Hotel for financial district and ferry.
text:
Nice NYC hotel that's close to the financial district and ferry. It's good if you want to be close to the ferry for the marathon start. Plenty of subway stations nearby for easy travel. Keith S was great at checkin!

I have to agree with everyone else that the elevator situation is horrendous. Waited long times for it just to realise its completely full. We were on a high floor and people would just get in the elevator on any floor even if it was going up. It was not great as you needed to add 10 minutes to your trip just to get out of the hotel. :D

title: Pessimo hotel, da non prenotare
text: Pessimo hotel, personale scortese, ascensori che non funzionano. Davvero sconsigliato. Il servizio non è’ sicuramente all’altezza della catena Hilton. I letti vengono venduti come matrimoniali ma sono una piazza e mezza. Esperienza terribile

title: Doubling Down with the PJ Elevator
text:
This was my second time staying at this hotel. The rooms are comfortable, but if you are checking out on a Sunday FORGET about trying to get on the elevator! We waited for the elevator for 20 minutes only to have to walk down the stairs! People were riding the elevator up just to be able to get on to take it to the lobby! 
Outside of that, you can ever go wrong with the warm cookies at check-in. I feel like after what you have to endure to check out, they may want to give cookies as a parting gift.

title: really nice place to stay
text: loved it , staff are lovely and very helpful. Our room was very well furnished and very clean, lovely soft bed and soft towels. we asked for a taxi for jfk to be arranged for our last day , this was no problem for them and everything went smoothly . ps we were given lovely warm cookies on our arrival much appreciated , very near 9/11 memorial , wall street . stock exchange and wall street bull and tube right across rd  to get to times square with ease , we would have no hesitation in booking again.

title: Pulizia e posizione top
text: Camera ampia e molto pulita. Prezzo buono per essere a Manhattan e posizione top nel financial district. L’Hotel offre tanti servizi e il personale è molto gentile e disponibile. Unica pecca gli ascensori, si rischia di dover aspettare parecchio tempo essendo un hotel di 44 piani. Va a fortuna, noi essendo al 15esimo piano non abbiamo mai dovuto aspettare molto.

title: Comportement décevant
text:
Nous avons organisé un voyage avec un groupe de 32 personnes, y compris des enfants issus de la protection de l'enfance en France, en collaboration avec le groupe Fram. Nous avons choisi de séjourner dans cet hôtel.

Avant notre arrivée, j'ai pris des dispositions en France pour faire livrer 32 cartes de métro à l'établissement. Il était convenu que ces cartes nous seraient remises dans l'après-midi de notre arrivée.

Cependant, à ma grande surprise, lors de mon arrivée à l'accueil, les agents m'ont informé qu'il n'y avait aucune trace de ces cartes de métro, bien que l'agence de voyages avait confirmé leur livraison le matin même à 10h30.

Face à cette situation, j'ai contacté l'agence en France, qui m'a fourni tous les détails de la livraison. Le lendemain, j'ai réitéré ma demande à la réception de l'hôtel, mais aucune carte de métro n'était disponible. À ce moment, un ami a évoqué la possibilité de contacter la police et de vérifier les enregistrements des caméras de surveillance de l'hôtel.

De manière surprenante, deux minutes après cette demande, les 32 cartes de métro ont été miraculeusement retrouvées dans une enveloppe. Cette série d'incidents soulève des inquiétudes légitimes quant à l'honnêteté de certains membres du personnel de l'hôtel, et cela a sérieusement compromis notre séjour.

Malheureusement, malgré mes réclamations, je n'ai reçu aucun retour. De plus, il est regrettable qu'il n'y ait pas de chocolat chaud disponible pour les enfants au petit déjeuner.

title: Excellent!!
text: The staff is phenomenal, the hotel is very clean, and the location is just right. The elevator is slow, but the accommodations, professionalism, and customer service from  the staff makes up for it. A special shout out to Jesús, his work ethic is top tier.

title: Bene ma non benissimo!
text:
Il mio albergo per 5 notti a New York tirando le somme è stato un buon albergo.
Buona la posizione per visitare la zona di Wall Street e World Trade Center, comodo a diverse fermate della metro, carina la camera, pulita, con grande doccia e letto comodissimo. Questi sicuramente i punti di forza.
Ho apprezzato anche moltissimo la macchinetta tè/caffè in camera, con i prezzi che ci sono a New York mi ha salvato la colazione che ho integrato con 2 croissant al baracchino all'angolo della strada.
3 ascensori effettivamente, come tutti dicono, sono pochi, però a parte quell'ora che va dalle 16 alle 18 dove ci sono i check in in cui arriva gente, nelle altre fasce orarie non ci sono problemi e non si aspetta.
L'unico appunto che proprio devo fare è che ci è stata assegnata una camera comunicante ad un altra e le prime due sere sentivamo i vicini adiacenti praticamente come se fossero nella nostra. Fortunatamente poi si è svuotata. Questo non si fa! si danno alle famiglie!
Se non fosse per questo meritava 4 pallini... È un buon albergo.

title: Udmærket hotel i finansdistriktet men for få elevatorer
text:
Elevatorerne er den primære årsag til at vi giver fire og ikke fem stjerner.
Resten er positivt. Personalet er venlig og serviceminded, værelserne er fine og større end forventet (har oplevet mindre værelser på f.eks. Cabinn hoteller i Danmark). Hotellet ligger tæt på flere subway linjer (gul, grøn, brun og rød linje), Battery park, færgen til Staten Island, vandet og børsen (NYSE). Brooklyn bridge ligger indenfor fornuftig gåafstand. 

Efter nærmere overvejelser valgte vi ud fra pris og anmeldelser dette hotel til 10 overnatninger i New York city (Manhatten). Ud fra anmeldelserne var vi forberedt på at elevatorerne kunne være en udfordring og det holdt stik. Elevatorerne er såmænd fine nok. Der er bare for få! Tre elevatorer til 44 etager er i underkanten og giver i perioder ventetid. Især morgen/formiddag samt eftermiddag. Altså når folk tjekker ud og ind. De fleste vil nok blive irriteret over dette men det er til at leve med hvis man er forberedt på risiko for ventetid. Vi prøvede trapperne både ned og op (sidstnævnte kun én gang...) men det kræver en vis fysik. 
Der er en stor isterningmaskine på hver tredje etage og desværre også på vores (32. etage). De larmer noget. Depositum på 350 dollars var i den høje ende men nok af en årsag. Vi havde faktisk to værelser pga. familie og slap med at betale depositum for et værelse.  :-)

At hotellet ligger i finansdistriktet gør omgivelserne fredeligere end f.eks. Times Square (og priserne noget mere spiselige). Tæt på hotellet er der et par købmænd og ok udvalg af madsteder (herunder take away). Vi satte især pris på poke bowl. 

Generelt tip i New York City: Det er dejlig nemt at bruge VISA kort direkte i subway i stedet for at købe et subway kort, som skal tankes op. Udgiften på ugebasis kan makimalt blive 34 dollars. Vi gik meget men brugte også subway meget.

title: Great location, great staff, great hotel
text:
This was a great choice.  The hotel is in an excellent location with access to so many different subway lines.  It makes getting round NYC so easy.
All the staff we encountered were lovely, friendly and professional, particularly the lady at check in.
The room was spotlessly clean and serviced daily. 
Yes the lifts are annoying - we were on the 41st floor so stairs weren’t really an option.  But it wasn’t a deal breaker as tourists - didn’t have anywhere to be on time.
I would stay here again and highly recommend

title: Stanza super per gli standard newyorchesi
text: Ottima posizione vicino alla metro, pieno di ristoranti e bar, vicino al toro di Wallet street. Letto comodissimo e stanza abbastanza grande rispetto agli standard di New York, doccia enorme e cambio asciugamani giornalieri. Ci sono 3 ascensori per 44 piani di stanze, ogni tanto bisogna aspettare l’arrivo di almeno 1 ascensore ma non è così lunga l’attesa come ho letto in altre recensioni. la reception è al 2 piano dove si trova computer, stampante, bevande e snack, caffè e te. Consigliatissimo!

title: Gut für einige Tage
text: Für die 4 Sterne fehlte noch etwas an Qualität. ( Wasser musste man sich selber kaufen) aber Personal war ganz nett und Zimmer sauber. Leider waren die Zimmer sehr klein und somit hatte man kaum Platz  seine Koffer zu öffnen

title: Ci tornerei.
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questa struttura per sei notti. La stanza è pulita. Ci hanno pulito la stanza, rifatto il letto e cambiato gli asciugamani tutti i giorni. Il personale è davvero molto gentile. La posizione per me è ottima, lontano da tutta la confusione. Ho letto molte recensioni che parlano di un problema con gli ascensori, noi abbiamo solo riscontrato qualche problema di attesa una domenica. Pe il resto abbiamo atteso al massimo 5 minuti. Non lo so, forse uscivamo ad orari diversi rispetto agli altri.

title: Never disappoints
text: The Double Tree remains one of the most consistent, comfortable and convenient hotels we use often. The staff is always helpful and cheerful despite frequently having to deal with large numbers of guests all at once. The location and neighborhood are great and continue to improve post-pandemic. Be aware that there are not enough elevators and delays can be substantial, but if you plan ahead and bring a healthy dose of patience, they are manageable too. Will continue to stay there often.

title: Rubbish
text:
Noisy, long wait for the elevator, and very basic and LONGEST check in ever which is not what you need at midnight after a long day of travel.

If I had to choose a ‘pro’ then it would be the cookie. 

Pretty much sums the stay up. Wouldn’t return if the room was free.

title: Un solo grosso difetto: ascensore
text: Hotel etichettato Hilton (ma di Hilton ha solo il nome) in un grattacielo di 44 piani nel Lower Manhattan. Posizione buona: nelle vicinanze si trova ogni comodità (bar, negozi, ristoranti ecc ecc) e sono presenti 4 stazioni servite da almeno 5/6 linee metro. Camera un po' piccola per soggiorni lunghi. Letto King dove si dorme da incanto. Bagno piccolo. Tutto sommato ottima scelta se non fosse per gli ascensori: troppo pochi rispetto al numero di piani e di persone ospitate.

title: Get a room ending in “01” and be patient with the elevators
text: Great location and the staff is really friendly and helpful.   Luggage storage on ground floor and check in is on 2. Breakfast on ground floor a little expensive. Usual comfy Hilton beds, good WI-FI, coffee shop next door. Plan on waiting for elevator on check out. Good location for subway stops. Great bar across the street.

title: A great location
text:
Just returned home after staying here for four nights.
Check in was swift and the staff were pleasant and polite.
I had noticed in reviews that other guests had commented on the size of their bedroom. My room was perfectly adequate, modern and spotlessly clean. The room had a safe, iron, ironing board, coffee maker etc. The bed was particularly comfortable. 
As is mentioned elsewhere, there are only three elevators, but to be fair I didn't experience any overly excessive waiting time and I was on floor 19. 
The hotel is situated minutes away from the subway at the Staten Island Ferry terminal. Lines 1, N, R will take you directly uptown to 34th Street for Macys and Empire State, 42nd Street for Times Square and 50th Street for Broadway.
Lots of coffee shops in the immediate vicinity of the hotel and a drugstore.
Ideal location for ferries to Liberty Island.
I would certainly stay here again.

title: Ottima posizione
text:
Hotel situato in una ottima posizione di New York 
Camere spaziose e pulite
Buona la colazione
Bagno ben fornito con ampia doccia con vari tipi di sapone
Un po’ debole il getto dell’acqua
Nota un po’ fastidiosa le attese  lunghe per prendere gli ascensori

title: Amazing
text: Really enjoyed our stay at the double tree by Hilton down town New York all staff were very friendly and welcoming but massive thank you to Venetta the receptionist who was very kind and helped us with all inquiries and needs . Rooms were immaculate

title: ottimo hotel
text:
esperienza decisamente positiva. camera doppia molto spaziosa con letto king estremamente comodo e molto funzionale anche il bagno. Hotel pulito e macchinetta di caffe/acqua calda in camera.
posizione molto buona, hotel vicinissimo a moltissime linee della metro che lo collegano in pochissimo a tutta l’isola di manhattan.
per quanto riguarda il problema ascensori di cui tanto ho letto nelle precedenti recensioni, sicuramente un paio di ascensori in piu farebbero comodo ma a noi in 9 giorni è capitato solo una volta di dover aspettare 4/5 minuti. Insomma niente di preoccupante

title: Mixed Bag of a hotel experience
text:
The first bit of information I did not see posted anywhere else was that the lobby for this hotel is actually on the second floor. Not a big deal, unless you need an elevator. There are three elevators for all 44 floors of this hotel so you will be taking the stairs a fair bit. I winced at those who chose a high floor, we stayed on the fifth and took the stairs almost daily. We often had to wait in excess of 10 minutes for an elevator (which don't have A/C).
The rooms are smaller than you might expect, but they were very clean and well stocked with bathroom supplies. The beds are soft and the tv was a good size (around 40 inches). The room (we had a double), came with a tiny fridge-but it was enough to store a few drinks.
The on site gym is open 24 hours and has two treadmills, two ellipticals, a couple of bikes and a few weights, all in all, totally suitable for a workout.
The hotel is located within a block of a subway that can take you directly to Times Square in 15 minutes. 
We were also warned of a possible wifi charge but did not get charged with that, even after a four night stay. This is possible due to the 4 hour long fire alarm that occurred on our third night, starting at 3am and went until 7:30am. There was no explanation as to why this happened, but since no one else evacuated the hotel we stayed in our rooms, assuming someone had smoked in their room and the fire alarm was broken. It made for a very unpleasant night. Another night we had someone decide to vacuum outside our room after 10pm, so that was also annoying, and a first for me (I stay at a lot of hotels for work). 
The staff were always up-beat and polite and aside from a couple of issues we generally were fine with our stay, as I say in the title, it was a mixed bag of positives and negatives.

title: Do not visit
text:
Horrible service and theft of my AirPods Max worth £500 in the downtown new York double tree Hilton. I was told an investigation will take place with the hotel insurers reaching out but nothing. Would not recommend. 
Elevator service is absolutely terrible. It is faster to go down by very narrow stairs than the elevators. Service is horrible and cover theft.

title: A good nights rest!
text: My husband and I booked this hotel through Groupon and thought it was a really nice stay. The room was clean and the bed was comfy! The front desk staff were friendly and professional. Isaiah help me and he was wonderful! They must have fixed their “ slow elevators “ because we didn’t have to wait more than a minute when we needed one. We hope to stay here again in the future!

title: Fantastic Staff, Great Location
text: The staff were very kind and accommodating. We came in for our arrival WAY earlier than check-in, around 9AM. They had been sold out the night before, and had no rooms available for early check-in, as not only had we arrived before check-in, but also check-out for the previous night's guests! They were so understanding, and told us that the housekeeping staff was working as hard as they could to get rooms ready to go. We didn't have to wait too long, only about an hour or so, until Samantha came and gave us a few options for rooming. KEEP IN MIND, that we arrived nearly 8 hours BEFORE check-in, so anywhere else that hour wait we had would be 3x longer. Samantha and another woman who was with her (early morning on the 16th of July, I couldn't remember her name) deserve all the props!

title: Needs more elevators!
text: The positives are this is in a good location for battery park and to subway stations for uptown. The hotel and rooms are nice, modern and clean. The rooms are small, but that’s NYC hotels. The downsides are the elevators which are too few and too small for a hotel this size. On our first morning 4 full elevators stopped at our floor before we felt it would be quicker to walk down 31 flights of stairs. Top tip: it’s quicker to select Up and take the mostly empty elevator to upper levels before it comes back down and is inevitably full. The walls are also paper thin and we could hear our neighbours.

title: Great location in lower Manhattan
text:
As others write, the two downsides to this hotel are (1) few and slow elevators; and (2) small rooms. If you know this ahead of time, it is not a problem. I stayed on the 43rd floor and rarely had to wait more than 5 minutes for an elevator. The room was comfortable. I had city view which is nice. The location of the hotel is great. From the door, you are a short walk to anything in lower Manhattan. Great restaurants and access to tourist sites. 

The people at the front desk were great; I felt welcomed with professionalism.

title: Nice location but that was all
text: We were told that this was a 4 star hotel, but many things weren’t that classy. Worst experience was the elevators. We had to leave half an hour earlier to have enough time for the elevators. Breakfast was located in the restaurant downstairs and was extremely pricy. 20 dollars pr person is a lot to pay extra just for breakfast. The room we had was extremely small. 4 persons were unable to open their suitcases at the same time. The staff at the hotel seemed quite indifferent with our stay. They were only interested in the deposit which we had to pay twice seing that we were locked out of our room when the first deposit was used. No kind of trust in people. So only nice thing is the location very close to the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.

title: Buon hotel nel cuore di Manhattan
text: Abbiamo alloggiato in questo hotel durante il nostro soggiorno a NY, posizione ottima a Manhattan  a due minuti a piedi da Wall street, camere pulite, colazione ricca e personale cortese e disponibile. È presente anche un distributore di bibite

title: Security risk
text: This hotel has way too many floors for the amount of elevators available. Wait times were excessive and I found taking the stairs was more convenient even for being on the 33rd floor. Also, the hotel staff assigned my room to someone else. Upon finally getting up to my room to relax, i was completely startled by my door opening to a stranger who was assigned the same room number. After needing to sort this mess out, i had a difficult time feeling safe in my room for the remainder of my stay and i will never return for another stay at this hotel.

title: 5 star New York Experience by 5 star Hotel
text:
The staff went above and beyond (specifically Mr. Diogenes C. (GM) & Mr. Brian G. (Billing)) to ensure my stay was 5 stars! I can’t say enough about their customer service. 

The hotel is nice, clean, comfortable, and in a wonderful location that is walkable to many great attractions. 

My stay in New York was excellent and this hotel was a big reason for it!

title: Great Experience
text: The best and most helpful hotel staff that I have had the pleasure of meeting.  Although the elevators are painfully slow(especially at check-in and check-out) the helpful people that work there far outweighed that.  We will stay here from here on out while in NYC.

title: Great hotel
text: Great stay. Stayed 4 nights and no complaints. Staff was very nice and accommodating and the room was nice. Room service came every day to clean. Great location next to Wall Street with many things nearby to walk. Would stay again.

title: Enjoyable Thanksgiving
text: We have stayed at this hotel several times and keep returning. The staff is always very pleasant and accommodating. The rooms are small (typical for New York), but always clean, well kept and meet our needs. The location can't be beat for subway access and easy walk to the Ferry if needed. The one constant downside remains the challenges with the minimal elevator space to serve the large facility which can result in long delays.

title: What you pay for
text: The hotel is worth what we paid. By no means was there anything wrong with the hotel or room but it was nothing to scream about. The location was perfect fir us in lower Manhattan and was only a short walk away from subway stops, places to dine out and the viewing platform for the Statue of Liberty and Battery Park. The room was a standard room fitted with expected items such as a tv, desk, safe and AC and the bathroom had a walk in shower. The room itself would have benefitted from some TLC. Our sleep was good and the bed was comfy but it is easy to be woke up very earlier by everything happening outside coke the morning (traffic, road works, etc). But I guess this is to be expected in the city that never sleeps. There are three lifts to go up and down which probed to be of great difficulty because of the number of people trying to use them at once. We would often have a long wait for a lift and when it did come it was not always possible to fit in and you would have to wait again.

title: A Quick Stay
text: I stayed at the Doubletree New York Downtown for one night during an unexpected layover. The room was clean and there was a working TV. The hotel was quite busy for the summer season so there were always people in the lobby. The common spaces of the hotel were new and well maintained. This is definitely a hotel to stay at if you're on the go in the city as the rooms are on the smaller side with little frills. That said, it served my needs and would definitely recommend it for a tourist because of the location.

title: Beware of your possession
text:
Um again very disappointed with this hotel. I didn’t find the hotel staff most helpful told me the booking had been cancelled but already paid fully for the room which sent my anxiety levels up. After chat with booking agent they sorted out the mix up which was fine. 

Room was okay and spacious and views where decent. What bother me was a left about 4-5 dollars of change on the desk went out for the day and came back to see the coins had disappeared. I didn’t want come across being petty but whoever clean the room took the coins for whatever purpose. I spoke to the reception who where no help try to past the buck and decided to leave the matter but decided that I didn’t want room service to service the rooms. Luckily my other possessions where still there but did make me feel a bit uneasy. So if planning on staying at this hotel I would advise to put everything in the safe provided. Also the lifts can be very busy at times so would factor that in your planning. Also wasn’t told via booking agent that they would take  $300 deposit. Overall as come to New York often for work I wouldn’t choose this hotel again.

title: Nightmare Fuel
text:
This hotel runs on Nightmare mode.

TL;DR: Front desk staff gave a copy to my room to a total stranger who set up shop in my room, they didn’t care when I went to complain, downgraded me to a different room and gave me attitude because I was rightfully upset at their incompetence.  The stay was not charged to me as remediation.

04/12/2023 - I arrived on Wednesday to the front desk about an hour or so before check-in to drop my bags so that I could get something to eat nearby while I waited.  I was received by Jose Rodriguez (Assistant Front Office Manager) and he informed me that the room was ready and that because I was a long time Honors member I wouldn’t have to pay early check-in.  I thanked him and was very happy with this and so I went upstairs to leave my bags and get something to eat.

04/13/2023 - Day goes by as expected.  All is well in the universe.

04/14/2023 - The nightmare begins.  I leave the hotel after noon to visit an old friend.  I come back to the hotel somewhere around 10:30-10:45 pm that night and upon entering my room I notice someone has entered my room and left their bags, put their toiletries in the bathroom and even hanged up some clothing in the closet (See attached photos).  I immediately go into fight or flight mode, more fight as I stood my ground and stayed in the room.  I pickup the phone and call the front desk.  I explain the situation and the girl that answered the phone tells me I need to go to the front desk and I inform her I have all my valuables up in the room and someone else has access to the room to which I don’t feel comfortable leaving my stuff and also at this point I don’t know if someone has gone through my things or stolen anything.  I end up going downstairs, give my ID to prove my identity and the keycards to the room to the girl at the front desk, she immediately goes into what I call “Damage Control” mode.  She doesn’t give a damn about what has happened to me and she is only trying to cover herself and the hotels behind at this point and she lies about having no idea what has happened and that the system shows nothing (I am a Senior Systems Engineer, I know she’s full of it, I’ve dealt with keycard systems for years of my career, there is a log with details, she knows what happened).  I’m furious at this point, they send me up with a security guard and I check my belongings at that point to see if I am missing anything and I pack all my stuff and so that I can get moved to a different room as they have done NOTHING to remove the other persons items or anything at this point.  She tells the security guard via the walkie talkie to leave the room so that she can talk to him, obviously so I wouldn’t listen to whatever mess she’s about to fess up to.  He comes back in the room, I am packed and ready to go and he calls her over and asks if she has a room ready for me, she doesn’t respond and we end up having to go to the front desk.  She is still lying and acting like this isn’t a big deal, she switches me rooms and gives me a downgraded room because there are no more River View King rooms available.  She offers to not charge me the day as some sort of consolation prize, I asked her if she was serious and if she thinks that’s going to fix what just transpired.  She doubles down on her offer and says 2 nights! as if this was some kind of auction, I laugh using all the powers that exist in the universe to not go postal on the facility.  I ask for the manager of the hotel, some guy named Diogenes Castillo who is no where to be found and couldn’t probably care less, I ask for any manager and she says he wont be in until the next day at 3pm.  I go to my downgraded room, put every possible lock in place and barely sleep that night, wondering if someone’s going to come barging in and I have to be ready to fight.

04/15/2023 - I have barely slept and am up out of my bed pretty early, I then realize my very expensive medication is still in the room.  I go to the front desk and tell the same incompetent girl to call her security guy and inform her about my medication.  She tells me she has gone to the room and said that I left a bag there with my last name on it (I have not left a bag but now their incompetence is starting to make more sense, the person they gave a copy to shares the same last name as I, maybe even the first name), I chuckle and say unbelievable and walk away.  The security guard helps me secure my medication and the person who is staying there is not there but must be having a great time at my expense.  I leave and come back later at 3pm sharp, to no surprise the manager has not arrived yet, I am starting to understand why these people are so incompetent, they say lead by example, and that they do.  He finally shows up about 30 mins late and to no surprise it’s Jose Rodriguez!  He tells me that someone said I wanted to talk to him.  I’m thinking his team can’t be this terrible to have not even explained the situation to him.  Indeed they have, whatever twisted version the incompetent front desk girl gave him.  I give him my version and ask him what the heck are they going to do to make this right.  He slaps me in the face by offering my Honor points, I ask him if he thinks me foolish enough to ever stay in a hotel with the name Hilton on it.  He keeps trying to push the points on me and that I can use them for other things than stay or gift them to someone.  I offer to gift it to him, maybe he can use them one day, he declines.  He makes no offer that is enough although nothing they can offer will fix this situation.  We finally arrive at me not paying a penny for the stay, I say thats the least they can do, he offers dinner at the hotels expense at the downstairs restaurant to which I tell him I work for a living I don’t need charity or food, he offers a bottle of wine, I tell him thank God I don’t drink.  We settle at not paying for the room, I advise him to teach his employees some manners before someone else decides to do it for him and I leave with one more day at this forsaken place before I leave home.

04/16/2023 - I go to checkout pretty early, some other woman helps me and tells me she can’t check me out and that she will when the manager comes since he is going to zero out my stay so I don’t pay anything.  I tell her I will wait and I get a coffee and sit down to wait for Jose to show up.  He comes back, gives me a receipt thats zeroed out, he apologizes for the mess up, I shake hands with him and he says I hope you will come visit again, I laugh and tell him I will never step foot at a Hilton for the remainder of my natural life span, I leave this nightmare and go home.

title: Muy bien situado y hotel precioso
text: De lujo!! Hotel espectacular. Muy bien situado. Totalmente nuevo. Habitaciones amplias y modernas. Aunque no tuvimos suerte con las vistas. Dispone de todos los servicios. Personal amable. Dispone de zona de vending de alimentos.

title: Clean but we were let into another guests room
text: At check in the young lady checking us in had an AirPod in the whole time &  didn’t go over anything about the hotel eg, where & what time breakfast was or any other relevant info about the hotel. She told us what floor &  room (wrote it down) when we got to the room the key wouldn’t work. We called down & they sent someone to come help. They opened the door with a master key & went to get us new keys. As we walked into the room we all quickly realised we’d been sent to the wrong room & floor & we’d just been let into another guests room with all their belonging in there. We went back down to the reception to be given a room 10 floors higher than that. The room was very clean but basic with a lovely view of the Hudson River. We didn’t have a remote for our tv which wasn’t a big issue as we probably wouldn’t have used it. The wait time for the elevator was up to 20 minutes at points. For a 44 floor hotel 3 very small elevators isn’t sufficient. Concierge at the main door very helpful & friendly. On many occasions it felt the younger female who checked us in was unprofessional, chewing gum & had an AirPod in every time we seen her at the desk. The hotel also had a very strong smell of cannabis throughout. Overall it was in a good area and was very clean. Downfall was being let into another guests room with all their belongings & the wait times for the elevators.

title: Service with a smile
text: The concierge service was friendly and efficient. The waitstaff accommodated our special request at breakfast. The hotel was in a quiet area with easy access to the metro, fantastic coffee next door at Grumpy's if not in the mood for a full breakfast, other cafes nearby, we had the best sandwich around the corner. The hotel is also within walking distance to the ferry service. A few bars in the area and great pubs nearby with good food. Quiet location.

title: Nice Staff Left Dirty Underwear - Bad Hilton Diamond Support - Bonvage Hilton off to Marriott
text: Staff was nice.  Location good. Mattress too soft, dirty underwear left in room from prior guest.  Overcharged on breakfast $50 for oatmeal.  I had several rooms rented PLUS the "Board Room" for a meeting and our team spent a lot of money on lunch and dinners.  Even as a Hilton Diamond Member i was unable to get a satisfacory resolve on other issues too.

title: 2 night stay
text:
We were welcomed by friendly staff and arrived early but we were allowed early check-in. Room was small but very clean and comfortable. We spent all of our daytime hours sightseeing so the room size was not an issue. We found the room to be recently updated so that was nice. 

The bathroom light is on a motion detector which was very annoying at night when you want to use the toilet and 100 watts of very bright light abruptly blinds you. I fixed the problem the following night by taping a piece of cardboard over the sensor so that I could use the bathroom without tripping the circuit.

I received inquiries via test each day regarding the quality of my stay. It was nice to know I could have easily addressed any issue that may have risen. (I didn't have any issues to address).
The elevator on one occasion was slow in arriving but for the most part the wait was not too bad.

Hotel is in a very safe and convenient street within an easy walk of many restaurants and lower Manhattan tourist attractions. It's also a quick 2 minute walk from the Bowling Green subway station to the hotel. Very convenient especially if you are carrying a lot of bags.

We found the room cost to be a decent value for NYC pricing...which is one of the main reasons we booked at this facility.

We wouldn't hesitate to book another stay at this facility.

title: Charge early check in fee
text: This hotel was booked by my company for weekend business on 03/11/23.  Just be advised that when we attempt to check in at around 2 pm , the front desk female advised there were rooms available , but there will be a $30 early check in fee （ The check in time for this hotel is 4 pm ).  So plan your trip well !

title: Count 25 minutes to get down with the elevators during rush hour
text: Unless you need to be in this area it is better to avoid and take a hotel more uptown. This hotel is quite basic: small basic rooms. Breakfast is quite simple: no freshly baked bread but the plastic toast bread, not a lot of choice (besides scrambled eggs, bacon and pancakes), orange juice is not fresh but the industrial kind of orange coloured sugar water. The worst thing of the hotel were the elevators. During normal times of the day it took 5-10 minutes to get up or down. On rush hour (between 9.30 and 10.30 and around checkout time) it took us 25 minutes to get down from the 20th floor. I dont think I will try this hotel again as there are better options for the same price.

title: Short break away , perfect .
text: Our stay here was great from beginning to end , hotel reception staff and man who looks after luggage all pleasant and helpful, our room was lovely   Clean and modern , super comfy beds , nice bathroom and good shower , room on small side but we were out most of the time so not an issue for us. Hotel in good position to get around and see the sights of New York , would definitely stay there again . We had no issues with the lifts no long waits a couple minutes at best . The quicker way is to take lift from 2nd floor reception as ground floor does take longer but only a few minutes.  All in all thoroughly enjoyed our stay and loved New York .

title: Would recommend
text: Tabatha at front desk was amazing!!!  After our reservation was messed up Tabatha cleared up the mess. She went out of her was to accommodate us. We appreciate it! Looking forward to returning once again.  Who says people in New York aren’t nice??? Lol

title: Go meet Hopton at the DoubleTree Downtown NYC
text:
While this Manhattan  location is super for any stay, an even better highight is Hopton, the first person you meet during the day when entering. Although he is accountable for only storing luggage, this tiny ground foor entrance becomes the welcome Center since the Front Desk is up the elevaotr to the 2nd floor. This tall distinguished well spoken uniformed Jamaican offers such a professional, kind, helpful first face of the 35 stories + hotel, with only about 10 - 12  rooms per floor. 

The ground floor elegant small restaurant serves 3 meals - expensive yet tasteful and with class. Tuxedo Maitre D. ALL hotel staff are well trained and wonderuflly polite and hospitable. Housekeeping is superb as well as  DAILY. 

Listen up, Casinos, who are still dodging this amenity. 

The N, R and W are less than a block. The Bowing Green subway Stop for the 4 and 5 are 1.5 blocks. And the Red 1  S Ferry subway is maybe 3 blocks, the gateway to the Staten Island Ferry. Plenty of eateries for every palate close by. All price ranges. I usueally stay in Midtown. Never again. Price, location and quality of Staff here  will have me returning, always.  If there is a downside, I overlooked it or did not notice.

title: Für New York in Ordnung
text:
Gutes Preis-Leistungsverhältnis für New Yorker Verhältnisse 

Guter Roomservice

Mobiliar ist schon etwas in die Jahre gekommen.

Gute Lage, WholeFoods und U-Bahn sind zu Fuß zu erreichen.

Großer Nachteil: undichte Türen zu den Fluren - unbedingt Ohrenstöpsel mitnehmen!

title: Average at best but does the job
text:
Stayed here for five nights with my wife in Feb 2023.  

Room - our first room was very small as it was booked for accessibility.  Managed to move to another room the next day which Dider kindly assisted with.  
Rooms are a fairly good size but the showers take time to heat up.  The housekeeping staff were fantastic and they always made the room spotless.

The accessibility room i was booked in my opinion was very small and "non accessible".  I cant see how someone with accessibility needs can maneuver around the room.  This is something the staff and Hilton need to address  

Hotel - clean hotel but given there are only 3 lifts for 40ish floors of rooms you will be waiting a long time for them.  better off taking the stairs if you are able to

Location - perfectly situated around 3/4 subway stations on different lines.  Bars and restaurants are plentiful around the area

Staff - i found the day staff more friendly than the evening staff.  one instance was that i made a booking at a restaurant and needed to cancel but given my phone was not connecting to them i requested if the hotel can assist me in making the call.  was told "we cant do that as we dont know your details" even though i was standing there.  a simple request and was shunned away with a weak excuse.  

Summary - hotel is situated in a good area away form the hustle bustle.  good value for your money.

title: Safe stay in New York
text:
This was my first visit to New York and some of the reviews here for all hotels fluctuate wildly. I took some advice from a good friend who worked int his area for years  and am glad that we chose this Hilton. It is in a great location, near lots of subway lines and great restaurants such as Adrienne’s pizza and the Dead Rabbit all within a 5 min walk. It’s an extra 5 minutes away from the madness of Manhattan but we felt a lot safer and probably slept better too as a result. 
The rooms were totally fine for 3 and yes the lifts take 5/10 mins around busy times, but you are in New York!! The amount of people we saw complaining about lifts was ridiculous. Thanks to all the staff who made our stay relaxing including the bell man and maids who cleaned our room and gave us fresh towels every day.

title: NYC Family Vacation
text: This hotel is close to several lower Manhattan  attractions. It is a basic hotel but very clean.  They allowed us to check in early without paying extra and gave us cookies as a welcome gift. Reception is on the second floor which is kind of weird. The elevators are so slow it takes forever to get to your room (this is the only reason i would not stay here again). In general, It was ok.

title: Great Hotel, great rate! Financial District
text: Except for the lifts, this was brilliant value! Amazing staff, felt welcome and lovely comfy room and bed! It’s close to broad street station and commutable to the rest of NY but way at the bottom of the Manhattan map. Closest is NY Stock Exchange etc

title: Great time
text: We spent 4 nights here and everything was exceptional. The hotel is ideally situated to trave around the amazing city. The staff were friendly and helpful, nothing was too much for them. I would highly recommend.

title: Best accommodation in Wallstreet downtown Manhattan
text: Because of the high level of customer service provided by Dio the manager at the time. We were more than pleased, grateful and extremely satisfied with Dio specifically. The hotel itself is what you can expect from a budget hotel in nyc, with the added bonus of double tree cookies, coffee and tea maker in room, subway SUPER CLOSE less than 50 feet, pharmacy in the corner, and toiletries.

title: Soggiorno a New York
text: Hotel ben collocato tra mezzi di trasporto e ristoranti, camere pulite e letto comodissimo. Il personale è molto gentile e disponibile. I prezzi del bar sono favore lì rispetto al costo dei negozi. Lo consiglio!

title: Great Location. Would Recommend.
text:
Great location. Minutes walk away from several subway stations and not too busy.  Walking distance from 9/11 Memorial, Statue of Liberty ferries, Battery Park and Wall Street.
Nice hotel, helpful staff. Don't know what the fuss was about re the lifts to floors as we encountered no problems at all.
Beds are so comfortable, best nights' sleep ever! Rooms lovely and clean. Air conditioning was a bit noisy but can be controlled via the wall panel.
Would definitely return.

title: The staff is awesome!
text: The hotel rooms are small (this is NYC) and the hotel has 44 floors, 3 elevators and the lobby is on the 2nd floor. There is valet parking there at a reasonable rate. There is a restaurant on the 1st floor at the street level. The rooms are clean the staff is friendly. Any encounters with a staff member was associated with a smile and a greeting. One staff member was Arilisy, she is a supervisor at the front desk and was so friendly and engaging. Arilisy made us feel welcome and she went out of her way to make sure we knew she appreciated us being there. What a wonderful person.

title: More than happy with our stay !
text:
We are currently staying here at the moment . I have to say the hotel is great . The rooms are clean and of a good size . The elevators have been okay . It is a very busy time and yes you might have to wait 5 minutes . The desk service have been so helpful in particular VENNETA and ARILISY they have been so helpful with my daily outings .  I request that the manager recognised these young women . They are a credit to the team.

The hotel is in the best location 2 mins to the subway . We’ve been to New York 5 times and so far this is the best location . There are plenty of restaurants close by and it is safe  to walk around at night . 

I can recommend a stay here .

title: Comfortable hotel
text:
One of the most comfortable hotels I have ever been.

Short distance to the ferries for the Statue of Liberty.

Metro system walking down stance with 3 different lines and easy access to JFK Airport.

Only thing that was missing in my opinion is a mini bar in the rooms but in the reception area you can buy drinks and various snacks.

Just be patient for the lifts as it is 44 floors but even though there are 3 lifts you might have to wait a few minutes.

title: Schönes Hotel mit kleinen Mängeln ✌🏻
text: Ein modernes, solides Hotel im Financial District. Sehr nettes Personal, welches auch Extrawünsche berücksichtigt. Schöne Lobby mit kostenpflichtigen aber günstigen Snacks und Kaffee. Selbst eine Mikrowelle ist vorhanden. Sitzmöglichkeiten und Computer stehen bereit. Kleines aber sauberes Zimmer, modern eingerichtet mit großzügigem Bett. Durchgang zwischen Bett eng. Aussicht aus dem 30. Stock je nach Ausrichtung eher semi. Fenster ist bei -10 Grad 3 Tage lang gefroren gewesen. Aufzüge brauchen deutlich zu lange, oder sind oft voll. Essen nicht bewertest, da nicht genutzt. Insgesamt 4 von 5 Sternen!

title: During Christmas Holiday
text: I’m actually still here. So far my stay has been pleasant the staff is very friendly and helpful. Conveniently located across the street from a subway station. Restaurants both chain & local within walking distance. My only complaint is the elevator can take 20 min I’m on the 35 floor so I’m not walking up that number of stairs. I will stay again but ask for a lower room in case the elevator situation isn’t resolved. The rooms do not have refrigerators so if your like me & always have leftovers prepare yourself. I had to waste some good Caribbean food and I hate being wasteful. This wasn’t a deal breaker for me but you may want to consider that if you’re traveling with kids

title: Völlig ok!
text: Ich kann das Hotel nur empfehlen. Für den Preis kann man dort super absteigen. Die U-Bahnstationen Bowling Green und Whitehall liegen quasi vor der Haustür. Die Zimmer sind zwar klein, aber man ist ja eh nur zum schlafen da. Einziges Manko an der Unterkunft ist, dass die Klimaanlage ein bischen zu laut war. Da die Zimmerfenster keine neuwertige Isolierung bieten und wir zeitweilig -13 Grad hatten, sprang nachts die Klimaanlage immer an, das war etwas nervig. Ansonsten aber ein gutes Preis/Leistungsverhältnis. Ich würde es wieder buchen.

title: great experience
text: They let us check in a few hours early which was nice. every staff member said hello to us in passing, our room was exceptionally clean and with updated decor. they only had one elevator working during our stay, so we had to wait a little longer but that was no problem. other than that our stay was extremely enjoyable! close to wall street and the bull, very short walk to the subway and lots of things around the area. would definitely stay again!

title: After hundreds of nights in hotel this hotel was one of the worst. Room not clean, internet poor
text:
Room filthy on arrive. Someone else’s long black hair on my feet sheets were dirty. Double charged breakfast creating credit card billing problem. One wash cloth for 2 people. Internet not working. 
Room very small.

title: Not the best
text: Checked in late night on 12/4. I told the receptionist at the check in desk to make sure our room was freshened up with towels, paper cups etc in the morning, she noted it. Before heading out for the day on  12/5 I once again told the same receptionist to have our room 3006 refreshed up with clean towels, paper cups etc, when we returned around 4:30 our room was not cleaned..nothing was touched. I spoke with Jose Rodrigues the manager on duty & told him I wanted our room freshened up every day with clean towels, paper cups etc & he apologized & made a note that the room would be cleaned every day during the duration of our stay & gave us 2 free breakfast buffets vouchers. The second to last day our room was not clean, freshed up..nothing was touched. I spoke with Samatha who told me there was no manager on duty, the manager would be in the next day. I spoke to Deo the manager upon check out the next day & he did was once again apologize for housekeeping issue we have had during our stay & gave me 2 free breakfast buffet vouchers. The common denominator upon housekeeping issues was “I’m Sorry” with everyone I spoke to (clearly showed me they try just go through the motions of appeasing customers) For housekeeping/uncleanliness is not ok after repeated reminders to freshen our rooms up. We paid a lot on money. Next issue the safe was not closing so we asked for another & that safe malfunctioned as well when attempting to open several times we would get an error messages & after several attempts to open safe finally opened this happened several times. Finally the outlet in the restroom would not run the blow dryer. After several attempts to re-start the dryer, I noticed the outlet was already loose. I didn’t notify front desk cause I knew they would “bandage the problem” just like the room freshen up & safe issues

title: Nightmare Stay so Stay Away
text: This double tree hotel is absolutely old beat an incomplete disrepair. The joke was trying to get an elevator to start, which took me almost 20 minutes to get to my room. When you are laying in your bed you can hear the showers turning on in the surrounding rooms. You can hear the elevators, going up and down and stopping. You can hear every door shut and people talking in the hallway at all times of the night. This hotel is so poorly constructed there is absolutely no buffer of any noises. The guestroom furniture is in complete disrepair. It Hass to be at least 10 years old, scratched, dirty and unattractive when I was unable to sleep because of all the noise that I could hear I attempted to check out to change hotels, and the front desk person refused to let me leave the hotel , I was forced to call Hilton corporate and have them intervene so that I could leave the hotel. When my credit card bill showed up, they charge me for the two additional nights that I did not stay in the hotel. Do not stay at this hotel. You will be absolutely miserable and unable to sleep.

title: Get it together Hilton
text:
Staff wasn't consistently friendly. There were a few courteous staff while others did not maintain professionalism. There are only 3 elevators during high-peak hours. It can take an hour to make it to breakfast or late for your destination. 
Cookies were burnt.

title: We didn't get our cookies! Otherwise, OK.
text:
The hotel is clean and tidy. The room was small but manageable. My biggest peeve were the lifts, they were sooooo slow!
It's in a quiet location which was nice we could step away from the hustle and bustle.
We were both gutted that we weren't offered cookies though. After travelling for more than 12 hours we were so looking forward to them!

title: OK Hotel with a terrible restaurant
text:
Hotel itself is OK and 3 stars. Small room, slow elevators. But the front desk staff are friendly.

However, their restaurant Antica Ristorante is terrible.  Food quality is low. Watery eggs, soggy bacon. Not much other breakfast choices. 

Servers are not eager to serve. Most of the time just stand in front with nothing to do. They don't refill water.

To make it worse, bill automatically adds 20% tips on their inflated prices without our knowledge/permission. Our group size is 4. RUDE !! Maybe that's why they don't bother to work hard.

title: Below par,  average
text:
Had a recent 7 night stay at the DoubleTree Hilton Downtown NY and it was average at best. 

The situation with the lifts can be very annoying depending on the time of day and it is true you could be waiting for 20 minutes for the lift and I was on the 39th floor. It took me about 5 mins to walk down but after a 10 minute warning from someone else who was waiting before me I was not in a position to wait! Check in was very cold and as a HH Gold member I expected more (regardless). I had to extend my booking before arriving and after several calls with Hilton customer service nothing was acknowledged about ensuring I didn't have to switch rooms during my stay. Even getting a message on the app asking, 'how can we make your stay awesome ' WELL I DID RESPOND HOW but it was a waste of time!! So disappointing. So I was rudely told I would have to stay in one room and switch over then on the day I did there was another RUDE member of staff who was going to make me bring my luggage down in the foyer and come back at 4pm to check in again...WHAT A JOKE!!! I simply refused and waited to speak to another member of staff (Analisee,  I might have spelled her name wrong) but she finally used some level of customer service and swapped my room without any issue. Honestly they need to train their staff properly so inconsistent. 
HH Gold member gey a $18 credit for the breakfast buffet that will cost you $25 in total. The quality is poor, but it is a DoubleTree. The is an Essen round the corner where the quality is better for breakfast or lunch so just pay a bit extra and go there! I only used the $18 credit 3 times as it was more convenient but the staff were friendly and attentive.
The rooms itself were pretty good , first was a city view room and then a Hudson view room. The Hudson view room was quite nice in fairness and the view was decent. 
My city view room stank of weed, ironically on arrival and each time after the room was serviced. After a few days I then realised a number of the staff smoke weed themselves as when they entered the lift the literally stank of the stuff and the were doing the room cleaning. Way to go Hilton!!
The lift situation is exacerbated by the staff using the lift to go through the floors.  THEY NEED THEIR OWN LIFT OTHERWISE THE SITUATION WILL CONTINUE TO BE A PROBLEM 

The guy doing the luggage on the ground floor was nice and helpful for directions and general tips..!! He is an asset to the hotel.
The location is in Wall Street and is about 30 mins from Times Square on the subway. Its pretty easy to get around as there are a number of stations by the hotel.
The main reason people will stay here is mainly the price point compared to other NYC hotels. Having stayed in numerous Hilton and associated brands globally this one really let's the side down. The fact that it's relatively new is a joke and the decor in the city view rooms was poor.
I found the Riu Hotel near times Square as a friend was staying there and next time I'm in NYC I will definitely be staying there as for a similar price point this hotel was far superior!
Hilton points or no Hilton points!!

title: Rip off hotel. Don’t stay there
text: The hotel was close to Times Square. The staff were not friendly. I was ripped off by the hotel. When I went to book a taxi to the airport he said this man can help and pointed to the man next to him. I thought it was a bit odd. They charged me 120 dollars to get to the airport and gave the receipt in Spanish. When I complained to the hotel all they have said is the taxi firm is not allowed behind the desk and the cost is dependent on number of passengers and bags. I was travelling with my two teenage daughters. We had 2 normal sized suitcases and three carry on luggage. Ripping off a single parent.

title: Toilet water leaked into my room. They said I had to stay in there. I slept at the airport instead.
text: On the final night of my stay, my bathroom ceiling began to leak water. I overheard maintenance telling the front desk a toilet had overflowed on the floor above my room. The front desk tried to lie and tell me it was rain even though I was 15 floors from the roof and the rain was light. This is not only insulting, it is unsanitary. Don’t stay here. They’re unapologetic and disgusting. Worst NYC hotel I’ve ever stayed at by a long shot.

title: Old fashioned
text: The hotel is in a brilliant location, you’re a 4 minute walk from numerous subway stations and lines into uptown Manhattan and Brooklyn. The hotel itself is dated for the amount of money they ask for a night. This does not include breakfast. They also take a $250 security deposit on each room which we had not budgeted for. This was a lot on the 3 rooms we booked. The rooms are very small and dated. The toilet seat was loose in our room and the towel rack and hook on the back of the door were missing/falling off. There was no bath only a small shower. The building has over 40 floors and the wait for the lift daily was very long. We had to walk down 29 flights of stairs on a couple of occasions due to waiting ages for the lift. The staff were however lovely and polite.

title: Good for a business trip
text:
Good choice for a business trip. Good location in the city. The neighborhood is very interesting.
The rooms are cleaned and big enough for 1 person. The staff is very efficient and can help you if necessary.
Point of attention: the elevators are terrible...slow and far from being enough for a building of this size ! Plan in advance when you leave your room (especially if you are about floor 15 🙂

title: Better than expected!
text:
Actually in a good area, away from the huge hordes of tourists that you see in Midtown around Times Square. 
Extremely slow elevators that stop on many floors on your way down. Even staff use the elevators so if you are in a rush dont stay at this hotel.
I even took the steps down one day from the 30th floor, and it was faster..
Small rooms that look smaller than in their pictures. But at least my room had a mini fridge which was nice.
Overall I was actually positively surprised, as I stayed at a super nice hotel in Midtown but I liked this hotel more since it was way more quiet!

title: Assolutamente piacevole!
text: Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 8 giorni/7 notti. L'esperienza è stata più che piacevole: lo staff è gentile e disponibile, la nostra camera doppia era spaziosa e dotata di tutte le comodità (armadio, cassetti, scrivania, poltrona, cassaforte, tv, té e caffé), gli ascensori non troppo affollati e tutto sommato veloci, e il nostro piano molto silenzioso. La pulizia non viene effettuata quotidianamente: ci hanno cambiato gli asciugamani tutti i giorni, rifatto il letto ogni due giorni e cambiato le lenzuola una volta sola (ulteriori pulizie sono a pagamento). Quello che personalmente avrei preferito è un cambio di asciugamani in meno, ma una pulizia dei pavimenti/piatto doccia in più. Infine, la posizione dell'hotel è ottima: situato in una zona tranquilla, è vicino a più fermate della metro, a più Starbucks per la colazione e a Battery Park, ottimo per le passeggiate. Lo consiglierei per chi preferisce una posizione comoda, ma meno caotica dei classici hotel a Times Square.

title: The work experience as a traveling manager
text: On my arrival acceptance done Boy unkind and rude personel. The worst experience I have ever had as a traveling manager. Very little rooms and average bad conditions. I did not know where to put my luggage. Prices highly overestimated. The Street is dirty and not much illuminated.

title: What a Gem!
text: I am a native New Yorker who chose this hotel because of its location and ALL the area had to offer during an extended visit to New York to see friends and family.  The hotel is intimate and cozy and offers comfort in the middle of a big city.    The Front Desk is professional and offered a warm welcome, patience and a welcome goodies to all.    The restaurant bar offered excellent food and most of all, the best service from the waiters to the captain who were so proud - and hard workers.   The bellman on departure truly cared about the guests and helping them with taxis, etc.   Every place has its pros and cons.  The hotel is 40 something stories high and slim so the elevators require some patience at peak - but everything requires patience.    The rooms had all the amenities we look for from refrigerator to coffee maker and were clean AND if you choose allow fresh air in which is important to me -- I love hearing street sounds in the distance.   Where else can you be two blocks from the NYSE? Battery Park?  American Indian Museum?  Stone Street?  Ferry to Staten Island and Governor's Island and South Street Seaport.   NY - I LOVE YOU Forever and Doubletree -- I'll be back.

title: Prima!!! Goede locatie!!
text: Qua ligging vonden wij het ideaal! Uit de mega drukte en je bent met de metro toch overal zo. Kamers zijn prima niet groot maar voldoende je bent toch hele dag op pad! De liften ja die verhalen hadden wij gelezen  en idd soms duurt het wat langer. Maar ach je hebt vakantie en wij hebben er niet echt last van gehad. Van de 4 dagen hebben we 2-3 keer een lift voorbij moeten laten gaan omdat die vol was of langer moeten wachten. Verder is de service prima en housekeeping ook! Al met al prima hotel en ontbijt is Oke wat je kan verwachten voor amerikaans ontbijt!

title: An affordable hidden gem in Downtown
text:
Booked two Hudson River View Deluxe King rooms for a single night. We got a really good prepaid rate through Hilton's website, and managed to get two high floor rooms (4410 & 4310). 

The rooms were perfect, and the shower temp and pressure was great. The shower itself is a little a small, but this is NYC and the hotel itself is a little small.

As others have noted, the elevators can be a bit of a problem. When we first arrived around 4:00PM there was a bit of a line and wait for the elevators. I think it took us about 10-15 minutes of waiting to get on to an elevator. We didn't have much issue though after that first time, and so I think you just need to be mindful of the rush hours that occur during the normal check-in/out times. 

On Sunday we left our bags with the hotel for pretty much the entire day while out wandering the city, and had no issue leaving or retrieving them later. 

A piece of advice for anyone driving: The hotel has the option to get discounted parking, but you're better off utilizing SpotHero (app) or similar. We parked from 2:00PM Saturday - 6:00PM Sunday for only $45 at a garage a mile from the hotel.

title: Très bien
text:
