Hotel situé à deux pas de wall street et du ferry pour statue de la liberté.
Situé dans une rue calme avec peu de circulation (bien pour vos nuits tranquilles).
Accueil bien. Nous n'avons pas été pénalisés par les problématiques d'ascenseurs (lus dans d'autres commentaires). Système de bagagerie gratuit.
Hotel idéal pour visiter le sud de Manhattan. Stations de métro à proximité.
Chambre propre et semble avoir été rénovée récemment. Bonne isolation phonique avec l'extérieur et les chambres voisines.
je conseille cet hotel.

title: Buon hotel a prezzo accettabile
text: Ottima posizione, buon prezzo considerando la media di NY, attaccato alla fermata del metro di Whitehall da cui si può raggiungere facilmente qualsiasi punto di NY. La colazione è un po' povera, ma accettabile. Camera silenziosa e pulita.

title: Prima hotel in rustige buurt, liften geen probleem.
text:
Wij hebben hier op de 26e etage een week geslapen.
Alle gezeur over de 3 liften viel 100% mee.
Wij verlieten ons hotel elke dag rond 0830_0900 en kwamen rond 2100 terug.
Altijd binnen 2 minuten een lift 
Relatief kleine kamers, wel over compleet.
Rustig en schoon, een klasse beter dan het echte Hilton in LAX!!
Aardige mensen in de lobby en bij de ingang 
Metro station op de hoek, (Whitehall)

title: Pésima experiencia en la devolución del depósito
text: Todo Perfecto en cuanto a las instalaciones y la ubicación. Sin embargo un punto sumamente negativo es que ha pasado más de un mes desde mi estadía y NO ME HAN DEVUELTO EL DEPÓSITO. Llevo días, semanas contactando al hotel (mails, llamadas, mensajes)  para exponer el caso y NO LE HAN DADO SEGUIMIENTO. Yo deje el hotel el día 25 de agosto y el día 23 que fue cuando llegue, me dijeron que mi depósito (el cual  fue por 100 dlls) me sería devuelto de 5 a 7 días laborales. Repito, ha pasado más de un mes y el hotel no se ha tomado ni siquiera la molestia de darle seguimiento. Pésima experiencia en cuanto a esto refiere.

title: Lovely hotel and great location.
text:
Stayed here with my friend for 5 nights and it was great! Lovely room with two comfy beds and a big shower/ tv/ fridge.  There is an iron and board in the room and a hair dryer.  Also a coffee machine. 
The room has AC if you want it.  We were on the 28th floor and it was lovely and quiet.  Didn’t have much interaction with the staff as it was not needed. When we did, they were helpful and lovely.  Loved the warm cookie on check in. 
Location is great, near the financial district and world trade centre. 
I read lots of comments about the elevators before I went but I didn’t have any problems really. Sometimes a bit of a wait but there are 44 floors!  Sometimes they would miss our floor in the morning for some reason so we found pressing up was the best thing to do as at least we were in one! They are really fast and the hotel are doing the best they can with them. 
Would definitely stay here again and I recommend. Given 4 stars. If I could I would give 4.5.

title: Location, location, location
text: This is an excellent location for accessing a range of transit options. Subway on the corner, walk to ferry ports, walk to the Oculus trains, you are well positioned to get around the city.  The hotel is comfortable and functional, with a helpful staff. As is often the case in New York, the biggest drawback is the wait time for elevators, which can be very long at some times in the day.

title: Faultless Stay
text: We have just returned to the UK after 5 nights at this hotel and can't report on any negatives. The room was spacious enough for two adults and a child with 2 very comfortable double beds. The decor was modern with a clean bathroom, large flatscreen television and a coffee maker. There was also a safe and an iron & board in the wardrobe. We stayed on floor 19 at the front of the hotel, the room was silent all night, we couldn't hear anything from adjoining rooms or the street outside. We never waited more than 3 minutes for a lift the entire stay, the staff were polite and courteous and special mention has to be made for the chamber staff who are simply lovely, work tirelessly and made sure we had fresh towels and a pristine bed daily. The location was perfect for us, there is a subway station for the yellow line at the end of the street and it's just a 2 minute walk to the green line. There's a convenience store at the corner of the block but this is pricey and closes early, however there is a seven eleven store just a short distance away. The location is perfect for Wall Street and Battery Park. There is an Italian restaurant on the ground floor and ice machines every other floor. Note you do have to scan your key card in the lift in order to select a floor going up. A breakages deposit was taken when we checked in, which was returned to my card less than 2 days later. In summary I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: The elevator does not stop on every floor
text: The location is great the rooms are big for New York standards but the elevator did not stop on each floor. We waited 11 minutes finally hit the up button to go up before we could go down. Also skip the hotel breakfast it is ridiculously expensive for the same breakfast that is free in most hotels

title: Kabus gibi otel
text: 30 senedir New York a gelirim kaldıgım en kötü oteldi eski bakımsız odalırın sesleri birbirine gidiyor duvar degil sanki kagıttan yapılmıs kapılar kapanınca yer yerinden oynuyor 44 katlı otelde 3 tane asansör var komedi gibi asansörü 5-8 dk bekliyoruz

title: Nice but noisy
text:
Great location downtown. Close to the subway, park and Sea port Room are small but clean and upto date. Coffee maker in the room. Staff was very welcoming . Although many complain about the elevators, there wasn't a problem and all 3 elevators were quick to arrive . Welcome cookie was a very nice touch 

The negative: too much noise from the hallway and adjoining room. Had to wear earplugs to get some sleep . Early morning is even worse.

title: Nice room. HORRIBLE ELEVATORS!
text:
The location is great. The rooms are clean. But there really is no overcoming the greatest shortfall of this hotel which is the elevators. 

If you’re coming to New York to stand in a narrow hallway to wait for a crammed elevator, this is the place for you! 

The building has over 40 floors with 10 rooms each. And three small elevators serving them all. Without hyperbole, we waited HOURS  for elevator service during our three-day stay. As a joke/experiment my wife walked down from the 39th floor while I waited for the elevator. She beat me to the lobby with minutes to spare. The stairwell is so narrow that carrying a suitcase in it is not possible. 

BTW, this entire review was written while I waited for a whole elevator. It is still not here. It is the running joke with everybody you encounter here. All of the guests are equally disgusted with this situation. 

Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.  

Still waiting for the elevator……/.

title: Horrible elevator situation
text:
Recently stayed at the Double Tree Downtown for a wedding. Very many of the wedding guests stayed there for 1, 2, or 3 nights.  It was the most dangerous hotel I was ever in!  More than 40 floors and only 3 small elevators.  I use a mobility scooter and waited more than an hour to get to the room after check-in. Husband walked down 14 floors to meet with family.  Twice, I called and a helpful staff member came up to get me when I had to get down, and each time, it took more than 15 minutes for the staff person to get to me. When we checked out, it took nearly an hour of waiting, calling, then getting on a packed elevator with the staff member, and it stopped on EVERY floor with open doors and angry people who could not fit on, even though nobody on the elevator was getting off except on the ground floor. The trip down after we got on with the staff member, took nearly 15 minutes!  If there were a fire, I would have been dead! 
 I did not choose this hotel, a family member booked it. Had I chosen it, I would have read the reviews and known about the elevator problem and booked somewhere else.
Sometimes, the staff with cleaning carts, garbage carts, used the same elevators and took some of the spaces the guests were waiting to use.  They had no service elevator.  While I was waiting for a staff member to help me get down to the wedding, a few staff members were cleaning rooms.  They needed things on other floors and walked up and down the stairs.  Many guests used the stairs. When waiting, it was common to see guests on the stairs through the little window in the stairwell.
I don't know how they can operate such an expensive hotel under such dangerous conditions.  I have stayed in hotels and motels in all sorts of conditions, but never have I felt such fear as knowing that I could not get out in the event of an emergency.
There are many hotels in NYC. It's a wonderful place to visit. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE! Your life depends on it.

title: Buen hotel
text: Hotel perfectamente situado en la ciudad financiera, con varios metros muy cerca, que te permite moverte por la ciudad tanto en metro como a pie. Las habitaciones son amplias y cómodas, el personal amable. Rcomendable

title: Great Downtown location
text: The staff made me feel like a Diamond  member every day. The location was also great as it is close to the Hudson River, Statue of Liberty, Wall Street, and the freedom tower. Rooms were very clean and staff very helpful.

title: Hotel muy correcto
text: Hemos estado 7 días en este hotel. Habitación con dos camas dobles pero el baño bastante Justo para 4 personas. Habitación sin ruidos. Vistas a otro rascacielos de la misma calle de entrada. 3 ascensores que van bastante lentos y llenos, es lo único malo. Hay un apartado en la recepción con microondas, máquina de café, comida etc. En la habitación hay neverita que si no lo abres, no sabes que es una nevera, ya que es como un cajón en el escritorio. También cafetera de cápsula grande. El hotel dispone de un restaurante italiano al que no fuimos pero tenía buena pinta. La ubicación muy correcta, en la zona financiera pero con diferentes líneas de metro cerca. Y muy cerca del ferry para la estatua de la libertad. Todos los días cambian toallas y reponen jabones. El aire acondicionado es demasiado fuerte pero en pleno agosto hemos podido dormir sin el. Sin duda, volveríamos. Calidad precio muy recomendable.

title: Couldn’t sleep
text: The room was perf. The bed was so comfortable. I couldn’t sleep at all because of the noisy air conditioner blower that kept turning on and off all night. Everything so up to date except those old rickety noisy on and off a/c units. I was there on business and needed my sleep. It was just awful. Plus there was a rooftop bar on the building next door and although I was on the 20th floor I could hear the music too late into the evening. The two elevators are too slow and too few to serve this building. Shame for all this because the room was perfect

title: Nice area hotel ok
text: The best part about this hotel is the location. Great bar opposite for a pint and close to the freedom tower and 9 11 memorial site. An ok hotel as far as facilities go. Rooms not the biggest but kept clean and tidy, staff in general were polite and friendly, gym was a bit of a disappointment however the standard joke during our stay was the saga surrounding the elevators. They must rate as the slowest in the world.

title: Honeymoon disappointment
text:
My husband and I stayed here as part of our honeymoon. Whilst I think a lot of the reviews on here are very harsh, the hotel was, all in all, a bit of a disappointment.
The lifts are certainly a problem, but we were on the 6th floor, and are able to use the stairs, so did more often than not. You'd be in a pickle if you couldn't use the stairs/were on a higher floor - there are 44! 
The room was a reasonable size for NY, but very dated and tired - chips and marks on furniture and walls, grubby windows etc. We had a procession of ants come to visit one morning, too!  BUT it had everything we needed. Just looked about 20 years out of date and not in great condition.
We are diamond Hilton members and have come to expect excellent service from Hiltons when we stay. The service was fine, but nothing special.
What I *will* say is that the location is absolutely excellent and we loved being in a slightly quieter area than the chaos of Midtown. Also, I think the breakfast reviews are unkind. We ordered from the menu and found there to be a lot of choice and the food to be tasty and good portion sizes. The staff in the restaurant were friendly, too.

title: Not a good place at all
text: Staff doesn’t answer phones from room, rooms are ridiculously small , elevators are horribly slow .asked for extra towels and pillows 7 times over 4 hours . Not impressed at all . Diamond upgrade means nothing in this hotel . Horrible choices for parking as well

title: Not quite the DoubleTree standard I would expect
text:
Stayed here for 4 nights with my daughter. The hotel is dated and room was quite small. We were advised on check in that hospitality will try to refresh the room every day but if we specifically needed it done we would need to request it.  They do not put water bottles in the room, I don't think I have ever stayed in a hotel that did not supply bottles of water, but especially in New York in June when it is very very hot outside.  They do sell bottled of water but for $2.50 for 500ml. Thankfully there is a store on the same street where we bought our own. There is a drinking water tap on the same floor as reception, however they didn't tell us this at time of check in. We spotted it a few days later but the water is warm out of the tap anyway. 

The lifts are an absolute nightmare and I really feel for people who were on higher floors than me, or those that could not manage the stairs at all. We were on the 11th floor and used the stairs mostly as the wait time at the lift sometimes was substantial due to only being 3 for 40+ floors.

The aircon was very strong, which was not ideal as it was right next to the bed which means you are either freezing if you leave it on overnight, or too warm if it is off.

In summary not quite the standard I would have expected for a Doubletree by Hilton hotel. The pictures definitely make it look a lot more modern and brighter than it actually is. Thankfully I had booked it very far in advance so only paid £450 for 4 nights. I had tried to amend my dates closer to the time but the price changed to £800+ so I kept it as it was.

title: Convenient & spacious rooms
text:
I don't understand why this hotel has so many bad reviews on Tripadvisor. The room is very big for a city like New York, far bigger than regular rooms in cities like London or Paris. Based on the reviews, I was also pleasantly surprised by the standard of the room. Check in was super quick and easy. Cleanliness was good, and we got plenty of refills of coffee, which we enjoyed. The hotel is convently located for the subway, within 2-3 minutes walk you can choose between 3-4 stations with different lines. Also recommend taking the boat over to Brooklyn, great experience. 
Note that the hotel has few elevators, so that might be an annyance if you're leaving/coming back at busy times of the day. We didn't have any issues.

title: Ok New York hotel. Super beliggenhed.
text:
Værelserne er som i New York lidt små men helt i orden. Sengene lidt for bløde for min smag men dejligt med dyner og ikke kun lagner.
Personalet komplet ligeglade og lidt sure, men man får den hjælp man har brug for. De reklamerer med at der er produkter på hotellet, men der er en mini shampoo på værelset uanset antal personer i værelset. Der bliver ikke fyldt op.Du kan bede om mere men får en hver gang. Så regn ikke med det. Rengøring hver dag selvom de skriver at det kun er hver 4. Dag eller efter anmodning.
Beliggenheden er super. Dejligt område og lige ved subwayen så nemt at komme rundt.

title: Stay away
text: This hotel has gone downhill.  Elevators are insufficient for the number of rooms.  Wifi never worked.  Could only get hot water out of cold tap.  Climate control inconsistent. Don’t stay here. Find another place.

title: Best place in Lower Manhattan!
text: When it comes to hotels, the Hilton is by far the best.  This one is right in the center of the financial district, within walking distance to most everything.  It's very affordable for being in the city and offers everything you need for a pleasurable stay.  The staff make you feel right at home AND you can leave your luggage there after you check out, should you still have other attractions you want to go visit.  Hands down, the best choice if you're heading to Lower Manhattan

title: Family time in NYC
text:
Three adults so we needed a room with a pull out couch.  Perfect choice as the king room had plenty of space and two huge TV’s.  Called ahead to see if we could check in early.  Our room was ready at 12noon when we arrived.  Loved the warm cookies at checkin.  Was skeptical of the reviews warning of the elevators.  We had no problems…we did use the steps once.  Full disclosure…our room was on the 4th floor.  

Used the parking for $45 - well worth it cause no street parking in the area and most garages charged over $70 per night for a 24 hour stay.  

Perfect area for walking - subway less than a block away.  Staff was great - it was annoying to have housekeeping start knocking on then door at 9:40am.  Would recommend a stay here!!!

title: Stay in Doubletree Downtown
text: The Doubletree by Hilton New York Downtown is an extremely small hotel and, as with most hotels in the NY area, space is at a premium.  Our room was supposed to be set up for 3 but the hotel set it up as 2 only and we had a tough time getting to get them to sort it (i.e. giving us the requisite number of towels.  Staff in the hotel were pleasant but they had a habit of using the customer lifts for transporting their cleaning trolleys on the lifts.  This, in turn, lead to delays on the lifts when calling then and also led to delays when stopping off to let staff off at the requested floors.  The hotel is located at the end of the financial district (the infamous brass bull of Wall St fame is located a short walk away.  The Hop On Hop Off bus service stops just around the corner form the hotel and was very convenient.

title: Beautiful and nice hotel, I recommended to everyone to go to this hotel Doubletree. Very clean
text: Excellent hôtel i really appreciate all the staff and the service, closers to anything you want enjoy during your visit, very good parking and the people at the front door is so helpful with your bagages and directions to your parking garage.

title: All the answer are “no”
text: Terrible time. Elevators are crowded and the waiting time may be 45 minutes. 4 people in the room and every day replacement of 2 towels. Have to call and ask more 2 every day. Asked to make a phone call for me to make a reservation for a shuttle and was not possible because the shuttle partner fo the hotel was another from that one I wanted…. Never will come back! They don’t need me as a client. I have been  before in so many Hilton hotels and never imagine this kind of care!

title: Unacceptably Bad: Do Not Stay
text:
We stayed at the hotel for three unfortunate nights at the end of a longer vacation. There are 5 major points we would highlight as leading to the absolutely abysmal review.
 1. Service: the hotel staff have no interest in any of the guests and we actually had to call the front desk while standing in the lobby to so much as be acknowledged by them. 
2. Furnishings: the room we stayed in was in a terrible state - peeling wallpaper, scuffed furniture, dilapidated chairs, bathroom doors without handles, or staples sticking out of the carpet - the place looked and felt like it was pulled straight from the dumpster. 
3. Access: there are some 30-odd floors and rooftop bar in this hotel with just four elevators and no upward access stairs - on a Friday night we had to regularly wait 10-15 minutes before we were able to get into a packed elevator to access our second floor room. 
4. Noise. Whether it’s the complete lack of soundproofing leading to us overhearing simple conversation in the room next door, or the sheer volume of the AC unit meaning we were unable to use it at night, this hotel isn’t loud due to street noise - the hotel itself makes plenty to ensure you never sleep.  
5. Water Pipes: clearly this building has been around for ages. As soon as we turned on the shower (which was covered in scuff marks and grime) we were affronted by the percussion section that was the pipes for our room. Good luck taking a quiet shower.
All in all, Hilton should be embarrassed to have their brand associated with such a poorly-run, shoddily-maintained, sorry excuse for a hotel.

title: There are much better options downtown.
text:
Rooms are okay, little noise barrier between halls and adjoining rooms, elevators are extremely slow ( needed to add on 15 minutes if going out). 

My bathroom faucet had only hot water so no cold to brush teeth, make coffee.

Check in was straight forward and accommodating.

title: Location at some expense
text:
We needed a hotel in Wall Street for a conference. This Doubletree popped up, so I booked on a whim. Location is EXCELLENT for this area of NYC, with premium access to Wall Street, WTC, and the NY ferry to Statue of Liberty. That being said, here are a few things to note from this experience.  
1.) it is located on Stone Street, but you won't find it unless you actually are walking passed it.  The entrance and marquee are recessed from the building.
2.) when you walk in, dont be concerned.  There is NOTHING of significant note that identifies you are in the hotel.  You must take 4 flights of stairs, or a very long wait for a lift/elevator to get to the beautiful 2nd floor lobby.  
3.) the lifts/elevators are horrible. There are only two (technically three), which have capacity for about 6 people close together.  With 20+ floors, you will wait, and wait, and wait for an elevator.  
4.) breakfast is on the ground floor in a very nice restaurant.  Even with Hilton Diamond status and food vouchers, expect to pay $12 out of pocket for two people (taxes, tip).
5.) Rooms and hallways are typical urban: Compact. 
6.) Staff were awesome and did their best to accommodate.

title: Hôtel correct à Manhattan
text:
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour à New York néanmoins cet hôtel ne nous laissera pas un souvenir impérissable.

Points positifs : 
- très bonne situation avec plusieurs lignes de métro à 1min de l’hôtel. 
- À deux pas de Wall Street et de Battery Park (Statue de la liberté)  et à 5min du World Trade Center. 
- gentillesse de l’accueil 
- literie excellente 
- machine à café et frigo dans la chambre 
- propreté de la salle de bain et de la chambre (sauf le sol) 

Points négatifs :
- le lobby est au 2eme étage donc on n’y passe jamais. 
- seulement 2 ascenseurs (3 avec celui du personnel de service) où l’on rentre qu’à 8 sans valises. On a été gêné que deux fois (attente de plus de 10min) donc cela ne nous a pas dérangé. 
- la vue pas terrible (notre chambre était au 14eme étage mais donnait dans la petite rue où se trouve l’entrée de l’hôtel). 

Pas d’avis sur le petit déjeuner qu’on a choisi de ne pas prendre à l’hôtel, vous trouverez facilement de quoi vous restaurer autour de l’hôtel et il y a un petit supermarché au coin de la rue. 

Conclusion : allez-y si vous avez un bon prix!

title: Great location but won't be back
text: I have stayed at this location multiple times, mostly for work.  Last stay (late May 2022) was for fun.  I regret "saving" $600 over the course of 4 nights for two rooms vs an alternate Hilton family property in the FiDi.  The elevator situation is enough to deter guests.  3 small, crowded, and not modern enough to service 44 floors.  The situation made worse by staff who use the elevators for service, and press the call button just in case the elevator comes when they are ready to move.  This means several stops where nobody is actually waiting to board (as if they could, given the capacity of about 6 decent-sized humans in each car.  Rooms are NY-small, no surprise there.  Restaurant on first floor has mediocre buffet for $15.  Make sure you sort out any breakfast coupons with the staff, or there will be billing issues.  Better, skip the restaurant and find one of the several bakeries/deli's within 2 minute walk.  Having stayed previously (and apparently having amnesia) I had no surprises.  But felt for several travelers who apparently were from overseas.  I hope they at least got a bargain rate.  I continue to be amazed that Hilton Worldwide allows this hotel to carry the Doubletree brand, as it clearly is far below standard of any other Doubletree locations I have visited.  A positive:  staff at check-in were friendly and helpful.

title: Wedding guest
text: We had a block of rooms for my daughter's wedding guest the week off 5/25 to 5/30, I worked with Bill and Yve in sales they were a lot of help and everything was smooth and as they promised. The staff were helpful and the location was great with Battery Park in the corner and lost of places to eat around it.

title: WARNING!!! Do not stay here!!!!!
text: I have never had a worse experience staying in a hotel in my life. This hotel doesn’t care about the safety of its guest. I have been to NYC at least twice a year for the last 15 years. I have always loved my trips to the city. My last trip (first and last time at double tree) was so horrible I don’t know if I can even go back to the city. If you care about your safety or safety of your family or friends DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!

title: Not worth the money
text:
The hotel did not feel like a 4 star at all. The entrance seems like a back entrance. There are only 3 lifts for 44 levels which means have to wait at least 15 mins for the lift. 
The room in itself isn’t that bad, but bathrooms are quite small and dated. 
The aircon blows air and is right next to the bed so if you have it off then it’s too hot and if it’s on then the air is literally blowing in your face and it stops on and off due to thermostat. Really could do with an upgrade. 
The coffee in the room is nice.

title: Double Tree Double Trouble
text: The elevators are a danger and never come when called, It is so bad it is not just an inconvenience the staff had no clue two were not working and did not care and gave very passive oh sorry. Ruined entire stay waiting over 30 minutes for an elevator

title: The Absolute Worst Hotel in the NY Financial District
text:
Paid $700 for a River View KING sized room...was excited by the 'great' pics on the internet. Here's what I got. 

1. There are 2 elevators on this 45 floor hotel- the third one is perpetually taken by housekeeping. 

2. Hallways are 4 feet wide- everyone runs into everyone...keeps spilling things. Which is why an entire elevator is used by HK. Guests (45*10= ~450 rooms...or 800 guest use 2 elevators that are 4x3

3.  The lobby is smaller than the living room of a decent apartment anywhere.

4. The rooms are like prison cells- 10x10 excluding the washroom. There's a tiny window and a tinier 'view' of the Hudson which is visible through a gap between skyscrapers....the fact that I could see a blue line is why they charged the premium. The room provides a view out of the Rikers Island prison...not one of Ellis Island or the Statue of Liberty..

5. The restaurant is absolutely horrendous AND rude. When questioned for service- their answer is 'we are not part of the hotel'

It is now almost 11 pm at nite...and there's nowhere to go. So, I will stay here. 

In summary my friends- if you have free money- donate it to the needy. If u are coming to NY- do not stay here even if it is the last hotel with rooms available.

title: Warning...Don't stay here!!
text: 3 Elevators are too small and slow. No service elevator so staff with carts jam the elevator leaving little room for guests. We, and other guests, walked down 27 flights to get out of the hotel. Pathetic

title: Terribile! Da non ripetere mai più!
text:
Ho 40 anni, mio marito 42 anni, e MAI pur viaggiando da quando ne avevamo 18, siamo entrati in un hotel senza entrare in una hall.
Ma questo è solo l’inizio di questa esperienza da non ripetere in questo Hotel che di “DoubleTree Hilton” e di 4 stelle, non ha praticamente nulla!
La hall che vedete nelle foto in internet (e che ha ingannato anche noi in fase di prenotazione) é al 2’ piano ed è davvero molto piccola. 
Appena entrati nell’edificio infatti, ci si trova dinanzi ad un banchetto infelice ed a 3 ascensori che, dovendo servire 44 piani, sono sempre perennemente occupati.
Occupati non solo dagli ospiti, ma anche dal personale che esegue le pulizie, che entra con carrelli di detersivi e spazzatura nello stesso ascensore degli ospiti!!
Vi sembra normale?????
Arrivati alla hall, ci si trova davanti a personale non multilingue, che parla solo inglese e non ti viene incontro per capirti in nulla!
Loro non ti chiamano taxi. Ti devi arrangiare. Se lo chiedi per l’aeroporto, ti chiamano un NCC che ti costa il quadruplo del taxi normale, ossia quasi 200$.
Conviene scendere in strada e cercarselo da soli.
Anche noi abbiamo avuto i problemi già rilevati da altri con la carta di credito. Non riuscivano a passarla e sembrava un problema insormontabile, senza fare la minima autocritica. 
E’ la carta dell’ospite che non funziona, non loro che stanno sbagliando qualcosa. Cambiando metodo invero, la carta é passata tranquillamente.
Arrivati al piano, eravamo al 43esimo (quindi quello con le camere migliori, per le quali abbiamo pagato un supplemento), ci siamo trovati dinanzi ad un angusto corridoio con una moquette orribile e molto sporca. Abbiamo scoperto che passano l’aspirapolvere solo nella hall, ne’ ai piani ne’ nelle camere. Da noi il pavimento era talmente polveroso e sporco, che al secondo giorno abbiamo dovuto lasciare un biglietto chiedendo perentoriamente di pulire a terra. Ed è stato fatto, ma crediamo con la scopa.
Tanta dev’essere stata l’ansia, che post pulizia si sono dimenticati persino un detersivo (anonimo) in bagno, e non sono stati in grado di portarselo via ne’ il giorno dopo ne’ durante una settimana di vacanza! Ce lo siamo tenuti in bagno per 5 giorni!
Ieri si sono scordati perfino di metterci la carta igienica in bagno! Ci hanno lasciato senza.
Frigo bar vuoto. 
La nostra stanza del 43esimo piano é apprezzabile come grandezza, ma la questione scarsa pulizia e vetusta’ della mobilia, ti fa dimenticare ogni aspetto positivo!
Non parliamo della colazione, anche quella infelicemente pagata in fase di prenotazione e fatta solo il primo giorno, quando ignoravamo come fosse!
Dimenticate i meravigliosi buffet Hilton e DoubleTree Hilton, vi mandano con un tagliandino rosa al ristorante lì sotto, quello che - per capirci - vedete nelle foto online con le tende bianche e rosse, e lì vi trovate quattro uova strapazzate ed un po’ di pancetta, senza un dolce, senza frutta, senza nulla che sia anche solo lontanamente chiamabile “colazione internazionale”. 
Addirittura quando siamo arrivati il primo giorno, ci hanno fatto sedere in una saletta angusta e buia, attaccata alla cucina (….) e fra le altre cose ci hanno portato un caffè imbevibile! 
Sappiate che di “ristorante italiano” non ha nulla! Per carità!
E’ stata un’esperienza pessima che non ripeteremo mai più e che sconsigliamo a chiunque non sia disperato! Le foto sul sito e online non sono attendibili. Chi lavora lì non ha la benché minima idea di come si faccia turismo e di come si tratti un ospite o di come si tenga una struttura ricettiva. A maggior ragione in tempi di covid!
E hanno pure messo i cartelli per avvisare che fanno pulizie speciali per covid! Ma per favore, forse pensano che gli ospiti siano ciechi?!?!
Per concludere, invitiamo chi da’ le stelle agli hotel a fare le opportune verifiche, perché questo é a mala pena un 2 stelle e mezzo ed il prezzo da pagare per questo livello é davvero un furto! E ve lo dicono 2 persone che hanno pagato soldi in più per avere una camera migliore e per la colazione per ogni giorno di vacanza!

title: Très satifaite
text: Localisation parfaite (3 stations de métro à proximité) , très confortable ,chambre faite tous les jours et une vue du 44ieme et dernière étage époustouflante! Petit bémol, l ascenseur qui est très long cela n' a été  vraiment gênant une seule fois donc j' y retournerai sans hésiter .

title: Die perfekte Metapher für New York
text: Das DoubleTree verkörpert New York: Die Lage ist perfekt im Herzen vom Financial District, unmittelbar an der Wall St. Bereits etwas in die Jahre gekommen, für amerikanische Verhältnisse recht eng mit kleinen Zimmern und unverhältnismäßig teuer. Es darf nur rein, wer nach langem Anstehen einen der zwei Aufzüge erwischt.

title: Beyond Awful
text: As a Hilton Honors member for 20+ years, I was horrified about my experience.  We arrived to check in at 9:00pm.  With only one room left, we entered a tiny room on the 36th floor, next to the ice maker.  Upon "settling in," we noticed our shoes were sticking to the floor.  Simple, basic amenities were missing: shampoo, extra blanket, etc.  The ice maker next to our room rattled and seemed to be in use all night (not every floor has an ice maker, so apparently many people used it.  We requested our floor be cleaned, shampoo added, and the blanket give to us was not worthy of an animal shelter.  Upon arrival the following night - our room had not been refreshed, the (wet) towels we used in the morning were still in the bathroom, our bed was not made and the floor was still sticky.  No one was available to address.  I won't be staying at a Hilton again, and nothing they "advertise" is actually true.

title: Very basic, decent location, set your terms at check in for your stay.
text: So positives are the location is good for subway and Liberty/ other tourist attractions.  Room was OK but aim for a high floor if you don’t want a view of an office. Negatives included only two towels in room for four - trip to reception (15 floors) to get two more. Room not cleaned for four days despite published promise to clean every two days - meant trip to reception (15 floors) to get more toilet tissue and then another trip on day four (15 floors) to ask for fresh towels.  Can’t help feeling I have worked as hard as the staff team this week.  Just get the basics right - if you are putting four people in a room, four towels.  If you say you will clean a room every two days then clean it. The response from the receptionist on the fourth night was that this was my fault for not asking for the room to be cleaned …. As I stated that it was not unreasonable to expect a room to be cleaned once during a four night stay I was told to complain to Expedia.  Complete indifference from the receptionist.  So if you’re coming be clear at check in what you would like to happen during your stay - be controversial, ask for a bare minimum 2 Star service and you will get better than we did.  Hilton must be thrilled with the apathy at this hotel.

title: Stay here if you are on Vacation but not a work trip
text: The hotel is nice and located in a great location, but it was very busy and noisy for a weekday stay. I was placed in a room in front of the elevators and I was hearing a lot of noise and my room had a water issue in the toilet and the toilet was making a noise all night nonstop. The elevators are very slow and they took awhile to arrive once you press the button.

title: Stay here if you need to, but it’s not great
text: Extremely busy hotel. Was told by garage that parking was not in/out. Elevators were so slow. Restaurant was poor quality. Lobby coffee cost $2 and was not good. Was not welcomed as a HHonors member. Junior suite room was very small. Bed springs were worn out. Bathroom had no counter space. Only redeeming quality is its location.

title: Ménage en option
text: J’ai réservé pour 5 nuits et j’en suis à la troisième. Première fois que je vois qu’il faut passer à la réception pour avoir le ménage fait. Donc comme je n’ai pas eu de briefing sur ce point. Premier jour pas de ménage fait. Je demande donc que le ménage soit fait pour les 4 prochain jours. Deuxième jour ménage fait , enfin lit fait , pas d’aspirateur, pas de dépoussiérage, pas de réassorts de ça fin et gobelets et par dessus tout 2 serviettes propre alors que la chambre est réservé pour 4. Je redescends pour demander qu’un ménage complet soit fait, on me répond qu’aujourd’hui le service était Lightning et que le lendemain un service complet sera fait. Résultat le lendemain aucun ménage de fait , pas de serviettes de rechange. La suite dans 3 jours

title: The worst stay at a Doubletree hotel ever
text: The worst stay at a Doubletree property ever. Get used to the thumping of washers and dryers if you are on the fourth or fifth floor. The laundry is open 24/7, so forget about sleep.  The  elevator takes forever, whatever floor you are on. And taxis are nowhere to be found early in the morning and after 5pm.  Really not worth the $$.

title: Servicio deficiente
text: Me quedé 4 noches.  El segundo día al regresar pasé pidiendo almohadas extra y no las llevaron. Me sorprendí hallar el cuarto sin arreglar, llame a recepción para preguntar y pedir se nuevo las almohadas y no respondieron.  Al salir al segundo día llamé desde fuera del hotel y solicité que hicieran mi cuarto, mi sorpresa al llegar en la noche fue que de nuevo no lo habían arreglado. Llamé para reclamar y me mandaron toallas frescas y las almohadas qué había solicitado la noche anterior. Hasta el tercer día arreglaron mi habitación. Me pareció un servicio deficiente Ya que ni siquiera nos dieron nuevo jabón y shampoo.

title: Great location, great value!
text:
We had a lovely, well equipped room on 44th floor. The beds were comfy, toiletries great, a fridge and tea and coffee in the room. The staff were all very helpful. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Its near 4 subway lines each within 500m of the front door. This means its easy to get to all the top spots in Manhattan. Plus you only need one change of train to get to and from JFK. 
The price of the hotel in March was less than £100 per night which was very good for a 4* hotel. There are plenty of restaurants, shops and delis locally.
The only negative is when 1 of the 3 lifts is broken. This can lead to waits of up to 10 mins for a lift.
Overall thoroughly recommended for the cost, comfort and location

title: Just left after 5 day vacation/ excellent hotel and staff
text: Stayed at this financial district/downtown hotel while on family vacation. The staff was exceptional, the amenities were plentiful including a guest laundry service, and the hospitality was outstanding. This hotel is in a very safe area because it is in the financial district and they’re a lot of business people walking around late at night. We had the option of taking three different subway lines all within close walking distance. Highly recommend this hotel.  I’ve recommended this place to friends and family already.

title: Good location but not suitable for kids
text:
The hotels location is really good within 5-10min to all subways lines. Check in took long due to only 2 staff trying to check in all people. 

Rooms are spacious ( 2 bedroom) as we only went to sleep we had no big expectation 

The breakfast buffet was included and had bagels/muffins and some bred. They had ham and some fruits and Joghurt as well. Bacon/egg/sausage and pancakes they had as well. It was severed in the restaurant next to the hotel

I would recommend this hotel if you do not travel with kids specially with stroller as the situation with the elevator is really a problem. We had luck that our room was located on the 5th floor and we had no kids with us so we walked up/down the stairs but the other ones waiting with the stroller loving on a higher up level they waited from 5-15min for the elevator. 

So personally I would not stay here if I have small kids and a stroller

title: Nice clean hotel
text: I booked 2 king rooms at this location and was not disappointed.  The pictures on the website are a true reflection of what the rooms look like.  The rooms are nicely decorated  and I had no complaints.  Location is great, the staff are very pleasant.  Hilton brand did maintain their standard.

title: Horrible Management
text: Manger Daniel( 8 stone st NYC) is a horrible manger he kept hanging up on me. He advised I had only 2 room when I had 3, kept over talking me and made me cry due to frustration with not listening to me and dominating the conversation. Will never ever stay with Hilton again.

title: WORST HILTON OF MY LIFE!!
text: PLEASE READ! This hotel should not exists! I have been a Diamond member for 8 years. Average wait time for elevator any time is 10-15 mins! Rooms are the smallest I have ever experienced in over 10 years! Only 1 person at front desk wait time is 20-25 mins to talk to any staff member! Cleaning crew tries but doesn’t have supplies and can’t get anywhere because of elevators. Hotel doesn’t have enough manpower or equipment and needs serious remodeling! This hotel should completely shut down!

title: Pleasant Anniversary stay
text: My boyfriend and I decided to celebrate our 2 year anniversary here and it was very pleasant. The person checking us in acknowledged our anniversary and gave us cookies while checking in. When we went up to our room we enjoyed our view and dropped off our things while we went out for the evening. My only complaint was our white socks turned black by the end of the evening but other than that the room was spotless. I’d definitely stay here again as our stay was enjoyable.

title: Not the best experience
text:
Was awakened 2 days straight with maintenance doing work and drilling in the connecting room next door. During check-in I had the worst customer service. The wait time for an elevator is ridiculous. The rooms are small. 
The location of the hotel is good. The rooms were clean.

title: Had a company meeting here
text: We had an executive meeting here in December.  We dealt with Bill Yetzer who made everything smooth and our meeting was a huge success.  We received great room rates, the meeting room was great, and breakfast and lunch was delivered on time and tasted excellent.  The rooms and service was great.  The hotel was in a great location to walk or subway to iconic NYC locations.  We would definitely host another meeting at this hotel.  Bill Yetzer was a huge reason this was a great success.

title: Silencioso, limpio y muy bonito lugar
text: Silent, clean and very nice place. During the stay we were accompanied by a ghost on the 42nd floor, he threw glasses and set lights, nothing eccentric but understandable due to the history of the site.

title: Fantastic
text: I had a great time and I had wonderful views. It was close to everything and easy to find parking. The woman at the front desk was nice and helpful. Check in and check out was easy. I would definitely stay again.

title: Fantastic Stay!
text: Great stay! Everyone at the front desk was super welcoming, the room was spotless and one of the cleanest I’ve ever stayed in, and it was close by all the attractions I was there to see.  I will definitely be back here next time I’m in New York.

title: Great Stay!
text: The stay was great! The staff were great! Carla was amazing! Loved the room and the view! The room was clean! They made me feel welcomed!!!!!! I would definitely stay again! I enjoyed the stay here! I would recommend to stay here.

title: Carla made this hotel my favorite!
text: Chose it for convenience. Steps away from many metro routes and wall street where I had a few meetings. But Carla the front desk manager is very kind and helpful, making me feel completely welcomed.  It’s way beyond my expectation! Also the lobby is cozy and view from my window is very pleasing!

title: Great Location
text: Great location. Staff was not particularly welcoming. Requested extra blanket which was never sent. Limited hot water. All in all very good value. Great home base for lower Manhattan. Very easy access to subway.

title: Ehh
text: Soundproofing should be a must. Loud guests and people smoking was a terrible way to spend my weekend. Thankfully my room was changed pretty quickly. Moving forward soundproofed rooms should be a option

title: Brian and Raul great service
text: Raul was helpful at the door. Brian was very accommodating and professional at the front desk even when it was busy and guests were rude to him. I appreciated his patience with any request I provided him. The location is good and the views from room were great

title: Holidays trip
text: Bathroom is a bit uncomfortable to use. The elevators are bit annoying, need to get used to how it works. Coffee maker was on the table which no outlet, had to move it to other table to use. But everything else was fine! Location is great. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

title: Very New York
text: All the plusses and a few of the negatives. Enjoyed the location, the restaurant staff and feeling part of the city. As is common in New York, the rooms are small and the elevator capacity is insufficient for the number of floors and guests. It can be a long wait at high volume times.

title: Horrible
text: Hotel was average . I have stayed in a few Hilton hotels however this was the worst one I have stayed at . Floors where very dirty and dropped something on the floor and saw dust bunny’s under the cabinets . Toilet was dirty behind the toilet seat. Really struggled to get towels as they never provided enough towels ! They also only gave us one pillow per person which has never happened before . Also not very helpful when got woken up at 12 in the morning by other people trying our door playing music and genuinely very loud waking my niece up.

title: Raul espinoza
text: As soon I came out my car this man made sure everything was great,He helped me bring in my bags, i loss my phone he did everything in his power to help me find my phone.This was the best help I ever had.I really appreciate everything he did for me. Best help ever.

title: Elevators Not Working
text: Terrible experience this past weekend. Elevators were not working and we walked down 35 flights of stairs on numerous occasions (my legs are still recovering 4 days later). I feel for those guests who may not have had that option and might still be waiting for the elevator! I am a Hilton Honors member and often look for Hilton’s to stay wherever I go, but I will be skipping this one during my next trip to NYC. One saving grace of this hotel is its location, Stone St. is a great area.

title: Full service hotel with great ammenities
text:
This  property, while older, is kept up very well. It is in the hear of the Financial district not very far from the subway (green and yellow lines), and from the Staten Island ferry. The only negative is the slow elevator service. They only had two of three working and it took a bit to get a car. I booked early and on Booking.com you can also add breakfast which I highly recommend the menu over the buffet. Make sure the front desk gives you the breakfast vouchers and looks it up on their system as Bed and Breakfast. 

The hotel restaurant is full service for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  

The room were very clean, and the shower had so much power, it created a mini flood on the bathroom floor. 

The room itself was on the smaller side, but that is very typical for any city room. 

My favorite thing was actually that the Smithsonian Native American History museum is right down the street and it is steps away from three subway lines.

I would recommend this property or the nearby hotels.

title: Worst hotel ever
text: Worst hotel experience ever. This is at best a 2 star hotel. Of the 3 elevators, 2 were broken. Even the one working was so slow that every time we left the build we had to walk down 31 flights of stairs, not just once but twice in just 48 hours. It's 100% a safety issue, for sure does not meet fire code. The stair cases are tiny. God forbid people had to evacuate, people may die tripping over each other. And if you have any luggage good luck! If bigger than a backpack you are in trouble. The 1 staff member working the front desk could care less about guests.Very unhelpful. When you arrive you have to walk up to the 2nd floor just to be in their crap lobby. Very difficult to access.  Bathroom is tiny, no counter space. This hotel is nasty. When we had to use the stairs there was trash on just about every floor, nasty! I was worried for our safety and made sure nothing of value was in our room. The cheap $49 a night hotels are nicer than this place. Wife and I will never stay at this hotel again. DO NOT SAY HERE, YOU WILL REGRET IT!

title: Work Trip
text: The room was clean and comfortable but the WiFi didn’t work, the elevator was very slow, there was no coffee available in the lobby in the morning and only one person checking guests and answering questions. The hospitality was lacking.

title: Elevator he**
text:
We visited the Doubletree downtown this past weekend and were sadly very disappointed. The room was TINY! No way it was the advertised 300 sq feet (2 double bed room). Our family of 4 barely could fit our bags inside. 

The worst part was the elevator situation. One was broken which left only 2. Average wait time was over 10 minutes. Even if the one elevator was working, 3 is not nearly enough. They were tiny elevators on top of that.

title: Elevator
text: Elevator took 20 min to go up and down and i had to go up 22 flights of stairs every time it was a horrible experience especially at check out i had to go down all those stairs with all my luggage and nobody even cared to help or say im sorry

title: No es el hotel para una experiencia inolvidable en New York
text: Lamentablemente este no es el hotel donde alojarte si quieres tener una buena experiencia en Nueva York.  Es cierto que está muy bien ubicado próximo al metro y a paradas de autobús que hacen que moverse en la ciudad sea fácil.  Aquí se acaba lo bueno.  Si eres miembro Hilton Honors, ninguno de tus privilegios de nivel será aplicado, así que no esperes ser tratado acorde a tu nivel. Las habitaciones son pequeñas , aunque en Nueva York en general son así. El edificio tiene dos acensores para 400 habitaciones, por lo que tienes que tener previsto unos 10 minutos de espera para cada recorrido de ascensor. Algún huesped llegó a decir que esperó ¡40 minutos!.  No hay ascensor de servicio, por lo que los empleados deben utilizar el mismo.  Las habitaciones no se limpian ni por petición cada día , hacen todo lo posible para que desistas de la limpieza de la habitación , por lo que, considerando el tamaño de la habitación, rápidamente acumularas botellas vacias, vasos usados,  papeles en una papelera que rebosará.  Consigue champú y gel en cantidad, puesto que el servicio de habitaciones no repondrá , aún cuando ellos mismos retiran el usado. Eso sí, toallas dejan todas las que quieras y más.  Si quieres disfrutar de experiencias nuevas,  el recepcionista te pedirá que hagas tu mismo la cama,  aunque eso sí, parte de la experiencia es compartida, te suben las sábanas al menos.  Encontrarás cucarachas en los baños, que nadie sabe explicar ni como han salido, y por supuesto nadie es capaz de solucionar el problema. Te harán una retención en tu tarjeta de credito por un importe superior al 30% sobre el importe de la habitación, por lo que si tienes una tarjeta de debito y esperabas gastar ese dinero en caprichos en la ciudad, no lo podrás hacer.  El día del checkout todas tus maletas serán amontonadas, debido a la falta de un lugar optimo para guardar el equipaje, así que mejor que no pongas nada frágil dentro de tu equipaje. Podría romperse.  No es para nada el estándar Hilton de hotel,  es como una casa de huespedes grande.  El personal rara vez es simpático , de hecho lo que muestran en general es cansancio. Estoy convencido de que habrá muchisima gente que haya tenido una experencia inolvidable en el hotel , por desgracia no fue mi caso.

title: Unfortunately
text: The hotel room was small , the pillows were disgusting. The shower doors leaked and the shower base had a huge crack in it. We had to use our towels to dry the floor instead of being able to reuse them.

title: Good location, bad service
text:
Customer service was bad 
No one answering the phone in the reception, especially in the busy days and only one representative works in the reception. No complimentary water even for first night. Was not told no room service until after checking in. Some bulbs are not working in the room. Guy in bag storage room was very rude and not welcoming. Overall did not feel welcomed at all. Was not even asked about my stay when checking out.

title: Never come to this hotel in New York the Doubletree has beautiful hotels around the world maybe not this one
text: Never come to this hotel in New York the Doubletree has beautiful hotels around the world maybe not this one It was supposed to be like a little honeymoon for my husband and I it was more like staying home doing everything yourself clean in the room he didn’t enjoy it neither did I

title: Amazing view
text: The view was amazing. Great location. Near restaurants and subway. Close to Brooklyn bridge and twin tower memorial. The room was clean and check in was fast and easy. Highly recommend and will be staying here again.

title: Excellent
text: Staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is great walkable from 3 different subway routes. Quiet and secure. A lot of restaurants nearby. Walking distance to statue of liberty and new jersey ferry. Only con is 3 small elevators for 44 floors.

title: Inadequate staffing...
text:
It took an hour to check-in because there was only one person checking people in. I was then told there was no valet and had to park my car in a garage and walk back to the hotel. It took two hours from check-in to finally checking into my room. 

The bed was incredibly uncomfortable. 

There’s a light in the bathroom that automatically turns on and you cannot turn that function off so a trip to the bathroom in the middle of the night was starling.

The thermostat does not function properly. 

My wife and I will not be returning to this property.

title: Great Hotel!
text: We stayed here overnight for a family trip to see Aladdin on Broadway. The rooms were perfect for our family of 4! The hotel room offered beautiful views of New York City and good access to downtown restaurants!

title: Location, location, location
text: This hotel is on a quiet side street, which is great for a New York hotel.  It's walking distance to everything lower Manhattan- from Battery Park to Wall Street (near the famous bull), and so much more.  The rooms are newly renovated, which was a welcome surprise.  I've been there pre-renovation as well, and while the rooms were nice, I prefer the hard flooring in the new rooms.  The lobby isn't on the ground level, and I'd say that that's the only drawback.  It's not a deal breaker though since the hotel is great and is in a great location.

title: It could’ve been better
text: This experience wasn’t as good as my previous experience a few years ago. The cookies weren’t avail nor warm, my friends sheets had stains, and the hotel staff wasn’t very friendly. But the good was the location of the hotel.

title: Elevators are terrible. Showers leak.
text: Do not get a high floor. The elevators are the worst. Be prepared to use the stairs if you don’t want to waist time.  The staff doesn’t reply to messages via the Hilton App. The rooms have a lot of miles on them and they are dark.

title: Great location but horrible customer service
text: I booked two rooms since the rooms are small and we’re a family of four with teenagers. We called ahead to get the address for parking and wasn’t told the right address then at check in the front desk was rude but could be because we arrived later around 8ish. The room we booked for our kids with two double beds was great but unfortunately ours with the one king bed AC was off so the room was hot and didn’t work.

title: So-so
text:
The walls are so thin that you hear everything that goes in, including a couple next door who was busy being intimate for 3 hours in the middle of the night.  The doors banged so loudly that each closure would wake me up.
Lobby and entrance are not so inviting

title: Nothing works right or as expected
text: Elevator used by cleaning staff and customers is rickity and slow and makes frequent stops. Room either freezing or boiling. Can hear other guests doing all sorts of things from hallway. I’ve machines make a loud noise that staff is too busy to fix. It permeates your room so that noise is all you hear. No extra pillows or blankets. No walking room in room. Staff too busy to answer phone. Cannot reach lost and found after stay to get my prescription reading glasses sent to me. No help with parking or luggage. Just awful.

title: New York trip
text:
I stayed in this wonderful hotel for 10 nights. And that was amazing especially with river-view room from the higher floor. 
This place is great for anyone visiting New York. Best location downtown.
Very nice ‪service‬, clean rooms and helpful staff. Special thanks  to Assistant Guest Services Manager Carla Carvalho at the front desk  - she was very friendly, competent, welcomed and always available for questions. 
I definitely enjoyed my stay here and would 100% recommend it!

title: Weekend stay
text: I came to New York for a weekend stay the hotel was okay the hospitality can be a little bit getter considering you're in hospitality. The bed wasn't comfortable and the amenities were bare. Overall 7

title: Great hotel!
text: Great hotel, wonderful staff definitely enjoyed my stay! Everyone was very helpful during my stay, restaurant was great recommend it to anyone food was delicious. Drinks was very good 10/10 awesome  👍🏾

title: Hidden Gem
text: I recently stayed at this hotel on business and had a great stay. Friendly hotel staff immediately greeted me upon arrival. Dio and Carla at the Front Desk could not have been more welcoming. My room was clean, updated and had everything I needed. Having a river view to look at was a bonus. I usually only see buildings. The location was also great. There were many restaurants to choose from within a couple of blocks. I will definitely stay at this hotel again when in the city.

title: Great Rooms with some good views
text: Spacious size for New York City. Had a nice view of the city from my room. Service was great. Near a lot of good restaurants and within walking distance to alot of attractions. Will definitely return to this property in the future.

title: Consultant
text:
I was originally going to stay for one night but fell and had to extend by stay. Dio and Carla at the front desk were beyond accommodating.
Also, the restaurant that was used for Room Service was excellent. Don’t miss the Spaghetti  Carbonara.
The room was clean and comfortable.

title: Amazing!!!!
text:
My family and I had an amazing stay at the hotel.  From the time we arrived we were greeted by the friendly bell staff. we were advised where to check in on the 2nd floor.  The staff at the front desk was pleasant and very helpful with suggestions on where to visit and where to go eat in the area.
The hotel was clean and the room for NYC was spacious, we had a room with two beds that over looked One World Trade - the view at night was simply breathtaking.
When we return to NYC this would be our hotel of choice .
So much still left to explore in New York

title: My hotel of choice in downtown Manhattan
text: I always sleep well at this hotel.  Bed is comfortable. Room temperature can be set low which I prefer.  WiFi is strong which helps with work emails and zoom calls.  With my Diamond status I get high floor rooms with great view.  Hotel management always recognizes my status and I get really nice snack bags when I check in.  Also I need quiet and never have been woken up by noise in adjacent rooms.

title: "Great location and very comfortable stay"
text: Spent two nights here for a mini vacation in downtown NYC. The front desk staff members were friendly and helpful and the accommodations were neat, clean and comfortable. I would recommend this location as a perfect jump off point for all that the Financial District and lower Manhattan have to offer.

title: Outstanding stay
text: Great hotel in an excellent location. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. The rooms were clean and spacious for a NYC hotel. I would recommend this as a great place for business and leisure travelers

title: Great Experience and excellent location
text: I spent 5 nights at the hotel for business and pleasure. The staff was excellent. Anytime I needed something or had a question they were very responsive. The lobby decor is very nice and we really enjoyed the meals we had at the restaurant. The room was very clean and recently remodeled. The hotel is conveniently located to many downtown attractions and it is easy to walk to them. There are plenty of restaurants and bars in the area. Overall a very good experience.

title: New York
text: Room was very clean. Service was great. Only problems we had was waiting for an elevator for over an hour and finally deciding to walk down 21 flights of stairs with our luggage to check out. The rooms are not very soundproof. We were awakened by our neighbors at 530 am.

title: Horrible Experience
text: Expect worst service of your life. The staff makes you feel extremely unwelcomed, like they don’t want you to stay there. They will yell at you, and the room AC and bathroom door were both broken. Worst hotel

title: Satisfacción, calidad y precio
text: El hotel cumplió nuestras expectativas acorde a lo ofrecido y las necesidades de nuestro viaje, la habitación agradable con vista a la ciudad, las zonas comunes son bonitas, si se requiere hay buen servicio de restaurante, el sector muy tranquilo, hay fácil acceso al servicio de transporte, el guarda equipaje fue muy útil para nosotros que teníamos viaje en la noche, el personal respondió rápidamente a nuestras solicitudes

title: Great Location, simple room
text: Overall the property is nice. The rooms are very tiny and the bathroom shower is just a little wider than the average person. There is not a lot of room to turn around and allow your full body to get wet. Unfortunately, my shower was slow to drain so the bathroom floor (outside of the shower) was constantly wet for extended periods of time. Other than that the train is close to train stations and pier 17!

title: This is a 2 star hotel at best
text: I stayed 2 times in a 7 day period both stats were disappointing. First- I stayed 2 days wanted to leave for 3 days and return for a stay. They refused to allow me to leave a bag there while I was gone. Next- the room is very small. I tried to order room service from the restaurant in the hotel. They don’t have room service- they delivered take out - with plastic silverware to eat very poorly cooked pasta.  On my return trip I had a deluxe King w river view. Barely had a river view.  I tried to take a shower- I had no cold water and the shower was scalding hot. I called 3 x and finally after an hour I had cold water- but the faucets were reversed-   The only good thing about this place is that the staff were very friendly. I don’t think I will be staying there again. Really not up to Hilton Standards

title: Great view but roach and mold overshadowed it
text:
The view from the  40th floor over looking the Hudson was amazing. However, that was the only highlight from my stay. The lobby had no clear way to guide check in traffic. Social distancing was out of the question with the tiny elevators - of which there were only 3 for so many floors. 
Upon getting to my room, it was small but doable. However, pulling back the sheets to check bed, I noticed dried lettuce and food… umm… so much for disinfecting.

At least there was no carpet- a definite plus for an outdated place. There was black mold in the bathroom, dogs barking in the room next to me and a roach greeted me in the shower .

I’ve stayed at many Double Tree locations and have to say, this did not live up to the brand expectation.

title: Decent, not great guests
text: Fair services. I could other guests extremely annoying. More for tourists than for those who look for business stay. Like other hotels, immigrants taking the role of housekeeping a d female hotel staffs were acting very weird. Felt insulted and underappreciated but it also felt like they enjoyed it that way which made me feel so sick about them. I hope that the service quality is ensured throughout the group across different racial or religious backgrounds. Professionalism counts.

title: Costly Sleep
text: This place seems to not care about those staying , as requests are never met, which at times can be costly mistakes. I requested a wake up call that was never made and ended up causing me to miss a tour I paid $125

title: Average hotel with lack of room servicing. Lack of service and communication with staff
text: The staff did not provide us with any sheets, room cleaning, trash take out, or fresh towels. Me and my friend asked the front desk multiple times during our stay and each time they ignored our requests. We had to reuse our towels for 3 days and sleep in dirty sheets. Visiting NYC requires a place to clean up and feel refreshed however this hotel did not provide us with the bare necessities for cleanliness.

title: Slow elevators
text: Not what I expected a Doubletree should be, I would’ve been better off at another property with faster elevators and updated rooms. Waited an average of ten minutes everytime we wanted to leave or came back. It got ot the point people were taking the stairs instead of using the slow elevators.

title: Subpar at best
text: The elevators are very slow even with three it took a long time to come and when they did they were often over crowded. The staff wasn’t particularly helpful or accommodating. There is no bottle water except for purchase. Overall the experience was subpar at best.

title: Great place
text: Firefighter there for 9/11 ceremonies. Close and clean. Great place a little price but nice place. Only thing is the elevators take for ever, other then that clean room, great shower, comfy beds, just awesome!

title: Great downtown location, friendly front desk
text: Best location downtown, short walk from south ferry, batter park, governor’s island ferry, south street seaport and restaurants. On weekends street parking nearby is possible along Broad Street, nearby alleys, across from Governors Island Ferry. Checkin is in floor 2, entry is at the street level. Recommmend higher floors for great river views. Rooms were clean and well appointed while being on the smaller side (OK by NY city std). Elevators are fine except for peak hours (check in, check out, dinner time, when it stops on many floors as everyone is pressing the call button). Finally Carla and Daniel at the front desk were very good - they will take care of you. Go with an open mind and remember this is NYC - I think you will have a good time.

title: Pristine
text: The property is close to many wonderful restaurants, New York Pier, train station and the Staten Island Ferry! It’s extremely clean and the staff is excellent. They do absolutely everything with a smile.

title: Unprofessional Team
text: Very unprofessional team and careless. They never got enough training and you can tell that they are tired of this job and the poor guests are paying for their stupidity. I walked out and stayed in a different hotel.

title: Small but clean
text: This property offers small but very clean rooms. It is conveniently located near Battery Park. The property is taking appropriate COVID-19 precautions such as “touchless check-in and check-out”. I got a very good rate below the published rates—-it is worth asking.

title: A very good value proposition
text: Good location and overall service. It was quiet and clean. We all enjoyed it. We will go back again as it was a very good value proposition. The front desk and concierge were good team players. All very helpful.

title: Отличное расположение
text: Хорошее расположение, близко к статуе свободы, Уолл стрит и другим достопримечательностям. Все быстро, удобно, быстро заселили.  До бруклинского моста 5 минут. Едой в отеле не пользовались, тк много мест вокруг

title: Great hotel and price!
text: Visited New York with my my 16 year old son. He loved the visit and location of the hotel, less than 5 mins from ferry and within minutes of subway locations. Lots of restaurants within walking distance of hotel.

title: Es un hotel bueno
text: El hotel es bueno, perfecto para ir a descansar, la verdad solo íbamos a dormir, las habitaciones son pequeñas, la espera de ascensor fue uno de los inconvenientes, tiene pocos ascensores para tantos pisos.

title: This hotel needs an update
text:
We chose this hotel for its location, but it was old and tiny.  It's narrow and tall -- we were on a high floor which is bad news when the elevators take forever !! We only stayed one night and got no sleep as one or more rooms near us where occupied by screaming, fighting, door-slamming people who carried on for a looong time before security finally arrived.

There are no amenities at this hotel. As a hilton gold member, we generally get a small breakfast ... not available here. They told us we could get some items out of their refrigerator case, but there was nothing decent to choose from (lots of junk food). 

DO NOT STAY HERE !!

title: Not worth it
text: The elevator was extremely slow, waited at least 5 to 10 minutes every single time. Hotel had absolutely no extra towels for approximately 2 to 3 days?? The shower door insulation was quite poor and soaked the bathroom floor after every shower a.k.a. why we needed extra towels as we had to use the ones we had to sop up the water. Room was quite small even with a king suite but I guess that should be be expected in NYC. Overall, was not worth the price we paid and will definitely not be returning. The 3 stars goes out to the easily accessible attractions close by and the wonderful front desk staff that were so nice and helped us at check-in.

title: Great hotel!
text: Everything was great except for the elevators. It’s takes too long to go up and down the elevators. Not sure what can be done to resolve that matter. Other than that I would totally recommend to family and friends.

title: Good location Low cost
text:
The staff was friendly and the room was fine. Close to a subway station. 
The air conditioning wasn’t always cold enough. The floor could have been cleaned better. I dropped an earring and when I looked under the dresser, that wasn’t a pretty site.

title: Overall good hotel
text: Service was friendly and fast.Beds were not as comfortable as I would have liked. Rooms were nice as clean. Elevators were awful. All staff was very helpful and pleasant. Prices were great. Location was great.

title: Terrible experience
text: Never had any cookies. Shower leaked all over the bathroom. Maintenance never came to fix any issues. Would not give us an extra pillow for my 1 year old son.I love double tree hotels but this was by far the worst experience.

title: Disgusting rooms
text: I was advised by hotel staff in the house cleaning the rooms are not being clean through the cove it and the lack of staff this is no reason that I should be checking into a $200 a night room that has not been fully clean and sanitize due to Covid they should be the top priority which is has failed for this hotel

title: No communication at front desk.
text:
Wrong info about ice machines (told me I could get ice on 17th floor) went to 4 different floors. Just to call reception again and was told ALL the machines is broken except 7th floor. 
Still charged my credit card even though I explain it’s an company booking and they should charge the card on file. After going back and asking why I was charged after I told them not to, they said they don’t know anything about company card. I asked to speak to manager, he said “ oh yes, reverse her charges (it takes 5-7 days) and charge the card on file.

title: Good value, some disappointments
text:
Pros: 
Clean room, good price, good value. Excellent front desk help.

Cons:
We couldn’t get housekeeping during our stay, the elevators are not sufficient for the number of floors / guests. Whoever was stationed at the street entry was almost farcically useless. I would have had to suppress my laughter if I weren’t so burdened by my luggage. I would expect this complete lack of service in a third world country where there has been a collapse of civil society and you need to grease palms to get things done. It was shocking to see two DoubleTree / Hilton employees standing there and chatting while I struggled to find a cart, load it up, and get checked in and up to the room with two kids in tow. My partner would have been able to help me, but since there was no clear direction about what to do with our car while we unloaded luggage and checked in, he had to stay with the car to keep it from being towed. 

Overall, a good stay.

title: Location, location
text: Great location if you want to get uptown, but not stay uptown and deal with all the hustle. Staff was amazing, the restaurants in the area are so good and there’s several train stations just around the corner, you can be anywhere you want on 20 minutes. I stayed there for two weeks for work and will do it again

title: Found a used cough drop in my bed (wasn't mine!) -- it took more than six hours to have my sheets changed
text:
I got in late at night and went straight to sleep. When I woke up I noticed pink stains on my sheets and pillowcase and found a used cough drop stuck to the bed -- it was not mine. 

I told the front desk and was assured that my linens would be changed right away. When I came back five hours later, though, they had not been touched. Ninety minutes after that -- and three additional calls to the front desk later -- someone finally came to change my sheets... and asked me to help him do so. 

This happened during a global pandemic when Hilton is apparently going above and beyond to make sure its rooms are clean and that its guests feel safe and comfortable. I would venture a guess and say that this incident violates every single Hilton standard for cleanliness and customer service -- I would also venture a guess and say that a used cough drop in a hotel bed is a major health code violation. 

I have been in touch with Hilton's customer service, but they have been dismissive and do not seem to be taking this incident seriously. They've stopped responding to my emails.

title: Disappointed
text: Hotel was not what was expected. The lobby/entrance had no one attending it and check in was on the first floor. People smoking in front of hotel entrance, restaurant had no coffee machine was broken and street had constuction going on hard to get around. No street parking.

title: Great value for location and comfortable accommodations
text:
The hotel was located in a great area with access to transit all around.  Our room was clean and comfortable. Here are the top 2 issues: 1) The elevator wait most times was horrendous.  There are 44 floors and only 3 elevators - one of which I wasn't sure if it was working.  One morning while trying to go downstairs from the 23rd floor I had to wait over 15min for an elevator to arrive.  2) the ice machines on multiple floors were not working - I know this because I went from floor to floor where it was indicated one would be.  This combined with the long ass wait for the elevator made a simple task of getting ice an overly complicated and annoying. 

This is all very much first world problems, but my opinion non the less.

title: Whole hotel smelled like marijuana and cigarettes
text: Do not stay here. Check in is horrible and the whole hotel smells of marijuana and cigarettes. Parking it 2 blocks away and elevators are horribly slow I do not recommend anyone to stay here even for free.

title: Front Desk Assistance Could Not Get Worse.
text: Stayed here for four days and from the moment I checked in, the front desk/lobby lady, Ariisy was giving us an attitude. Every time we asked for any service she had something to say. The last day, I realized that my friends clothes had been soaked from the AC unit leaking. After having told Ariisy all this, as well as the fact that we were in a rush to catch our flight, she so kindly offered to dry our clothes. “What else do you want me to do?”, she said. WHAT A JOKE!! I was pissed and asked what she could do for me, and she just said that it was our choice whether we wanted to dry the clothes or not. Do not make the mistake of coming here because you will be treated like garbage. Thanks for nothing Ariisy!

title: Horrible, terrible, atrocious
text:
I got to the hotel and somehow they didn’t have my reservation locked in. Fine. I paid 600 dollars cash for the stay. Whatever. I asked for an early check in (red eye from Los Angeles) and they charged me 50 dollars to check in a couple hours early. There are a whopping THREE elevators for the whole hotel (40+ floors), they take forever to come when you press the button and when they do end up coming they are often filled to the point where you’re pressed up against other people uncomfortably. At one point, only one elevator was working so I walked up 40 stories of stairs to get to my room. Sounds fun, right? 

The people that work the front desk are just god awful. Rude beyond belief. One lady by the name of Ariisy was so rude I actually couldn’t believe it. The air conditioner leaked water all over my clothes and soaked them through. I called the front desk and Ariisy answered, proceeded to ask if I wanted to do my own laundry and dry it off (I mean, you can at least apologize right), sent someone up who just looked at it, said it was just cold, and walked out. I honestly do not think Ms. Ariisy should continue to be allowed to work anywhere and hope nobody has to deal with her ever again. She, along with all her colleagues, are so lazy that they made me go down to get my food delivery, extra towels, blankets, and anything else I requested. 

Do yourself a favor and don’t go here. Please. 

P.S. If for someone reason you make the mistake of going to this hotel, do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY from Ms. Ariisy. God bless her heart, but she is mean, rude, and lazy.

title: The elevators are the worst and the rooms are very small.
text: Terrible hotel .. I fell down the stairs and nobody cared. Had to take the stairs because the elevators run every 30 mins. The rooms are small you can hear everything coming and going. The ice machines were down on several floors. Oh and they charge $50 a night deposit

title: Review
text: Average hotel. Accommodations were clean and neat. Great location in downtown Manhattan. Easy to get to many major attractions including Brooklyn Bridge, the Piers, 911 Memorial and Museum, Stock Exchange and more.

title: Needs to Improve
text: Surly front desk clerk who insisted I did not have a reservation until I presented her with my printed copy.
