Informed no free breakfast as restaurant is not yet open, but did not offer any nearby alternatives. Bathroom mirror light not functioning. Downer for makeup application. Other than that, clean and quiet.

title: Great hotel for the money.
text: Great hotel for the money. Aside from the slight hitch with the water this hotel is a phenomenal value. Located in the heart of downtown Manhattan, it’s accessible to everything including subway, restaurants, and more!

title: EXCELLENT!!!
text: The hotel service was really good. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The location is very accessible and that easy to go around the city even if you go to Central Park. Still very accessible with the subway system.

title: Terrific Location
text: I enjoyed the location as it was close to areas of interest to me during my stay. It also happens to be located on the first Street to ever be paved in New York City. The hotel had everything I needed and was close to other shopping venues where I was able to purchase necessities. I would stay again.

title: Tiny Rooms, Noisy and lack of accessibility getting to /from rooms
text: If you like tiny rooms with endless noise and have all the time in the world to wait for your elevator to take you down, this is your spot. Barely any room to walk in your room. Also the walls are paper thin. I could hear my neighbors talking all night long because of how close the rooms are packed next to each other. It also took 25 mins to get a hold of an elevator just to go down to get a cart for my bags. Once I was in the elevator with others, it took another 15 mins to get all the way down since everyone was trying to get on. There are 3 elevators. It should be not be as bad as it was. Totally unacceptable.

title: Not worth it
text: Arrived Friday after Checkin time of 4pm. Had to wait in line to take elevator up to registration where we also waited in line and eventually were told our room was not ready. Then waited again to get elevator to our room. The elevator system is appalling. Make sure to leave an extra 10 mins just to ride the elevator. Our room had no trash can and no remote for the tv. Our WiFi was not working and when I called downstairs the gentleman I spoke to was clearly stressed and said he had a line of ppl in front of him and could not help me right now with the WiFi. Also I should mention we never got our free cookies. Walls are very thin. Could hear conversations. Other than location and price would not recommend. I am a Hilton member.

title: 👩‍🍳
text: Customer service was superb.Very friendly and welcoming but the room could have been cleaned throughly there were still crumbs between the cushion and chair and shower was still dirty. I have asthma, so the smell of smoke of marijuana was very discouraging to smell all through the hall way. So I had to use towels to cover the bottom of the door to keep the smell and smoke from seeping in.

title: Good location not clean
text: Room was super tiny. Not clean or updated really. Loud guests and a crowd that just needed to not be there. I didn’t get a cookie so what happened with that?? Room service was good though. Food was very tasteful and the value was great.

title: The worst front desk staff - rude.
text:
Checked in 1 hr early, unfortunately, Anna was checking me in. She isn't the friendliest person. She charged me $30 to check in 1 hrs early, fine. She told me the hotel is fully booked and couldn't give me the river view I paid for.  Fine. The room was decorated very modern and nice! But the room wasn't clean. The bathroom floor had dirt along the walls and shower. There was dirty around the furniture. Wish I had a broom. But not a major issue, since I often carry lysol wipes to disinfect the room handles (precautions for Covid). What I didn't like was there was no hot water. Waited for Maintenance at 930PM to arrive and tell me the hotel is not booked. There's only 20 rooms booked tonight and therefore it's necessary to run the shower and sink for 10 minutes to get some hot water. It will take 10 minutes to have hot water.  Wow. What a waste of water and my time to wait 10 minutes for water that will be warm enough for a shower! And this is okay with Hilton?????
My other issue, why did Anna lie and say the hotel is booked and couldn't give me the river view I Paid for? But she's still charging me $30 to check in 1 hr prior to check in.  Anna doesn't seem to like her job, maybe she needs some training or repositioned to another job at Hilton. Front desk isn't her strength. She's not friendly at all!

title: Staycation for New Yorkers
text:
At $90 for a clean, king bed room on the 39th floor, this Doubletree is perfect for us locals looking to have a "stay-cation" and kick around FiDi.
Lunch at the Seaport, a ride on the SI Ferry, dinner at AMPEIA rooftop at 100 Broad St, a nightcap of whisky while sitting by the fireplace at Fraunces Tavern, and a good nights sleep.
We awoke late the next morning and felt like new!

title: Doesn’t merit 4 stars
text: My stay here was a major disappointment.  No complimentary water bottles in the room.  The walls were so thin I could here every intimate detail of what was transpiring in the room next door even after the occupants kindly agreed to try to keep the volume down.  My back aches from the mushy smudgy uncomfortable bed.  The front desk attendant treated us with the courtesy of a youth hostel manager when we checked in.  I will never book a DoubleTree again!

title: A quiet slice of luxury in Downtown Manhattan
text: Let me first say the reviews on here almost made me cancel but I figured for a 4 star Hilton hotel, it cannot be that bad! As a gold member, I was upgraded to a view room and given free breakfast (which was grab and go but included a breakfast sandwich, yogurt, muffin, fruit and a bar). The one pet peeve I had was the 5-10 minute waits for the elevator but that is a design flaw and probably not the hotel's fault (44 floors and only 3 elevators). They recently renovated the lobby and rooms and they look really nice! This hotel is steps away from the Ferry to Staten Island, 1/R/W trains at Whitehall Street and the 4/5 trains at Bowling Green. Would def stay here again!

title: No me han devuelto mi deposito, me quede el dia 12/12/20
text:
El hotel todo perfecto, pero el deposito no lo eh visto de regreso; fueron 50 USD los que me pedían.

En todo lo demás muy buen hotel en todo su esplendor, a unas cuadras del ferry.

El lobby esta en el segundo piso

title: Good Property to stay in downtown.
text: Its a decent hotel with limited amenities. Good property for a short business or leisure stay. It also has a restaurant on the ground level. Good food and decent ambience. Would surely recommend for all kinds of travelers.

title: Convenient to ferry
text:
***Disclaimer- Traveling during COVID and therefore lots of reduced amenities***

We stayed here overnight since we wanted to do a short day trip to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.   Great spot to stay at if you want to do this and you don't need the extra frills.   

Rooms were very clean and our stay was comfortable but as Diamond members, we sorely missed the extra things that come with this status though.   Instead of breakfast in their restaurant, we were given frozen food (i.e., frozen breakfast sandwiches, yogurt, juices) to put in a paper bag to take with us.  All in all, it's a great deal but again, you will be missing the added touches that you've been accustomed to.

title: Good visit, but eventful
text:
The hotel was really nice. Rooms well kept and facilities good.

However, there isn’t enough elevators. My partner was waiting over 15 minutes for an elevator at one point. Not the hotels fault I guess, just bad building planning by whomever constructed it.

There also seemed to be a squatter in the hotel who decided to protest outside of the hotel!

title: Hairs and crumbs on bed sheets
text: Ok this is an unprecedented times and everybody is going their part however this hotel is not. I was getting ready to go to bed and I found hairs and crumbs in between the sheets. How come they say they are going the extra mile to have everything clean and sanitized before guest’s arrival. How come I am going to feel safe at this hotel now? Did they really clean and sanitized the room?

title: Così Così
text:
Premesso che non era la mia prima volta a NY, dove torno appena posso, prenotando all'ultimo la scorsa estate non avevo molte alternative e così la mia scelta è ricaduta su questo hotel.
in passato avevo già usufrutito della catena DoubleTree/Hilton, trovandomi egregiamente.
credo che questo hotel sia abbastanza sotto la media rispetto ai suoi "fratelli". 
inizierò dai punti positivi: la posizione. per molti dormire a downtown/financial district non è il massimo. a me la zona non dispiace affatto. l'hotel è abbastanza vicino a due fermate della metropolitana, con cui raggiungere sia il centro città che Brooklyn. per quanto mi riguarda, adoro camminare e trovo che NY abbia un ottimo sistema di mezzi, per cui anche se si è un pochino decentrati di fatto questo non costituisce un problema.
pulizia dell'hotel: direi sufficiente.
i punti positivi purtroppo per me sono terminati. non ho usufruito della colazione quindi non posso giudicare.
la camera (una superior) era abbastanza piccola, e nonostante avessimo prenotato una vista città, al nostro arrivo ci viene consegnata una camera con vista palazzo di fronte. dopo averlo fatto notare in reception ci viene detto che siamo stati noi a prenotare la camera sbagliata. al che, con disappunto, devo mostrare la prenotazione di Booking, solo a quel punto ci viene data la camera giusta. questo punto lo trovo davvero spiacevole.
al ritorno, al momento di prenotare l'auto per l'aeroporto, ci viene detto che l'auto sarebbe arrivata di lì a poco, ma attendiamo per più di mezz'ora invano rischiando di perdere l'aereo.
capisco che NY sia una città tafficata, ma mi aspetto che se mi viene detta una cosa, questa sia rispettata. morale? abbiamo chiamato un taxi.
penso che tutto possa essere migliorato: dall'accoglienza, alla cura dei dettagli, alla cortesia del personale.
non soggiornerò più qui e non mi sento di consigliarlo (se non nel caso non si abbia altra scelta, come nel mio caso)

title: Miserable policies during a time where we all need a little humanity
text:
1)Early checkin (an hr) costs 30 dollars. 2)Checkout is at 11, 11:20 you will be charged another nights stay
3)a microwaveable dinner when nothing else is open is 10 dollars
4)they still charge the resort fee despite having poor internet, zero amenities, and everything is shut down. 
5) there is zero staff to help with anything
6) feel like they are trying to take us for everything we've got when the whole deal is that we are here because we can't afford anything else at a time when people are close to being on the street...

I will not be using hilton anymore. Im disgusted.

title: 立地はいい
text: ニューヨーク滞在時に１泊。場所は少々分かりづらいがマンハッタンのアクセスには抜群。部屋も清潔感があっていいがややビジネスホテルの様な雰囲気。

title: It's all about location.
text: Tiny everything here. Small rooms, no bathroom counter space, small walkways and very slow elevator service for 44 floors. Only 2. took the stairs a couple times from the 15th floor because I didn't have time to wait any longer. On site restaurant will cost you $30 per person for a breakfast buffet that's worth maybe $15. Location is good but I will not be back.

title: Great experience
text: I visit New York at least twice a year and I have to say I will be staying at this Doubletree from now on. I have to say I've had a great experience even with the fact that the elevators are a little slow. I have to applaud the front desk team. They are spectacular particularly Elijah and Marcus. They were so friendly and helpful when I checked in.

title: 便利な立地
text:
ロウアーマンハッタンのバッテリーパーク近く、ウォール街からも少しの距離。JFK空港に向かう地下鉄駅もすぐそばで

title: Excellent Staff Make A Difference

The service provided at this hotel was superior and unforgettable. Upon arrival, my business colleague was checked in by Tina and I was checked in by Davedena. Both ladies were rather personable and professional. Davedena addressed me by my name and thanked me for being a Hilton Honors member. These things make a difference. Additionally, I appreciated the offer of a cookie and two bottles of water after a plane ride and meetings.

title: Excellent Staff
text: This hotel is located in the business district and is a few steps away from great restaurants. The front desk staff were personable and attentive. I felt like a person rather than a number. As a business traveler, I see many front desk staff. This team was superior.

title: Disappointing third stay at this hotel
text: Based on previous experiences at this hotel, we opted to return for a third time. However, the poor attitude and rudeness of certain reception staff was disappointing when they dealt with problems that arose during our stay. Such a shame!

title: マンハッタン、ブルックリンに行くのに便利！
text:
Staten Island Ferry Whitehall Terminal（スタテンアイランド行フェリー乗り場／自由の女神を見に行くのに最適）のすぐ近くにある。近隣にはもう1件ヒルトンホテルがある。付近には地下鉄駅が3つ（South Ferry、Whitehall Street、Bowlling Street）利用可能。マンハッタン中心地、ブルックリンに行くのに非常に便利。
特にSouth Ferry駅はエレベーター設置駅なので、重たい荷物がある時でもなんとか利用できる。
標準的なキングベッドの部屋に宿泊。ベッドはふかふか。寝心地も良い。テレビも大画面。ただし、バスルームはシャワーブースのみ（ニューヨークは仕方がない）。それと冷蔵庫が無い（ホテル内に氷、自販機があるので基本的には問題なし）。比較的広い部屋で仕事が出来そうな机があるが、デスクチェアーの皮がボロボロで少々残念な感じ（それ以外は問題ない）。
なお、各階の部屋数は少なめだが、高層ビルなのでチェックアウト時間はエレベーターが相当混雑するので覚悟しておいた方が良い（フロントが2階なので1階に降りるのも大変！）

title: Great Hotel
text: This was in a great location, price was great, parking rate was reasonable for NYC.  It was located within walking distance to 3 subway stops.  The room was clean.  The elevator was a little slow but there are 44 floors.

title: Clean, Convenient, and Friendly Staff
text: The property is not much on atmosphere, but I have stayed here many times, but for value and location, it continues to be my number one downtown choice. The rooms are NYC-tiny, but well appointed and clean. The “on-site” restaurant offers a reasonably-priced range of options (and room service), and there is a small fitness center that gets very busy (though if you are there before 6 AM or after 8PM, there is usually equipment available). 4 subway lines and the Staten Island Ferry within a 5 minute walk.

title: DoubleTree by Hilton New York Downtown/Financial District
text:
Was in town for a business trip to a client site located in SoHo, the Double Tree was a little farther than where I originally wanted to stay, but the R & W Subway line was actually right across the street; so getting to the client site was a quick 15 to 20 minute subway ride.  Another 15 to 20 minutes and you're in Midtown Manhattan.

The Double Tree is also literally down the street from Battery Park where you can catch the ferry over to Liberty/Ellis Island and is in walking distance of the World Trade Center & 9/11 Memorial (or another short Subway ride on the R/W).

As for the hotel stay,

 - The good
Loved the city view from my room.
Warm Cookies available at the front desk - comfort food.

All staff -- front desk, support, restaurant  -- were courteous, attentive, and quick to respond to all requests; they made the Double Tree feel like home during a challenging business trip.

Tip: Fastest responses to questions and requests were via the text message feature in the Hilton Honors App

Dinner at Antica Ristorante next door was excellent - a bit pricey, but I really enjoyed my meal.  Quite a few restaurants/eateries  within walking distance, so you have options.

- The acceptable 
The room was a bit on the smallish side, and I had to crank the thermostat at times to keep it comfortably warm during a cool to cold week, but hotel staff was quick to supply a blanket upon request and all was good.

Bed was too soft for my taste as I have a preference for something firmer since an auto accident long ago, but that's just me.

Elevators - Could be a tad bit slow at times.  I was there for nearly a week, and two of the three elevators were always working with one elevator not available from time to time for one or two days.  However, I was on the 35th floor (by choice), so I knew to pack a little patience during those "busy hotel" times.

The breakfast buffet was good -- a bit pricey for the available options scrambled eggs, sausage/bacon, pancakes, oatmeal, fruit/cereal/breads (menu is also available).  Dunkin Donuts and Starbucks are just around the corner, so additional options are within walking distance

 - The tad bit strange
After my reservation was made, I read a few reviews mentioning issues with bed bugs, and on an early day back from a client visit, there was a small gathering of people in front of the hotel dressed as...bed bugs?  with signs -- Ok, I personally did not have any problems with bed bugs at this hotel, but - that happened.

title: Parfait !
text: Un hôtel spacieux, lit King size, chambre très bien agencé, vu sur les building de NYC en plein cartier des affaire, j'ai adoré cette hôtel et ses services ! Commande pour le dîner afin de manger en chambre...

title: Bed Bugs!!! 😷😳
text:
I recently stayed at Double Tree that’s located in the New York Downtown area. To start, my stay at The Double Tree included excellent service. Staff was very welcoming and showed professionalism. But I do have a major complaint regarding my room, which was the bed bug that I found crawling on a pillow on the bed at 2am. 

 When I first seen the bug I mistook it for a possible roach, which isn’t good either. But after a closer inspection, I realized that it was in fact a bed bug. I took a few photos and videos. I checked and packed all my belonging and went to the front desk to complain. Although I planned to check out early this morning, I was still giving another room for night. But I am still not convinced that it’s not throughout the other rooms. Which is why I choose not to sleep on the bed. 

Don’t do it lol

title: A little disappointed
text: The rooms are very small a matter of fact the tv is larger then the room and hard on the eyes to watch. And the elevators are very slow for 40plus story building this hotel is set up very strange the check in is on the second floor there’s no lobby to speak of you two cookies at check in and that’s it no extras

title: Il posto giusto come appoggio per visitare la citta
text:
Ho visto Hilton migliori di questo ma tutto sommato è un bell albergo a downtown, la reception è al secondo piano ed è una bellissima e grandissima sala rinnovata da poco, le camere sono piccole e vecchie , avrebbero bisogno di essere rinnovate, la colazione la offrono nell ristorante sotto l albergo, è Buona ma potrebbero mettere più prodotti e cose da mangiare, ma per essere un double tree non ci si può lamentare..
 La sera la zona limitrofa è deserta e molto tranquilla, a due passi da wall street e da ground zero.
Buonissimi i biscotti caldi che ti regalano al check in 😍

title: In a good area near the financial district
text: Reception staff were friendly & helpful and the free cookie was appreciated..  The room was small but very clean. The hotel does not offer breakfast, but there are plenty of places nearby to get it. The hotel was very convenient to several metro stations ie Bowling Green, South Ferry etc & also close to the free ferry to Staten Island.  The only complaint we had, was the 4 lifts to service the number of rooms in the hotel, but the staff did tell us that the lifts are about to be upgraded.  We had never stayed in this area before, but thoroughly enjoyed it & would consider it again next time.

title: Other hotels way better than this one
text:
Stayed for a week in business in the financial area. Terrible service, unfriendly front desk staff when checking in after 10pm.

Major construction project with a lot of noise and limited elevators which take forever to get.

Room were terrible, either too hot or too cold. 

Water for shower was too cold.

Terrible musty or smoker smell in the room. Thin windows could hear everything on the street below.

Restaurant attached has the worst breakfast and very costly.

Ashamed it is associated with the Hilton .

title: Calm quiet clean .
text:
Nice team in a quiet and clean hotel. 
Near staten island ferry, wall street and charging bull.
Subway whitehall and bowling green at few meters to go up or downtown and Brooklyn.
Discover Manhattan by boat with staten island ferry for free. Amazing pictures...

title: Amazing!
text: Tina and Dominique were amazing!!! Tina made sure we were well accommodated and they gave us amazing service! They went out of their way to make sure we were happy and we are thankful for that!! We would definitely come back and stay at this Double Tree by Hilton!!

title: Great Experience
text: Second time at this hotel, visiting family in NYC.  Very accommodating and staff very helpful.  I would definitely stay here again. The location was extremely convenient for walking to restaurants etc. The room was just right for me.

title: Excelente hotel
text: Sin duda me volveré a quedar en ese hotel cuando regrese a nyc la limpieza es increíble la estación del metro se encuentra a 2 minutos o menos camino y las camas son extremadamente cómodas y el servicio al cliente de los empleados es increíble

title: Good
text: Everything was good and nothing to complain. Was very close to my IELTS exam center. It took just 5 minutes for me to reach the exam center. I would suggest my friends as well to try out this Hilton. Great

title: Excellent value.
text: I was in New York for work, spent two night here.  Very easy, accommodating, great location, excellent value.  The staff and other guests were friendly. Subway and good restaurants and coffee all nearby.

title: Grundsätzlich OK
text: Sehr gut Lage in Manhatten. Alles sehr gut zu erreichen und gute Möglichkeiten sich im Umfeld zu versorgen. Leider war die Klimaanlage/Heizung des Nachts zu laut und auch nach Wechsel des Zimmers nicht wesentlich besser....

title: Clean and cheap
text: Hotel prices for an average hotel in NYC can be as pricey as an upscale hotel in other areas of the U.S.  The DoubleTree by Hilton downtown on Stone Street hits the mark with clean rooms, friendly staff and well-located in the finanical district with at 3 major subway lines in walking distance to the hotel, tons of shopping at WTC Brookfield and restaurants/bars.  Be wary that the financial district is a ghosttown on the weekends - though, if you don't mind a little longer of a walk or taking a subway to other areas of the city, this is a great hotel for the budget-minded traveler.  Be wary that the rooms are TINY as you would expect for NYC, river views exist on the higher floors but they are obstructed, the gym is clean but small and there is not bar, lounge, or any other amenities.

title: Great cookie service
text: I found a great deal online. i was giving great customer service by the staff and the cookies were great. Thr hotel was clean and very spacious. The room was simple n clean which j liked very much i would recommended it to anyone for the price that i paid

title: A great stay!
text: Arrived late afternoon after a long flight and check in was a breeze. The front desk personal was really kind and professional. I also got a cookie, which I was told was complementary and free throughout my stay (nice touch). I got the keys to my room which was located on the 30th floor, overall a nice room with all the amenities that you need and the most important thing, a comfy bed! View wasn't the best, nor the worst. One downside was the noise coming from the hallway, the door didn't seem to have good soundproofing at the bottom. Overall a great stay and I can really recommend this place!

title: Best affordable hotel in Manhattan
text:
Súper localización excelente servicio magnífica atencion

Las camas son una delicia

title: Outstanding
text: Outstanding in every way. Staff was extremely friendly and quick. Even maintenance and housekeeping staff we met in the elevators were kind, happy, and welcoming. We were able to store our luggage securely until check in time as we arrived in the city many hours early.

title: Great stay!
text:
We were booked to stay at this hotel for 5 nights over the new year period. The location of this hotel was perfect for us having previously stayed uptown on our last visit. Walking distance to the brooklyn bridge, battery park, 9/11 memorial and plenty of shops and restaurants.
Walking distance to all subway lines and the hop on hop off buses station.
Check in was quick and easy, they do put a hold of $250 on your card incase you incur a charge during your stay. 
Id read a lot about the lifts in this hotel and was dreading it a bit, on a short break I did not want to waste time waiting around for lifts however, the only time we had to wait a little longer than expected was on check in due to how busy it was. Not once for the rest of our stay did we wait more than a minute, we were on the 8th floor though so that might have helped.
10/10 for the housekeepers, room serviced, cleaned and fresh towels everyday, very happy and impressed with this after reading some previous reviews!
On to the room itself - quite small for two people, especially when the ironing board was out but we did not spend much time in there so not problem. Couple of drawers were hanging off and not useable but we only had a few bits as it was a short stay so we didnt mention it. TV was great, bed really comfortable and the shower was always hot, perfect. So why the 4*? Unfortunatly this is mainly down to inconsiderate guests. I think there is 10 rooms per floor, Therefore all rooms are near the lift and the door to use the stairs. We could hear the 3 lifts, we could hear talking, shouting, singing (fair enough at a reasonable time but im talking 3/4am). Paper thin walls. When a door was opened in any room on the floor the walls in our room shook as the door slammed shut, which was often. The door for the stairs was even worse and that was next to our room. So thats all that let it down for us, so pack some ear plugs!!

title: Mediocre
text: Pros: Good location, friendly staff, free bottles of water. Cons: Room was small (as expected in downtown Manhattan), somewhat run down and had fruit flies/bugs in the bathroom. Unacceptable: Hotel restaurant where HH breakfast is served has a C Heath grade. Very rare to see such a low heath grade, unacceptable for a hotel restaurant.

title: xmas in nyc
text:
Good hotel close to the subway into the centre of manhatten,time square etc,food place accross the road,we used that a couple of times,we did find staying in nyc expensive,as we normally only 
do day there ,as we have family that we stay with in conneticut,there is a deli nearby which was good ,cant remember the name of it,drinks are expensive in the bars,$40 for a bottle of wine,we found a wine store nearby wine about $14 upwards depending what you want,if using the subway for more than 1day buy a ticket for more than that its cheaper.

title: Viaggio a New York Natale/Capodanno
text:
Hotel situato nel financial district di Manhattan,quartiere abbastanza tranquillo di giorno e molto la sera.
Diversi i localini presenti nel quartiere dove poter cenare la sera e fare due passi.
Molto vicino all'ingresso della metro,alla borsa di NY e battery park partenza delle barche per la visita alla statua della libertà .
Hotel in zona strategica,abbastanza costoso,letto comodo e personale abbastanza gentile.
Stanze non un granché con arredamenti datati e non di livello,prezzi abbastanza alti,letto molto comodo e ottima posizione.
I prezzi secondo me sono troppo  alti per quello che offre ma del resto siamo a NY a Capodanno....
Voto complessivo 6

title: Parfait
text: Nous avons passé 5 nuits dans cet hôtel et tout s’est passé pour le mieux. Les lits sont très confortables, le service de chambre parfait, l’accueil de même. Nous avons adoré la position de l’hôtel! A deux pas du metro reliant time square... et à deux minutes à pied de Battery park... Nous y retournerons à coup sûr!

title: Excelente
text:
Otimo custo beneficio.
Cumpre exatamente com a sua proposta.
Só poderia ter um frigobar também, mas tem cafeteira e o café e açúcar são respostos todos os dias.
Ótima localização, bem próximo à linha amarela do metrô

title: Reasonable proposition if the price is right
text: Hotel conveniently located next to the multiple subway lines and breakfast options. The hotel has apparently not been refurbished for a while and a couple of things in the room were broken but nothing you would really care about and acceptable given an attractive rate. The long delays with the lifts that some have mentioned did not materialise for us ... just once out of a dozen uses did we have to wait more than 2 minutes. My biggest criticism or suggestion for improvement would be the bedding ... we had a sheet on top of a naked duvet on top of another sheet which is just weird. It may be a bit slower for the room maids but a duvet should have a proper duvet cover.

title: Hellhörig/ Preis,-Leistung aber ok
text: Das Hotel ist von der Lage sehr gut. Das Preis,-Leistungsverhältnis ist wirklich ok. Die Zimmer sind sehr hellhörig. Bei Partygästen oder laut sprechenden Nachbarn wird man auch mal aus dem Schlaf gerissen. Aus diesem Grund mussten wir auch 1x das Zimner wechseln. Die Problematik der Aufzüge ist im Hotel bekannt. Wenn man nicht zu Rushhour Zeiten das Haus verlässt oder betritt ist es in Ordnung . Der Zimmerservice kam oft nur nach Aufforderung oder erst spät nachmittags.

title: Ottima sistemazione
text: Ottimo hotel nella punta inferiore di Manhattan, ha pochi passi da Wall Strett, dagli imbarchi per Liberty Island, dal Ponte di Brooklyn e dal sito di Ground Zero. Inoltre, sempre molto vicino all’albergo, sono presenti molte fermate della metro che permettono di raggiungere tutta New York. Posizione perfetta! Staff molto gentile e camere belle e pulite. Avevamo una camera al 40º piano con una vista molto bella. Comodi e veloci gli ascensori. Colazione nel ristorante al piano terra, ricordatevi di prendere il voucher alla reception! In sostanza ottima sistemazione per una settimana a New York.

title: Convenient base for the city
text:
Stayed for a long weekend. The location is good, easy access to the metro and wasn't a problem reaching from JFK.
Lots to see and do around the area.
The rooms are huge, but it was extremely good value considering you are in Wall Street. Elevators can be a bit slow at peak times... might be worth considering a lower floor.

title: Estancia durante Navidad
text: La relación calidad-precio del hotel es buena, teniendo en cuenta que fuimos en época navideña y todo es más caro. La ubicación es muy buena, al lado de varias estaciones de metro que comunican muy bien con el centro de Manhattan y con el aeropuerto. La habitación y el baño son espaciosos y limpios. El desayuno es repetitivo, pero la calidad de los alimento es buena. El personal de recepción muy amable. Volvería a repetir.

title: Hilton Downtown Financial District NYC
text: Hilton Financial District NYC. Excellent Choice. Great location, friendly staff, clean and nicely furnished. Breakfast had many choices and was good way to start your day. Very quiet. Safe neighborhood and easy walk to Starbucks and subway.

title: Terrible Room Service and Cleanliness
text:
For clarity, the employees at the counter and ground floor were incredible. They were very courteous and professional. 

However, out of a 4 night stay, our room was only cleaned and serviced once. Despite our request to have someone  clean the room on the 27th, no one came to clean the room. We had ordered Chinese food on the 26th and as such, we had food garbage which needed to be cleaned. We had to deal with 2 days of food garbage in the room. We also had no more space to use the garbage bins and we had no towels as a result of the lack of house keeping.  It was the biggest disappointed coming to a hotel room with garbage which wasn't cleaned and the scent of food because no one took out the garbage, it was disgusting. 

Out of the years I have traveled and stayed in hotels, I have never had a hotel neglect their customers in this manner. Its poor hospitality with a clear disregard for their customers. 

When you book a hotel, especially in New York City, you are spending a tremendous amount of money. Within the price you pay, you are also paying for your room to be serviced (house keeping), so its reasonable to expect your room to be cleaned, to be provided with fresh towels and have your garbage cleared. None of which happened here. 4 nights and house keeping just came once. 

I always go out of my way to tidy the room before we leave in order to make it easier on the house keepers, mainly because I think its rude to keep a room a mess for house keeping. The most basic house keeping was non existent, what a disappointing stay.

title: Bom custo/beneficio
text:
Boa localização, bom custo/benefício, equipe prestativa e educada .
Tivemos problema no aquecimento do chuveiro e enviaram um técnico. No entanto, o problema voltou a acontecer.
Outro problema é que o hotel é enorme e tem só 3 elevadores. Nós estávamos no andar 40 e aconteceu de ficarmos mais de 10 minutos dentro do elevador até ele parar em todos os andares. Além disso, quem estava em andares mais baixo sempre pegava o elevador lotado e não conseguia entrar.
Os quartos são muito próximos um dos outros e você consegue ouvit o vizinho perfeitamente. No entanto, não há barulho de rua ou sirene (Só as buzinas da balsa).

title: Would stay again!
text: My boyfriend and I stayed here at the beginning of December.  The hotel was decorated nicely for the holidays.  The room and bathroom were both very clean.  The staff were very friendly.  The hotel is in walking distance to restaurants, sites and the subway.  No complaints here.

title: Ótima localização e atendimento
text: Bem localizado no Financial District com várias linhas do metrô próximas, permitindo ir a pé no WTC. Serviço bom. Sugiro pegar os andares mais próximos do térreo ou no topo (o elevador pode estar cheio de vc estiver no meio). Só o café da manhã (buffet) poderia ser mais variado pois era igual todos os dias (nem todos as reservas incluem o café da manhã). Cafeteira e frigobar no quarto. Se quiser usar microondas é só ir no lobby que está disponível, inclusive talheres de plástico e guardanapos.

title: Get ready to use the stairs
text:
The 2 out of 3 slow, tiny elevators that were working were completely incapable of transporting people through 45 floors with 10 rooms per floor. We started our trip on the 29 floor, got tired of taking the stairs up and down 28 floors, and changed rooms to the 5th floor. We would wait at least 10 minutes for the elevator and if it came within that time frame it would be completely full every time since there were always people waiting for the elevator on every single floor. 

The AC Unit in our room on the 5th floor would not work and would automatically revert to cooling at 72 degrees after a few minutes of operating at whatever temperature was set. The engineer replaced the fan in our AC unit but was unable to fix the reverting issue and we resorting to sleeping with the window open- in NYC, you can imagine how loud it was.

The 2 front desk staff were overwhelmed with the workload that was placed on them (granted, the stay was at what I am sure is a peak time in the tourism season), and the hotel was obviously under staffed.the interactions I had with them were unpleasant, but I completely understand why they would be predisposed to unpleasantness given their working conditions. 

The room amenities were very nice though. Tiny, but that is NYC.

title: Really a great team, friendly and clean place to stay!
text: Team was awesome!  Friendly and went out of their way to make our special overnight in NYC special.. great location close to subway.. with quick access to uptown.. or southern Manhattan attractions!  Signature cookie was a extra special treat!

title: Very good
text:
Rooms are smaller, but not too small.  I was happy with the size.

The room was very clean.  I did not score higher because the hot water takes some time to warm up in the shower, and the sliding bathroom door was very stubborn (they repaired the latter the morning after we reported).  

We lucked out and our room was on the top floor.  Even if we had not had a room on the top floor, if you have a north-facing room, you will have nice views.  (I am not certain about rooms facing other directions.)

It is a short walk to a subway line to get up north to the tourist spots.  The subway ride takes 20-30 minutes.   

I would stay here again.  This was a simple and easy place to stay and was worth the price.

title: Vacation
text: Room was small, but clean and nice. I assume almost all New York hotels rooms are small. Service was excellent, no issues. I would stay at this hotel again. Good location for easy access to subway, restaurants, and tourist things.

title: Stay at the Double Tree by Hilton New York Downtown
text: The Double Tree always provides great services. My boyfriend and I arrived an hour earlier than our check-in time but the staff already had our room ready! All staff members we ran into were nothing but friendly. The room was very clean and the noise level in the hotel was quiet. Even after check out they allowed us to keep our luggage in a secure place until we were ready to leave the city. I could not be more satisfied with our stay.

title: GO ELSEWHERE!!!
text:
We come to NYC quite frequently, as well as travel and this was our worst hotel experience EVER.

My young daughter had a big audition, and my father in law was nice enough to spend almost $1,000 between train and hotel for us to be able to get there and relax for her to do her best job.

The train ride was wonderful, but I knew we were getting in early so I called the night before to inquire about early check-in. They told me to call in the next morning, which I tried to while on the train and they had me on hold for over 10 minutes...we were almost there, so I figured I'd just inquire once we got there.

We booked the room on the Hilton app, and it required our payment information so my father in law gave me his card info. NOWHERE on the app, or the confirmation e-mail did it say that we needed to bring the card physically for payment. When we arrived, we were told that we had to have the card physically present, and of course since my father in law didn't come with us, we had to get him to drive 20 miles round trip into his work to print and complete an authorization form with copies of both his card and ID, front and back.

The front desk person never got his e-mail reply, so had to call him back and got him to text the photos to me. The attendant said that wouldn't work. I asked her if I could print it on site, she said she couldn't guarantee it would suffice. Tried to connect to WiFi to print, but of course I didn't have a room yet, so I had to go back and ask for the password to print. FINALLY got it printed, she went away for 10 minutes then came back and said it needed to be provided 24 hours before check-in.

At this point I am LIVID, so she said she would not charge us for the room that day, but rather the next to satisfy the 24 hour rule. I had to give a physical card for the incidentals though, which posed another issue. What should have been $50 held, on my bank account it showed SIX DoubleTree debits @ $50.00 each...so $300.00!!! Because of this, I was unable to use my debit card during our trip...thank GOD I had cash.

Two hours later and almost missing the audition...the only reason why we were there, we got a key to a room. There's 44 floors and only 3 elevators so it took 20 minutes to finally get up to the room.

We made it to the audition and coming back I was insistent on not eating at their restaurant (we paid $60 for lunch while waiting for the above to get figured out...one $13 house glass of wine and two appetizers) so we grabbed Chipotle. My own fault for not checking, but they didn't give us silverware, I ordered a burrito bowl. Realized it after waiting the 20+ minutes to get to our room, and I was not going to waste another hour going back down and up to get one.

I called room service to see if they'd send a fork, and they said they could but would have to charge us the 10% room fee. Insanity! Called the front desk and they happily obliged. An HOUR later, I finally got my fork.

After we showered and tucked in for the night, I received a phone call to my room. It was the front desk letting me know that for some reason, they tried to authorize my father in laws credit card and it declined. I called him, and he was unable to reach his credit card company to see what was going on. He told me to have the hotel call him and he would provide another card. The front desk said that was unacceptable and if another card was used, he would have to go through that whole process again with the authorization form and the copies. How do businesses pay for rooms for their employees?!

Thankfully he was able to get in touch with the credit card company, and same as my debit card, the reason why it was declined was because there was a fraud alert since there were 4 debits from DoubleTree at $50, $100, $150 and $200. They did whatever was necessary to make the card be authorized, but WHAT A NIGHTMARE.

Still livid, the next day I called Hilton to let them know of my experience and the person on the other line was a total idiot. He kept thinking I was not in my room yet and tried to connect me with the front desk, which of course at this point were the last folks I wanted to speak with. I then e-mailed my concerns and was basically told that was just their fraud policy and sorry about it. So much for their "Care" guarantee about doing whatever is necessary to make everything right! Nothing about this hotel visit went right.

We didn't get much sleep as the room we had didn't have blackout curtains, just sheer ones and the bright city lights shined right on through. I didn't want to spend $14 on pancakes for my daughter for breakfast so we escaped that awful place and experience the second we woke up, and will NEVER go back again.

title: First time visit to NYC
text: The wife and I visited NYC for the first time, spent 5 great nights based out of the Double Tree, Stone St. Room provided was  a Hilton Honours room, easily enough space for the two of us for the length of stay. Decor was to a reasonable standard, maybe in need of a refresh but nothing major and everything functioned as it should. We had room 707 which sadly gives you a view of the back of the hotel and the 'garbage truck' did disturb my wifes sleep during the first night. Room higher up with a better view would have been fantastic, but you can't have everythingI guess! Staff all very professional, polite and accomodating to any request made of them, maybe I should have asked for a change of room? We didn't eat in the on site restuarant as too many other places to eat in NYC. We used the 'air train' and subway to get from JFK to the hotel and this was very easy and if you get the right train the nearest subway station is a hundred yards from the hotel - be aware that it DOES NOT have elevator so you will have to carry any luggage up/down to the platform etc. If we visit again I would happily stay here again!

title: Location and hotel area is too small
text: Street entrance too small upon arriving.Wait time for elevator is too long so took 3 flights of stairs with your luggage which wasn't cool. Cookies were great for my kids though. Wish street entrance was bigger

title: Juste pour y dormir, c’est tout.
text:
Arrives a une heure tardive, recu sans sourire. 
Notre chambre était a l’époque de la creation de l’établissement.
Peinture cloquante, chaise poussiéreuse et tres abîmée serviette déchirée climatiseur d’époque...
Nous y sommes restes 11 nuits. 
Pas une bouteille d’eau délivrée pendant notre sejour. 
Nous nous sommes adresses au personnel.
Reponse rupture de stock 
Quand au cadre de l’etablissement, les chambres sont a revoir. Regardez les photos, elles ne sont pas truquées mais réalistes.

title: COCKROACHES!!!
text:
Don’t believe me? SEE PIC BELOW. This is unacceptable and absolutely DISGUSTING . My gf HAS ZERO TOLERANCE  to cockroaches and I made sure I booked what I thought was a 4 star hoteL TO AVOID THIS. Now I’m here consoling my gf who is unable to go to bed after seeing the cockroach next to her toothbrush. I paid extra money during a busy weekend in nyc for this place and I cannot believe that a hotel of this size is this FILTHY. 

This is on top of the fact that there’s a door that connects our room to the one next door and we can hear EVERYTHING! The elevators on top of that is a 10 minute wait during peak hours. 

Im so annoyed and embarrassed in front of my gf that something like this can happen at an upscale hotel. Avoid this place at all costs. PLEASE!!!

title: Good stay in the heart of Financial District!
text: Arrival was a bit rough, since my room was not ready. Otherwise the staff has been friendly throughout and very helpful during my one night stay. The room had a decent size and the amenities where just right. All was clean and I was able to store my bags for a couple of hours - all-in-all I`ll be back.

title: Find another spot
text: Maybe my standards are too high but the room i was in was not as clean as  you would.expect for the price point.  Be prepared to take the stairs or wait forever for an elevator in thee morning. Bring earplugs.

title: great and friendly customer service
text: the rates were perfect and the front desk person and other employees were great and always eager to help. had a great experience. would highly recommend and would reserve to stay at the same location again if need be

title: Great stay
text: It is the first time that we stayed at this hotel and we will be very happy to stay there again soon. Helpful and attentive staff. Great breakfast variety. Please consider adding a mini fridge to the rooms to keep bottles of water given to HHonors members and prescriptions such as insulin at an adequate temperature. Thanks!

title: Muy limpioo!!
text:
Hotel muy bien situado, las habitaciones muy limpias y espaciosas.
Lo único que las recepcionistas no son muy simpáticas, son bastante frías y si no hablas bien el idioma no se esfuerzan mucho. 
Los chicos de la entrada super simpáticos y atentos, te guardan las maletas si tu avión sale tarde, sin ningún coste.
Nos han cobrado dos veces la estancia del hotel aun estamos esperando la respuesta de porque ha sucedido, esperamos que se resuelva pronto.
Por lo demas todo muy bien, hay varias lineas de metro muy cerca y el Ferry esta a 2 minutos andando.

title: 5 day getaway for two couples
text: The staff were friendly and the beds were super comfortable but the pillows could be a little softer but the hotel is in the lower part of Manhattan which worked good for us because we spent most of our time in lower Manhattan

title: SHOULD RATE HIGHER!!
text:
actually i hesitated to stay in this hotel because of 3,5 rating. I only stay here 3 nights. And i spent other 4 nights at other hotel which got 4 points of rating. Guess what? This hotel perform far better than the other hotel in NYC. This hotel return all of my deposit (50usd per night) unlike other NYC hotel. Very clean. Staff perform enough friendly. The only downside of this hotel was the lift. Lift actually perform quite fast, but since the hotel have so many floor, i think 3 lifts was not enough especially during check out time. But since im in no hurry because im in NYC for holiday, not for business purpose. Its not a very big deal for me. If this hotel receive higher rank, i definitely gonna stay here for a whole of my NYC trip. Come on guys. Give honest review!!!

Pros
-Good location, just 2 train line from JFK airport
-Near 9/11 and lot of food, bar n cafe
-hotel very clean and quite new and smell nice
-bonus cookies was delicious
-tap water quality okay

Minus
-lift not enough to accomodate 30++ floors

Definitely stay here again for next NYC trip

title: Love this place and the staff is incredible!!!
text: I can't say enough about how great my stay was this Fall!! The team was just awesome!! Quantaisha made us feel like we were at home!! The place was clean, the staff friendly and bent over backwards to help us out, the location was perfect and near all the subway stops we needed - I mean, you can walk three minutes and get on the line to Yankee Stadium- what could be better!! I already can't wait to stay here again!! But the staff take the cake. They know how to treat people and make them feel special!!! Nothing but love for them!

title: New York magica 🗽
text:
Hotel molto carino proprio nel quartiere finanziario a due passi da Wall Street, a pochi passi anche dal porto per la Statua della Libertà 🗽, dal ponte di Brooklyn e dal Museo del Memoriale del World Trade Center. Molto comodo per la vicinanza con la metropolitana. 
I piani sono 44, ma come leggevo in altre recensioni, io non ho trovato assolutamente gli ascensori così lenti ! Anzi !!! 
La camere sono piccole ma accoglienti. 
Lo consiglio !

title: Very nice hotel right in the financial district
text: I stayed here for a late party right near our office. The hotel is very conveniently located in the Financial District, Stone Street has some nice pubs / bars, but it is a bit quiet after hours and on weekends as this is not the tourist district at all. The hotel was quiet, each floor has 10 guest rooms, the rooms are typical NYC compact, but well appointed with nice linens, comfortable beds and towels. The front desk staff was very pleasant and overall a very nice place to stay. Close to Wall St, Delmonico's Steak House, the Freedom Tower, Battery Park, all are within 10 minutes walking from the hotel.

title: So noisy I barely slept
text:
I was initially very impressed with this hotel - the rooms were clean (although a little dated), beds were comfy and the check-in was good. 

The pleasant experience stopped there. Someone had used the ice machine in the middle of the night, and it proceeded to make a massive amount of noise for over an hour. After complaining to the hotel staff at 3am, I managed to negotiate a discount (after declining the initial offer for Hilton rewards points). The staff did handle this very well, which was much appreciated, but the lack of sleep completely ruined my stay.

title: Great location, friendly staff
text: Great location, very friendly staff at check in, very considerate of my requests. I couldn’t stop sneezing when I got into the room which was weird. It was nice and comfy - I would book again for sure. Thanks for the warm cookie 😇

title: Good location for downtown
text:
I've stayed in a few DoubleTrees and unfortunately this one does not have the slightly nicer feel that many of them do - it's a very simple NYC hotel with no frills. The rooms are larger than average in the city and have very comfortable beds and everything you need for a good stay. In the winter the heating works very well but it is quite noisy.
I would have the same complaints as some others here about the lifts - they take forever and are definitely not enough for a hotel of this size! 
Staff were pleasant and helpful. I didn't eat here so can't comment on the food. There is a Dunkin' around the corner for morning bagels and some other fast food chains nearby. Very close to 3 different subway lines which is convenient for getting uptown. Walking distance to the South Ferry/Battery Park tourist areas. 
Good option if you get a good deal on price and don't mind not being in the buzz of it all.

title: Very nice hotel, great staff and location
text: Stayed here over the weekend and really enjoyed my stay. The hotel is right in the heart of the financial district and also very close to two large subway stations. A few 100 metres from the famous charging bull. The room was nice and had everything needed and was very clean. No issues recommending this hotel and would stay here again.

title: Dated and overpriced
text: Dated and overpriced rooms and poor concierge service. Not what could be described as a prime location and very expensive for what you get. Paid 2 x price of similar hotel in Midtown. Also no concierge was there at busy departure time

title: Un ottimo soggiorno!
text: Posizione strategica, a pochi passi da diversi mezzi di trasporto. Personale gentile e disponibile, wi fi gratuito, camera pulita e letto molto confortevole. I prodotti da bagno di ottima qualità, all’accoglienza ci hanno regalato un cookie squisito...non c’è che dire siamo rimasti pienamente soddisfatti!

title: Slowest Elevators In The City
text: Location is in lower Manhatten near Wall Street and Ferry, 40 + stories of rooms, have 3 small elevators that are slow, I mean turtle like.  Stairs are an option, I guess, for the super healthy.  Rooms are small, bathrooms small, not great views.

title: Worst hotel experience of my life
text: One of the worst hotel experiences in my lift (if not the worst). Had to wait almost 10 minutes all the time to get in to an elevator. day before our checking out the room was not even cleaned. and when i was in the bathroom a lady just came in to clean the room after i complained at 6pm!!!! The front desk was very rude specially the 2 ladies at the time of departure. I couldn't believe after charging more than 200 dollars per night and having the Hilton name the level of the hotel was unbelievably bad. I will think not twice but so many times before choosing another double tree.

title: Mainly spot on
text: The hotel is in a great location with restaurants and bars within a couple of minutes walk. Reception is on the second floor and we were greeted really warmly, rooms are a good size for NYC and nicely furnished including tea and coffee facilities and a safe. The two gripes we had were :- 1) the lifts are a nightmare as there are not enough for the hotel size. We waited 15 minutes and ended up going up to come down 2) the breakfast buffet is $30 per head an in our opinion not as good as what you’d get at a Garden Inn for half the price. We were taking a NCL cruise and the hotel is about a ten minute easy taxi ride from the cruise port.

title: Average Hotel Stay
text: Good location close to Wall St., very few in-room amenities. Dated room that was a bit cramped, overall a satisfactory experience at best. Friendly hotel staff that accommodated a last-minute reservation.

title: bon rapport qualité/prix dans Manhattan
text:
cet hotel, situé au sud de manhattan, propose de bonnes prestations à un prix acceptable pour New York. Les chambres sont confortables et pas trop petites. La literie est très bonne, la télé big size, la salle de bain très fonctionnelle. 
Par contre , le petit déj est à éviter car trop cher et pas de buffet comme souvent aux States.
Et les 3 ascenseurs semblent un peu insuffisants vu le nombre de chambres

title: Elevator from Hell
text:
This was my second stay at this doubletree. I came last year and really enjoyed the location and staff. So when I booked a returning trip to New York, I fondly remembered this hotel and promptly booked two of my four nights here. 

We arrived at 7am after a redeye and had very little hope that we could check-in early. Obviously, they pretty much laughed at us and told us to come back at 4 for check-in. They did offer to text if our rooms were available sooner. I thought that was a really great gesture and excellent customer service. 

We return to the hotel at 330p because we had reservations we had to leave for by 4pm and were hoping to check in and change. We get to the front desk and were told that yes our rooms were ready an hour ago. We never received any texts or calls like we were promised. When I asked why, they apologized and said they must have forgot. Well gee thanks...

After my last stay where I was on the 39th floor, I was grateful I was on the 9th this time. As I recalled, the elevators are really slow and I knew I wouldn't mind taking the stairs if I was on a lower floor. The room was nice but a little cramped, which is to be expected in New York. 

Honestly, this was a mediocre stay. Nothing bad and nothing great. I love the area and was able to get some great runs in because of where we were located. And the subway was easy to access. I was mostly happy after the rough check in up until the check out. 

We are waiting for the elevator at 10:50am so we can check out at the 11am check out time and move to our next hotel. There are three elevators but for some reason there is only one opening on our floor. And every time it opened it was jam packed full of people and luggage. We were patient because we knew everyone was checking out at this time. By 11:10am I am no longer patient while waiting for an elevator. My friend took the stairs since he only had a duffle bag and went to check us out of our rooms so we wouldn't be fined for a late check out. At 11:20am my other friend was sick of waiting and took his suitcase and pushed it down the stairs. I tried to wait it out and get an elevator because I had a large suitcase, duffle bag, umbrella and purse. At 11:30am I was fuming. I had wasted 40 minutes of my day waiting for a friggin elevator and could no longer sit in the hallway reading my book. I then started the trek down the 9 flights of stairs with all my luggage just as everyone else had. It took me forever as I had to keep moving out of the way of multiple other people doing the same thing. When I finally made it to the bottom, I was angry, covered in sweat and carrying a now broken umbrella because it got stuck in the stairwell. 

Not one employee apologized or offered to help. Just one comment when I finally made it to the bottom of "rough day huh?" I am still baffled by this experience. I made an exception the first time with the elevators but I now understand the old saying "fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me."

I will not give this hotel a third try regardless of how much I love the location. The elevators are a joke and the lack of empathy from the employees is laughable. We had a much better experience at the next doubletree we checked into and only wished we had just stayed at that one the entire trip instead of subjecting ourselves to this nonsense.

title: 自由の女神のフェリー乗り場近くのホテル
text:
2泊しました。
場所はマンハッタンの南側で、自由の女神やウォールストリートへのアクセスはとても良いです。その分ミッドタウンやセントラルパークには電車でなければ行けません。部屋は広くはありませんが十分です。フロントの方の電話対応があまり親切では無かったことと、エレベーターが少なく中々来ないことがあったのがマイナス点でした。ただ近隣にはスーパーやドラッグストアなどがあって便利ですし、街なかの騒がしいのか苦手な方にはオススメ出来ます。

title: Nice play to stay
text: The hotel is in a good location, the rooms are clean, there are not enough elevators, you need to wait a bit. Yves, the receptionist is very helpful, turn to him with any requests, he helps you. Subway is near to the hotel and you can find great restaurant nearby.

title: Make sure your confirmation spells out everything you selected and paid for because otherwise they will not honor it
text:
Stay in Hilton? Make sure your confirmation spells out every little detail of what you  paid for because otherwise they will not honor it. 

I stayed in this hotel the end of September 2019. It was a last minute trip and was because I wanted to go to an event on Governor’s Island.  I noticed that the Hilton Hotels offered a “Stay Longer Sunday” on one of the Hilton websites it explained this meant you could stay until 6pm on Sunday.  I selected a Hilton Hotel that offered this. 
I drove to NYC on a Friday evening. I arrived to the promised valet parking and found nobody around. Finally a man appeared downstairs and rudely told me I’d have to wait for the valets.  He disappeared, finally a more mannerly individual appeared to help me, and the valets finally arrived.    
The room itself was ok.  The bathroom is very badly designed – no shelves to put anything on so you end up having to pile everything on your suitcase outside the bathroom, the shower has a weather strip to stop the water getting out but it stops about 2 inches from the bottom of the shower so the floor was very wet.  There is no bath and the shower is tiny. 
In the bedroom there was a drip from the AC unit – it was dripping onto the floor. 
All of that aside it wasn’t terrible – we got room service and the waiters were polite and the food was pretty good. 
The reason I wanted the stay longer Sunday was because I wanted to shower after the event on Sunday, before driving home – so on Sunday morning we went to our event and came back around noon, ate and showered. As I was showering the cleaning staff knocked on the door. My daughter answered and told them we had bought the stay longer package.  I finished my shower, my daughter was showering when the downstairs staff called me – I told them I had bought the stay longer package – they told me they’d need to see that – and they’d need to see where it said until 6pm. Of course the confirmation only said “Stay Longer Sunday” (I paid more for this option) but didn’t say what time, so when I went down to show the confirmation the front desk woman she told me this didn’t prove that it was until 6pm and normally they’d charge someone an extra night for not leaving on time.  At this point I needed to get back upstairs so I told her I needed to pack and this had caused myself and my daughter a terrible amount of stress. She didn’t miss a beat, was entirely unconcerned about what this did to us, the customer, she then questioned me for leaving my daughter in the room (my daughter is 12) unpleasant words followed and I returned upstairs to finish packing.  Not a hint of an apology, embarrassment, No customer service concern – nothing! It was basically “Prove it” which, due to the confirmation that only stated “extended Stay Sunday” I was out of luck. 
Another supervisor / manager type called me shortly after I got back upstairs, she basically restated what they had already said – they had no intention of honoring what I purchased my receipt only said “Stay longer Sunday” but didn’t say until what time therefore I should have been out of there by 11am. 
I actually had no intention of staying until 6pm – I had a long drive back – but I was hunted out of the room.  I am a middle aged, professional woman. I am quite sure I have never been hunted from anywhere before – it was a really awful experience.   Not only did I not get any form of an apology – they stuck to their guns and let me know I could have been charged for the extra time. 
A few days after I got back I started a chat with their customer service – and was expecting based on this chat – that they would contact me and apologize. Nope! Not one hint of that. 
They had multiple opportunities to make this right and opted instead to not do that.  I understand that it’s tough to get staff right now – but Hilton really needs to do better than that.

title: Great hotel
text: One of the better value options in NYC for our dates. Great positio in financial district. Perfect for the ferry over to DUMBO for lovely dinner options. Hotel had limited lifts which could be a probelm for higher stores. Arranged a taxi for us to the airport. Rooms were clean and well maintained.

title: Nice Hotel
text: This was a nice property. Rooms are pretty tiny. The Employees were all very nice and accomodating. We were there for a wedding in the area and not at all familiar with where we were. The employees were very helpful.

title: Fijn Hotel
text:
Een fijn hotel, met goede ontvangst en service van de medewerkers. De kamer was ruim genoeg, netjes schoon, licht gehorig. Het bed was heerlijk! Badkamer was voorzien van douche, wastafel en toilet. Een extra schap om je spullen neer te zetten en wat extra haakjes aan de muur/deur, was fijn geweest. 
Het hotel heeft 3 liften, die ook alle 3 door het personeel gebruikt werd voor de schoonmaakkarren en stofzuigers. Dit veroorzaakte veel opstopping waardoor je soms wel tot een half uur moest wachten voordat de lift op je etage stopte.

title: Super friendly staff but a bit pricey
text: Great views, great location, but a bit pricey for a simple room.  Had one issue where we asked for a crib and it wasn't there in the room, and when the brought it to the room they just left it there and didn't set it up or open it.  Otherwise the front staff were excellent.

title: Services supplémentaires
text:
Nous avons réservé un taxi via leur personnel. Prix annoncé: 75$ en paiement par carte. 
Arrivé au taxi, il nous annonce qu’il ne prend pas la carte et qu’on lui doit 80$... inadmissible, une pure arnaque ! Nous avons dû nous arrêter pour retirer de l’argent et donc prendre des frais supplémentaires dû à un retrait à l’étranger.. 

De plus nous avons payé un supplément pour avoir une vue sur ville: vue qui s’est relevée être sur l’immeuble d’en face, donc aucune vue sur ville.. 

Prix petit déjeuner affiché nul part: nous décidons de prendre au buffet (nourriture de très moyenne qualité et choix très limité), surprise au moment de la note.. 60$ pour deux personnes et un seul matin, exorbitant !! 

Enfin, les ascenseurs desservent très mal les étages:  15 minutes d’attente en moyenne pour un ascenseur.. 

Bref, je vous le conseil simplement pour une chambre classique sans supplément pour petit déjeuner et je vous déconseille de passer par eux pour prendre un taxi.

title: Would recommend if not staying in hotel much.
text: The hotel was fine, but needs renovation and care. It's in a good location but the elevator is VERY slow, the rooms are dated and worn out, and staff were only just ok. The heating and cooling didn't work properly in my room, waking me and keeping me awake more than once.

title: Roomy with a side of interesting
text:
If you’re looking for a lovely hotel to stay in, this should absolutely be one of your top picks. The location to midtown/manhattan is quite a trip but if you’re going to enjoy the lower side of manhattan you’ll love it. It’s practical to get to the subways and the lovely flower shop on 44th as well! I do have to say the room was a lot smaller than what the photos entailed, the lobby was lovely and if you get a higher floor it’ll feel incredibly lovely. The walls are thin so be careful what you do! It felt like a very snug hotel overall. If you’re a Hilton Honors member use it to your advantage! They give you a warm delicious cookie at check in 👍🏽

There are three elevators and I’m assuming we visited during the off season - but I can’t imagine what it’s like when it’s busier. You’ll have a bit of a wait if you’re on the higher floors to get an elevator but that’s not anything the staff can control. The front desk attendants at all times were lovely and checked in with you if anything was wrong. 

If you want to use the digital key option you won’t be able to - you mind as well just go straight to the front desk anyway.

title: Great stay
text: Had a great stay, loved the location and staff was great. Anna and Marissa were very helpful with providing directions and recommendations. Quiet location which is great and easy access to subway and bus stops. Hotel isn't fancy but it will do especially since the prices here are very reasonable.

title: Concierge Hopton
text:
Hopton is an amazing Concierge! I know him for a long time, he always is very friendly and kind!!! The best guy ever!!
Everytime when he is downstairs he helps all the people! He knows everything and he is the most helpful guy i ever met.

title: Weekend Stay
text: The room was very clean, we got a king sized bed but it definitely seemed more like a queen. My boyfriend is 6’3 and his feet were hanging off the bottom of the bed. There are some restaurants and bars in the area but a lot of the places to get food that weren’t sit down seemed to be closed on weekends and only open for the people who work in the area during the week. The staff was nice, getting an elevator to the room was a little tricky as there’s only three for the pretty large hotel, was much easier and quicker leaving your room.

title: Bien situé et cosi
text:
Chambre très belle et grande. Les lits sont tres bon. Machine a glace a de nombreux etages.
Quartier tres sympa. Proche de tout.
Petit point négatif l'ascenseur compliqué a avoir .....
Proche du ferry pour aller sur staten island.

title: CUIDADO!!!! PRECAUCIÓN!!! TE ROBAN TU DEPÓSITO DE GARANTIA!!!
text:
El hotel esta muy bien ubicado, sin embargo, parece que el hotel no paga bien a sus empleados. Ya que te roban tu depósito de garantía. Al salir del hotel me dijeron que me devolverían mi dinero a los 3 días. Y no fue así.

TEN CUIDADO Y PRECAUCION  !!!! 
NO TE QUEDES EN ESTE HOTEL  l!!!
SI TE VAS A QUEDAR EN EL DISTRITO FINANCIERO DE MANHATTAN BUSCA OTRAS OPCIONES PARA QUE NO TE ROBEN TU DINERO   !!!!

title: A decent hotel in Downtown Manhattan
text:
If you are looking for a place to in the center of the financial district, then this property would be absolutely fine. The rooms are apt for one or two people and are very comfortable to stay in. A number of people have talked about the lifts, but you can easily overlook that by taking a 5-10 minute buffer during peak hours. The staff is friendly and courteous. I would have expected more from the buffet but with the limited options available, the taste was absolutely fine.

A decent option to stay in given the price range.

title: Not worth the money
text: I got in and completed pre check in around 9am, got my room at 410pm. Mattress had a big depression, one guest slept on the floor with bedding provided from downstairs as rooms are sold out and no cost available. Faucet is broken and coming out the wall. I understand this is New York and space is limited, but two elevators for a hotel with 40+ floors is horrible. Not to mention trusting the brand and paying approximately $400/‘night. Would’ve been better off staying at a Hampton inn

title: Fun in NYC
text:
Great experience overall. 
Two great friends traveling to NYC for fun and relaxation.  We slept great, only issue was the hot water which took too long to warm up. However,  the staff were great and attentive.

title: Exceeded Expectations
text:
When booking this hotel, I didn't expect greatness. I did a lot of research before coming to NYC; as I do on any vacation and I expected a small; unspectacular room. What we got was a very nice, well equipped room and a very comfortable bed. The view was great as well. Although I couldn't see the Statue of Liberty from our room, we did have a very good view of the Upper Bay of Manhattan. The service was top-notch. Everything is within walking distance. We used the Metro Line and Big Bus Tours to get around, and all stops were close by. Even without the bus/subway to get around, there's good selection of local restaurants and such if you don't want to see the usual New York attractions. 
The only drawback; which was minor, is that sometimes it took a little while for hot water to reach the shower and faucet. That's the only "complaint." I can say for a vacation in NYC with that being the only drawback, we lucked out big time! When we get around to wanting to come to NYC again, I'll definitely book again.

title: Ok
text: I spent a night in the doubletree for a business meeting, the hotel is located in the heart of the financial district so it’s a good choice if you have business in the area but the hotel itself needs some serious upgrading. The bathrooms especially need to be updated. The cookies at check in are a nice touch and the staff was nice but definitely time for a revamp.

title: Financial District Gem
text: The Hilton DoubleTree in the Financial district is everything you would expect from a Hilton property. The staff is friendly and alert. Room was exactly as it should be, clean and we'll put together. Breakfast on first floor was well done.

title: Great hotel, elevators a bit slow
text: Great hotel with lovely views.  Walking distance to Wall Street, the Freedom Tower and the Statue of Liberty.  Elevators are a bit slow.  A lot of floors, so if you are travelling business or have a tight schedule to keep - choose a lower floor.  Also, be mindful that the front desk is on 2 while the entrance / exit are on floor G.

title: Great Service
text: Special commendation to our bellman, Hopton, for helping us get a cab after a snafu with our ride share.  Hopton went out of his way (2 blocks!) to hail us a cab and help us get out of Manhattan to catch our plane.  Everyone I met at the hotel was pleasant and helpful.  I hope to visit there again

title: Hotel un po' logoro e colazione mediocre.
text: Gli interni dell'hotel necessitano di una ristrutturazione per essere all'altezza dello standard Hilton. La colazione è davvero mediocre: i peggiori pancakes mai mangiati negli Stati Uniti. Nota positiva certamente la location.

title: Casi todo muy bueno
text:
El hotel está bien ubicado en el distrito financiero cerca del metro, pero aun así es muy tranquila la zona. El personal es super cordial, siempre ayuda y la mayoría habla español. Tiene 44 pisos y solamente 3 elevadores, por lo que en fines de semana se demora mucho (MUCHO) en subir o bajar. La habitación está muy bien por tratarse de Manhattan. No tiene ni refrigerador ni microondas, pero hay máquinas de hielo, y un microondas en la recepción (piso 2) donde uno se puede calentar la comida si la compró fuera. 
Está a un paso de Battery Park, cerca del memorial del 9/11 y del puente de Brooklyn. Vale la pena.

title: get away
text: I have read many reviews on this hotel but as far as I am concerned, I didn't have any problems or complaints at all ! Of all  the times I have stayed in NYC, this has been the best hotel I have stayed in...Very clean rooms, toilet and lobby...People complained about the slow elevators but so what if you have to wait a minute or two....It was fine....Four of the front desk people I want to compliment and I hope Hilton rewards them and they are Venetta, Anna, Dominque and Armando...These employees could have not been nicer and more knowledgeable They made the check-in and check-out experience wonderful.....I give it 5stars and will book here next time i'm in NYC

title: New York trip
text: No significant concerns other than trashy street outside, which I'm not sure the hotel has any control over. Rooms were smaller than usual in my experience at this price point,and compared to other DoubleTrees I've stayed in.

title: Great location, great place to stay
text:
I stayed here for a week in mid-September. It was an excellent choice - close to all major transport routes.
There are good places to eat all in walking distance.
Special shout out to Hopton - the best bellhop there is! Thanks buddy.

title: Recommend this hotel
text: Only two elevators for 44 floors so at one point I waited 10 minutes for an elevator, however room and bathroom are good. The room is bigger than most NYC hotels I would say. Staff is friendly and location is good.

title: Beau séjour en globalité
text:
Un beau séjour, les chambres sont parfaites et spacieuse. La litterie est confortable. Et on est très bien placé, proche de plusieurs station de métro et proche pour prendre le ferry pour visiter la statue de la liberté. 
Le seul point négatif : 
 Il faut être patient pour attendre les ascenseurs, beaucoup attente.

title: Clean, great location... slow elevators and safety concerns
text:
This hotel is in a great location in the Financial District - you can easily walk to stores, restaurants, coffee shops, the subway station right around the corner, and some NYC tourist highlights (like the Charging Bull). We came to NYC for the weekend (2 nights) to visit with some friends, so access to the subway was key so we could easily meet up with others in our group who live all over the city.

Other than a great location, the hotel is very clean and the rooms are pretty standard size for a city hotel. However, the bathroom was extremely small with absolutely no place to hang a towel, so even if you wanted to be eco-friendly and reuse your towel, you don't really have the option to do so. I couldn't do my hair/make up in the bathroom because of the small size, but luckily there's a large mirror in the bedroom. 

The closet had ample hanging space and included a safe. No fridge to keep though. Another drawback is that the air conditioner was very loud, and if it wasn't 90 degrees out I would have opted to turn it off, as the blowing woke me up every time it started up in the middle of the night.The gym is severely lacking but it does the job. Two treadmills and one elliptical, but one treadmill was broken so that was disappointing. 

You seriously need to leave your room at least 10 minutes before you need to be anywhere because the elevators are SO SLOW. Like painfully slow. 

Another weird thing is that the reception is on the second floor and there's no one to greet you on the first floor. I found this a little unsafe, especially late at night, as anyone could wonder in off the street and go to any floor without a keycard. 

Overall, very average hotel. If you're only going for a few nights it's okay, but any longer probably wouldn't be pleasant with the elevator issues, small bathrooms and possible safety concerns.

title: Very disappointing .. Billing issues
text:
Very very disappointed with the customer service at the front desk. I stayed there for 9 nights and they charged the entire amount from my FX card at the time of checking in. The day I was supposed to depart, I found a debit of $150 early morning. At the time of check-out, I was told the amount will be reversed shortly. I was leaving for London and the travel card was the only mean for me to load foreign currencies. To my surprise, my card declined to function in London the next day and while examining I found that an amount of $1971.96 has been charged to my card once again which has resulted in massive inconvenience (in addition to $150 which is still not returned)

I wrote back to Hilton customer care the same night (8/29) and within minutes they replied stating that I shall get a response within 3 days. Just to let you know that now it is over 7 days and one has bothered to get back to me even after multiple follow ups. Although the amounts are pending with merchant for clearance, the frustration and inconvenience caused due to the irresponsible behaviour by Hilton staff is truly deplorable.

Mistakes can happen, however this amounts to tormenting if you are travelling with family and kids…. Fortunately, not my case this time. I have been to few Hilton properties in the past (Berlin, Dead Sea, Zagreb, Cairo to name a few), all were almost flawless in their service and customer care. 

One more thing – they didn’t offer me the hot cookies which they usually do for customers while checking in. Not a big deal…….but Hilton missing something. I will think twice next time for sure!

The 2 stars are for cleanliness and location. The room was well done, spotless and spacious. The property is very close to subway stations (Whitehall and South Ferry) which makes commuting to any part of Manhattan really easy.

title: Annoying check-in process
text:
The guy from check-in was misleading and confusing. He asked me to pay a deposit of 50USD by credit card. After I payed, although my transaction was approved, he said that my credit card was declined and asked me to pay again the deposit with a card of one of my friends. This was not nice and very annoying ,to charge me twice. In the end he talked with his colleagues and it was not necessary to charge me twice any more.
The 50 USD deposit should be discontinued. Have more respect for your customers!

title: Average
