text: Not a bad location, the lifts (3 of them) are very slow because of the number of floors and the staff / maids us them too meaning this slows the whole process down. The air conditioning unit in the room was cold, but very old and leaked the floor was wet. I had a sore throat for a couple of days.

title: Hotel aceptable .
text:
Localización wall street ,zona muy tranquila de noche, alejada de restaurantes,aunque volveria a esa zona .
Habitación doble dos camas y espacio ajustadillo para 4 personas , limpio y funcional, ruido de fondo constante aunque no impide sueño , planta 37, con escasez de ascensores pero no tuvimos problemas.
Recepción correcta sin alardes y curiosamente en primera planta .No usamos restaurante .
En conclusión buena relación calidad precio.

title: Estadía en doubletree by hilton financial district
text: El hotel es muy lindo, limpio y cómodo. Realmente pasamos bien. Existió simplemente un detalle, que fue un error en la reserva. Ese error fue responsabilidad nuestra, pero el staff del hotel no fue servicial en absoluto para poder ayudarnos a buscar una solución. Otra cosa fue que esa supuesta Warm Cookie que te obsequian al llegar y hacer el check in, nunca la recibimos. En los días de estadía vimos gente recibirla, pero a nosotros nadie nos la dió. A pesar de esto no deja de ser un lugar recomendable para ir a quedarse.

title: Great hotel
text: Great hotel in great location for quitew good value. Rooms were clean, no noise from outside or others rooms. Staff was very helpfull and provided all needed info. very close to ferry if you would like to visist Statue of Liberty and Ella island. For other locations, metro just couple steps away

title: Great location
text: Room was large 2 double beds bathroom with walk in shower the room was cleaned everyday and lots of fresh towels.Plenty of wardrobe space and a coffee machine The elevators were a bit slow in arriving but it wasn’t really a big problem .The hotel is near many subways and lots of eating places near the hotel.Staff were friendly quick checkin at the reception desk the hotel is downtown nice to escape the hustle of Times Square.The hotel is 5 mins away from Staten Island ferry and battery park

title: Great stay in NYC
text: Overall a great stay! I mean, you're visiting NYC, so the room is just a place where you're gonna lay your head.We drove into the city and parked at a garage nearby. 60 bucks to park...but its NYC and sort of expected. Check in process was smooth. We got to check in early too....yay! Warm cookies with the keys! Friendly staff at Registration Desk. Stayed on the 18th floor. Room was decent size for NYC. Clean too. Queen bed....soft and comfy. I would recommend. We didnt have the elevator issues as described in previous posts....I mean, we had to wait maybe a minute or two, but nothing bad. Room wasnt as shabby as other posts made it out....maybe I'm not as nit picky.

title: Ok place to stay
text: Over all a Nice place to stay . But er har to pay 100 usd more than the add on Booking.com Said.  I dont know who fault it is but i felt i didnt want to argue becouse the people in the frontdesk didnt seem very friendly .

title: Easy walk to evrything downtown
text: Clean room with a comfortable bed.It was a little strange that check in and the service desk are not on the ground floor, but it didn't present a problem. There are 40 floors so the elevators can get pretty busy.

title: Worse than a Days Inn
text: This place is a dump. No service elevator, you will literally just stay in a hot box of an elevator for 20 mins just to leave the building. Rooms are falling apart. On day 2 of a 4 night stay, house keeping just decided not to show up. Hotel staff don't even care. Apparently they are just use to have the place get crap reviews, so why try! Ps. I am Hilton gold through Amex platnium, but if you do book direct through Hilton.com, you get ZERO of the benefits which I paid for. Stay at any place else, PLEASE!!

title: Great rooms and location
text:
We thought everything was fabulous. The room was great and we found it to be plenty of space for 2 people. We were super nervous about the elevators after reading reviews, but we didn't find this to be an issue. We were on the 33rd floor and I'm happy we didn't request something lower because our view of the water was fabulous. 

The location was nice. We had quick access to several subway stations. Our bags were held for us and retrieved quickly on check in day when we were ready. Every staff member we encountered was helpful and nice.

title: Don’t waste your money...
text:
I arrived last night joining my other half for a few nights in the city before heading to Montauk with family.  What a disappointing start to vacation.  I travel for work (which is in hospitality) and have stayed in about 100 hotels in the last 12 months.  This is the worst.  

I understand worn rooms in need of upgrades.  I understand small rooms in busy cities.  What I can’t understand is dirty rooms which makes the tiny, dated room feel gross.

I have never in my life written a negative review but please don’t stay here.  There are too many great options in the city to waste your money.

title: Una delusione
text: Ho soggiornato qualche settimana fa in quest'hotel. Elementi positivi: sicuramente la location e l'accessibilità. Sono rimasto molto deluso dal comportamento poco professionale e molto freddo del personale di ricevimento sia al check-in sia al check-out. Addirittura una dipendente era collegata ad Instagram al cellulare mentre parlava con noi in maniera fredda. Pulizia delle camere da rivedere, come anche la qualità della biancheria, bucata o sporca. 3 ascensori per 44 piani sono un problema - più di una volta siamo saliti al nostro piano a piedi attraverso le scale di emergenza. Peccato.

title: Great stay all in all
text: Booked this hotel through a travel agency. Price was amazing for the area! Alonzo at the front desk was awesome! He did great checking me in and attentive to anything that I needed. Hotel room was super clean and temp was good. The only complaint I had which I have already seen on here is to service the entire building of 44 floors they have 2 elevators...

title: Are you serious????    Can you please get me an elevator please.
text:
When i first seen this hotel it looked like a standard Dbl Tree Hilton so I was expecting the amenities/ service / and Facility of a dbl Tree by Hilton.  NOT.  Everything except for the service at the restaraunt was amazing.  

1>) Lets start with my number one problem #1  

Elevators.......   I thought it was strange that there was people in the lobby playing spades in the lobby while waiting for the elevator.  YES its that bad.   My mother who just turned 71 this year was forced to take 8 flights of stairs because we couldnt get a elevator to save my life .... Or hers for that matter.   We missed to rides in our uber giving ourselves a 10 min  window to make it downstairs...  We had to take the stairs on our last trip and then after we made it down the stairs we STILL missed our ride.

The rooms were small and dingy and dusty. 

The lobby was fairly nice  but overall i would say to save your time and money and go to the hilton garden inn right down the streeet.

title: Great downtown location
text: This hotel always delivers great service and value.  Staff is helpful, rooms are clean, the location is fantastic for business trips in Lower Manhattan.  Also a great location for family trips and vacation stays.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
Check In was around 15:00 and we reached around 11:00 and yet the front staff allotted a room to us immediately winning our support. 

Location: Excellent
Whitehall Station opposite hotel. Battery Station a few steps ahead takes you anywhere you want to go. Bus stops just behind the hotel. 

Siteseeing: Excellent
Charging Bull, Wall Street, 9/11 Memorial, World Trade Center and Statue of Liberty walkable distance.

Restaurants: Excellent 
Chitpolte opposite hotel with cheap Tacos, Burritos, Marketplace offering takeaways, Dunkin Donuts, Potbelly and other great eateries around and even a great Bar/club in front of the hotel.

Will recommend it 100% to all who want to visit either leisure or business.

title: Yet another disappointing Hilton hotel
text:
I have just spent 3 nights at the Doubletree by Hilton - Financial District and I have to say that I would never recommend it to anyone. 
The rooms are so small and you don't even have anywhere to put your toiletries in the bathroom. The AC unit was a nightmare. It was so noisy and antiquated that it barely cooled the room and I had to use ear plugs in order to sleep. 

The elevators are a nightmare....only 3 serving 44 floors! The layout of the hotel is also a nightmare. Reception is on floor 2 and it's a bun fight every day trying to get from the ground to the 2nd and elsewhere within the hotel. No amenities as such. 

Breakfast is hosted in the adjacent restaurant. Worst Hilton breakfast ever. Not only was the choices on offer extremely limited, but the scrambled eggs where so dried up they resembled yellow cow pats. The serving dish didn't close properly, which added to the problem of the eggs drying out. The chef certainly knew about it as he kept trying to push the lid down to close it. Interestingly enough they are awaiting a food hygiene standard rating....personally I know what I would award them!  The tables weren't properly set with cutlery and teaspoons had to be requested. The melon wasn't ripe, the things that looked like a scone could be used as paving bricks. It all seriously yuk, apart from the bananas which had not been tampered with. On a positive note, the coffee was quite good. 

All in all it is a fairly rubbish hotel located in a good area. Best it's demolished and rebuilt. Would I recommend it to anyone....no, unless I really disliked them.

title: False advertising and too many problems
text:
The location of this hotel is great, with a station for the R and W trains on the same block, and access to the 1, 4/5/6, and Staten Island Ferry nearby. I also found the staff friendly and was pleased with the housekeeping service. However, the main room was tiny, with only a narrow passageway around the perimeter of the bed. And the bathroom was small as well, with no counter space to speak of - and I travel light. All of this could have been OK - it's NYC after all, there's no need to spend a lot of time in a hotel room. But I'm a very tall guy, so when I book a Cityview King Room - and the view of WTC was great from the 40th floor - I think it's reasonable to expect a Standard King mattress, not what I have determined to have been what is referred to as an "RV Short King" mattress. My 79" height belongs on a standard Queen or King mattress, with 80" in length, not the 75" RV short king. And I checked the Hilton website to be sure and, no, this non-standard mattress is not disclosed in the description of the King room. It says there's a 32" TV, but can't be bothered to be honest about the short bed. Although the mattress and pillows were comfortable, I woke up with sore feet that didn't get proper rest from walking the streets of Manhattan because they were hanging off the end. The fundamental purpose of this hotel room - rest - was defeated by this. Don't lie to people about the mattresses in your hotel rooms.

Almost as frustrating is what it took to get out of the hotel every morning. The other reviews on this site - and I read them thinking, "It can't be that bad," - are not exaggerating about the amount of time it takes to get an elevator down, especially in the busy morning hours. There are only three elevators - and small ones at that - to service a 44-floor hotel with nine rooms on each floor. Many people end up getting on an up elevator and then taking it down as that's the only way to get out of the hotel in the morning, so no matter what floor you're on, you're taking a risk at getting down to the lobby. If someone is already on the elevator with luggage because they're checking out, not only does that mean there likely isn't room for you on the elevator, but even if you can squeeze on, it's going to definitely stop on the 2nd floor - where the reception area is - rather than going straight to the ground floor. Why is that extra annoying? Because if you squeezed on a full elevator on floor 40, it's still going to stop at almost every 2 to 3 floors for other people who are calling the elevator, and you're going to have to be rude and press "door closed" to try to make it move any faster at all. Again, this sounds like an exaggeration, but it's truly a nightmare. Especially in the heat and humidity of August - the A/C is minimal, if at all, in the elevator.

A friend of mine in NYC says, "You get what you pay for in New York" and this hotel proves that adage very true. It was one of the cheapest hotels to book in the area through Hilton's website, and now I know why. I prepaid for the room to save even a few more bucks, but while my credit card was charged for the prepaid room at the time I booked, and I agreed for a $50/night deposit to be put on my card as a pending charge to cover incidentals - standard hotel business - what I didn't agree to was to have my card have a pending charge for the price of the room THAT I'D ALREADY PAID FOR. When I spoke with someone at reception about this, they acknowledged it was an error that shouldn't have happened, but that there was no way it could clear until I checked out after five nights. I didn't take a trip to NYC expecting not to spend money, but to have that much money tied up on one of my credit cards for my entire stay was ridiculous and rude.

I have stayed at Hilton properties all over the country and while no hotel is perfect, I have generally been able to rely on consistency throughout the Hilton brands. This hotel was a big dent in my confidence.

title: Un punto di riferimento
text:
È la seconda volta che alloggio in questo hotel. Personale accogliente e disponibile.
Camere con vista meravigliosa. Bagno piccolo ma pulito. Stanze pulite. Prezzo ottimo e ben collegato con metro. Lo consiglio

title: good
text: 酒店很好，很喜欢，下次还会去的，服务员态度也很好，环境也好，非常喜欢，很舒服，很有家的感觉。可否留一个邮箱给我，需要确认一些信息，谢谢

title: Meglio di altri
text:
Posizione: ottima per visitare downtown, tranquilla per quanto riguarda il traffico, l'hotel è molto vicino a wall street, ai traghetti ed alla Freedom Tower.
Reception: situata al secondo piano del grattacielo, personale un po' freddo e poco disposto a capire le esigenze.
Garage presente, ma ci è stato rifiutato il servizio perché avevamo una moto e non un'auto. Abbiamo Cmq parcheggiato nella strada sotto l'hotel.
Solo 2 ascensori e molto lenti.
Camere: ampie e ben climatizzate, letto grande come il bagno e la doccia. Acqua gratis tutti i giorni e attenzione anche nell'integrazione dei te e delle tisane. Asciugamani cambiati quotidianamente.
Pulizia attenta.

title: Normal
text:
Este hotel tiene una muy buena ubicación y esta bien conectado. Las instalaciones son bastante buenas y están bien organizadas.
Sin embargo, algunos miembros del servicio te atienden sin mirarte a la cara o sin ni siquiera hablar. Además un día a se olvidaron de limpiar mi habitación y otro dia me quede sin papel higiénico.
A pesar de estos dos percances el balance es bueno.

title: Clean Rooms
text:
The staff was very nice, friendly, and helpful.  This included the maintenance staff as well as the cleaning services staff. I usually stay in midtown, however I was traveling with work and this was the hotel they had selected. Great location to Staten Island Ferry, Wall Street, Brooklyn Bridge, 9/11 museum. The subway is very close.  

At night this area is not as busy making for quiet rooms. I had a nice view of the Hudson River.   Restaurants are in walking distance.  Nice walk to East River piers where you can find good night life and food.

title: Great Hotel Centrally Located
text: Hotel Centrally located in the Financial District.   Subway station close by, Restaurants and very walkable.  Warm chocolate chip cookie during check in which I found to be very sweet.  Room was clean and comfortable.  I would stay there again.

title: Great location poor maintenance
text: The hotel is in a great location in the financial district, subway; NYSE, tourist attractions. Rooms are small and not well maintained. Would not stay here again. Find a better newer hotel - there are plenty within close distance

title: Is ok
text:
Very great location easy to get food and transportation
Greating only first day is all about money 
Hospital is not ok 
The breakfast is bed just the need more heart in .
Pay for bag even we stay for 10 day 
No back

title: Nice hotel but not good with environmental concerns
text: This hotel was very clean and the staff was nice. My complaints are about environmental issues. The first thing the desk staff does when you check in is hand you two plastic bottles of water! Plastic water bottles are quickly destroying the environment, AND NYC has delicious tap water, so there is absolutely no reason why this hotel should be handing out water bottles. There are cups in every room that could be used with the tap. Also, every morning after I showered, I hung up my towels, since the little card said that they wouldn't be replaced if they were hung up. Yet, every day, I came back to my room to find that the used towels were taken and new, clean towels were left in their place. After two days, I just left the Do Not Disturb sign on my door and refused the housekeeping. What a waste of water to wash all those towels after only one use, and what a shame to make your guests think you care about the environment, when you actually don't. I strongly encourage the management to reconsider its policy of handing out plastic water bottles to all guests, and to start implementing the laundry policy that is actually advertised.

title: Long Weekend in the City
text: Great price for the location.  Easy access to the subway and walking distance to Battery Park.  Clean rooms and very nice common areas. Easy check in/out process and loved that we were able to get an earlier check in on our arrival date.  Baggage storage was also super helpful for our departure.  The rooms are a little on the small size as many reviewers have mentioned but honestly, how much time are you spending in your room when you're in NYC!?  Our room was plenty big enough for myself and my husband.  The only complaint we had was the elevators.  During peak times (check in/out, dinner hours) you could wait upwards of 30 minutes to get an elevator which can be really inconvenient if you're in a hurry.  For future visits, we would definitely request a lower floor just so we can utilize the stairs instead.  Overall it's a great property and I would definitely consider staying again for future visits!

title: Хорошо
text: Для Манхеттена хорошая цена, удобная логистика, спокойное обслуживание. Для бизнеса то, что нужно. Много станций метро рядом. Кондиционер работает на каком-то одном режиме, пришлось выключить и все наладилось. Много пишут про лифты и долгие ожидания. Мб из-за того, что июль месяц, но больше 3 минут я лифт не ждала. Для 40-этажного здания это нормально

title: Good for a quick weekend
text: Right by the subway, take one train right uptown. A block away from the water. Really a great location to try and get everywhere in one weekend. Room was tiny. Not enough elevators to serve the amount of floors they have- long elevator wait times.

title: First trip to New York
text:
Visited this month and found the hotel to be very comfortable. Room was good size with great bathroom, and very good A/C. 
Lifts do take a while but this was a minor issue. 
Hotel’s central location for buses, ferries and subway. Plenty of local restaurants with varying prices in close proximity.

title: New York sightseeing with family
text: Great location for a family but there is only 1 room with 2 full size beds on each floor.  The elevators were not too much of a hassle until it came time to check out and they were all in use and full (think of a subway car during rush hours).  Housekeeping would take away dirty towels but kept forgetting to replace them?!  Staff were friendly when I called each night but I’m not sure why it kept happening.  Television was not secured very well to the wall and the bathroom shelf was loose so it would not hold anything.  Rooms are small but I guess that is expected in New York.  Food in lobby is hella expensive.  You would be better off going to the Duane Reade on the corner to get snacks and drinks but it closes early so plan accordingly.  Room 3904 views from room added. 5 minute walk to Bull statue, stock exchange, Federal Hall and other historic landmarks.  This area is much quieter than Times Square, especially at night :) Decent dining nearby but I would avoid Murphy’s Tavern next door (loud and the food is really not that good).

title: Off beaten path
text: Average hotel.  Do not go beyond the 5th or 6th floor as elevators are in high demand.  We used the stairs.  Fairly comfortable small rooms with extremely loud air conditiining units.  But here's the deal.  For New York, it is a decent hotel with a drcent price.  Close to subway?, quite doable for seeing city.

title: Loved staying here.
text: This was the perfect place to stay, close to Battery Park where you catch the cruise line to the Statue of Liberty, a short walk to the 9-11 Memorial.  So much to do in this area. Would definitely stay here again on a return trip.

title: Disappointing standards and poor staff attitude
text: I stayed here for a business trip, whilst the location was superb, and the bed very comfortable, the big issue was that a cleaner removed an expensive umbrella from my room, and when i reported this, the attitude of reception staff was very poor, and no responsibility taken to remedy the situation. I would not stay here again as i would be unable to trust the cleaning staff with my luggage items.

title: Very small and smelly room
text: The rooms are tight but hopefully you are not in NY to stay in your room.  They have a smell to them that nothing made it better.  We just go used to the smell.  The staff was very nice and the room was clean.  Not updated. Nice size tv. Check in is on the 2nd floor.  Elevators are slow.  The gym on 3rd floor has nice cold water.  And the cookies are hot and tasty.  No microwave nor fridge in room.. but plenty of places to eat and great location for walking everywhere. Overall, it’s okay for sleeping, reminds me of a cruise room.

title: Besides ok location nothing seems right with this hotel
text: Our family came to New York almost every summer for few broadway shows and we usually stayed at Times Square. This year because we wanted to see Macy’s fireworks. That’s why I booked this hotel. However it seems nothing is right with this hotel. The receptionist was not friendly, there were birds drops on the window for days. We had to asked everything in the breakfast room.  Ran out of food, milk, drinks, coffee silverwares. And every time we asked the staff looked as they were being bothered. We paid for breakfast included in our booking. The foods were very standard.

title: Nice hotel but not for anyone with mobility issues.
text: The hotel, the location and the room was nice but there are only 3 very small elevators for a 44-story hotel with probably close to 400 rooms. The wait for the elevators was awful most of the time and several times we chose to just walk down from the 15th floor instead of waiting an average of 15 to 20 minutes for the elevators.

title: Good staff trying to overcome a broken hotel
text: A great staff but horrible maintenance with poor cleaning and broken elevators and toilets. We ended up walking up and down 5 floors because of elevator shortages. The room also had a cleanliness problem with hair left over from the previous guest as a bonus

title: Great location for the fireworks
text: Need better communication regarding the parking. The sign says no stopping. No valet in sight. We circled the building and called the front desk. No issues after that was resolved. The room was clean the bed was comfy the view was great. There was a dirty food tray in the hall when we arrived. Still there 2 days later when we left. Overall great experience.

title: New York City stay
text: Room was very clean and very up to date.  Extremely comfortable bed. Location is perfect for everything near the Statue of Liberty and World Trade Center.  The staff was friendly and we really enjoyed being able to walk to the attractions.  Parking was reasonable and very close the the hotel

title: Views
text: I stay at Hilton's pretty much exclusively because of how amazing they are and how much they care about their guests. This one was no different. The location was perfect for fiancial district and the views from our room was breathtaking. My one and only complaint is the slow elevator. You will be waiting an eternity for those tiny elevators. Doesnt help that you have to wait on the ground for the elevator to take you to the second floor to check in and then wait again for it to take you to your room. But it's a small price to pay.

title: Good Location, clean rooms.
text: The location was good.  It is close to our office, fun restaurants, the subway, battery park, stone street.  The rooms were clean, however, very small.  If you had two people in the room, it felt crowded.  We had to wait for elevators 5-10 minutes each time.  The breakfast service was terrible.

title: Double Tree by Hilton New York City - Financial District is the best!
text: I thoroughly enjoyed my brief stay!  Your hotel is beautiful and has the best customer service and wonderful amenities.  I will stay here again both on business and personal travel.  I will highly recommend your accommodations!

title: Great stay!
text: Great location, comfortable beds, friendly staff!! Near some attractions and good restaurants just steps away! I came for vacations but will be back for my business meeting. Thanks for the cookies, they are always great!

title: For the $ it is a good hotel
text: The room and hotel are nice.  The problem was the elevators.  We waited between 6-10 minutes for an elevator to even stop at our 21st floor, and 9 times out of 10 they were packed beyond capacity when they did stop.  We finally used the 20 flights of stairs carrying all of our bags, to depart.

title: Subpar
text: Hotel is not up to the Hilton brand. Staff was friendly but lobby is small crowded. Rooms are small. Too small for two people. Restaurant was not terribly good. Tired decor. Hotel is in a rather ugly area. It is convenient and otherwise good value given high prices in NYC.

title: Small, but nice
text: Rooms are small (it is NYC of course), but overall nice. Friendly, helpful staff. Restaurant was good (again tiny) and waitstaff was very attentive. Will stay again if in NYC for business (nice walk to the office)

title: Nice hotel but loud location!
text: The hotel itself is nice, our room was clean and comfortable. There are issues which other people have mentioned such as everything being a little cramped (which is understandable in NYC), the lack of a fridge in the rooms and the limited number of elevators leading to long waits. However, the main problem for our stay was noise from outside. We had been up since 3am travelling and really needed an early night's sleep but an open air restaurant/dance bar opposite the hotel started playing music really loudly from 5pm until past midnight. Obviously you expect a bit more noise being in NYC but this was ridiculously loud. We complained to the front desk, unfortunately we couldn't be moved to a higher room (we were on floor 16 of 44), but they did provide us with ear plugs and said that they would send over someone to ask the bar to turn the music down. Unfortunately this didn't seem to have much effect and we finally fell asleep in the early hours of the morning. We were then awoken from our unplanned but very necessary lie-in early by people using the elevators which were just outside our door. At this point we decided we couldn't face another sleep deprived night and checked out a day early. The hotel is in a very useful location and it's not their fault but it was definitely too loud at night for us.

title: No me gusto
text: Es un hotel que queda downtown NY. me quede ahi porque tenia una reunion cerca. la proxima vez busco otro hotel en la zona! el checkin poco servicial. la habitacion no estaba limpia, en la ducha habian pelos! por mas que habia pedido late checkout, housekeeping toco la puerta unas 4 veces. queria dormir un poco y empezaron las pruebas de las alarmas de incendio. los ascensores lentiiiiisimos

title: Disappointing/found bug
text: I booked this hotel to tour my friend in NYC. We travelled from Albany and arrived in the City after a 3 hr drive. We walked around and see some places then checked in to hotel around 4pm. Relaxed and my friend was tired so went to lay down sleep, after a few minutes rests we are getting ready to get dinner or walk to town when we saw a bug. I killed it with smashing it with tissue. Now we are pissed. We get ready to go down, packed all our stuffs back to our bags ( to make this short) we brought the bug to front desk and let them know what transpired, my friend left in the room to finish packing and checking out stuffs. The front desk offered to change our rooms, I didnt make a scene and asked them to simply make it right, instead we were given a room in 14th floor with access not working. Messed up room was hot, ac not working at all. I filed a complaint and they told me it will take 72hours to respond. Well I'm only here for one night. I complained about having a full bed when they know it's two people in the room. They said no two bed so no choice, everything was full. I said did u guys check? This has stressed me so much that I can't rest since we wont fit in a the mattress so I asked for them to make this right, hot room same bed size as before, they gave me a comforter and I use that to sleep in the room that I paid for 135 USA plus taxes about 140-150 for a four star? And not even four star. I asked in my complain for refund if I will be stuck in this room. Again they apologized and said no upgrade. We will see if they refund me since overall this place has bug. We will see. I am now reviewing hotels I will get in my travels. I will update you guys about this issue and case.

title: Worst hotel ever
text: Worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Check in was fine and was excited about the free cookie and the high floor, but as soon as I entered the room it was all downhill. There was a smell to the room that i was trying to figure out. The tv was a wall mount that couldn't stay up. It kept falling down. I noticed that the AC was leaking water. I called the front desk and was put on hold for 5 minutes with no pick up. I hung up and went down to the front desk. I told them about then issue and they said they would contact and engineer to come fix it. I went out to enjoy the city and when I came back from being out I noticed that the AC was still leaking water into the room. The floor was soaked. And I mean soaked. (Now I know why there was a smell to the room when I came in). That whole night it was a rotation of sleep, dripping water, and clicking from the AC. I could not sleep all night. The next day I was a miserable person. Not the way I thought i would be spending my vacation. I called down again and told them of the issue. They sent someone up to fix it, but the room smelled and the carpet was soaked. I went down and told the from desk and they said at first they couldn't move me because they were booked. (45 floors with approx. 10 rooms on each floor.) I found that unliking, and of course they were able to put me into another room on the same floor. I would recommend that no one stay here. Horrible rooms and bad customer service. At the very least they should have moved me immediately without any questions and offered me a refund for my stay. Instead they lost me as a future customer and I hope others hear my warning. There is other options in the city.

title: Nice location in Financial District
text: We came to the city to take in some Hamilton history. This hotel is so close to the things we wanted to take in: Trinity Church, Wall Street, Fraunces Tavern and more. Hotel is located very close to subway for easy access uptown. Breakfast is served in restaurant next door and there is a connecting door so you don’t have to go outside. Rooms are clean and compact but nice. Hotel is also very close to ferry terminal. Staff is quite helpful.

title: Great Place to Stay in  the Big Apple
text: If you are looking for a great hotel close to the action with the best staff and comfortable rooms, then this hotel is for you.  Near Wall Street it is a stone throw away from the boat to Liberty Island and multiple subways

title: Good option for financial district
text: Very happy overall with this hotel. We chose it due to location, being near where we needed to be. Cheaper than similar ones up in Midtown so it was a good option for us. Staff were friendly and room clean. Rooms a bit smaller than expected and the lift/elevator system was a bit overwhelmed around the checkout time (this is perhaps due to the reception being on level 2 so guests are constantly going from ground level to 2 and restricting the service to upper floors). View from upper rooms fairly decent and you get capsules of milk in the room unlike some other hotels in NY. There's a restaurant on the premises serving Italian food in evenings, quite decent. Would stay here again for a low-mid price option in Manhattan.

title: From Texas to NY
text: Everything was great and the value was awesome. I would definitely stay here again. Staff was very friendly and offered recommendations of local places to eat and directions for using the public transportation system.

title: good location, but crammed
text:
Pros: service was prompt and courteous, snacks upon arrival were appreciated as were the breakfast vouchers for the room downgrade, room was clean, love the location - pub and pharmacy around the corner and short walk to Wall St bull and to the Pier  at which there is a great view of the Statue of Liberty
Cons: very narrowly built, felt crammed, all double rooms were right in front of elevator door so we could hear foot traffic which was disruptive when sleeping, no mini fridge in room

title: No Water
text: The water was turned off from 10 pm to 4 am.  When I expressed my dissatisfaction with the front desk, I was given bottles of water.  Did not know what to do with the water.  Someone had to explain.  Paid too much to have to replenish my own toilet water.

title: gute Lage ohne Service
text: die Lage des Hotels ist wirklich super. Beim Einchecken war alles in Ordnung, bis meine Frau und ich das Zimmer bezogen haben. Der Blick auf den Fluß war teilweise durch das Gebäude blockiert (keine Hinweise dazu). Der Arbeitssessel war richtig abgenutzt und draußen was die Eismaschine viel zu laut. Ich bin von der 32-Etage zum Empfang runtergefahren und habe 20-Mal bei vielen Etagen angehalten. Ich beschwerte mich über die Gesamtsituation. Das Hotel war ausgebucht und ich konnte das Zimmer nicht wechseln. Mir wurde gesagt, daß ich morgen das Zimmer wechseln kann und mich wieder am Empfang im Laufe des Tages melden soll. Weil ich auf Aktivitäten für den ganzen Tag war, meldete ich mich spät nachmittags am Empfang. Eine Dame hat meinen Fall angehört und zeigte keine Bereitschaft, um mir zu helfen. Weil ich mich über mehrere Sachen beschwert habe, hat sie mich ignoriert und darauf hingewiesen, daß das Hotel nicht verpflichtet ist, dies und jenes zu machen. Ich fragte sie, ob das Hotel Pflicht hat, um das Wohlsein des Gastes zu kümmern. Die Frage wurde nicht beantwortet. Weil ich die ganze Zeit mit privaten Aktivitäten beschäftigt war, habe ich die Beschwerden nicht weiter verfolgt.

title: Great Hotel in Financial District - Consider a Room on a Lower Floor
text:
This was a great little hotel right at the end of Manhattan. It is easily accessible via a number of subway stops and a short walk to the Staten Island ferry. It is a short walk to Wall street, Bowling Green and the Bronze Bull and within walking distance to the Freedom Tower and the 9/11 Memorial. There are awesome restaurants all around and really trendy bars. 

The hotel was decent with a comfy bed and all you would need for a short stay. The only thing that was really annoying during our stay was the elevators. Me and my partner were on the 19th floor and during busy times it took FOREVER to get an elevator. With only three lifts, it would be full by the time it reached our floor. We would often take the stairs in the morning.

I would consider getting a room on a lower floor if I were to come back for another trip.

title: A dormitory in New York City
text:
The location is very good, but at the time of my visit, Stone street was very dirty due to a nearbye street festival.
The hotel has no reception at the ground level,
the reception is at the second floor. But  the elevators were extremely busy and slow. So  I had to wait a long time before being able to even go with my suitcase to the second floor. There is no refrigerator in the room, no water to drink. The hotel is an expensive dormitory.

title: Quartier très agréable, hôtel correct
text: Quartier de Wall Street, animé le jour et calme la nuit, nombreuses stations de métro alentour. Hôtel confortable mais quelconque, à choisir lorsqu’ il offre un bon prix. Excellente literie comme toujours chez Hilton . Éviter le petit déjeuner sans intérêt , à prendre dans une salle triste

title: Good place for NYC sightseing
text:
Minuses:
- poor breakfast
- high price in comparison with other hotels of this net (in other cities)
- not properly working air conditioner

Pluses:
- personnel
- easy to find, near the subway
- good placement for sightseing
- very clear rooms and bathrooms

title: Super location in Battery Park area
text: Loved our stay to bike the 5 Boro Ride. Excellent location for start and finish of ride. Hotel staff was super friendly and accommodating for all the cyclists staying there. Felt very welcomed! Would definitely stay again!

title: Bike the Boros Ride....ride.
text: Staff was extremely professional, courteous and friendly. It was a very busy weekend and the Doubletree team did everything in their power to keep a full hotel happy and moving.  Great job!!! I would stay here again.

title: Good location, friendly staff.
text: This is a great hotel if you're planning on doing the lower Manhattan tourist attractions. Less than 1 mile from Wall Street, World Trade 1 and ferry to Liberty and Ellis Islands. We were able to walk everywhere. Subway station 2 blocks away for a 10 minute ride to Times Sq. Only downside was extremely long elevator rides and noisy housekeepers.

title: Ok, elevators are an issue
text: Hotel was packed for weekend. Checked in at 5 pm, and waited 20-25 mtes for an elevator. 3 small, slow elevators with barely enough room for people and their bags. Bellman couldn't find luggage being held for afternoon. Not impressed.

title: A clean, modern and comfortable hotel in a fantastic location
text: Our stay in this hotel was great - all of our dealings with staff were very positive and they were always helpful and friendly. The location is perfect with many subway lines only a few minutes walk away. There's plenty of bars and places to eat nearby. Close walk to Brooklyn Bridge, Chinatown, Soho and more. We will definitely return and I would recommend to travellers who want to be away from the 'madness' of uptown Manhattan.

title: Goede locatie, prima kamers voor Manhattan
text: Schone kamer, grote bedden en een ideale locatie. Grootste nadeel was dat je af en toe erg lang op de lift moest wachten (1x zelfs 10-15 minuten). Verder waren de kamers iets verouderd maar dat deed niet af aan de hygiëne.

title: Excellent location, helpful staff - economical choice
text:
This hotel is in a prime location. Easy walk to restaurants and shops. Rooms were okay; very clean which is most important to me. Be advised that the back side of the hotel overlooks a cemetery. This is not a good option for someone who is terminally ill or has recently lost a loved one. I recommend that you ask for a different view.

David at the front desk was incredibly helpful and accommodating. Honestly, David was one of the top employees that my family has ever had the pleasure of dealing with at a hotel. He was incredibly attentive to every person's needs. We spent several hours conversing with family in the lobby following a family wedding. All of us were very impressed by David's pleasant greeting of every guest who arrived in the hotel that evening.

title: Beautiful in great downtown location
text: Near Wall street and the Staten Island Ferry located near the Freedom Tower. Lots of great shopping and restaurants really close by. The people at the hotel are great guides and can help you find whatever you want. The rooms up in the tower have great views. Great place to stay.

title: Buena opción en Wall Street
text:
Lo bueno es que si bien es pequeño, resulta cómodo. Se agradecen las amenidades como la cafetera. La ubicación hace que sea silencioso y favorece a la gente que planee hacer actividades en Brooklyn o las islas cercanas del sur.

Lo malo el agua salía amarilla (pero no dudaron en darnos botella de agua mineral para que podamos tomar tranquilos) y la ducha no siempre sale caliente. La cama toda deforme. La limpieza a medias.

title: Excelente Localização, e óptima relação Preço/Qualidade
text:
Extremamente bem localizado, com 3 linhas de metro a menos de 10 minutos. Ferry para Staten Island (para ver a Estátua da Liberdade) a 5 minutos a pé.
Quarto amplo, com vistas de Wall Street. American Cookie de cortesia, e máquina de café no quarto. Bom pequeno almoço, com Bagels, Muffins, fruta, Iogurtes e quentes - atenção que é necessário um voucher de pequeno almoço para cada dia, mesmo que a data no voucher inclua todo o periodo da estadia.
O único senão só os 3 elevadores que parece que estão sempre cheios, exigindo frequentemente paciência extra.
Possuem também free storing room, o que permite, para quem possui voo tardio, ainda visitar boa parte da cidade.
Atrações a menos de 10 minutos incluem o memorial/museu do 9/11, a One World Trade Center, e Wall Street.
Excelente relação preço/qualidade.

title: 1st time in New York
text: Hotel was great, at the top of the road is Whitehall street subway and less than a 5 minute walk away was south ferry station, so was really easy to get to places such as Times Square but out of the way of all the crowds!

title: Perfect location
text: This hotel is perfect for those that wish to walk around lower NYC and in the financial district. The rooms were clean, staff was always helpful and most importantly there is coffee in the room. You will not be disappointed.

title: Great Stay
text: Stayed April 4-6, 2019  with 2 adults and 2 girls for spring break vacation. Very convenient to Ellis Island ferry (5 min walk), subway (2 min walk) and financial district (5 min walk). Staff was very accommodating and helpful with how to get around in NY via the subway. Beds were very comfy. Rooms were small, but its NY so that was expected. Hotel, rooms/bathrooms all clean. Nice hotel and would definitely recommend. It was quiet and not a lot of room noise. We choose financial dist as it was cheaper than times square yet convenient to get down there via subway. not a party area so that was nice since we were on vacay with 7 & 11 yr old girls. a few restaurants within quick 5 min walk. walked to restaurant/market called Essen, which had fresh food buffet like whole foods does, which we really enjoyed twice: had one person who is on a plant based diet, and she had plenty of options to choose from as well. it was right around the corner from hotel.

title: Kind of a high rise motel - stay here only because of location
text:
I took two grand kids to NYC to see the sights. I did not want to drag them from Midtown to get on a ferry for the Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island, so this was a good choice location-wise: literally 5 minutes to the ferry and a 20 minute walk to the 9-11 Museum & Memorial. 

Otherwise, the rooms are teeny, dark, and basic. Virtually no 'lobby' - Check-in is on the 2nd floor - very inconvenient. There are 3 elevators for a hotel with 45 floors. Expect long waits for the elevators, which are also used by staff for cleaning carts etc.

The breakfast food is substandard (fruit and oatmeal tasted funny, even the coffee was pretty bad). All this for almost $400 a night. Again, NYC is expensive, there are not many family friendly hotel choices in the Financial District. 

Oh - and they have no concierge. Only time in my entire extensive traveling life where the person referred to as 'the concierge' could not name a single family friendly restaurant in the area. Just so you know: there are many, including a Mexican restaurant right across the street.

title: Customer service at front desk unprofessional
text:
On this trip to NYC I was chaperoning alone, 7 students aged 16-18 years old, in 4 rooms. I rang multiple times to check room accommodations, even the night before my stay. I paid in advance with the school credit card and completed the tax exempt form. While on the phone I wanted to make sure one of the rooms could accommodate 3 teenage boys. I was told only king size rooms were available. So to solve the problem I asked for a roll away bed. I was told over the phone- no problem. On arrival, I felt like my reservation was an inconvenience. It took a while to find my reservation and when I asked about the rollaway I was told that due to storage restrictions they do not have any at the hotel. The hotel was full and therefore they didn’t have any other rooms to accommodate the three boys. I asked to talk to a manager. I waited 20 minutes and then asked the manager to call me. She did call and I was told that a room maybe available late tonight if a cancellation comes in. We lucked out. A room did become available, for one night only. Now I had 5 rooms on five different floors. Yippee! Fun at curfew! 

After the first night we checked out of the room we were given. Later in the afternoon I talked to another person at reception about our situation and asked what was the plan for night two. He asked me to explain what had happened because there was nothing in the computer on our reservation. I explained and was told the same thing that I was told the previous night. Totally full hotel. No rooms available and no rollaways. This time I felt my situation was falling on deaf ears and when I asked for a managers name who was on call that night, no name was given until I asked which business card should I contact. I asked if I could have more comforters and pillows sent to my boys rooms so they could sleep on the floor for one night only. The receptionists said they will send some bedding up. I gave the room number and they questioned it. I told them to look at my reservation to confirm the room it’s needed for. 

I am so upset that a 17 year old kid that paid to go on their first trip to NYC has to sleep on the floor because of a lack of communication and blatant bad customer service from a hotel chain that we as a family are gold loyalty members of. 

The hotel is 44 stories tall, the elevators take forever so ask for a lower room so you can use the stairs. Don’t expect employees that actually can accommodate you because their hands are tied and because of a lack of accommodations in the financial district they really don’t care.

title: Disapointed
text:
Hotel has 3 elevators for 45 floors. We had to wait each time 20 min to get the elevator and to stand on the edge of the door just to get the chance to get to the ground floor. 
We also had a chewing gum on the wall next to the pillow.

title: Missing breakfast voucher
text: Hotel was fine, but the free breakfast was not included, even though I had the room rate with free breakfast.  Staff could have cared less.  Paid for breakfast and it tasted like the eggs were cooked in toilet water.

title: Comfy stay, clean rooms, but front desk staff is lacking
text: As others have reviewed, this hotel is immaculate.  We were on the 43rd floor and the view is stunning.  Despite being so high up, we had no trouble heading to or from our room as there are 3 elevators.  As mentioned by others, it takes a LONG time for the hot water to arrive, both at night and in the morning.  Our concern was with check-in.  We arrived late (after 8:00 p.m.) and there were two women working at the desk (Mar. 30th).  Neither greeted us, and both wanted to hand us off to the other (one of them was obviously trying to leave at the end of her shift).  There was no welcoming manner to either of them, no offer of the hospitality bag with complementary water, and I had to ask for the "warm cookies."  Others in our group who arrived at various times throughout the afternoon/evening received no cookies and no water, and didn't know to ask.  When leaving the next morning I asked for the welcome bag, and they were happy to accomodate.  This staff couldn't have been nicer or more professional.  When, minutes later, a HUGE busload of touritsts arrived en masse, I didn't know who to feel worse for, the TOURISTS or the single check-in person!?! Stressed staff should not be so obvious to the guests.

title: Great Central Location
text: This hotel is in a great central location, walking distance from The Rockafella Centre, 5th Avenue, Times Square.  We had a family room - 2 double beds.  The room was large, beds were comfy, the bathroom was a bit on the small side.  We were greeted with warm cookies on arrival which were amazing.  The staff were very helpful and polite.

title: Nice & clean
text: Good location in the financial district. Short train trip to the Village for a night out and close enough for an inexpensive can ride back to the hotel. However, on the weekends, the businesses in that location are not open or open later due to the majority of people are only there to work Mon-Fri

title: Horrible Start and Horrible end - but a great stay in between
text:
We booked 3 rooms for 4 nights in March 2019.

As this is a New York property, you need to expect the rooms will be small. They are however very clean and comfortable with great bedding and bathroom facilities. The hotel is in a great location with so much to do around the area and close to the subway.

We unfortunately had some very negative concerns. 

1) Check in:

We arrived early and understood that we wouldn't be able to check in until the correct time, but we thought we could at least ask. We were greeted by a very terse check-in attendant named Venetta who was extremely rude to us. Practically yelling to us "That check in is not until 2pm." We kindly asked if there was a  possibility to see if she could check to see if any rooms were ready. Again we were yelled at by her "Can't you see that Im very stressed out here! You need to wait and see when the manager arrives!" We asked if she could give us an indication as to when the manager might arrive. "I don't know!" She yelled, "Maybe in an hour - maybe in two hours?"  We sadly backed away and took our bags to the bell desk to be looked after while we went and found some breakfast. After this, we went back to see if this manager had turned up. He was there and we asked if we could check in early and he made everything look so easy. He found us all rooms that were available and checked us in early. 

2) Check out:

We had other issues with the hot water, and this occurred at our final morning of checkout.

We needed to check out at 5:00 for a 14 hour flight. Each of us set our alarms at 4:00 so we could shower and prepare to leave.

My room had NO HOT WATER - it was freezing
My two other friends' rooms had ONLY HOT / BOILING WATER.

None of us were able to take a shower before we departed to the airport.

I was the first to the check out desk and made a small complaint. The check out attendant apologised and offered to add 1000 points on my Hilton Honour account. 

2 weeks later and this hasn't happened.

My friend checked out and made a small complaint and the checkout attendant apologised and offered to contact expedia (who we booked with) and provide a small refund as compensation. The same occurred with our friend in the third room.

None of this has happened and I feel sad that we were lied to by the desk staff.

So overall, a great hotel but we had a horrible start and finish to the experience.  This is a great disappointment to the Hilton brand.

title: Hidden Gem
text:
This hotel is located on Stone St, just a few hundred feet from a subway station, yet it’s a little difficult to find as the signage is simple and the entrance perpendicular to the building.
Once inside the halls all feel very tight, and there are only 3 elevators for a very tall hotel. All that said, I loved this hotel. 

The staff of the Doubletree was very professional yet super accommodating. Once, I figured out where it was, the location was perfect. Lots of hustle and bustle by day and super quiet at night. 

I had two different rooms (I only expected to stay one night so checked out...only to check back in for a second evening), and each was very comfortable and super clean.

I would recommend the Doubletree to anyone staying in Manhattan that doesn’t want to stay in the tourist centers!

title: Regular visitor
text: This is a convenient, clean and friendly hotel. The wait for elevators can be considerable and the location of the hotel lobby on the second floor sometimes means doubling elevator trips. The staff is friendly and does its best to make you feel comfortable.

title: Great place to stay in Financial District
text: Truly had a wonderful experience at the DoubleTree. The staff were awesome. The restaurant attached is really a gem.  Not too pricey but the food was outstanding.  Noise level in the room was well below most New York rooms.  I did not hear any of the street noise. Could be the location or which way my room faced, but I'll take it in any case. Was great.

title: Double Tree Hotel Financial District
text:
the position is excellent: downtown Manhattan, close to the subway and in a zone which is undergoing new development (pedestrian area in Wall Street) and walking distance to 9/11 memorial and new area
you are immediately on the Broadway and close to Smithsonian National Museum of American Indian.

The rooms are nice, with good bathroom facility, mine overlooking the street
The welcome service at the check-in was professional and having water and cookies as Hilton Honor member was a treat

the lobby is at second floor and if you check-in in rush-hour time, especially on Friday, waiting queues at the elevator can be long

title: Meh...
text:
I checked in on a Thursday afternoon (3p), and the 2nd floor lobby was busy. The impression I got was chaos. While I waited my turn in line I was witness to one of the attendants behind the desk speak to a guest in a very curt tone as the guest asked questions about their booking. The more questions that were asked, the more visibly frustrated the attendant got. These were my first impressions...

I got our room assignment, found our way up, and walked in only to find that the confirmed and paid for double room that we had booked was a single. So I called the front desk and explained that I thought a mistake had been made. The response i got was that all the double had been booked, and there was nothing that could be done. I questioned the fact that I had a booking that was confirmed, and was told "I'm not sure what to tell you" and was offered an opportunity to come down to talk about it further, but there was nothing that could be done. Puzzled, I thought to myself then what was the point??

I gave the stay a 2 rating because of the location. It was convenient to have the subway stations near by. I used the Moovit app to navigate my routes - highly recommended. The hallways were narrow, but quiet. This DoubleTree location's staff could  benefit from some customer service training.

title: Convenient location, would benefit from renovation
text: Convenient location, clean room, though interior is somewhat aged and needs make-over. Price is adequate for what you get. Entrance on ground level is not appealing, but then it gets better. Good Italian restaurant.

title: Not what was expected
text: After stating this was a honeymoon in the booking and also mentioning at the desk; we were not treated anymore than a number. The room itself was fine, they put us on the 42nd Floor. That said, this was a service doing the least necessary. I felt underwhelmed having been a honours member too.

title: Our Favorite NYC Hilton So Far
text: We've stayed at almost 10 of the NYC Hilton Properties, and this Double Tree is our favorite so far. Great price, super clean, nice restaurant on property, and really friendly staff. Miss Venetta helped us during check-in and check-out, and made us feel at home!

title: Room Too Small
text: We were in a room with a king sized bed but the room was too small. My wife and I couldn't even walk past each other. The shower was also too small. The staff was very helpful. The bellman gave us an umbrella to use bcuz it was raining.

title: Stayed for the location.. Will come back for the cookies
text: Arrived 4 hours before check in but no issues.. Big rooms for NYC.. U great location..4 subways within 3 minutes walk. Time Square and midtown 10 minutes by subway.  3 Duane Reade (convenience stores) within 2 minute walk. Plenty of takeaways and restaurants within 10 minute walk

title: Great service
text: I had the pleasure of staying here this past weekend.     The hotel was great and the staff and housekeeping team were pleasant.  Vicki at the front desk was especially professional, accommodating, and attentive to our needs.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: My stayed
text:
Good service from the hotel staff they were very friendly and polite. 
They even help me getting a ride to the airport 
Room was very cozy and good view of the river,  will definitely come back and stayed in this hotel

title: Average
text:
My last visit to New York I stayed in Hilton garden inn near Central Park which was an absolutely wonderful stay thinking that I closed my eyes and booked Hilton double tree assuming the same quality. 
First surprise was definitely the entrance.. you enter and you would think is this what I paid for? 
Corridors on the room floors are too narrow to even drag your luggage 
Nevertheless the rooms were nice enough - happy with that but the housekeeping is not so great they only made my bed but didn’t clean the room which was quite weird

The guy answering in room dining calls is quite rude and not helpful at all. Got sick during my stay and even after mentioning that he didn’t offer to help me with things that I needed. But I contacted Hilton through their online chat on the app and got a call back right away to cater to my request which was great! So plus point for that!

Lastly got early check in and late check out so plus point for that too. 

Location wise if you’re visiting for tourism it’s definitely not somewhere you should be since the weekends and weekdays after 6 pm is very quiet.

title: Best sleep ever!
text: Wanted to celebrate my 30th in NYC without waking up to the NYC noise and busyness. I slept like a baby at the hotel! The beds were comfortable and clean! The hotel being where it is was perfect, wasnt too busy for an early August weekend. Hallways were quiet. Im planning to book AGAIN for 31st birthday!

title: Save yourself the hassle
text: This Hotel was nothing short of disgusting. Rooms were outdated, dirty, no comfortable accommodations and when anyone showered, this really loud high pitched noise would start... you can imagine how much this happens at a Hotel... and they advertise that if you aren’t 💯 satisfied then let them know and they will make it right. Total lie. Please save yourself the aggravation and take your hard earned money elsewhere. I have stayed at many different areas at the Fairfield Inn and the Hampton Inn and they are always clean, comfortable and professional!

title: Pleasant time near Battery Park
text: Convenient to both east and west side trains, plenty to do, an area I was previously not familiar with. Plenty of restaurants, and with Battery Park right there, we had a good view of Lady Liberty anytime we went to the park. If she is your goal, remember to make reservations well in advance.

title: Great location but review your bill carefully before checking out
text: Great location near the river and financial district, but please review your bill before leaving. Was changed two (2) daily valet parking charges on the same day and didn't have a car nor did I drive in NY.

title: Great location near Wall Street and Battery Park
text: Went on business and the location is excellent - right on the subway line, next to wall street, and near battery park and the ferry to the Statue of Liberty. The only critique I have is that I was on a higher floor and the elevators would sometimes run a little slow, get crowded, or stop at every floor to pick up more passengers although already at capacity.

title: All is good but AC
text: everything is excellent. Service is great, helpful and friendly staff. Clean room, perfect location. But the AC is too loud and hard to keep on a comfortable temperature. Leave it on, it soon gets too dry and warm even on a low temperature. Turn it off, it’s freezing in the sleep.

title: Worst stay ever!!!
text:
I did have a few concerns with this particular stay. This was a vacation trip for me and my wife. It was my first time ever coming to New York and seeing where my wife was born. So, with me being a Hilton rewards member I wanted to stay in the nicest location to which I believed Manhattan financial district to be an affluent safe area. 

However, our stay didn’t reflect what I thought one bit. After a few nights, we noticed our first room had an ant infestation in which I have video of. So, they moved us to a different room, but the door wouldn’t close shut on its own. I had to manually force it to close shut. Also, the shower was leaking water out on the floor and soaked the entire floor towel we had down and I almost slipped getting out the shower as well. 

Lastly, one of the main reasons my wife loves Double Tree is for the amazing soft warm chocolate chip cookies. But for some reason at this hotel the cookies were rock hard and we try getting new ones daily (3x) but yet the same results just over cooked and hard. 

Hopefully, something can be done about this major inconvenience because I didn’t feel as if I got the value for my money and this experience with Double Tree didn’t give me a great first impression on New York.

I even extended my stay in New York one more day and stayed at a different hotel Holiday INN Downtown Brooklyn and that stay was 100x better.

title: Excellent service location steps from subway
text:
The entire front desk staff and restaurant staff were very professional and accommodating. They were efficient and organized. Extremely impressed by the service. 

Literally down the street from the RW subway line (yellow) and convenient to the SI terminal. 

Room small but good temperature, liked the carpeting, huge TV screen, cookies on arrival. Water pressure excellent. Location of room was so good that room was quiet and slept incredibly well. Largest downside was more elevators need to run at all times and the wait time for the elevator was long. (44 floor building and a slow elevator system because building is older). Not like the fast elevators in large high rise offices in NYC.

title: Run down hotel
text: I would not recommend this hotel.  Rooms and bathrooms are tiny.  Narrow hallways.  Long elevator waits.  On top of this no views which I thought you’d at least get on a higher floor.  The bathroom in my room also has a broken electrical outlet right by the sink which seems unsafe.  Won’t be returning.

title: Weekend visit
text: Close to subway stations.  Not on a busy main street.  Convenient to some good eateries---Leo's Bagels, Justino's Pizza, and Murphy's Irish pub.  Warm chocolate chip cookies are the best we've ever eaten.  Great value!

title: Great Hotel to stay when on Business
text: Love the cookies and the pleasant staff to greet you.   I stay here most of the time when in the City for business.  close to many restaurants and the rooms are very clean.  The only issue is when the hotel is full the elevators are extremely slow.  I had to walk 26 flights down stairs.   Warning if hotel is full, stay on a lower floor.

title: Angenehmes Hotel, zuvorkommende Angestellte
text:
Habe hier nichts am Hotel, der Lage oder auch den Zimmern auszusetzen. Seit langem mal wieder ein Hotel ohne Haare im Bad oder sonstigen Dreck wo er nicht hin gehört.
Die 25$ je Person für das Frühstück (wenn nicht davor gebucht) sind übertrieben. Wir haben in einem der unzähligen Stände in derselben Straße für nicht mal 15$ frisch zubereiteten Kaffee und Beagles bzw. Brötchen mit Rührei und Speck gehabt. Gegessen haben wir es dennoch im Zimmer!
Somit nur 15$ statt 75$ für 3 Personen - was will man mehr?

title: Great value for money
text: Stayed here last year as a couple wanting to enjoy a less tourist type holiday and see what New York has to offer as a local. The hotel is quite far from Times Square but easily reachable by subway - taxi rides ended up quite expensive. The hotel is a stones throw from the Hudson. However we enjoyed exploring the financial district but bars were expensive and busy due to the clientele being business users. As a base and as we did not mind taking the subway everywhere this was okay. Room quite small but all New York hotel rooms tend to be on the smaller side. Staff very helpful and friendly, room was clean and bed was comfortable but overall basic and dated - fine for a place to sleep, shower and head straight back out.

title: Идеальное место
text: Номер был на 30 этаже. Вид идеальный. В номере очень чисто, убирались каждый день. При заезде в гостиницу нам дали свежие печеньки каждому. Заселили раньше на час, чем надо, за что огромное спасибо! Рядом есть метро, минут 5 ходьбы. Есть продуктовый магазин, кафешки и тд. Расположен в тихом районе.

title: Exciting
text: Perfect getaway with your partner. Location was excellent. Staff was excellent and helpful checking in and out.  Lots to do close to transportation World Trade Center easy to get to grand central and 34th street

title: Perfecte locatie
text: Binnenkomst bij de liften is rommelig en doet goedkoop aan. Het is jammer dat je niet in de lobby komt als je naar je kamer gaat, want daardoor is er geen persoonlijk contact met het personeel. De kamer is ruim en schoon, maar weinig luxe. 's Nachts is het erg stil, dat is prettig. Verschillende metrolijnen en bezienswaardigheden op loopafstand. Ik raad dit hotel aan vanwege de ligging.

title: Prime Location With Great Staff and Congested Elevators
text: The hotel staff was amazingly courteous, and it is in a prime Manhattan location.  However, the elevator wait and congestion was somewhat frustrating.  In spite of the situation, my date and I were impressed with the hotel room.

title: Good location
text:
The location was very close to the train station at Bowling Green. Also close to Staten Island Ferry and Battery Park.
Room was clean and bed was exceptionally comfortable.
Concierge were excellent and super helpful.

title: Terrible experience
text: I arrived late on a Friday night for a 3 night stay- I was Checked into a room me and my son went up to that room only to find that the door unlocked but the bolt was on because another guest had already been checked into this room. I come back downstairs and tell the woman at check in- she stands around saying I don’t understand this doesn’t make sense and I wait for about a half hour at midnight with my 6 year old for a room. I notice my check out date is the next day- she tells me somehow they split my reservation and I’d need to call - so I go upstairs I’m on hold for 40 minutes to ve told that my reservation Is fine and that there should be no issues. So I call down to the front desk and the woman informs me all is well and that I would need to do nothing else . The next day after working and being out most of the day we go back to the room only to find that the key does not work. I go back down to the front desk- let me note there are only 3 elevators for a building with over 40 Floors. We get there again we are waiting for an additional 16-20 minutes so they can figure it out and find out if my personal possessions are still there or had been moved ?? So then after all of that I am told I can go back to the same room my stuff wasn’t moved I just need to CHECK IN AGAIN. Literally the worst experience at a Hilton to date.

title: Excelente Servicio
text: Excelente instalación, el personal muy amable y muy atento te entiendan en ingles y español, el servicio de limpieza excelente, si solicitas algo no tardan nada, el Internet a pesar de ser gratuito es de muy buena calidad, excelente detalle el de la galleta y muy rica

title: Très correct
text: 4 nuits avec petits déjeuner. Armez vous de patience pour accéder à une table le matin aux heures de pointe, tout comme pour les ascenseurs. Chambres propres literie très confortable, pas trop de bruit hormis celui de la clim. Ne passez pas à côté du rooftop.

title: Great experience!!
text: Went for vacation/ anniversary getaway. The hotel was quiet and had a great view of the city. The hotel staff was great. The front desk staff was very accommodating. Breakfast was classy the wait staff was very friendly and they had a great verity of foods offered.

title: Great location small room.
text: While the room was small, which was not unexpected, the promised "river view" was the neighboring building under remodeling construction. The bathroom was designed by someone who never used a bathroom, no place to hang cloths or towels or counter space to a toothbrush or toothpaste. Great location and staff was friendly.

title: People who care about their guests
text: Hotel rooms in New York all look the same when you're asleep. It's getting to the room that matters. From the doorman to the desk staff, each person greeted me warmly and made me feel welcome. From finding a place for dinner to a smooth morning check-out, each person radiated joy in their job. Who wouldn't want to wake up to that?

title: Excellent service & convenience!
text: Perfect location for a business trip with an exceptional restaurant on the main floor. Within walking distance of the 9/11 memorial, along with other great NYC attractions & restaurants. The entire staff were very hospitable and always helpful when local recommendations were requested. The front door staff saved the day by hailing a last minute cab to catch a train during a snow squall!  Next stay will definitely be a room with a view. Would highly recommend this location for business or pleasure!

title: Excellent
text: I was picked to be the guest of the day and my boyfriend and I got upgraded rooms as well a nice little gift which was unexpected. Everyone was extremely nice and we’re thinking about staying here again for Valentine’s Day,

title: Good location of this hotel
text: This hotel has really good location and a subway stop is literally next to the hotel. Perfect you can walk to the World trade center. It is just 5 minutes by walk. The stuff was friendly what we appreciated because we had also another and worse experiences in NY.

title: Mixed - great location, terrible room service
text:
This hotel is cheap and very well located for the subway. They give you a delicious cookie when you arrive and the beds are comfortable. The heating is noisy and the windows drafty. 
Do not order the room service breakfast. I've never seen anything quite as dreadful.  Grey, uncooked toast for 20 bucks. My advice is to stay but go elsewhere for your breakfast!

title: Perfect location!
text: This hotel is perfect for the financial district hotel. I had left another nearby property because of issues and Elizabeth was super nice and helped me and my family get an early Check in. The rooms are small but are very clean. The bathrooms are super nice and are well designed. The elevators are fast and I only waited maybe 2 minutes max. Breakfast was in the restaurant next door and was super nice as well! I can’t wait to come back here!

title: Paul
text: Det var fantastiska sängar och kuddar. Och sen var dock väldigt högljudd annars tycker jag att hotellet gav väldigt bra valuta för det är pengar jag betalar. Det var nära till tunnelbana och bra restauranger.

title: Quiet & good value
text: We stayed several nights at this hotel during January 2019. We found staff helpful & were pleased with our room. Would return. Quiet part of NY but excellent access to various subways & plenty of restaurants at hand.

title: Great Stay!
text: Stayed here in November with my boyfriend, our first time to New York, this hotel was pretty central, subway all around it, staff were great very helpful, and polite id definitely return again in a coupe of months.

title: Great location but give the breakfast a pass
text:
We spent 5 nights at this Doubletree and generally things were as expected. The location is perfect in that it is footsteps from a subway station and walking distance from any building in the financial district. Check in was quick and the staff (Luis) was able to make a room change for us quickly and without any hassle. The rooms are small but this has to be expected for a downtown location in any city; however they were clean, contemporary and well furnished. 

There was some maintenance issues that were never fully resolved, the sink faucet has to be run while the shower is on to keep the water hot, the bathroom fan ran constantly and the solution was to disconnect it and there was a deep crack in the shower floor which could cause cuts if you were not careful and for that I took off half a star. 

The breakfast was a let down. While the staff were pleasant and attentive, Fernando was particularly good at this job, under cooked eggs to order were more a health hazard than a morning welcome and overcooked hot buffet food made the place feel like a cheap motel. even with free coupons for the week, my wife and I chose other local options such as the starbucks round the corner or one of the fantastic breakfast foot carts within eyesight of the front door. Again for this I took off l half star.

A final note is to give praise to the door staff all of which were friendly and always had time for a quick chat. Hopton was especially helpful with his morning greetings and informed us of (and arranged for) the airport shuttle which we did not know about and this saved us time and stress.

Doubletree is not a hotel that should be passed up and with a few minor updates and changes it could easily compete with other more expensive locations.

title: New York visit
text: I came back to New York with my daughter cause my son is getting married. Chose this hotel for convenience and I did not make a mistake in choosing this hotel. It’s in the middle of everything. I am recommending this hotel.

title: Doubletree Hilton on stone
text: Very clean kept great greeters and really good house keepers I loved it loved it loved it loved it I will be back soon for my next business trip to nyc so double tree be prepared for me lol housekeepers and greeters keep up the good work

title: It was ok
text: Not there fault but the hotel was located in what seemed like a sketchy ally so don’t go there for the view. The staff was nice and accomadating. They always greeted me when I walked in. My shower water was cold...and it was like updated locating but kind of also dirty looking at the same time. It was just ok for a quick business trip

title: one star customer service
text: hotel reps overcharged me for the stay. it took me many-many emails to get my money refunded. 5 people were copied in the conversation, however only third or fourth email would get a reply. finally a rep offered some milage to me as a compensation for the mistake and trouble, a couple of months later, I'm yet to see the miles in my account. follow up emails are not getting any replies. again, with 5 (!) people copied. not sure if i'd like to remain a hilton gold member after this...

title: Good Hotel with a Great Location
text:
Good hotel!!! The location is excellent, about a block away from Battery Park and the ferry to Liberty Island and Ellis Island. 

As with many things New York, the arrangement is different from elsewhere in the world. When you enter on the ground floor you won’t find a check in desk—that will be on the second floor. Take the elevators up. Be patient they will come (44 floors). 

The staff were excellent. They greeted us with a smile and saw to all our needs. 

The lodging was New York standard. Narrow halls and smallish room. But given the space they have to work with...

Tip: if you can’t turn off the light over your bed check out the switches on the wall behind the entrance door. They don’t look like normal, residential light switches, so there is a chance that you will miss them when getting ready for bed, after you are standing there naked calling the front desk asking them how to turn off the light and they are offering to send up the hotel engineer and you are asking if there is any other way because you are naked and then you see the switches that you overlooked because they don’t look like normal switches

title: Excellent place to stay
text: Very nice hotel, excellent service. The staff is nice and helpful. When I got to the hotel front-desk staff was really nice and the check-in process was really fast and painless. The room was cleaned everyday and the towels changed. The check-out was also very fast and painless.

title: Great value for the money
text: Great location and great price.  Easy to get in and out of the city from  lower Manhattan.  Easy walk to the September 11 Museum.  Love running over the Brooklyn Bridge.  Easy to get to Tribeca and Greenwich Village.  Taxi or Subway easily accessible to explore other parts of the city.

title: Noisy and bathroom was way too small
text: Location was very noisy, ice machine, other guests and street noise. Bathroom was tiny, no space at all near sink, very hard to use. Staff was great, food in restaurant was also good. Had breakfast buffet well stocked and warm, great selection and price, wait staff very attentive.

title: Hotel hilton
text: ubicación del hotel es excelente, puedes tomar fácil subway. y cerca sitios para comer, las habitaciones bien, único detalle falta mantenimiento agua caliente y extractor de olor baño no funcionaba bien.

title: Hotel discreto
text: buona posizione, nel cuore del financial district. camera (al 38esimo piano) con vista sulla freedom tower, abbastanza spaziosa e pulita. Il prezzo, per me eccessivamente alto, è comunque in linea con la media del periodo e della città

title: Great customer service
text: Just when we thought customer service was dead , my  family and I had the most wonderful experience . Alan & Luis (at front desk) helped us out with any and everything we needed .
