We will be back ! Their energy and customer service were superb . These are the type of employees that make a GREAT business !

title: Nice stay in the Financial District
text: Stayed in this financial district hotel for two nights. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. It is NY so there was outside noise but the hotel itself was fairly quiet. The area is nice, close to the Charging Bill statue. I would stay here again.

title: Good room option in the financial district of Manhattan
text: Stayed at the Doubletree Financial District just before Christmas.  The rooms were nice for NYC and the location was decent to see numerous points of interest in NYC.The check in was efficient and the staff friendly.  We were quickly up in our room so we could go exploring Manhattan. We didn't have any meals at the hotel, but lots of restaurants close by for all meals. Also decent bar scene in the financial district, even on the weekend.  Obviously a little more quiet in that are as opposed to Times Square, but that not all bad.Fairly good access to the subway to get uptown on both the west and east sides.  Took the subway to Lexington to see Central Park and the department store windows. Also caught it to take in a Broadway show.  Hit a couple restaurants and bars close by, and would recommend the bar at Delmonico's.  Also Leo's bagels for breakfast.  But also stopped at probably the worst Starbucks we have ever been to on Broad street.Hotel is also close enough to walk to Battery Park (to see Ms Liberty)  and the 9/11 monuments/museum.  A place of great sorrow, yet fascinating stories.  The freedom tower views are amazing, but the experience is way too commercialized.End with the hotel, I would recommend as a good place to stay in NYC.

title: NYC vacation
text: The staff was frienly and welcoming.  The hotel was very clean from the lobby to the hallways and rooms.  The location isn't the best but the subway is near and with the price, I would definitely come here again.

title: Shame on you Hilton
text:
The staff were wonderful, friendly, courteous, helpful, but please Hilton give them something to work with!! There are 3 small elevators for a building with 40+ floors. You have to add at least 10 mins to your schedule to get in or out of hotel. Check in was slow and painful. I arrived at 2:00pm, which was an hour before check in so I understand that needs to be figured in. Still I did not get into my room until close to 3:30. Bathroom was cramped, toilet was stained, towel rack broke as soon as I took a towel, at 3:00am I discovered I could not shower unless I wanted 3rd degree burns. When I tried to adjust knob for water temperature the entire fixture turned around. The curtains did not close so that the lights from the office building next door (which were illuminated 24/7) were shining into room as I tried to sleep. I asked for a taxi to be arranged and all they would do is get me the Hilton limo which was going to be $35 to go 0.6 miles. 
Location is good, restaurants and shopping and pretty much anything you might need is within walking distance. Also they have a very nice gym.
Overall a very disappointing experience.

title: Starting to doubt the hilton brand
text: This is the 2nd Hilton that I stayed in  in the NYC area and the 2nd time I was very disappointed.  The room was super small, no hot water, etc.  No one was at the front desk when I got there around 2pm  I had a meeting to get to and no one was to be found.  Turns out that she was finding some info for a guest, which I understand but to abandon the desk for a long period of time is unacceptable.  The location was great for access to the ferry and there is a half way decent bar right next door.  This Hilton is off my list as is the Embassy Suites in Times Square.  These are both newer Hiltons so I'm wondering what is going on with the Hilton brand.  I may resort to Marriott when I'm in NYC.  Come on Hilton - get it together!

title: You Can Find Better/Newer for the Same Price
text:
We intentionally stayed in the Financial District, as we didn't want to be in tourist-heavy parts of town.  Also, we preferred to stay in a hotel which catered to business professionals, in the hope that we would have a nicer stay.  I stayed at this hotel in 2009, and I expected to find the same experience.  I was disappointed. 
Cons: 
Room size:  I must have stayed in an upgraded room before, because, even though I had a King Size room, the room was extremely small in comparison to my previous room. 
Extra Amenities: There is nothing special, here.  If I were traveling for a company, I would feel short-changed, as the only little extra here is the warm cookie, IF you go downstairs to ask for it.  
Surroundings: Unfortunately, there is construction near the hotel; so, that messed with the appearance of the street on which the hotel sits. 
Cons: 
Cleanliness: Housekeeping does a great job.  My only complaint is that I saw the bowl full of some mushy substance sitting in a corner right outside my room for two whole days and nights.  Even though I mentioned it to an employee at the desk, the bowl remained there all night and the next day.  ...frustrating.  
Environment: It is very quiet, there.  And, although the hallways are extremely narrow and almost every room seems near the elevator, I didn't hear any noise--either from the street or elevator--when I was in the room.  
Dining:  It's pricey, but there are several places to eat, in the area.  Be prepared to pay dearly for the best dining experiences in the area; however, there are some sandwich shops and coffee shops, in the area as well.  
Essentially, I do believe the hotel was well-priced, but I believe management needs to step things up.  There are too many similarly-priced options--both in this area and others--for me to ever consider staying here, again.

title: OK stay
text: Stayed here over the Christmas holiday.  As a former New Yorker, I understand that space is a premium in the city. If you are looking for a spacious room, this would not be the right kind of hotel for you.  The staff was courteous and the rooms were clean.  We had a problem with the bathroom and the staff took care of it right away.  I needed to print something and the printer in the business center was not working.

title: Good stay with great location
text: The stay was good, with many tube station close by. Many attractions are at walking distance as well, which would make this a good stay for tourists. Cleanliness was good with very friendly and helpful staff.

title: Good price for Manhattan
text: I've stayed at this hotel for 1 night. This hotel is located at the south edge of Manhattan near the Battery park, Wall St. and the Bull. It's accessible by subway which is only 2 blocks away. Check in was fine and they give a cookie as a way of welcome. The room was clean and in a good shape. The bed and the sheets were comfortable. I had a nice sleep. It cost me around 175$ cad with taxes for one night which I found the value excellent for Manhattan. Overall this hotel is very good and I would probably return if I have a chance to return in New York.

title: Affordable, good location, but there are issues
text: If you are single person traveling to New York for a short time on business, this hotel would be a great choice. But  if there are two of you traveling, be warned that this is a cramped hotel space, even by New York standards. The bathroom is so small they decided to install a vertical toilet paper dispenser. Horrible design choice. Very little counterspace  in the bathroom. The location has great access to several different subway lines,  making it easy to get to the theater district or  Lincoln Center. The staff varied from incredibly friendly, especially those of the front door, to others who seem terribly bored with their work. Housekeeping did not replenish supplies for the coffee maker, and a call to the front desk to ask for them was met with indifference, and nothing was ever delivered—even after a day.  Of course, the free cookies at check-in are a wonderful bonus. If the price is cheap, go for it. Otherwise, look farther uptown.

title: Impromptu Dec visit
text: We took an impromptu trip to NYC based on a tempting hotel offer at this Doubletree.  It was a great location with wonderful Doubletree warm cookies and an equally warm front desk staff.  Everything else was below par: sagging mattress,  short sheets (only covered 2/3s of the bed), no blankets, small small room withTINY Footprint, no towel racks, andand scratchy TP.  The elevators were slow as molasses

title: Are you sure this a Hilton property ?
text:
First of all, I want to say that this bad experience started when after I receive the confirmation after I make the reservation , I send an email with a request to 
tracey.martinez@hilton.com but nobody answer.

In the day of the C/I we arrived around to leave our luggage around 12 PM , we ask the Front Desk agent to point us to Brooklyn Bridge which was a little difficult for her. 

After a long and rainy day in the city , back to the hotel, the C/I process was unfriendly: no info about the property, no questions about the reason of the visit in NY ( even it was a special event for me which that's why I was sending the email !). And what was very important for me: no question about the method of payment !! They charge the cc on file in advance and with an impolite attitude the Front Desk agent told me that she can do nothing about that!
In the room when we try to use the shower there was no hot water !! We call to the Reception and the lady told me that we must wait 10 min because the room is on the 43rd floor! 
We called again to ask how we can stop the heater because in the room was 75 F , but nobody answer on the phone and we figure it out ourselves hot to stop it from a button under the heater.
Also, we wait 4o minutes for a toothbrush kit!
The only positive thing was the view on the 43rd floor .
All of this after I booked this reservation thru my Hilton member account.
Next time pay attention when you put a big worldwide brand on a hotel in NY.

title: Double Tree Financial District NY
text: Great location, close to Wall Street, subway at the corner of the street, ferry to the Statue 5 minutes away. Great for turists that want to move around NY even for the first time. Good restaurants and 9/11 Memorials!

title: Great Deal
text: The nightly rate was too good to pass up. This is my third visit to this property and I have to say the staff were beyond friendly and helpful at this visit. The bellmen at the door are amazing...helpful, professional and make you feel like you are returning home each time you enter the door. The elevators are so very slow, but that was the only negative part of the stay.

title: Old tired hotel with staff who are not interested in you
text: We booked a suite - It bore no resemblance to any picture.The Net curtains were black and you could barley squeeze past the beds.We had booked the suite for use of the sofa bed - It was not made up on arrival (no pillows or duvet) - asked at reception at midnight and they said they would contact housekeeping - Nothing happened - no apology no phone call, my son just slept under a sheet and his coat.Sofa bed was very uncomfortable – Thin matressBreakfast - poor - no one is interested in you. Food was not always replenished - ran out of Bread, Jam, pastries, and limited fruit etc. If you wanted fresh coffee you had to go and find someone or if you wanted a cup of tea... that was difficult!Construction opposite was going on overnight outside our room (505) on two occasionsIf you like 1970's Brown, and no interaction from any staff - you will love this hotel, however for me it was poor.

title: Naja
text: Hotel ist in einer super Lage, nicht weit vom Zentrum entfernt jedoch nicht mitten im Trubel.  Zimmer war sehr schön jedoch war es als wir Einchecken wollten noch nicht geputzt. Dann bekamen wir ein neues Zimmer, dort das gleiche Problem. Erst das dritte Zimmer war dann Bezugsbereit , kleiner Punktabzug.

title: Amazing!!
text: Great location, super quiet, easy to check luggage before/after checking in, and Allen is the best!! We loved our stay and everyone working there. Not far from Newark airport if you are flying in/out of there!

title: Find somewhere else...
text: Completely unimpressed for the price paid. The location is excellent when you need to stay downtown as multiple subway lines are super close and lots of great food too. Unfortunately, the hotel is nothing to write home about! Tiny rooms and bathrooms...and when I say tiny, imagine the toilet paper touching the side of the toilet and having it in the way when you sit down or pee! Imagine a closet that has a tiny door on one side of the bed but no place to put your clothes or luggage; think of stepping outside to change your mind since there is no place in the room to do so...except that the hallways are so narrow and tiny there isn't room there either! Breakfast was never stocked, bacon dripped in grease, fruit cut but not cut properly (pineapple with all the knobs not cut off). The staff want to help and are a really nice bunch, but they have a limitation of the disaster that is this property

title: Excellent short stop in NYC, close to the subway!
text: Recent trip to NYC, excellent staff, very nice room, great location, access to Subway, walkable to duane reades and many restaurants and bars including sports bars!  Will definitely stay again, no problems experienced and of course the warm cookies are always great!

title: Buono ma non al top
text: Posizione ottima, centralissima nel Financial District. Personale cordiale e disponibile. La camera è buona ma forse non al livello dei prezzi e della zona (doccia con tenda e a pavimento aperto, un mobile ammaccato, no attaccapanni alla porta..)

title: Not worth the price
text: Suites are small, elevators are slow, parking is an adventure. No private lot available. Icon charges for each entry regardless of duration. No where to load or unload luggage, lobby on second floor, no help with bags or holding open door for those with luggage

title: Not what I expected, needs renovation
text: This place really needs a good renovation. In my shower, the ceiling was falling apart, and there were patches all around the room, patched badly. The carpet felt like I may catch a disease from it. Not much of a lobby, on the 2nd floor. The room was also really noisy. I expect noisy from NYC of course, but I've stayed many other places and this was quite loud.

title: Nice location
text: Nice quiet part of town with nearby pubs and restaurants hotel clean, staff friendly. Elevators extremely slow/ frustrating. If you can time your travel around peak elevator time do so! Otherwise recommended.

title: Down Town Manhattan
text: This hotel as one great thing going for it...LOCATION! It’s located in a great position in the financial District. Ideal for exploring this area. If your looking for a hotel where you can sit drinking at the bar then this hotel is not for you! The rooms are clean tidy and contain everything you need! Great Irish bar next door as a added bonus!

title: Good compromise - Ideal geographic situation
text:
After lloking at different hotel options uptown, we finaly chose this one, in Lower Manhattan.

I was a bit worried to be far from everything but my doubts vanished straight away :

- 3 metro stations around, with many main lines to uptown and Brooklyn (and JFK airport 50 minutes away with just 2 connections),
- Liberty cruise pier, Wall Street, Charging Bull statue all about 5 minutes walk away. 
- The brooklyn Brigde, World Trade Center and City Hall are also not so far (you need to like walking in NYC anyway ;)). 

Room are not big but nicely equiped (far enough when you spend all your day out) : TV, fonctionnal bathroom. 

Bed are "smooth". 
Our room was clean.

Breakfast buffet is simple but also this is very sufficient. 
Everyone can find something they like. 

The area is very quiet people-wise on week-ends. 
A few little restaurant around and a mini supermarket that is very convenient.

My only minus points will be that the isolation is not very hard. We can hear the next room and outside. 
Also, there are changing all the towels everyday. This would be nice to be able to choose to keep them for a few days if we want, as some other hotels do, in a "environemental spirit". 

We will nevertheless come back to this hotel when we come back to NYC.

title: Bra läge och nära till allt!
text: Bra läge och närhet till allt. Tunnelbana 100 m därifrån. Nära till Battery Park där vi såg Frihetsgudinnan, Ground Zero, Whitfield Mall, Century 21 och massor av flera affärer.Restauranger fanns i närheten. Rekommenderar frukost på Essen.

title: Buen hotel
text:
El hotel está muy bien. Nuestra habitación bastante cómoda con dos camas, baño un poco pequeño pero manejable.

Al llegar en front desk nos dieron una galleta de chispas de chocolate un muy buen toque de bienvenida.

Todo el staff en general desde portero hasta camaristas muy amables y sonrientes.

Aparten del buen servicio destaca su ubicación ya que se encuentra muy cerca el metro y el ferry.

title: Hotel with too many problems
text:
The first two days were ok, but then I spent other 8 days without wifi and I totally needed it for work as I was on business. Plus there was a problem with the lifts on the first day and one was broken. It normally took 20-25 minutes to get a lift, so sometimes I had to go downstairs through the stairs for 20 floors.
They did not make up for any problems although I had no wifi and I could not work. I had to go to cafes around to go on working in a hotel like this which should be designed for business trips.
Absolute chaos! I would not recommend it.

title: Schlechtestes Hotel ever!
text: Das Hotel hat uns 4 Zimmer gezeigt, die alle dreckig, beschädigt und nicht angemessen für ein dobletree sind.Wir wussten, dass das Hotel renivierungsbedürftig ist und nicht die modernste Ausstattung mehr hat. Das ist aber kein Grund dafür, dass alle Badezimmer dreckig und voller Schimmel waren bzw. Dass die Badezimmertür herausgebrochen war, der Spülkasten defekt oder kein warmes Wasser vorhanden war. Das einzig Gute an dem Aufenthalt war die kostenlose Stornierung, sodass wir in ein anderes Hotel wechseln konnten!Trotz Hilton Mitgliedschaft würde uns kein funktionierendes Zimmer angeboten, was ich nicht nachvollziehen kann. Da hat auch kein Restaurant-Gutschein mehr geholfen.Besonders unverschämt fand ich die Aussage der Hotelmanagerin, dass unsere gezahlte Rate, da wir im Voraus gebucht hatten, zu günstig ist und somit keinen besseren Zimmerstandard hergibt. Geht in meinen Augen gar nicht!

title: Honest Review
text: Well, overall our experience was good, the location was perfect and the staff was friendly. The only two problems we encountered during our stay was the noise outside the room. We could clearly hear people talking and laughing during late hours. Also, the elevators were another issue. There aren't enough and therefore the waiting time is too long and it can get claustrophobic inside the elevators when there are a lot of people at once.

title: Surprisingly pleasant stay
text:
I booked a stay at this hotel, which was a good deal but like always, no change no cancel. Then I read some review and got scared by the elevator issue and other bad comments. But, when we actually got there, everything turned out to be quite good. The elevator waiting time can be a bit longer at peak hours, but no more than 5min, and they placed a tv in the elevator hall, and always someone there greeting guests. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. Plus the location is so convenient, near to different subway lines, makes daily sightseeing super easy. 
不要被这家酒店的评论吓到，电梯问题没那么严重，最高峰时间也就等个五分钟。员工非常友好，位置超级便利，性价比超高，推荐给来纽约旅行的小伙伴。

title: Hotel com bom custo beneficio
text: Gostei da acomodação porém achei inadimissivel um hotel da rede HILTON ter overbooking nos obrigando a ir às 1:00 da madrugada para outro hotel da redeChuveiro sem identificação de água quente e friaInternet tem de logar novamente de vez em quandoCafé da manhã deveria estar incluso em todas as tarifasBoa localização no sul de Manhatan

title: Absolutely fine
text:
Was a bit worried after reading some of the reviews. But the hotel was absolutely fine. Clean, comfortable rooms and friendly staff. No waits for the lifts at all. In a great location. We enjoyed hot cookies each night on our return home after a long day out. The luggage staff were very friendly and helpful. 
Thanks for a great 4 night stay.

title: mixed feelings: the very good and really very bad
text:
We had indicated we would arrive early. We did not expect our room to be ready by the time we arrived and left our luggage with the best front door person ever Allen. He should be called Director Of First Contact as he is really a great ambassador for the hotel.
When we arrived back at the hotel at the agreed time the room would be ready, it was not. It only had . to be checked on cleanliness and such. The lady at the reception would come to us one that was done. It should not take more than 10-15 minutes according to her. Only the lady did not come to us. Even worse, she ended her shift and left without informing us at all. By this time we already waited for more than 30 minutes.

By the minute my wife got more annoyed and I was not a happy person. After almost an hour I went up to the front desk. Nobody acted as if they were up to date with our situation. This despite the two gents behind the counter being there when we walked up almost an hour prior.

This infuriated me and the front desk manager was called for. I explained to her the situation and she was apologetic and very unhappy with this treatment. She rectified it by upgrading us and providing us with breakfast and a dinner voucher.

The room was nice; a bit dated though and soem things were loose or not properly fixed. We were already happy that we finally had a room.

The next day we used our voucher in the Italian restaurant at the ground floor of the hotel. After dinner we paid with the voucher and left a cash tip. The latter despite very bad service from the waiter who had more eye for four girls sitting at a table near us. He was trying to impress them and we could overhear him fibbing. (you do not leave the great country of Albania to become a waiter in New York when you have this great life and make so much money in Albania).

When we left the restaurant and were waiting for the elevator this same waiter came up and demanded more tip. When I told that I had given him enough for the great service not rendered he threatened us that he would take the full amount on the hold by the hotel and more. 

You can tell me anything. I am big boy, been in war situations so a guy like him does not make me feel uncomfortable. My wife though is another story. She is all for kindness, harmony and more. She felt so uncomfortable that she started hiding stuff in the room in case he really would access the room and take stuff. Also she did not want to go for breakfast anymore since that is in the same restaurant and she wanted to avoid a confrontation in case he would be working the breakfast shift too.

We sent an email to hotel manager. He called us back as we requested. He implied he was not happy with the situation and would come back to us. The manager never came back. We went for breakfast elsewhere.

Overall the hotel is reasonable. It is more three stars at most (service rendered by Allen are five stars).
We probably would not go back. And do not count on the hotel manager as he will not follow through his promises.

When you decide to stay in the hotel avoid the overpriced Italian place. Go next door to the Irish pub. They serve better food at more realistic prices. In the weekend Barry is on staff and he is a blast. (the owner Dennis is not bad either, he knows all about black and white movies)

title: Great location, but could use some help!
text: Great location and concierge. I felt the hotel is benefiting from the Hilton name, without upholding standards. The room I was in had a fly problem. No matter how many we killed, they kept coming back.

title: Great location, great value
text: Great location in the Financial District, super value. Hallways and stairs are narrow, just a comment. Rooms are smaller, but not an issue. Super clean. Elevators can take a while, plan accordingly. Breakfast was great in hotel restaurant.

title: Good location, comfy bed, paper thin walls.
text:
I booked this due to its location and decent price.  I’ve stayed in Doubletree hotels before - hard to square the fact that this is in the same chain.  Bellhop staff always very courteous and welcoming.  Front desk polite enough but best they could offer for a late check out was noon on a holiday when it’s hard to imagine they were expecting lots of guests.  Ho hum.

It is a great location near the subway, shops and restaurants.  Unfortunately it is quite a noisy location with hooting etc and poor sound proofing which meant I was disturbed at night.  And the walls are paper thin which means you can hear the people in the room next to you even if they are not that loud. 

Small room, fine for me on my own though.  Comfortable bed and decent housekeeping staff.  Shower tiny - not enough room to swing a cat.  Corridors the narrowest I have ever seen in a hotel.  And lifts, yes, rubbish.  Too slow.

Don’t think I’d stay again.  Shame as it’s a great location, but the hotel doesn’t live up to the brand, I’d expected better.

title: NYC Fall 2018
text: Great hotel and very helpful staff. Plenty of subway options. Very close to South Ferry and Battery Park (for trip to Statue of Liberty). The only drawback is that the area shuts down at night. There are very few options for food after 8p. However, the hotel and staff were great!

title: Buen hotel, buena ubicacion y buen servicio.
text: La ubicacion es increible, en la esquina hay una estación de subway, un Duane Read y justo al lado un bar. En los pasillos hay máquinas de hielo y en la habitación cafe gratis. Lo unico malo que podemos decir es que los elevadores son muy lentos. Fuero de eso, es un excelente hotel!.

title: Slow Elevators!
text: I would not select this hotel again when traveling to New York.  The layout of the hotel is inconvenient when traveling--you have to open a door to enter the hotel (this may be temporary in colder temperatures), then go up a floor to the lobby.  This would not be a problem if you didn't have to wait and wait and wait for the elevators.  Taking the stairs is not an option with bags and checking in/checking out.  However, I have never seen so many hotel guests taking the stairs with me than at this hotel.  Upon checkout it took > 10 minutes to get an elevator on a Sunday morning--I was concerned we would miss our flight, and by the time the elevator came to our floor, it was almost always full. We also experienced issues with the internet being out for a day during our day, which was inconvenient.  The rooms are also very small, even for New York.  It would be nice if the bathroom had any space to put items--just a very small shelf.  Can hooks be added to hang clothes or towels?  It's impossible to even put down the hairdryer in the bathroom--more storage in the bathroom would be helpful.

title: Great hotel in financial district.  Close to subways.
text: This hotel was in a good area.  I felt safe walking to and from there.  The room was small, but no smaller than other rooms in NYC.  The bed was comfortable, and the bellman were the best in the city!  Very friendly and helpful.

title: Very good hotel overall
text: Had plans in the city during a work trip with some friends.  It was actually a college class reunion trip.  Plans called for us to end up at a bars in the financial district so a booked a room on my Hilton App for a nearby hotel and found the DoubleTree.  It was a short stay.  I found the hotel nice and a typical downtown hotel.  The room itself was small but cozy.  The king bed took up most of the room.  There was a small desk, and a decent bathroom.  The location was great for either work or staying for pleasure.  Overall, I would recommend for staying in the area.

title: Excellent
text: My husband and I chose this hotel for it's price and location.  Multiple subway lines right outside the door. Easy to get around the entire city. Safe, quiet area. If you are a newcomer to NYC and unsure about the subway, don't overspend and stay in Midtown/TimesSquare! The subway is safe and will get you anywhere quickly.  Here you will sleep in a much quieter (and nicer, and larger) room than most NYC accommodations!  It's also a convenient 5-10 minute walk to the Wall Street Bull, Oculus, Freedom Tower, and Statue of Liberty ferry.  We loved it and will return!

title: Very Good
text: We had a great time, with very friendly staffs, excellent service and comfortable beds. There are some subway stations near this hotel. We could also walk to the Battery Park and see the Statue of Liberty.

title: おおむね良い
text:
部屋は普通に綺麗でした。広さも大きいスーツケースが広げられた。
バスタブのない部屋でしたがシャワーもあたたかくてよかった。ただ、床はびしゃびしゃになった。
チェックインの際にあたたかいチョコクッキーをいただいたのが嬉しかった。

title: Sehr guter Service
text: Wir waren rundum zufrieden mit unserem Aufenthalt im Double Tree im Finamcial District. Die Mitarbeiter*innen waren durchweg sehr freundlich und zuvorkommend. Die Lage ist super, da man verschiedene Subway-Linien in Fußnähe hat sowie Supermärkte und Restaurants/Imbisse/Pubs.

title: Visita con Familia
text:
Excelente ubicación, a unos pocos pasos de la linea R del metro que va directamente al centro de Times Square y de Battery Park de donde salen los botes a la estatua de La Libertad y de las linea 4-5 que va directo a Grand Central
La habitación muy limpia y cómoda, con caja de seguridad y servicio de café, el servicio siempre amable, los elevadores un poco tardados. Viaje con mi esposa y dos hijos y la pasamos muy bien. Hay una farmacia cerca con víveres y algunos bares que son tranquilos los fines de semana.
Es un poco caro, pero así son todos los de Nueva York.

title: Very nice hotel and good location. Stay here!
text:
Weekend stay and we enjoyed it very much!  Very nice staff and a Starbucks around the corner. The hotel is clean, modern, rooms are medium size (good for New York) and right around corner from subway and loads of nice restaurants and bars in a very safe area. This is not Broadway, rather it is a Great location for taking ferry rides, seeing the lower Manhattan sites, heading to Staten Island etc,. Good launch spot for China town, Brooklyn and East side, Lower East Village, etc. 

This is not a big lobby grandiose hotel, but it’s a very good hotel, if you want big lobby and Times Square stuff then go uptown and spend a fortune. This is a comfortable place, warm and less stressful, with limited amenities. But, Hilton always does a nice job and you will be pleased for the value. Yes, Elevators are slow and can take a while. Many hotels in NY are like that and it’s frustrating. Just request a lower floor so you can use stairs if you want. 

Enjoy!

title: Hotel vraiment sympa !
text:
Hotel bien situé accessible en métro au sud de Manhattan.
Réception vraiment très très très lente mais personnel sympathique. Compliqué d'atteindre les chambres dans les étages supérieur car les ascenseur semble faire un peu ce qu'ils veulent et l'attente est interminable.
Les chambres sont propre, spacieuses, jolie vue sur l'hudson, belle salle de bain et moderne, vraiment bien pour de relaxer après de jours de visite et la literie est incroyable !

title: Situation top !
text: En voyant les prix des hôtels à NYC, nous étions affolés ! C’est un peu plus cher que « les moins chers » mais sincèrement plusieurs arguments en valent la peine : proche de plusieurs métros différents, salle de bain et chambre privée (pas toujours le cas pour 20-30€ en plus la nuit!) et sincèrement ces commentaires sur les ascenseurs, on ne les a pas trop compris.. ok ça met peut être parfois quelques minutes, mais pas plus, avec 43 étages ça peut se comprendre, et pour un logement à 110€ bien situé à NYC nous on a survécu ! Par contre c’est vrai que l’espace des chambres et sdb n’est pas bien grand.. mais si vous n’avez pas la folie du grand grand luxe cet hôtel est un bon plan dans l’ensemble !

title: Sloppy Service and Lousy Follow-Through
text: I had five problems requiring action by hotel staff in less than two hours after check-in. I subsequently had seven more issues, making it an even dozen over a three-night stay. These included broken flush mechanism on toilet, inability to get change at front desk for a $20, absent room service menu, incomplete room service menu, elevator buttons that don't light up to indicate they have been pressed, inability to access the WiFi, not being told how to access the WiFi at check-in or the $50 incidentals charge, room service nor answering the phone, front desk doing nothing about room service answering the phone, recommended private car arranged by hotel not showing up while two taxis were waved off, the bathroom door not staying open and the desk too small for a room service tray, and waiting 25 minutes for someone to talk to the party girls in the next room who were loud and causing beer fumes to come through the connecting door. The worst part was I booked it because of the low price for the holiday weekend not thinking about how much taxi fare was going to be going and coming to my conference in Columbus Circle and plays in the theater district. The front desk manager made amends on my bill but I'd much rather have had a problem-free stay than two nights comped. The only good things about the hotel are the bellmen, the shower and the bed.

title: 华尔街附近的双树，很紧凑
text:
距离华尔街非常近的一家酒店。早晨可以看到来来往往的金融上班族。离克林顿城堡也很近。
不过酒店整体设施偏经济型，价格却不低。房间很小，我预定的房间还有一扇假门。浴室的防水做得很不好，长时间淋雨后会发现水漫溢了出来，只好用脏毛巾垫着。

title: Ok hotel to stay for business
text: Stayed here a couple of times. The hotel is nice to stay for business, not sure if I would stay here with my family. The rooms are an ok size but during the winter it's getting cold in the room. Almost felt like the window was open. Maybe I was unlucky during the winter.

title: Good location for lower Manhattan
text: If someone wants to experience financial aspect of NewYork then this is the place to stay with Wall Street at a walking distance. Ferries which provides an awesome view of New York skyline can be boarded from a nearby sea port.

title: Convenient for Wall Street business
text: Close to multiple subway lines and Staten Island Ferry. Near many casual restaurants/bars during regular hours. Hotel is small with very slow elevators. Rooms are clean and average. Current location is under heavy reconstruction so traffic is congested and construction noisy. Room rates reflect. It looks like this construction will continue into mid-2019.

title: Nowhere Near Hilton Standards -- And DON'T USE the Hilton App to Check In!
text:
This property is in the Financial District, near the Staten Island Ferry and several subway lines.  In that respect, convenient.

Staff at lower elevator lobby were courteous -- always a welcome.

Good breakfast in lobby restaurant for Honors members.

I had booked my room six months in advance.  I booked a high floor, river view, away from the elevators.  (I am Hilton Gold, and my profile has for years said away from  the elevators.)

I got to my room.  Arrived right on time -- no last minute check-in where rooms might have been limited.  No river view.  View of the cooling towers of a nearby building, plus the rest of the skyline.  Right across from all three elevators.

Room was very small.  And then there was the smaller bathroom.  Shower stall -- no exaggeration -- was only 24 inches wide.  I am not a large person, but showering meant constantly bumping my elbows on the walls.  A person of size would have a very difficult time fitting into that shower.

Halls on guest room floors are so narrow that two adults cannot pass without turning sideways!

Staff team leader William did, per policy, check with guests about their satisfaction, so I met with him in the lobby.  He admitted that some rooms are very small.  (Why would you put a Gold Member who booked six months in advance into one of those rooms?)

He did follow up on the river view issue.  His explanation was that, when you use the HILTON App to check in, it apparently overrides the booking instructions you made and just assigns you a room.  I did not choose a room with the system -- just let the App assign the room.  (Again, why would the hotel's App assign a Gold Member to one of the smallest rooms in the hotel?)

Lesson: DO NOT use the App to check in!

So, overall, I always hesitate to give a low rating to a property, and truth be told, the room and facility were clean and modern.  And you might expect the small size, etc., in a Red Roof Inn or limited service hotel you booked at a bargain rate.

But this is a DoubleTree (Hilton), and in that respect, via DoubleTree/Hilton standards, this property deserves a Poor rating.

title: Average, customer service needs to be improved.
text: Immediately upon arrival, the Bellmen(s) introduced themselves and offered a very warm greeting. Shame that staff at Reception didn't reciprocate the introduction and instead offered a much more casual approach. Room was average, shower door pulls out instead of sliding across so the water residue drips on the floor, the bed is too short for those taller than 5ft 6, the curtains do not pull across so there's little privacy and disturbance of light.  Rooms are too close together so walls are not sound proofed, lifts are fast but can stop frequently, expect some construction noise near by.  My room view over looked the river and faced office buildings. Also perhaps being picky, would have helped with a fridge and microwave but perhaps being in the financial district this is seldom used.  Location wise, hotel is in a decent location, a subway is adjacent to the hotel

title: Charged me for a night I didnt stay...
text: I had to get my credit card company involved because they would not reimburse me. The manager was useless ans no one from the hotel would return my call. I would not suggest staying here - there are better options.

title: Double Tree New York
text: We try to come to New York once a year as it is one of our favorite places. We had a great stay at the Double Tree. Great staff, very comfortable room, comfortable bed, centrally located. We will be back again.

title: Value for money
text: Location of this hotel was fantastic for us; the view was lovely but we could get to the hustle and bustle of Times square within a few minutes by subway. The room was clean and a good size, and the beds were comfortable. Upon arrival we had a lovely warm cookie, I did find the entrance a bit strange though as you need to take a lift up to reception. Sometimes there was a wait for a lift, but never long enough to leave you annoyed. Overall I would stay here again.

title: 3rd stay
text:
Ok my 3rd stay. Was bad 2asnt great I am learning a few things about the hotel. 

Stay on lower floors. Thaecwait for the elevator is as bad.

Dont eat at the hotel Restaurant not even for Breakfast.

Dont expect to feel like appreciated customer. This is NYC someone will need your room and the hotel knows it. 

Its location is good. And a great Pub next door so I will st stay here when required.

title: Naja!
text:
Das Hotel ist ok. Zimmer klein, viel zu teuer und man hört alles was auf dem Flur passiert. Es gibt absolut keine Schalldämmung. Teilweise hatte man das Gefühl die Gäste auf dem Gang wären bei uns im Zimmer. 
Am schlimmsten war jedoch der Service des Housekeeping, wir fragten, ob wir eine zweite Decke bekommen könnten, weil wir nicht eine Decke teilen wollten. Wir bekamen daraufhin eine Decke, diese war jedoch nicht mit einem Laken bezogen. Daher musste ich auch nach einem Laken fragen. Dann durfte ich mir selbst die Decke in das Laken wickeln. Am zweiten Tag, lag die zweite Decke, ohne Laken auf dem Bett. Ich müsste somit wieder ein Laken bestellen und selbst einwickeln. Am dritten Tag lagen Decke und Laken auf dem Zimmer - zur Selbstbedienung ... am vierten Tab war die Decke wieder verschwunden....

Das war eine Frechheit, man hätte doch merken können, dass immer zwei Decken mit Laken benötigt werden!

Auch wartete man immer 10 Minuten im 42. Stock auf den Lift... drei Lifte für 44 Stockwerke ist definitiv zu wenig.

Einzig positiv war der Blick aus unserem Zimmer auf das One World Trade und die Nähe zur Metro.

title: Noisy and overpriced
text: Have stayed here a few times for work because of location and this place is consistantly poor but expensive. I can never get a good nights sleep because there are always building works going on over night outside the hotel that are loud. The lift to the lobby takes ages to come so i have to allow 15 mins just to get out of the hotel in the morning. Having stayed in several hotels in nyc this is so overpriced for what you get. Avoid

title: Not all reviews are bad
text: I had read some pretty horrific reviews about this hotels, specifically related to the elevators, but I didn't find anything unusually negative considering this was in NYC. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean. It was also a quieter area of town and the bed was super comfy, so I got a great night's sleep. Yes, the elevators were smallish and slow, but I think that's typical based on other hotels I've stayed in while visiting New York. All in all it was a pretty typical experience with a typical price for the area.

title: Convenient to Wall Street
text:
First impressions of this hotel are not good.  You enter off the street into what looks like a basement corridor.  There is no reception desk and indication of where to go until you get to the elevators at the end of the corridor where a sign directs you to the second floor.  After a long wait for the elevator (an experience repeated daily), you ride to the reception area.  It's a nice space.  A little dark, but with plenty of comfortable-looking places to sit.
My room about half-way up the building had a view only of a neighboring building undergoing renovation.  Perhaps a higher floor would have a nicer view.  The room itself was about as should be expected in a major city.  It was not spacious, but had plenty of storage space and an armchair.  The bed was quite comfortable.  There is a coffee maker and safe, but no refrigerator or microwave oven.  There are NO USB charging ports.
If you eat in the hotel restaurant, be ware of the automatic 20% service charge.

title: Clean room; tight spaces
text: The hotel is shoe-horned into a space in the financial district that makes it convenient to the subway (Whitehall stop on the R, W) and walking distance to Wall Street, but provides a cramped experience.  The room is small, the hallways the narrowest I've ever seen, the elevators too few, slow, and small (people on lower floors going down with luggage have to wait for an elevator that isn't full).  There's a small uninviting lobby and no food service.  Overall, a place to stay in a clean room if you have to be in the financial district but not a place to hang out and relax.

title: Hôtel déconseillé
text: Bonjour, l’hôtel est très bien situé cependant, les chambres sont très petites, le rooftop accessible 1 soir sur 7 car il y a des soirées privées de plus, le service laisse très clairement a désiré il y a tous le temps la queue et le service est lent. Nous avons dû changer de chambre car le roof top est extrêmement bruyant et nous étions 4 étages en dessous....

title: A Small Experience
text: I’ve never paid  more for a hotel room and received LESS for my money. The bathroom was the size of a coat closet, with no place to put any toiletries. It took three requests and six days out of an eight-night stay to have a phone installed. No place to have breakfast, no place to buy toothpaste. BUT, the chocolate chip cookie was tasty.

title: Decent price for the area
text: No real complaints about the hotel, other than the elevator being a long wait at times, the Internet only working the first day and the floor being constantly wet from the shower, so you'd have to put down a few extra towels.Other than that, Allen was always super friendly and Tony was a delight.

title: Well located and efficient
text: Convenient location in the financial district, small rooms but well equipped. The hotel staff is very efficient and the restaurant has a very good service. Close to the WTC and to the Brooklyn Bridge.

title: No complaints
text: We had a fine stay here. This is a standard NYC hotel as far as size is concerned—(not typical for doubletree if that is your reason for booking). The room bathroom appears renovated with a nice appearance. The staff were nice and accommodating, especially the greeters downstairs. Yes the elevators were a bit slow but our experience wasn’t as overwhelming as other guests so we did not have an issue. As far as tourism, there’s a lot to see in lower Manhattan and the train station is a short walk from the hotel. Also, lots of healthy options to eat around the hotel which we appreciated. There is an Italian restaurant in the hotel but didn’t try it. The main downside was the cost. It was extremely pricey to stay here likely being that it was Columbus/Indigenous people weekend so you would’ve thought we were in SOHO on a typical weekend for the price. Unsure of the normal nightly rate but we would not normally pay so much for a weekend if we weren’t already planning on being in town. However, it was overall a good experience.

title: Expectations were higher
text: The hotel is well located in the center of the financial district and right on the metro station. Rooms are relatively ok, but it is visible that the hotel is older one. What was not good were breakfasts - quite "poor" breakfasts, not enough space and very unpleasant staff in the restaurant. Given the fact that the hotel was quite expensive it did not meet my expectations and I will search for another hotel next time.

title: Good value in NYC
text: This was a solid value in an expensive town. My room was small, but clean and comfortable, the staff was unfailingly polite and helpful. The location is excellent, near ferries and water taxis, the WTC is close by, as are several subway stations. There had been a problem with an elevator the week before I arrived, but it had been resolved before I checked in. My only complaint about the room was the bathroom. It was small, dimly lit and poorly designed - a large vessel sink took up most of the surface of the small vanity, leaving little space for personal items.

title: Not well cleaned or maintained.
text: The only thing that saved this from being a disaster is that is it is a relatively new building.  Two lights were out, hair around the bathroom, and the bathroom floor mat had rust. The iron shot out rusty water. The noise from garbage collection and construction was notable and did not stop until 11 PM. Staff said it would stop at 10 PM. General attitude: we are fully booked. Not rude (by New York standards), just seemingly bored with hearing the same old complaints. No empathy. No apologies.

title: Solid 3.5 stars
text:
Unlike recent reviews, I had a good experience.  Bell staff greeted us warmly at the entrance.  Front desk staff at 5pm was great at check in, but the overnight staff was less warm and somewhat uninterested in being helpful. 

Room was very clean and seemed to have been recently remodeled, yet small but typical of NYC.  The elevators are slow so plan accordingly.  It is a quiet neighborhood on the weekend but the river and subways are close by. 

A solid choice in lower Manhattan if you can a good room.

title: Awful experience
text: Staff rude and unhelpful, bad customer service. Left standing while they continued their conversations no interaction whatsoever. Double charged for two rooms still awaiting refund & room deposits?Rooms in need of a good clean, vacuum & dusting!

title: What a dive!
text:
This Hilton branded hotel is within walking distance of the financial district and the WTC, but it is a dirty, damp and smelly place. Our very small and cramped room was on the 6th floor. When we got off the elevators we were greeted by a heavy, pungent odor. Once in our room, the smell was worse. I asked the housekeeping attendant, who was in the hallway, if she would spray a deodorizer in the room. It worked temporarily. Within a couple hours, and once we had gotten into bed, the odor returned. It was in the carpets and drapes. The next morning we asked to be moved and we were accommodated. Our next room on the eighteenth floor was a bit larger, but the carpets ere so damp my socks got went. The bathroom towels looked clean, but there was a terrible smell to them.

For the price, this is neither a value nor a pleasant experience. If Location matters more than cleanliness then you may be able to get over the other issues. Otherwise, stay away.

Hilton should be ashamed to have their name on this venue.

title: Bello in una bella posizione
text: L hotel è molto carino, in una posizione fantastica dal quale sono raggiungibili due stazioni metro. Dalla nostra camera vedevamo wall street. Mi è sembrato abbastanza pulito e la camera confortevole. Se devo trovargli un difetto per usare l ascensore ci si impiegano anche 15 minuti.

title: Will NOT Return
text: Cramped dark roomsDamp carpets and showers leaked (dirty)Long wait for elevatorsOver-priced for what you getWebsite Pictures outdatedLocation is great - conveninet to several sightseeing highlights and subway stations

title: What a dump.
text:
This hotel is an embarrassment to the Hilton brand. 
Three lifts for 44 floors so you can wait for a very long time to get a lift. 
No restaurant for breakfast, unless you use the place next door. 
And, crowning glory, if you go to work at 7 am and.come back at 8pm, it's entirely possible that your room will not have been changed, as I found. 
No mini bar for cold drinks. 

What a joke of a place. Avoid at all costs.

title: Way over priced for this hotel!
text: We stayed here 6 nights and paid $293 per night purchased through Expedia. The location was perfect for what we wanted to see and do. The king room was small, with no view to speak of. Hallways were barely wide enough to get a large suitcase through. Our biggest complaint was with housekeeping. At various times we were missing toilet paper, wash clothes, coffee packets. Shampoo etc. was provided upon arrival and never refreshed the supply. The toilet seat was never lifted and cleaned. The sheets had several holes and several nights were not changed at all. Plastic water glasses and paper coffee cups were provided instead of glass. The mini fridge had some ripped up plastic stuck to the top. Furniture had gouges and chips out of it. Hanging around in the lobby were representatives bugging us to buy into their Hilton Time Share vacations places. The shower was fairly small but very hot and quite nice as was the very comfortable bed...two pluses. This place was definitely not worth almost $300 a night even it is was in NYC.

title: Not worth it!!
text: The pricing of this hotel is far too high when taking into consideration what it actually is. Firstly, only 2 elevators are available for over 40 stories that have to be reached, forcing us to go down the stairs 10 floors. In addition to that, they take forever and are the smallest I’ve ever seen. The halls are tiny, making it almost impossible to walk with luggage through them. Once we finally got to our room, it smelled like fast food, absolutely disgusting. Then, there’s also the fact that the breakfast that the hotel works with currently, is extremely poor. Lastly, the wifi is a disaster, it works from time to time and I needed to work, and couldn’t, due to the fact that it was so terrible. Overall, 400 dollars a night is just not worth it. A Marriott hotel near Manhattan is just fine, as opposed to this.

title: Good location, needs an update
text: Tried 3 times to get someone to answer the phone to bring a replacement coffee maker that didn’t work.  No one ever answered.   The office chair in our room was worn and tattered beyond repair.  The valet staff was ok.  Way below expectations.

title: Worst hotel I have stayed in
text: Never stay in this hotel. It's in the financial district but that's about the only good thing. No water/no mini bar/rooms are very dated/hallway is dirty/curtains don't close/it's very noisy/staff are rude & abrupt/lift didn't work so had to wait 20min or walk 10 flights if stairs (has 50 floors so could be worse)/air con was very loud/it was meant to be cheap but price went up (£240 per night) on arrival. Nothing good to say about it.

title: Ongoing issues
text: You should know by now that there is an ongoing problem with the elevators at this location. Honestly, give yourself an hour lead if you have to move your luggage by a certain time. Otherwise, it's what you should expect from an old hotel that doesn't seem interested in renovation.  And of course, a lot of construction in the area is par for the course.

title: Great Affordable Hotel
text: Finding a nice and affordable hotel in Manhattan was a mission. I was shocked to find the DoubleTree at the price I did. We arrived in New York on a Red Eye and were exhausted. Having plans to simply drop our luggage off, we were allowed to check in. In our first room, the heater seemed to be on despite the thermostat saying it was cooling. You could feel the heat from the hallway. The front desk was able to get us into a different room on a lower level. I was very grateful they got us into a lower level because the elevators were extremely slow and we took the stairs the majority of the time. The rooms were nice and modern, but very small from what we are used to. The hallways matched the compact size of the room but besides that, everything else was great. I would definitely stay here again due to the ability to easily get to Brooklyn, Midtown, and more.

title: Great staff & location but small rooms.
text: This property is a big tricky to find.  Stone street only runs for a block or two and the hotel lobby is on the second floor.  The ground floor has a doorman on duty directing you to the elevator or steps.  In our case it was steps because only two very small elevators worked and you often had a 15 min wait for the elevator.  Rooms are small, updated bathrooms.  Staff is great. I complained about the elevator service and my rate was adjusted.  We were on the 8th floor and twice had to walk up because no elevator came.  Usually walked down also.   Location is great for any business in this end of Manhattan.  Plenty of local bars and restaurants within walking distance.  Near the bull and defiant girl.  Alos native american museum is two blocks away free and interesting.  They have a car service to the airports.  $65 to JFK cash or credit.  We used it and at the airport the driver said credit was $71 so somebody is messing up.

title: Date night weekend
text: Elevators out of service, more than 20 minutes to get up or down with luggage, check in employees talking and not paying attention to guests coming in. Absolutely the worse experience in a Hilton property. None of this disclosed when booked recently. Will never stay here again. Call and check on construction, out of service challenges so you can make a more informed decision.

title: Good location, clean room
text: Ill start with my initial reaction: I felt the staff was pleasant and accommodating. Room was small but was clean and had a nice city view from 39th floor. Bed/pillows comfortable. Thought breakfast in the back room of the onsite Italian restaurant was unusual, tried it and never went back. There are plenty of other places to eat nearby. The hotel is under renovations so know the noise it can bring (wasnt bad). The elevator situation is the true negative. Everyone files in whether going up or down just to get inside. There are over 40 floors and only two working elevators when we were there. Positives: Location is close to subways, Starbucks and easy walk to WTC area. The desk staff was very friendly and Baggage area employees were helpful.

title: Elevators sucked!!!
text: Thers was an elevator down the whole time I stayed there. We had to wait 15-20 minutes for the elevator to arrive. It was very difficult because my room was on the 30th floor. Only Tony the bell man was there best part of the hotel.

title: Great Hotel
text: Good hotel, brilliant staff, nothing was too much trouble. Especially Kenya who was brilliant with our mobile problems, and the guys who look after the luggage were so helpful. Great location for subway and lots of good places to eat

title: Not what you expect from a Hilton
text: When we checked in, the Reception staff clearly didn’t really want to be there and weren’t very welcoming. On our way to our room (we arrived about 6pm) the corridor was still littered with room service trays from the previous day. The room itself was well kept but the shower made a terrible noise when used. Additionally, like other guests have said when we had a fire alarm at 3am and needed evacuating, the staff didn’t really know what was going on and did little to put guests at ease considering the situation. Their handling of this was particularly bad and led to a lot of confusion and stress amongst guests, the staff didn’t seem bothered that most of the hotel were under the impression that they might burn to death in a high rise hotel fire at 3am given that some instructions were telling us to remain in our rooms, some were to go to the lobby, others were evacuating the building entirely. One of the most stressful experiences I have ever had, couldn’t wait to leave when we checked out.

title: Clean look, but stinky room
text: We booked knowing the issue with the slow elevators so I won’t go into that. We stayed Saturday, Sept. 15 and Sunday the 16th. The room seemed clean, but there was no missing the musty mildew smell. Didn’t take long to figure out it was the wet carpet from the dripping air conditioner. We were only staying two nights and didn’t feel like dealing with a room change. Other guests said they had the same issue too. I sprayed perfume and hoped it went away. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and updated. Water pressure and temperature in the shower were good. However, there’s no place for toiletries or much of anything. We were on the 31st floor and had a great water view. The hotel was okay but I expect more from a Doubletree. The same glasses sat outside our neighbors room the whole time we were there. Not their fault, I assume, but the fire alarm went off at 2:45am.  Talk about being scarred on the 31st floor!  Man on the speaker said it was an issue on the 12th floor. People on 11, 12 & 13 were to walk down to 9. The alarm kept going off and we were left to sit there and hope everything was okay. After a while they announced the FDNY cleared the floor and all was well. It was hard to get back to sleep!  Side note . . . We recommend Broadstone Bar across the street for food and drinks. We had a few small plates and it was all delicious.

title: Lift failure took too long to be fixed.
text: For such a premium hotel it isn't reasonable for such a long delay to fix the lifts. A sign posted on the walls stated that there could be up to a 15-20minute wait - being on the 38th floor it's not easy to plan trips accordingly as suggested by the hotel.

title: Good and not so good
text:
The rooms were clean, the hotel in general was nice and in a great place.   The problem is that the elevators are small and slow so it will take you an extra 10-20 minutes to get either to or from your room.   Even at 10:30 at night.  It once took me over 30 minutes before I decided to walk down 29 flights of stairs.

However, for the price you can not beat it.   Every where else is 2x as much.

title: Worst Hotel Experience of My Life
text:
I struggle to find the words to describe how poor my experience has been. 

To begin, a 44 floor hotel only has two working elevators, one of which is periodically reserved for staff. As a result, when someone pulled the fire alarm at 3AM and the entire building had to go downstairs, there was a long queue for the elevator so I had to walk up 16 flights of stairs. Meanwhile the staff were unable to provide us with any information on what was going on.

Add to that: a horrible smell in the room, a ringing sound in the ceiling due to water pressure issues, holes in the sheets and no coffee refills by housekeeping. 

I cannot stress enough how terrible this hotel is being run for the amount of money they charge. Hilton should be embarrassed that their standards have fallen so low, particularly in such a marquee location.

Avoid, avoid, avoid.

title: Good location, but a reminder that you often get what you pay for
text:
New York City hotels are notoriously expensive, with rooms that are often the size of closets.  The Doubletree Financial District offered really reasonable rates for Labor Day weekend, but I'm afraid I learned why after my first evening there.

Having taken a redeye flight from the West Coast, I arrived at the hotel at about 8 AM on the Friday of Labor Day weekend.  I knew there would be little chance of having a room available to check into so was prepared to check bags with the valet and come back to the hotel in the evening to officially check in.  The front desk very generously offered me a voucher for free breakfast buffet in their downstairs restaurant since no rooms were available.  They did not have to do this -- was a very nice thing to offer.

I returned to the hotel at around 8:30 PM, ready to finally get into my room.  There was a line of guests stretching from the elevators to the front door of the hotel.  The hotel has an odd layout where the front desk and lobby are on the 2nd floor.  But what was causing this huge backup was the fact that one of the three elevators was out of service!  For a 44-story property, three elevators isn't sufficient so when one goes down, the entire hotel basically grinds to a halt.  There was no valet downstairs so I could not pick up my bags.  I walked up the stairs to the lobby to pick up keys.  The front desk told me that the valet would eventually bring up my bags, but to be please be patient due to the situation with the elevators.

About an hour later, the valet arrived with my luggage.  I was actually pleasantly surprised it was only an hour as I was expecting worse.  Luckily, I wasn't going anywhere else that night so I didn't have to deal with the elevator situation again.  I went to sleep assuming that it would be taken care of by tomorrow.  Unfortunately, the third elevator never went back into service so my entire weekend was spent with 15 - 20 minute waits for every elevator trip.  When your room is on the 28th floor, taking the stairs isn't really an option.  Needless to say, it's extremely inconvenient to add an extra 20 minutes into each trip on the elevator.

To the hotel's credit, when I wrote to complain about how the elevator problem really made the weekend more difficult, they offered a sincere apology and Hilton Honors points.  It's a tough situation for everyone, but the hotel really needs some work on it to have it meet Doubletree standards.

title: Passable
text:
1ère impression mitigée avec un hall d'accueil inexistant vu la situation du lobby au 2eme et l'attente aux ascenseurs longue.
Cookie de bienvenue et accueil correct, chambre et salle de bains vieillottes mais literie agréable.
Hôtel calme vu la situation dans le financial district. Certaines chambres ont vu sur l'Hudson 👍.
Un rapport qualité prix correct pour NYC.

title: Find a different Hilton property
text: Elevators do not work and when they do they are SLOW. 10-15 minute wait at the ground entrance for the 1 1/2 elevators servicing 44 FLOORS!!! They are TINY and only fit 6 plus light luggage. You have to call the lobby to get your thermostat to work as there must be a lock out control. DO NOT accept transportation advise from the guys at the front door. They misrepresent costs of taxi/uber services so try and get you into one of their "buddies" vehicles. As a lifetime Hilton Diamond I've see it all and will NOT return to this location.

title: Excellent location, other than that average
text:
The location couldnt be better for our very first introduction to NYC. Centrally located in the Financial District, with a few subway stations just around the corner and within a 5 minute walk to a hop on hop off bus stop. Beautiful places like the 9/11 memorial within a 10 minute walk. Id also recommend a visit to Battery Park on those humid city days. Cute little places to have breakfast or to have dinner nearby as well. We liked the Irish pub next door - a fun place to end the day.

Rooms are tiny though. And the beds are so small! Annoying noice coming from the air regulator in the bathroom, same applies to the airco in the room. The view from the 37th floor made up for all that though. 

Staff at reception didnt seem to make an effort whatsoever, the rest of the staff was great. Always greating the guests with a smile and happy to have a chat.

And the elevators.. yeah.. well, it often was a challenge. Especially during the morning rush and when its cooking outside.

title: Not worth the money
text:
Looks like they are doing some work there. Not all elevators are working and they are limited anyway for a hotel with so many floors, so you should get a room on a low floor and walk up /down the stairs.

In the middle of the night staff opened my door, apparently at the request of another guest who did not know the room number. Not sure what the security protocol is here.

Outlets in room are very limited. Either you make coffee or you charge your electronics.

Apparently they have mildew and mold issues, there was a dirty commercial portable air mover in my room.

title: Mediocre - Not worth the price
text: The hotel is awkward. Registration 2nd floor, entrance ground level. Big waste of time by waiting for only 3 elevators for 40+ floors.  Rooms are very small and also awkward layout.  No where in the bathroom to put your toiletries. I kept my luggage on the floor no place to put on for an easy reach.  Breakfast is not included in the price but I recommend going to the Dunkin Donut around the corner. Food was cheap and poor selection.

title: Ottima posizione, servizio un po meno. . .
text: Posizionato nel downtown di Manhattan, è veramente comodo alla metro e ai trasporti, un po meno nei servizi. . . Un ascensore su tre rotto ha, praticamente, reso lunghissime le attese. Wi-fi non sempre regolare. Insufficienti gli asciugamani in bagno (più volte segnalato e non risolto). Nel complesso, non male.

title: Terrible and overpriced
text: Lifts not working. Waited over 20 minutes to get to my room. Carpets dirty, mild in shower. Phone not working. Really surprised how bad a hotel in this location is. Also three check in staff dealing with one person whilst four people wait in line.

title: DO NOT STAY HERE
text: Under construction, elevators not working, hotel room carpet soaked, construction noises, room falling apart - peeling wallpaper, beat up furniture... the list goes on and on. I strongly recommend looking elsewhere

title: Avoid this hotel until repairs are made
text: They have had a broken elevator for weeks, and don't tell you until you arrive that you need to allow 15-20 mins to wait for one, or take the stairs. Hard to do in a 43 story building. The AC in the lobby and hallways of the floors was not working so the wait til was exacerbated by incredibly hot temperatures which meant we were sweating thru our suits. Get your act together DoubleTree, this hotel is a disaster and my money will go elsewhere until you spend some of yours on bringing it up to acceptable standards.

title: Nice hotel to stay with family.
text:
on Google
In July 2018, we stayed in this hotel with family. It is very good hotel with clean room, nice bathroom,  cordial and cooperative staff. Location of hotel is very good. Subway station is very near and you can find every kind of good food around . I recommend this hotel for visitors with family. Good experience.

title: Donde está mi equipaje
text: Venimos para 1 semana, el segundo día, después de estar de excursión, nos encontramos que  la habitación se la han asignado a otras personas y nuestras cosas han desaparecido. Al reclamar y después de esperar 2 horas consiguen localizar el equipaje y dicen que no saben cómo ha podido ocurrir. Increíble!!! Tres ascensores, de los cuales solo dos funcionan, toda una odisea. La limpieza deja mucho que desear, aunque sí cambian las toallas todos los días. El personal muy correcto.  Buena ubicación, metro muy cerquita.

title: Good rooms, good location but service problems.
text:
This is a decent hotel with good room and the location is really good; this is right on the subway lines and the charging bull is close by. 

Rooms are relatively good for NY and check in was good. This is a relatively safe area and the building is in good condition. However, it all depends on who is at the desk. 

I do not understand how any staff thinks they can talk like a boss with anyone let alone customers. The young interns are good but the managers talk to you like they are doing you a service by giving you any time even though you have paid money and are accounting for their salaries. 

At first, we were polite thinking they are having a bad mood but they only tried to impose themselves more. So, we ended up talking impolitely to make them sit up because they seemed to really dislike being talked back to and I did not understand why they are okay doing that themselves to customers; why be in hospitality industry if you can't be polite? 

We also moved rooms as the AC was not working and they had given us a lower floor before. Apart from the usual excuses of that this is not so and so's job and not doing anything worthy of reasonable service, they made us wait five hours to give us the key  and didn't bother to check if the room was ready even though we did it ourselves and saw the room was ready. "Procedure," we were told but that's really lack of empathy and laziness. 

Again, they lost one of the items while moving and, as expected took two days and multiple managers and multiple reminders to get it done... all while it was with housekeeping. 

The managers and staff at reception really should be cleaning the dishes and doing housekeeping if they think being polite and enterprising is not something they are paid for.

title: Elevator trouble
text: The photo shown here says more than any review I can write. This hotel is simply unacceptable for business travel. The staff was nice however and the room was clean. Well located for meetings in the Wall Street area. Close to subway stops too.

title: DO NOT stay here!!!!
text: Three elevators for 44 floors. Only one of them worked. One was perpetually stuck on one floor and one was gushing water. The employees did not seem to care, as if this was a common occurrence. No amount of cookies in the world would make up for the fact I had to take the stairs 12 floors every time I wanted to do something. I can't imagine being any higher, or having a handicap.

title: Labor Day Weekend
text:
Pros of Doubletree ! 

- AMAZING view !
-Great Room Service ! Bowtie w/ Salmon was PHENONOMAL. 
-Removed breakfast when I inquired :)
-Very close to transportation
-Very close to shopping and eateries
-Complimentary waters and cookie depending what tier you are as a Hilton Member. 
-Comfy bed with soft pillows

Cons of Doubletree

-Only 2 working elevators w/ 44 floors. Unacceptable. I felt even more sorry for the couple who waited 15-20 minutes , and then decided to walk down the stairs. Due to limited elevator service, I didn't go to gym the way I hoped.
-Breakfast ! There was limited options- and the bacon was extremely salty. And mediocre customer service at best. 
-No air in the elevators or hallway
- A small shower
-Outdated room

Overall, it was an okay experience but I wished it was better.

title: Fine stop for a night!
text:
Got in late, welcomed with waters and a cookie. No free breakfast but coffee was great in the room, bed super soft, shower fine. In a very cute neighborhood if you have time to wander. 

For a place in the middle of the city, quiet and convenient.

title: Miserable place
text: Broken elevators with no signsBlack specs in water from sinkMosquitoes in the roomApathetic staffNot worthy of the doubletree name. Be prepared to carry your luggage down 15 flights of stairs or be trapped forever

title: Everything went wrong
text: When things go wrong, everything goes wrong.  Labor Day weekend and the MTA scheduled subway track maintenance making it difficult to get to midtown.  The hotel didn’t plan that so it’s not their fault.  Of the 3 elevators 1 was broken and a 2nd was spotty.  The posted it could take up to 20 minted to get an elevator.  (44floors) Time est was about right.  They also had no WiFi.  Maybe you’ll have better luck...I won’t know- I don’t plan on giving them a 2nd chance.

title: Romantic weakend
text:
2 out of 3 elevators did not not work for entire weekend over Labor Day .. wait was over 20 minutes to go up or down in elevator.. did not tell you until you get there and did not tell you until you checked in .. Totally not acceptable.. .!people carrying bags from 
upper stories down stairs to get out instead of having to wait 20 or more
Minutes . No apologizes .. just acted 
Like it was not a problem  Room is so small , which  Was  no problem if you can 
Rlevati

title: Inconvenient and Dodgy Entrance
text:
I thought the DoubleTree was one of Hilton's better brands.  I was wrong.  There is construction on Stone Street and it limits parking, except for City employees.  There is no place to safely leave the car for the valet.  Parking was several blocks from the entrance and we had to wait 20 minutes to get our cars -- since we had two cars, we were waiting 40 minutes!  $60 per car, ouch!

The hotel entrance is a small hallway and foyer with three elevators.  The foyer shares an entrance with the restaurant next door.  it was very odd.  The elevator takes you to the second floor where you check in.  Too bad breakfast did not come with the room.

Check-in was quick and our room was ready.  The rooms were clean and orderly.  The shower door leaked and left a lot of water on the floor.  The doors are very loud when they closed, waking me from a sound sleep at 6:00 am, and the sound from the deadbolt locks reverberated through out the floor.

The hotel is in a good location and convenient for walking.  Plan on an extra 30 minutes if you plan to valet your car!

title: An ok hotel in a great location
text: We chose the hotel for its great location and were overall happy with our stay. The room was clean and quite comfortable, however, it was facing a dark courtyard and the windows were very dirty, so there was no daylight. We had an issue with the air conditioning,  the systems seem quite old, but the staff is super helpful and managed to re-locate us in the middle of the night. Overall it is an ok hotel in a great location.

title: The manager needs to get a handle on his property
text:
Today was the day from h*ll for us in this hotel. Woke up to no water available in any of the 44 floors. Returned after a busy day out and found only one elevator (out of 3) in working condition. Mind you this hotel has 44 floors. Also, the wifi is currently down. Pity the poor folks who are depending on it to check in for their Airline flights.

Small room, leaking shower stall, loose toilet seat. No mjini fridge in room. But we lucked out in having an ice machine on our floor.

Long wait times to use an elevator. (either up or down) 

A lot of grumpy staff, which does not surprise me.

All this and over 200 bucks a night for a room. Oh, and they also put a $50 charge PER NIGHT on your card in anticipation of your tearing the place up.

No explanations for all of the problems, no apologies for any of the inconvenience.

Comlimentary bottled water available, but you'll have to brave the elevator problems to get down to 2nd floor where the desk is located in order to ask them for the water.

Sorry all you Hilton Honors folks, but this place is a joke.

To top it off, during all of these problems there was a hotel employee snagging people on their way in today to try and sell them on Hilton Honors.

title: Gute Lage, freundliches Personal, katastrophales Frühstück und schlechte Aufzüge
text:
Die Lage im Financial District ist perfekt, 3 Subwaylinien in unmittelbarer Nähe und der Ausblick aus den oberen Etagen auf den Hudson und den Battery Park ist gut. Der Hoteleingang ist etwas unübersichtlich. Internet und Zimmerausstattung sind Doubletree typisch, die Zimmer selbst NY - typisch kleiner. Auch sind sie sauber, aber etwas renovierungsbedürftig, insbesondere die Türen im und zum Zimmer sowie die Bäder. Der Fitnessbereich ist gut ausgestattet und völlig ausreichend.Das Premium Internet (HH-Diamond inklusive) funktionierte weitgehend einwandfrei, ein Ausfall wurde schnell behoben.

Was allerdings absolut nicht zufriedenstellend ist, sind die Aufzüge. In den Morgen und Abendstunden haben wir teilweise bis zu 20 Minuten in der 43 Etage gewartet, in den Abendstunden war die Schlange, die unten wartete so lang, dass wir uns lieber zu Fuß auf den Weg hinauf gemacht haben (Workout für den Tag gespart :-)) . Absolut unverständlich ist es, dass über das Treppenhaus und die Aufzüge jeder Flur für jeden nicht Hotelgast jederzeit ohne weitere Kontrolle - v.a. Abends- erreicht werden kann. Eine Aufzugkontrolle gibt es nicht und die Treppenhäuser sind immer offen, auch wenn Sie eigentlich geschlossen sein sollten im Groundfloor. 

Was absolut nicht einem Doubletree oder Hilton Standard entspricht ist das Frühstück, welches in dem anscheinend selbständigen Restaurant im Groundfloor serviert wird. Wenn ich es als Diamond Member nicht inklusive gehabt hätte , wären wir wahrscheinlich gar nicht hingegangen. So haben wir es dreimal in Anspruch genommen und erlebten jedesmal das gleiche Bild: Die Kellner völlig überfordert, die Speisen lieblos als Buffet aufgebaut, die Brotauswahl und die Muffins aus der Tüte und nicht frisch, die Rühreier teilweise komplett alt, nachgefüllt wird nur auf Nachfrage und ohne System. Alle nicht Buffetspeisen müssen extra sehr teuer bezahlt werden, Getränke außer Wasser,schlechtem Kaffee und Tee ebenfalls. Vor allem beim Kakao/Milch für kleinere Kinder seltsam.
Der Service ist katastrophal organisiert. Am dritten Frühstück wusste sogar ich, wo der Koch den Greek-Naturyoghurt lagert, aber die Servicekräfte fragten ihn jeden Morgen danach, nur er dürfte offensichtlich an den Kühlschrank- und so wartete ich jeweils 10 Minuten und musste noch dreimal nachfragen. Das geschnittene Obst - jeden Tag das gleiche waren Melonen in so grossen Stücken, dass sie zum Essen mit dem Joghurt erstmal kleingeschnitten werden mussten. Die zusätzlich ausgelegten Bananen waren erkennbar schon in der Schale komplett zermatscht. Fazit: Die restlichen Tage unseres Besuches haben wir köstliche in mehreren der zahlreichen Diners und Kaffees im District gefrühstückt. Abendessen in dem Restaurant haben wir erst gar nicht probiert.

title: Ottimo hotel!
text:
