La posizione dell'hotel è eccellente, a 1 minuto a piedi da Wall Street, zona ottima.
L'entrata dell'hotel quasi non si nota e sicuramente l'ingresso non è dei migliori: la reception è al secondo piano.
Personale molto gentile, offrono dei biscotti appena si arriva.
Il costo è un po' alto, ma nella media di NEW York.
Noi avevamo una camera al 29esimo piano e non abbiamo mai aspettato più di due minuti gli ascensori.
La nostra camera purtroppo era vicinissima alla macchina del ghiaccio e sfortunatamente ci sono persone che di notte prendono secchi interi di ghiaccio... se le persone fossero più rispettose si dormirebbe meglio.
Le pareti non sono molto insonorizzate.
Le camere per essere a NY sono abbastanza grandi e la pulizia è buona.
Il trasporto con auto privata per il JFK costa 65$, non male!
Vicino ci sono diverse linee di metro e diversi locali.

title: A disappointing stay at the DoubleTree
text:
We stayed at the DoubleTree FiDi for a family trip to New York, largely because the location was convenient with the ferries and subway close by and the had a Junior Suite that would accommodate our family of four.  

When we arrived at the hotel, I expected that blankets and pillows would be in the room given that we had 2 adults and 2 kids on the reservation.  Using the Hilton app, I requested that these be delivered while we were out at the theater and I received an acknowledgment from Vanetta that this would be done.  I saved a screenshot of her confirmation. We returned after 11 to find that they were not delivered and the message had been deleted!  It took almost an hour (with very tired kids) to get what we needed.  On top of this, the couch was dirty, stained, and worn.

Our AC was also leaking into the carpet giving a moldy smell to the room.  When we spoke to the front desk the next day we were told there were no other rooms available but they would see what they could do. I was promised an email from Peter the GM, but ended up speaking to Enoch who offered to move us to 2 adjoining rooms instead.

One of the new rooms still had the AC leaking into the carpet, but it was less moldy smelling!

I had good experiences with Enoch and the bell staff, but problems were largely dismissed by other staff.  I was told repeatedly that no one else had complained and that all they could do was ask for housekeeping, maintenance, etc. to act but that they could not do anything else to make sure it happened.  As a Hilton Gold member I expect more and so should Hilton.  The fact that the hotel was running at close to 100% occupancy means they don't have to!

Platitudes from the front desk staff that they will try harder next time are worth nothing.

title: Um hotel confortavél
text:
Estive neste hotel no inicio de agosto de 2018.

Hotel - O hotel em si é muito bom. O pessoal que trabalha são bem atenciosos desde a recepção, serviço de quarto, recepcionistas, até os rapazes que guardam as malas, muito prestativos.

Quartos - Quartos amplos e arrumados, banheiros limpos todos os dias, TV. Só não tinha frigobar este foi um ponto negativo.

Localização - Está localizado próximo a Wall Street, próximo a duas linhas de metrô a Amarela e a verde, atende bem a toda Manhatan. Fica bem perto do porto que leva a Estatua da Liberdade. Próximo ao Touro de Wall Street e tem um comércio muito bom no seu entorno, com restaurantes, cafeterias, farmácias e etc. Achei o entorno bem seguro.

Me hospedaria novamente. Um bom hotel e com um custo benefício otimo, para os padrões de Manhatam.

title: Just okay hotel for the price.
text:
The room itself was fine, big bed with nice coffee/tea machine to make a coffee on the go.
The entrance is odd as you have to take an elevator to the reception, and anyone can take that elevator without have to go through the reception.
The elevator waiting hall is uncomfortable especially at night.
We came back a few times late at night and it was dark and quiet and had to wait a time long for the elevator to arrive.
The hotel is in a very quiet area at night with hardly any people on the street.
For me as a very experienced female solo traveler I didn’t mind but I can imagine that when you are alone as a female it could be a bit uneasy.
We also stayed in the Hilton metropolitan and there were a lot more people around.
As a couple or with more people it’s fine.
Hotel is in a good location for Statue of Liberty but it’s a bit out of the way if you want the ‘Times Square action’ in walking distance.
Staff was friendly, and efficient.

title: 4 stelle?
text:
Premetto che in questa vacanza on the road ho soggiornato in hotel molto peggiori ma la questione è relativa al costo e la classificazione dell’ hotel che nell’ insieme è comunque comodo e strategico.
Però 4 stelle anche no.
Niente frigo bar in camera. 
Abbiamo soggiornato 2 notti e il secondo giorno non ci hanno riassortito le scorte ( già carenti alla dotazione iniziale) di shampoo, balsamo e sapone. Ora, ok il sapone ma eravamo in due e un piccolo flacone di shampo lo abbiamo fatto fuori per lavarci del primo giorno ( io ho i capelli lunghi e ho dovuto utilizzare un’aggiunta mia perché non era sufficiente).
Ascensori: un disastro. Probabilmente il fatto che reception ed ingresso siano  su piani differenti, che ci sono più di 30 piani e solo 3 ascensori  sta di fatto che Abbiamo aspettato anche per 10 minuti in più di un’ occasione.inoltre nn si capisce se ce n’e uno dedicato al personale che comunque abbiamo trovato un sacco di volte su quelli per gli ospiti con aspirapolvere, scope e varie pertanto impossibile salire per mancanza di spazio.
Abbiamo soggiornato 2 notti e per un’ intera giornata abbiamo avuto fuori dalla porta carrelli con biancheria parcheggiati sul corridoio o ridosso della stanza, difficoltoso pure uscire coi bagagli. 
Infine: check out entro le 11, chiediamo info e tariffe per il late check out- orario 12 costo 100 dollari. 100 dollari per un’ora? Quando lo stesso giorno simulando una prenotazione last minute nello stesso hotel per la notte il costo era 105? 
Io tutto quello accennato sopra lo avrei accettato senza problemi se l’ hotel fisse stato un 2 stelle.

title: Amazing Stay!!
text: Me and my wife traveled to NY for about three days, the hotel was great. The room was nice, comfy bed, nice bathroom and amazing service. Great location in the Financial District with a lot of places to eat, shop or just enjoy yourself. The only problem with the hotel is the SLOW elevators.. You get used to it, but I thought that it should be mentioned.

title: Exelente Lugar, Limpio y Comodo
text: El hotel es muy recomendable, la atención del personal es excelente siempre dispuestos a resolver todas las inquietudes que tuvimos, hasta te reciben con una cookie de chocolate muy sabrosa.La Habitación muy cómoda y limpia, la cama placentera y el espacio ideal para 2 personas.La ubicación, muy buena en la esquina está el Metro amarillo R y W (Est. Whitehall St) y a media cuadra el Verde (Est. Bowling Green). todo muy cerca, aunque este al sur de la isla.Seguridad, ningún problema, solo hay algunos Homeless como en todo NY que no complican el retorno de noche.

title: trip
text: stayed here 3 years ago and it is still good and convenient to where we wanted to go.   My husband had to go into work for a day, and it was convenient to Water St in the Financial District, Staten Island Ferry, and Ferry to Governors Island

title: Great location for Liberty/Ellis Island visits.
text: Rooms were quiet, clean, great rain showers bathrooms, although a little on smaller side but the air conditioner's were nice and cold. Service was great, the guys at the door were welcoming. We just couldn't beat the location for statue of Liberty/Ellis Island departures, the Bull, not far from 911 and 911 shopping mall. Everything was fantastic

title: Financial district
text: Équipe super sympathique toujours al écoute et très serviable Hôtel proche du ferry Chambre classique pour NYmoquette à changer mais l’emsem De la chambre est propre Petit dej simple mais okNous n’avons pas pu expérimenter le dîner car 22h c est trop tard pour ce quartier

title: Very poor quality of o hotel
text: As the show 4 star hotel in website... But when we checked in we do not feel the hotel as advertised very poor service room was very small  bathroom was very poor cleaning overall just wasted our time and money.  Very unprofessional and route staff...

title: Need to take care of business before the building falls down
text: Staff looked like they just wanted to go home.  Issue with room, moved to diff room, even more issues .  Did not want to move again so just tried to work with what we had.  Was not the cleanest. Issues with aC system leaking water in carpet, used ice holder to keep water from leaking onto carpet. Sheets had hairs, and bed too soft as well as the pillows, felt like a water bed, body just sinks in.  Water knobs in shower wee loose and falling off.One of the maintenance or engineering personnel was fixing a room, door open and laying in carpet and watching TV or videos on cell phone (at least hide yourslef)Need to keep a routine maintenance check to solve those little issues than can potentially grow into bigger problems.

title: TINY room with no hot water
text: TINY room, poorly maintained (no hot water, phone broken, outlet didn't work) very nice staff though!  Justinos pizza was walking distance and amazing! Parking is $40/ night but close by- probably reasonable for Manhattan?

title: Good Stay
text:
Hotel was great. Just what we wanted for a few nights. Close enough to walk to Battery Park and get the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and pick up the Big Bus Tours to check out the rest of Manhatten. Close to Wall Street and the 9/11 Memorial is walkable.
Room was clean and a good enough size for the 4 of us (2 adults and 2 kids aged 5&2) and beds were comfy. WIFI worked perfectly well.
Staff on check in and check out were great.
One tip though is leave a little extra time when using the lifts as you can wait a long time and often arrive full which wasn't ideal with a buggy/stroller.
Would stay again.

title: Good location for lower Manhattan
text:
Small but clean room. Compact bathroom with narrow shower. Double bedswere not made for two adults. No real floor space or chair for a desk. TV was huge for a small room. Lots of storage space and safe in closet.  No microwave or refrigerator.
Corridors are narrow. But on 4th floor there was an ice machine right in the hallway.
Lobby on 2nd floor. Elevators got busy around 9pm. A bit noisy on the street; I was not expecting that in that area.

title: Een prima plek in New York
text: Uitstekende bedden, geen lawaai 's nachts, schone kamer en elke dag schone handdoeken. Een goede situering van het hotel bij metrostation en diverse bezienswaardigheden. Vriendelijke en behulpzame portiers.

title: Perfect location, excellent staff
text: This hotel is the perfect location, close to many attractions and subway stations, restaurants and bars.  Downtown is a bit quieter, so it is very pleasant to come back to and get a good nights sleep.  The staff is superb.  Welcoming, helpful, friendly.  The room was extremely clean and well appointed.

title: Alles wat je nodig hebt in NYC
text:
The hotel is located in the middle of the city. The subway is in the street. 
9/11 memorial is a couple blocks from the hotel! 
For some greet breakfast by Essen you have to walk one blok from the hotel and also for a great diner you havent to walk that far.

title: Everything what you need.
text: Kleine hotelkamer maar effectief.De kamer was klein. Het bed was goed, sliep heerlijk. Snachts wat stads geluid maar dat hoort bij New York. De badkamer was goed schoon.We kwamen 3 uur eerder aan dan normale check in maar konden gelijk onze kamer in. Super, zeker na een lange vlucht is dit heerlijk.

title: Hôtel très bien situé
text:
Hôtel très bien situé dans New York (10min de métro de Times Square, 5min à pieds de top of the rock) ! Cependant il y a que 3 ascenseurs pour 44 étages donc on attend beaucoup.
Quand nous sommes arrivés la chambre était très propre mais après notre première nuit, le lendemain, le ménage était bâclé, gant oublié dans la chambre, serviette manquante etc ... 
j’espère que ce n’était que un oublie !

title: Just okay for a short trip
text:
The outside of this hotel needs a facelift. The ground floor is hot and not pleasing to the eyes. There are like 4 elevators and all of them are slow as hell because there are 40+ floors so it takes forever to go up and down. The hallways are small and so are the rooms but that's expected. I found my room to be cleaned to my liking. The toilet ran and the A.c gave off a burning scent at times.

There weren't always cookies available and I asked twice! I also had a package delivered and UPS informed me it was taken by front desk. No one could find my package for 2 days! I was legit about to raise some hell up in there!! Allan was able to find it for me so I was happy about that. There were many places to eat around: BKing, Dunkin Donuts, Starbucks, Essen for buffet breakfast, and a few taverns etc. This hotel is also in walking distance of Wall Street and the Staten Island Ferry. Many sites to see that aren't too far away. Check out was as easy as check in. The only way I'd think of staying here again is if I was able to get a good HHonors deal as I had this time around. But there is no way I'd pay almost 200 a night to stay here.

title: Not what we expected
text: The location is great, it is a nice hotel, cheaper than a lot of other hotels in the area and one that offers familyrooms. I booked two family rooms (2x double bed) but ended up with 4 rooms (2 connecting ones) what was nice because that means we had more space. But we had to wait for more than an hour before we could get into the rooms (we arrived after 3pm so ar check in time). We were told we had to wait for 10 minutes but it was more than an hour. That is a long time - traveling with 4 children and wanted to go discover the city. Two rooms were on the 9th floor, the other ones on the 19th floor. We didn’t had a curtain in our room. The elevators are a disaster and it takes like forever to be able to catch one. The coffee and tea are nice and the refill it really often. The toileteries are good quality. It is clean and the staff - except for the woman that checked us in - is really nice and kind and helpful.

title: Piacevole soggiorno a New York
text:
L'hotel si presenta nel complesso bene, ma considerando il prezzo ci sono diversi spunti di miglioramento: es. la pulizia (buona ma non impeccabile), gli ascensori (piuttosto lenti), piccole manutenzioni varie (qualche piccola crepa in bagno). Però il letto era comodo, l'aria condizionata ben funzionante, il bagno carino anche se piccolo, TV con mega schermo e il personale molto cortese e disponibile. 
Posizione ottima: vicinissimo al porto per prendere il traghetto verso la Statua ed Ellis Island e al toro di Wall Street (1 isolato), stazione della metro a pochissimi passi.

title: Molto pratico!
text: Hotel nel cuore del financial district quindi una posizione relativamente tranquilla e piena di attrazioni.  A 2 passi avete 3 linee metropolitane, il battery park per visitare la statua della libertà, il famoso toro di wall street ecc.. quindi come posizione è davvero ottima! L'hotel in sé va benissimo: il personale è molto cortese, sorridente e gentile, nota di merito a Tony dell'accoglienza e della gestine bagagli che è stato con noi gentilissimo e sempre disponibile! Le camere sono abbastanza spaziose, si dorme bene e sono dotate di ogni comfort. Purtroppo tolgo una stella per gli ascensori: soltanto 3 per 44 piani diventa davvero noioso attendere e poi una volta a bordo fermarsi quasi ad ogni piano per arrivare giù.  Davvero unica pecca ma quando tornerò a NYC comunque darò un'occhiata nuovamente a questo hotel.

title: Fantastic stay, great location and good rooms
text: I read a lot of different reviews of this hotel and whilst some were good, I would stay only one was accurate. This is I would say a 3+ star hotel(details below) with 4 and 5 star service, especially as regards the customer service and room service. Yes there are only 3 lifts for 44 floors, but the longest we ever had to wait was 5 minutes, except on day my sister waited 20 minutes, due to people leaving- that happens in any hotel!! The rooms were fine and cleaned daily. I will give a special mention to Ramses with his knowledge of New York, Simone, Harry, Tony and Tina who were extremely friendly and made our stay even better than it was. Also the hotel were extremely accommodating, even though the booking agency had got one of our rooms wrong and there was nothing they could do about it- my advice book with the hotel direct!! The hotel's location is superb and there is is subway just 2 minutes away. Chinatown on Canal Street  is 40 minutes walk away off Broadway. Also the free Governor's and Staaten Island ferry is just a few minutes away too. Wall Street is just around the corner where you will find Starbuck- I love the coffee! and lots of place stop eat. Tony, we had a fantastic ride back to the airport and thanks for making us laugh Harry- You are all stars. I cannot recommend this hotel enough and we will definitely be using them again when we visit. By the way the rooms varied in size but were comfortable and normal for rooms in financial districts- trust me I have stayed in a few.. Only missed a fridge, hence the 3 stars instead of 4 star hotel, as used to fridge in the 4 and 5 star hotels I say in, but air conditioning will keep room cool enough for most mediations, unless it has to be kept in fridge like insulin. (Fortunately did not need fridge this time!) Still we loved it and highly recommend it. By the way the bathrooms were not that small, just normal for district.

title: awful
text: I really think this is one of the worst Hilton hotels in their entire chain; I'm diamond member and have stayed in hundreds of their hotels around the world. I walked into my room, and the AC was broken; they switched me to another room, and it seemed freezing. when I turned up the temp from 68 to 69, the heat came on, so it was either freezing, or heat! It's 90 degrees outside. The toilets don't work properly in the bathroom. The walls are paper thin, and I could hear my neighbors tv past midnight. The wait for an elevator is the worst I have ever experienced in any hotel, anywhere. Only thing going for this hotel is it is conveniently located 1 block from major subway station (Bowling Green) that will pretty much get you anywhere in Manhattan or Brooklyn. Someone in Hilton management needs to seriously re-evaluate the service and conditions of this hotel and figure out how to fix it.

title: A real deal in a convenient location
text:
I stayed at the Doubletree in the financial district without doing much research; the price was right and that's what mattered for a one-night stay.  But I was pleasantly surprised!  The hotel is 1/2 block from the W and R subway lines that take you midtown/uptown in about 15 minutes.  My room was on the 6th floor overlooking a construction site so noisy during the day but quiet at night.  You can (of course) request a room on a higher floor with a city or river view for a little more $$$.  The room was a good size; bathroom was a little tight but totally OK with a good shower, sink and toilet and pretty nice towels.  Very comfy bed; nice linens and a coffee/tea maker.  Air conditioning worked well in the sweltering heat (just a bit noisy) and wifi coverage was good throughout.  
As others have noted, the elevator can take some time to get to you but other than that, a great place to stay in the city at a reasonable rate.

title: Amazing experience in the big apple
text: I stayed at the Double Tree Financial District during my recent trip to Manhattan and I wan not disappointed!!  From the moment I walked in the staff made me feel like family.  Every single staff member was friendly and helpful from the front desk, to the porters. I appreciated the warm cookies and water I received upon check in. The Jr. Suite I stayed in was super clean, had a huge comfortable bed and two huge TV's.  I will say that the bathroom was a little small, but it was newly remodeled and beautiful. I highly recommend this hotel! It is close to the subway and the ferries and it's in a part of town that is surrounded by great restaurants and bars, but isn't crazy crowded. I will definitely be back!

title: All perfect except the elevator.
text: Everything was perfect except the elevator. There are 44 floors but only three elevator. There's only one button for the elevators(which means only one elevator stops per a cycle), so if there are many people using it, especially in the morning or evening, and if you're staying in middle floors, it's almost impossible to use the elevator. You need to expect that you'll wait for 5 to 10 mins for the elevator in rush hours.

title: An All-Around Poor Experience
text: You must first take an elevator to the 2nd floor to get to the front desk. At evening/night, there were plenty of mosquitoes at the entrance of the elevators. My room wasn’t properly cleaned at check in! I found an empty box of condoms, an empty water bottle, and a hair brush underneath the bed at check in! Strands of hair were in my shower! Check in just wasn’t pleasant for me. I also ordered room service which took nearly an hour to be delivered. It’s summer time and I often like to enjoy fresh air, I cracked the window (on the 9th floor) and mosquitoes took over my room. However, I closed the window over night and woke up with plenty of bites on my body. I don’t ever complain about hotels, ever, but today I had to take the time to say that this is the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at in NYC. The rooms are also very compact!! - on a positive note, the doorman, if you will, were very polite and welcoming, the rooms have an exceptional design and bedding.

title: Good location
text:
The location was good. Ferry to Statue of Liberty is at walking distance. Beds are comfortable. A couple of metro stations nearby which made it easy to commute. 
A complementary service/gift would have been nice for occasions like anniversaries or birthdays, but unfortunately they don’t take such requests.

title: Anniversary Celebration
text:
Had a wonderful vacation 
Saw all the favorite New York attractions 
Enjoyed the meals, tours and broadway play.  9-11 memorial was awesome 
Empire State Building was beautiful at night 
Hope to return again

title: hidden gem
text: I've stayed here before, great hotel, close to Statue of Liberty, Wall Street, 9/11, Brooklyn bridge. lots of places to eat, old Stone Street has a ton of bars and restaurants. 2 minute walk to the Bull. train station on the corner, easy access to Brooklyn. Rooms are small, beds are very comfortable.

title: Carino
text:
Abbastanza pulito ma non troppo ha problemi agli ascensori molto lenti
Non proprio economico per quello che offre con stanza piccola e bagno molto ristretto. Reception al piano 2 obbliga tutti a prendere gli ascensori

title: First stay in New York
text: This hotel is located near a lot of places to eat from casual eating to sit down.  The subway is very close.  Walking distance to Wall Street and Ground Zero.   Hotel staff is helpful  Kudos to Elizabeth, William, and Robert.   Rooms are very small but comfortable.  Elevators are slow, so be patient.

title: Terrible elevator takes away from experience
text: I know this sounds trivial. However this hotel easily takes top marks for the worst elevator. Two are always running, a third when not being used to take out the trash..... literally. All are equally slow servicing all 44 floors. They are not vented well and gather all the humidity from each of the poorly temp controlled floors as it runs - so hot. Great place for hot yoga if it weren’t crammed with people desperate to get on it. Beyond that the room is good, bed comfortable. Was told at check in that I had vouchers(diamond) for a full breakfast. Contrary to what I was told, day two was rudely chased out of the door by the waiter asking for money, hen telling us it’s only good for the buffet. The buffet is a joke. Had he been present in the past ten minutes he wouldn’t have had to chase us. Additionally wanted to charge us for the English muffin that I gave from my meal to my counterpart. Wow. Could have been handled so much better! Needless to say that was the last meal we had there and for the rest of our week were happy to pay for all meals elsewhere.

title: Strategic
text:
Stayed here for only 2 days. Convenient coz it’s close to Duane Reade and couple of cheap food trucks nearby.
And it’s close to shopping mall as well, only 10 minutes walking to Westfield Trade Centre.

title: Terrible hotel
text: In the first place we got a room with a huge leakage on the ceiling (which apparently was also affecting all the other floors above and below our room). Even though the leakage was evidenced, and the room was not in an acceptable condition, the hotel rent us the room and as I could hear to other customers as well. To apologise they offer to wash the clothes that had been damaged because of the leakage but they lost my boyfriends’ shirt, that he needed to work on the next day. We spent a big part of our trip trying to solve these issues with the staff and I feel profoundly disappointed. I would never recommend this hotel.

title: One night only, many mistakes
text: I had in mind to have a comfortable night in NYC, south Manhattan, and went after known names in the market. The hotel offered good price, great location. It all looked good. But since I got there, it seemed that they found an already built building and decided to fit a hotel in it. The rooms and corridors are narrow and never saw a reception in the second floor of a hotel. There is no place for you to park during check-in (ok, that’s NYC, folk) but you literally enter the hotel from its back. I left my wife and kids in the car, got an elevator to reach reception, and went to ask information, but I was checked-in in couple of seconds, got my rooms keys, and quickly took my stuff to my room. That looks good, except for the fact that the receptionist didn’t ask any questions about who’s entering the room with me, and that seems a very serious issue concerning the security of the hotel. It looked like you can bring in whoever you want. Next morning, went to a small restaurant where we’re supposed to have breakfast and I was asked for vouchers. “Which voucher?!” “The receptionist should have given you”. Leave your family and your good humor, go up one floor, ask for breakfast vouchers. By the way, the poorest breakfast in America. Hilton is no longer synonym of luxury hotels anymore. Oh, but there’s parking at the hotel, one block down the street. Don’t forget to ask the receptionist for stamping your parking ticket, otherwise you may have to return to hotel to get it done, and if it’s raining ... the bedrooms are clean, but politeness is not a crew’s strength. That’s just in one night, for me that’s enough.

title: Hotel and Location
text: This hotel is in the heart of the Financial District. Very convenient to all the local restaurants. Very costly when it comes to food but its NY. Wonderful Hotel and the Staff was amazing...this is a nice property. Nice rooms.

title: Poor experience all around
text:
My wife and I stayed for two nights, and used a hilton rewards certificate for one night.  When we got there, we had to explain to the check-in staff multiple times that we were there for two nights, not one.  I've done the same before at other hilton properties, but this was the first time it was an issue.  Additionally, while we were waiting in line to check in, someone else came up and was trying to get our info, related to "Hilton Grand Vacations".  I don't pay to visit a hotel and get sold a timeshare while waiting in line.  Our second day, we got back to our room and our keys didn't work.  The woman at the desk said because we had two bookings, we had to go down and have the keys reactivated.  She acted like this was our fault - and that we should have known all this.  No other time I've used a reward certificate in combo with a booking has this been a problem.

The room was fine, other then the shower leaked water all over the floor.  The hotel is 44 stories, and has 3 elevators.  We had long waits for elevators, and lots of stops up and down.  I would suggest a floor low enough you can take the stairs if you don't want to spend 10 minutes trying to get to your room and back.  

The breakfast included as a gold member is the worst I've ever had at a hilton hotel.  It's in a tiny room with only 5 tables.  The hot food was OK.  The first day there were no drinks - no coffee, juice, water, milk.  The second day the waiter brought us some water, after we asked (saw other guests do the same).  

There is a hampton inn nearby, I will stay there if I ever need to be in the Financial district again.

title: great wee hotel
text: We stayed here when visiting our daughter who lives in Wall Street and prior to a cruise.  It is a great wee hotel and the room was quite big compared to usual NYC rooms.  We have a great shower which was great.  The location is quieter than the busy Times Square area but suited us and easy access to the subway across the road.  Stone street where the hotel is is quite but the other part of stone street is where the rest of the bars/restaurants are.  The Irish bar next door was good.  However although the food was great in the restaurant attached to the hotel, being served wine in a plastic glass was not on.  Will be back next time we are in NYC

title: Just ok
text:
I changed to this hotel, thinking paying the extra amount for a Hilton hotel in New York would be worth it, but unfortunately not..

Rooms are small enough. Staff are friendly.

Some of the reviews relating to slow lifts are a really a point of perspective. We came to a lift and it appeared after 2mins although the person waiting said it had been 10.mins and then complained that it would stop at every floor on the way down🤔 but isn't that the point of a lift that it stops at floors to let people on and off.

It can be a bit slow but it is a 44 story building.

Beds are comfortable but both myself and wife did get bed bug bites. The hotel really needs to address this as it seems to be a recurrent theme of comments.

title: Small, dingy hotel
text: The location and friendliness of staff were the only positives about this location. The room was very small (not sure if this is the way NYC hotels are) and dingy smelling. The AC was very hard to stabilize temp in room. It was either freezing or hot and it also broke on the 2nd day. The shower was so small that at 5'4 I barely fit and it would flood the bathroom floor everyday.

title: hotel buone
text:
sico hotel, pulito, ottima posizione. prezzo alto ma il linea con new york . letto molto comodo e tanti cuscini. pulizia eccellente, wifi terribile. centro fitness piccolo ma tenuto bene.
consigliato solo se trovate un buon prezzo, altrimenti e’ caro

title: Fun in Big City
text: Doubletree was a great stay! Plus Hilton Honors gets you free water and cookies which is nice!  Clean, modern room. Wish it had an in room refrigerator but other than that good overall for price and stay.

title: Great location
text: I really like this hotel which is great location. You can get in the subway for R,W,4,5,6 line! within a few minutes Starbacks is aound the corner! You can walk to charing Bull!, Wall Street, Ferry to Statue of Liberty. Not too far from One World Trade Center.

title: Perfect location for seeing the Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial & Museum, Wall Street
text: The best thing about this hotel is the location.  You can walk to Battery Park where you get on your cruise to the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. You can walk to Wall Street and the 9/11 Memorial & Museum.  It is on a quiet street with a nice bar/restaurant across the street, a drug store around the corner and a Starbucks around the corner as well. There are other places to eat nearby as well.  The price of this hotel is fantastic if you are shopping Manhattan prices.  The downsides:  the room was very small and the elevator situation is unacceptable. It is extremely, extremely slow. We stayed on the 11th floor and ended up dragging our suitcases up and down the stairs (not fun.) The ceiling leaked water from the unit above us and got my clothes wet in my suitcase. If you're on a budget and seeing things in the financial district, go for it, but be aware of the downsides.

title: Great location, friendly staff!
text: We stayed 2 nights for a family trip. We could walk to Statue of Liberty cruises, Freedom Tower, great restaurants on Stone Street and South Seaport. Rooms were small and elevators were slow but the friendly staff more than made up for it. Special thanks to Allen & Tony at the Bellhop. Always smiling, friendly, helpful. Remembered our names and always fist bumped our kids. Sad there were no chocolate chip cookies :(

title: A great deal for Manhattan
text: The financial district might not be the first choice when your primary activities are going to be mid-town, but this hotel is a bargain for Manhattan.  If you don't mind walking a bit to catch the subway it's easy to get to other areas.  There are good restaurant options in the neighborhood.

title: Stuck In The Elevator !!!
text:
Horrible experience, 
 Ill start with the ok, I was offered an upgrade for being a Diamond member to the 44th floor, room 4407 to be exact, While quite small it was a nice cozy room.
 But the nightmare of being all the way on the 44th floor has its problems. I stayed for 10 days, and not once was I able to get either down or up on the elevator in under 20 minutes, This was the average wait time just to board it, The entire staff uses the same elevators including all the housekeepers and workers. Not once do they offer to wait, They just push them selves into it.
 But here's the real problem, On 7/14/2018 in the morning while in the elevator heading down with 8 yes 8 other people it stops around the seventh floor. It was stuck for over 30 minutes, with zero ventilation or air able to get into then elevator. The alarm in the elevator and the fire department also located in the elevator didn't work. Luckily we had phone service, One of the phone's called the  front desk, Who was of zero help, She told us that this is the first time that this happened (Which is actually a lie, As the Bellhop the following day said it gets stuck all the time) She mentioned that it would be less than 5 minutes before it was running again, So after 25 more minutes we told her to call the fire department, As even oxygen was getting scarce, and panic had set in we asked the front desk to call the fire department in which she actually refused to do. So we called on an additional cell phone on our own, Just as the Firetruck was getting dispatched the elevator moved, We all got off the very next floor and walked down the stairs.
 I had such a horrible experience that I checked out a day earlier than I was supposed too and stayed in a different hotel.
 Zero compensation or even an apology were never extended my way.
I dont want to even get started on how terrible the Breakfast Buffet was.
I will never stay in this hotel again.

title: Excelente Locación
text: La locación es muy buena , a solo unos pasos está el tren a que te lleva Central Park ,5ta avenida , Empire State y demás atracciones en 15 minutos . el Area es muy segura  camine al ferry que lleva Staten Island y la estatua de la Libertad , ground zero etc . El hotel es muy acogedor , front desk es muy atento siempre están pendientes de que tengas una buena estadía , mi cuarto fue el 3406 king size bed . Definitivamente estoy pensando volver a NY y volver a este hotel .Si piensas viajar a NY solo o con familia recomiendo este hotel por la locación y la seguridad del área. Al checar te darán una deliciosa galleta 🙂

title: Location/
text:
The hotel is located in the financial district which I think is a good location and easy to get to all major attractions in new york. The subway is quite close and within walking distance. 
Lets start with the good things: 
Lobby – very  nicely done it looks very professional and clean. It’s a good welcome to the hotel itself. The staff were very friendly and professional. 
Okay here goes the bad things. Bearing in mind that I have spent time in many Hilton hotels over the years and have been a diamond member. These have been at varying levels of cost and quality. 
Room – Standard size, same amenities that you would get any Hilton. Coffee machine which is fine, the linen was old and did have a whole in there. The iron needs replacing and ironing board also. The air conditioning is loud and I believe was damp on the carpet underneath. There is one sofa seat as well. There was no bath but shower which had decent pressure. The sink was too big and there was no place to put my shower gels, etc. 
Food – When I checked into the hotel bearing in mind it was my first time in new York I was actually quite excited about the breakfast and food in the hotel. I checked the menu in my room and was really disappointed to see it was standard menu that you would find in the uk. To add the menu was in such a tatty state, it was falling apart. In the morning I went to check on the breakfast. The food is served in a partner restaurant at the bottom of the hotel, I have not been more disappointed in hotel food in my life. There was a very limited selection of food, for the hot food, there was scrambled eggs, cardboard bacon, bad sausages and pancakes. There was no fresh rolls or croissants, the fruit seemed to be canned.  I should have known that there was something wrong after there was no one in the restaurant for breakfast in the morning. 
Lifts- There are only 3 lifts in the building and they are constantly in use by the guests and the staff. The staff (not the receptionists or public facing staff) use the lifts themselves even if there is only one level for them to go. They could easily walk this but I don’t know why they don’t. They are constantly busy and at peak times you can wait for 20 minutes for the lifts. 
Overall a good location but that’s about it, unfortunately I have been told that hotels in New York are expensive but I expected more from a hotel that costs over 200 dollars per a  night. I would not stay here again and cannot recommend it to anyone.

title: Excellent hotel
text: Great location with easy access to the subway.  Our room was a decent size and very comfortable.  The parking garage was close by and reasonably priced.  We went to visit the NYU campus and catch a Broadway show and the staff was very helpful with giving us directions to various locations.

title: It was okay.  Clean, fine. Initially wrong room, Tub leaked,
text: Meh.  I guess this is what you get for just under $200 a night in the Financial District. I guess I am used o Q-tips, nicer soaps, a fridge. The rooms was pretty clean, not spotless....  and smelled fine too. Bed was very comfy. But whatever.  I specifically requested a room with a tub... and they gave me a shower room... I switched it out with little resistance from front desk.  Then, when I took a bath, (my solution to a cross country flight) I was interrupted by knocking at the door and a man's voice.  I ignored, they continued, I got out and told them to go away, I hadn't ordered anything.  I was a little frightened. I returned to the bath, anther knock, and a few more. Again I told them to leave.  They said it was security. Now, I would think someone would call first, before sending two different men to a room with a single female occupant. No way am I answering that door, especially still dripping from a bath. I called the front desk and they said the room below me had a leaking ceiling and they had to check the room. They said they had called first... but I heard nothing. The phones are weird so who knows.  They offered to send a woman from front desk up with the man but said they did need to check the tub. I decided instead to vacate the room. They called me shortly to say it was ok and fine to return.  After I complained and asked to cancel my next night, which they refused a refund for... they instead offered to switch me to another room, with a view, and complimentary breakfast. Overall, it is fine. These things happen.  But I would not stay here again.

title: Forgot my charger and Shirt and the team were not helpful at all
text:
I usually always try to book and stay at the Hilton properties but next time I'm going to avoid this Doubletree Hilton. 
I was on a business trip and was switching hotels.I checked out early in the day and remember that I've forgotten my watch charger and a shirt after I've arrived at work I gave them a call and told them that I've forgot them in the room ( maybe an hour or two after my checkout) I was told they would contact me back and they didn't I've had to go back to the hotel after work and I asked them if they were able to locate it. They told me I had to wait which I did 30 minutes and then they I told them this is taking too long and to give me a call if they do locate them and of course 3 minutes after i left they said they couldn't find anything. 

The Shirt was in the hanger and the charger was next to the TV I'm truly sad that this was my DoubleTree Hilton experience.

title: Definitely recommend to anyone
text:
Loved the staff great location.
Bit tiny room but the large tv to most of the attention of the size of rhe room.
Clean and roomservice kept it so.
Didn't notice any noise from the street even though we were on the 4th floor.

title: Bien situado, buena habitación
text:
El hotel está bien situado, en la zona financiera, muy cerca de los ferrys a State Island y Estatua de la Libertad. 
La habitaciones están bien.
La recepción algo incomoda por estar en la segunda planta.
Los ascensores no son suficientes para el número de plantas/habitaciones.

title: Ótima opção, no contra-fluxo do metrô...
text:
O hotel fica muito bem localizado, próximo a três diferentes linhas de metrô de NY, o que facilita e agiliza a movimentação pela cidade. A região não é turística - é frequentada por executivos durante o dia e é bastante deserta durante a noite. A grande vantagem é que pela manhã o metrô para sair dessa região é bem vazio, ao contrário dos que chegam - o mesmo ocorrendo à noite.
O quarto standard não é muito grande, mas é confortável. A limpeza dos quartos é bastante cuidadosa. O staff é gentil e atendeu com simpatia e prontidão todas as nossas solicitações.
Só não recomendo o restaurante italiano anexo ao hotel - a comida não agrada, o serviço é pouco profissional e o preço não compensa.

title: Frustrating & Inconvenient Property
text:
This hotel is just insanely frustrating.  I stay at Doubletree and Hilton properties regularly - and this is the worst one I've stayed at.  
Pros: 
1) Room was relatively clean 
2) Bed was comfortable.
3) Breakfast at the restaurant next door is good (and included in some reservations).

Cons: 
1) Elevators are SO SLOW...  and the lobby isn't on ground floor... so every time you need something, you wait for the elevator and then get off on level 2.  then wait AGAIN for ANOTHER elevator to go to your room.  I timed it last night.  It took 7 minutes to get from the ground floor to my room because I needed to stop at the front desk to pick something up.  Absurd
2) Rooms are TINY... you can barely walk around in them and 2 people cannot pass each other in the room.  Even by NY standards - it is SO SMALL
3) Noise - we had to move rooms because the screeching from the broken plumbing in other rooms was so awful we were up all night.  They told me they didn't know what we were talking about - but then 2 other guests in the elevator said they had also been complaining.  The old plumbing needs repair.
4) Poor staff service.  Other than the manager (who I corresponded with on text... not in person); the staff were not helpful or accommodating.  And to be honest, the manager could have done more to help with the absurd noise our area of rooms was dealing with.  One of them actually SCOLDED me for losing my breakfast ticket/voucher.  What am I, 5 years old?  

Just stay elsewhere - this hotel is the pits.  I suspect it will not be a Hilton property for long - it just doesn't meet their standards.

title: Outdated hotel in a good location
text:
I stayed here with my son when we came to New York City to celebrate the end of his GCSEs.  We chose the hotel mainly because I know the Doubletree brand and also the location in Lower Manhattan is good. 

The location is definitely the high point - right by Battery Park, the hotel is ideally situated to explore Liberty, Ellis and Staten islands and the financial district. We spent an entire day doing this. There is also a subway station at the end of the street for exploring the rest of the city. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and courteous throughout our stay. We had a view of the Freedom Tower from our window which my son loved. 

But the hotel itself is a little disappointing. The decor in the rooms is very tired and in need of a refresh. The air-conditioning unit is effective but incredibly loud which makes it difficult to sleep at night. So you have a choice of the 35 degree NYC humidity or being kept awake by the rattly AC. 

The lobby is on the first floor (American second floor) so the welcome on the ground floor is underwhelming. There are only two lifts so the wait is sometimes really long - 10 minutes plus, which when you're on the 32nd floor is tough. 

The restaurant is not actually part of the hotel but a separate restaurant next door with an interconnecting door. Don't waste your time having breakfast here - there are tons of much better places to have breakfast a short walk away. Pearl Diner, on Pearl Street, would be my top recommendation as it's an original American diner where nothing has changed since the 1950s. 

Overall the hotel wasn't worth what I paid for it. There are better options in New York City.

title: Great Value
text: Stayed here with my family one weekend.  Price was reasonable for NYC.  Location was convenient and right in Battery Park.  Room was small and the king size bed took up 1/2 the room.  Great Irish tavern downstairs.

title: quiet, clean, pleasant stay
text:
i was here on a friday and saturday so the area was super quiet. it's close to a chipotle and very close to the subway.

the hallways are kind of cramped and the elevators can take a while since they get crowded

room was spacious for a NY hotel and clean. they had a good rate on booking.com when i booked for three nights (you get the third night free).  got some natural light from my window although it was small.  staff was great, especially the concierge. easy to walk to the 9/11 memorial. area was safe.

title: Work made me stay there
text: Stayed there for 3 night for work. If it wasn't for work I probably wouldn't stay. got a room on the 16th floor but the view was blocked by another building. Had to wait a very long time for lifts, especially during peak times. Toilet looked worn out and the shower curtain was smelly! The breakfast buffet was so poor I decided to go out for breakfast. I will not be in a rush to go back.

title: Businesshotel am unteren Ende von New York
text: Klassisches Businesshotel mit großzügigen Betten. Kostenfreien Kaffee, Tee auf dem Zimmer. Hotelzimmer sind okay und sauber. Rezeption freundlich, aber unverbindlich. Liegt genau hinter der Börse. Leider aussicht nur auf andere Hochhäuser

title: Helpful staff and great views
text: Wonderful hotel in a very crowded neighborhood. Staff was extremely helpful and the view from our room was gorgeous! Kids loved the warm cookies on arrival. I would definitely recommend this place for anyone.

title: New York Broadway 47th and 7th
text: I want a hotel to be cleaner and have decor that is at least on a par with my home. This venue was some way off the mark and would not recommend this anyone. Room appeared tired and needed a good refurbishment decided that the hotel relies on its location and just turns over the room.  Novotel where we stayed two years ago and only a block away was much better, cleaner and with modern decor.

title: Short Trip
text:
I stayed at the Doubletree for 4 nights at the end of June. On arrival which was late around 2am they were 2 staff at the front desk checking in no line just myself and one other couple came up to the 2nd floor where the lobby is located. I had the less competent of the two as she could not seem to get me situated. The couple was dealt with by the other lady within 5 mins and about 3 more people came and left after that and I was still waiting. Eventually I was told the room I booked(King Room city view) was not available so I was placed in a room with 2 double beds for the night and given complementary water(2 small bottles) and breakfast. 
The next morning I had breakfast. It was nothing spectacular and not a very wide selection. The basics fruit,toast, bagels, pancakes, pastries bacon and tater tots and a few other things. 
Got to check out of my room the next day and into the room I booked around midday. The room had a slightly smoky scent when I entered. Also the heaters in the bathroom took a lot longer to kick in. Like 10 mins for the shower to heat up. The other problem I had was with the temp control. I tried to turn the ac down a bit since the room was getting too chilly and then it just went kaput and started blowing hot air. After like 5 mins of trying to figure out on my own or waiting to see if it would readjust on its own I got frustrated and called to have maintenance come check it out. They came about 15 mins later by that time it was just overbearing. And that was on the same day I was getting ready to check out and trying to get all my stuff together didn't improve my mood. 
Checking out was a lot smoother however I checked my online banking to see I had been charged more pending than was on my booking so I made an inquiry and sure enough they had the wrong rate by an extra 20 a night which is an extra 40 a night in my currency which is A LOT. I'm not sure it would have been changed if I didnt draw it to their attention. 
The best staff were the guys at the entrance. A special mention to Allen who was super helpful with my luggage. 
Overall for the prices in NYC I need the service to match and I was let down by the service at Doubletree. The location is great with plenty restaurants closeby,  the rooms are comfy and well designed but some fine tuning needs to be done with the staff and  maintenance of the  facilities.

title: Our Forth Of July Stay
text: I will start off by saying that if you read reviews on this hotel you will see a couple things that repeat review after review. One... the elevator situation. Really bad. Especially if you are on a higher floor. There were times I had to wait up to 20 minutes for the elevator to arrive. At one time.. out of the three elevators only one was working. There was a line for the elevator out the ground floor all the way up the block. Not sure why the hotel has not addressed this issue. Like I said its been the talk of multiple reviews. Another thing is the rude front desk. Another common issue. If you don't like your job you should probably should find a different job. Just standing there to check in  multiple people were angry with the front desk service. Ok. Now on to  the room.Our first room was on the 37th floor. We had to change rooms due to the air conditioner leaking water all over the floor. Sopping wet all around the bed. The carpet was had mold. So this had been going on for awhile. The air conditioner grill was broken and  only half of the unit was blowing air. The air blowing out the vent... too smelled like mold. So after going down and talking to the front desk girl, she was rude and said they didn't have any rooms available. My wife started to get irritated. She finally got us a new room but it wasn't ready yet. So we left and came back later to another front desk clerk. This one was very nice. She told us that she was putting us on the top floor. I guess these were newer remodeled rooms. This is were we stayed the rest of our stay. Not to say that there weren't issues but we dealt with them. Hair left in the shower after the maid cleaned. Also she did not restock anything. Shampoo. Ect...The phone didnt work. The TV was acting funny. also the long wait on the elevator... Like I said we just dealt with it. I wish Management would deal with these issues. The hotel is in a great area. It just needs some attention ASAP. On a brighter side. The door men were the best. They helped us with everything we needed. With a smile. If it wasnt for them I would have rated the hotel less than average. We will not stay in this hotel again.

title: Practial and friendly
text: Location was excellent, close to a variety of transport options and plenty of food outlets. Staff were efficient and friendly. The room was of adequate size and well serviced. The cookies provided on arrival were appreciated!

title: Great Location in Financial District
text: This hotel is located near the tip of Manhattan.  You get a breeze due to close proximity to the river and it is a nice breeze.  It is close to the subway and it is close to the South Street Seaport.  It is in a great area for walking.  I highly recommend it.

title: Great Stay for the Fourth of July
text: Me and my son had a great vacation to the city for the Fourth of July.  Hotel was comfortable, clean, and friendly staff.  Hotel was conveniently located to the subway, great food and entertainment.  Hotel staff was welcoming and very helpful with directions and recommendations for sights, food, and entertainment.

title: WORSE HOTEL I TOWN!
text:
DO NOT STAY HERE!!!! 
This has to be the WORSE hotel I have ever stayed, there is a food tray seating outside for for night! (see pictues), my room has not been visit or clean. There is so much NOISE and door SLAMMING that it's impossible to sleep. The elevator bell it's so LOUD and it goes on every time the door opens.

DO NOT STAY HERE!!

title: Hotel mit sehr engen Gängen, aber gemütlichen Betten. Gute Lage Downtown.
text: Das Hotel befindet sich in einer unscheinbaren Seitenstraße mitten in Downtown. Ca. 5 min zu Fuß zur Wallstreet und 10 min zum World Trade Center. Der Eingangsbereich des Hotels ist ein wenig gewöhnungsbedürftig, man muss in den zweiten Stock per Aufzug um an die Rezeption zu gelangen. Aufzüge wie auch Gänge der einzelnen Etagen sind sehr eng. Dafür sind die Zimmer geräumig und die Betten bequem. Das Frühstück ist nicht wirklich vielfältig. Jeden Morgen Rühreier, Speck und Pancakes. Sowie ein bißchen Obst. Das wars.

title: Keep Coming Back for More
text:
This is the third time my husband and I have stayed at this Double Tree, and we could not be more satisfied.  From the minute we walked in to the hotel to the minute we left, we were always greeted or asked about how our stay was going by every hotel staff member.  It's these simple gestures that make our experience at your hotel so worthwhile.

Upon receiving our accommodations, we were placed in a city view room on the 43rd floor.  The room and the views were amazing and so considerate of the staff to place us in such a great room!  

Everyone at the Double Tree genuinely wants their guests to feel welcomed and have a comfortable stay. You have no idea how we appreciate this and the time taken to do this.  There is no doubt we will be back again and again.  By far, of all the Hiltons we have stayed at in New York City, this has been our favorite!

title: Be prepared to wait from a Hilton Lifetime Diamond Member
text: This was our first visit to this property.  The hotel is in a long, tall, narrow style building in the Wall Street financial district.  The small three elevators from the entry point in the street level entrance gets busy and over whelmed at various times to service the 40+ floors.  The front desk for check in is located on the second floor.  Also, the hotel restaurant, which is a local restaurant as well, is located and accessed via the street level entrance.  The breakfast menu, selections and service was not up to par for what I expect from a Hilton property.  Also, the rooms, furniture and amenities need an upgrade at this property, besides addressing the elevators and restaurant issues.  If it was not the interaction with the friendly hotel staff and managers, this property could easily slip into a "two" rating with the negatives that need work, but it also has the potential to be a "four" rated property as well, if the owners / management start to work on the deficiencies we encountered.

title: Pire experience de ma vie
text:
Hôtel réservé et payé via Booking plusieurs mois plus tôt. En arrivant sur place à 23h on nous annonce que nous n'avons pas de chambre et que l'hôtel est complet. Pas une excuse pas un instant d'empathie. Débrouillez vous avec Booking !!!aucune aide. Scandaleux. Inadmissible. Plus jamais Hilton 
Plusieurs personnes dans notre cas le même soir. Hôtel le pire de ma vie. Aucun service. À fuir

title: Security/Homeless Guest
text: We had issues with a homeless guest in the main lobby and the elevator. The elevator had a very strong odor of human urine and feces.  The main entrance is NOT monitored at night and anyone can access the ground elevator from the street.  The rooms were clean. The elevator was not.  The Italian restaurant next door was amazing!! I paid over $1000.00 for 3 nights and will not be back.

title: VERY Average
text:
Got this as a great deal through Hotwire, which was good, so can't complain there.

Hotel is on the end of the island of Manhattan, so if you want to explore the Statue of Liberty or those attractions like wall street, this is the place for you. You're at least 30 mins from midtown so take that into account.

Check in was nice, the entrance is odd and there is a TV playing odd things in the elevator welcome lobby. 

Lobby is on floor 2 and the agents were nice and efficient. Even though I couldn't get points she did take my number to get credit for the stay and got two free bottles of watter, so that was great.

Elevators are not enough for the number of floors of the hotel and while there are only 9 or so rooms on each, elevators take FOREVER during peak times. 

Our room 2403 was fine. Bed was nice and the shower was too, but that's about all I can say about it. 

The room looked like it had someone who was on a bender in it before us, the lamp shade was broken, the grate on the HVAC too, and the desk chair was peeling. 

I guess it was clean? It seemed fine.

Also the bathroom sink is ridicuilous- its a raised bowl and if you turn the water up at all it gets everywhere, and don't even think about shaving in it. Also we had no cold water in the sink, which was odd.

I'd stay again if there was a good deal but there's so many great hotels in NYC, check out another one.

title: Better than I expected
text:
The hotel was in a great location. Lots of restaurants nearby. You are super close to the Statue of Liberty ferry and Battery Park. Not far from the Brooklyn Bridge and freedom tower. The subway was right across the street that took us to Time Square and Central Park. 
The room is big but getting to be a little out dated. It's fine for New York though. 
The real winner for me was the staff. Allan the concierge was awesome and I can't say enough good things about how friendly and helpful everyone was. Will stay there again for sure.

title: Knock before you enter
text: I checked in Sunday morning about 7:50 am. When I went to the room and used the key, the door opened up to a startled man who was asleep in the room! This is very problematic for security reasons. This isn’t the first time this has happened to me at Hilton properties and there wasn’t a satisfactory answer as to why the check in system can’t tell when rooms are filled. Very disappointing.

title: Horrible, small room with a sticky floor
text: I have stayed in many hotels in New York, this was the worst by a long way. The hotel is tiny, dated, the room had a sticky carpet (the type you would expect in a London Pub)...  There was really nothing good to say about the hotel.

title: Bed bugs found! Do not stay here!
text: I would not recommend this hotel to anybody that appreciates cleanliness and sanitation in a hotel. After a 3 night stay for a work trip at this Double Tree, I found BED BUGS in my bed when I woke up on my last morning there. The maintenance crew was extremely helpful in checking out the room, but only found more when they came upstairs. The front desk staff seemed extremely unconcerned, they said they would have to wait until the manager was in later that day to resolve the issue. I was supposed to hear back from a manager 5 days ago. I have called everyday to get reimbursed for my room and to convey my frustration with the situation. I still have yet to receive a call back from management. The customer service at this hotel has been horrible in this situation, and I would not risk getting bed bugs by staying at this establishment.

title: Letto comodo e ottima posizione
text:
Con mia moglie abbiamo deciso di soggiornare in questa struttura sia per la certezza che avremmo trovato un letto confortevole, marchio di fabbrica della catena Hilton, sia per la posizione decentrata rispetto al Midtown. L’hotel si trova nel Financial District a 300 m da Wall Street, a 200 m da Battery Park da dove si parte par prendere il battello che ti porta a vedere la statua della Libertà ed Ellis Island, a meno di 1 km da memorial 9-11 e dal Freedom Tower. La sera é pieno di taverne tipiche della old NY, Stone Street....
La struttura non é ben tenuta né moderna, ha i suoi anni, ma nel complesso é accettabile, noi avevamo un stanza al 43mo ed era rumorosa dato che le macchine del condizionamento dei grattacieli prossimi erano vicini. Bagno discreto, macchina del caffè e frigo bar disponibile,stanza non molto grande con moquette diciamo consumata...
La lounge é al secondo piano, servizio buono, unica pecca l’ascensore che la mattina per scendere si aspettava anche 10 minuti...
Possibilità di colazione al ristorante italiano adiacente alla struttura

title: Great place to stay!
text: I don’t normally write reviews but I felt it was important this time especially reading some of the other reviews. This was my first time staying at this hotel and was very impressed with the customer service, professionalism and welcoming staff. From the minute I walked in the front door, at check-in and in the elevator to my room, staff members were quick to greet me with a welcoming smile and light conversation. I’ve never seen so many happy staff members all working under the same roof. I was only at the hotel for one night but every time I came in and out this is what I experienced. My room was clean, quiet, the bed was very comfortable as well as the room temperature. I had no complaints and if I’m ever in the area again I will plan to stay at this property and will recommend to others.

title: Tolles Hotel, sehr sauber und guter Lage. Unbedingt ohne Frühstück buchen!
text:
Das Hotel befindet sich im Financial District, die Lage ist daher gut da es viele Restaurants/Lokale/Bars in der Umgebung gibt und es am Abend und am Wochenende verhältnismäßig ruhig ist. 

Das Personal ist sehr hilfsbereit und zuvorkommend, freundlich und stehts bemüht zu helfen, hier kann man wirklich nicht meckern. 

Wir waren im 40.Stock mit toller Aussicht auf den Hudson, die Erfahrung, lange auf den Lift warten zu müssen, teilen wir nicht. In 90% war der Lift innerhalb von 1-2Minuten da. Wenn man aber um 8:00 zur Stoßzeit runter möchte, kann es sich stauen. 

Sauberkeit ist auch top, das Zimmer war immer sehr gut geputzt und sauber und ordentlich, man merkt, dass man hier auch Qualität bekommt. Einzig die Bettwäsche hatte manchmal kleinere Löcher/Flecken. Aber ansonsten war immer alles Tip Top gepflegt und wir waren sehr zufrieden. 

Die Zimmer selber sind ok, großer Fernseher, Internet ist top, Bad auch ausreichend aber alles etwas klein. Wer es geräumiger möchte dem sei eine Junior Suite empfohlen, da die Zimmer wirklich nicht sehr groß sind. Dafür hat man einen Teekocher, eine Garderobe inkl. Bübelbrett/Eisen und ein sehr gemütliches Bett. Es befand sich keine Minibar/kein Kühlschrank am Zimmer. 

So toll der Rest war, man muss aber klar vom Frühstück abraten. Dieses erfüllt nicht den Standard, den man sonst von so einer Kategorie gewöhnt ist, weder was das Platzangebot, noch das Getränke/Speisenangebot oder das Preis/Leistungsverhältnis anbelangt. Unbedingt ohne Frühstück buchen. Wer Hilton Gold Member ist, hat es zwar gratis (sofern man über die Hilton Homepage direkt bucht) aber auch da weicht man gerne nach ein paar Tagen in die umliegenden Cafes/Bagelshops aus. Wer keinen entsprechenden Status hat zahlt 25$/Person dafür, dass man zwischen schwarzen Kaffee und schwarzen Tee wählen kann, das Rührei, der Speck und die Würstchen im Dampfbad liegen und nicht schmecken und das Gebäck auch nicht wirklich schmackhaft ist. 

Ansonsten tolles Hotel, würde es, bis auf das Frühstück, weiterempfehlen.

title: Another great stay in NYC!
text: Loved being in the "quieter" financial district.  Comfortable beds.  Professional, helpful staff. Close to abundant restaurants, bars, convenience stores and sightseeing.  Loved the proximity to the metro system (half block). Enjoyed the tasty breakfast each morning (plenty of selections for everyone).    Rooms were typical NYC size, but clean and suffice!  Only downside....no mini fridge in room.  (Would have loved one...especially while traveling with kiddies.  Could have used a place to keep cold food & drinks on hand.)

title: Horrible Stay
text: Do not stay at this hotel!!!!  They left a smelly food tray in the hallway for 3 days. Also left a housekeeping cart in the hallway for 3 days. The rooms where freezing and it was dirty. I will never stay here again! Oh there was also spiders in my room.

title: Good place to stay
text:
Excellent  location, plenty of very good places to eat around here, cheap or expensive, the hotel staff are friendly and helpful, and the room I stayed in was pretty small but very comfortable and clean. The shower and sink had excellent water pressure and almost immediate heat so taking a quick was easy and literally painless (I hate cold showers).
The only complaints I have is there is no kitchen or kitchenette, or hot plate/microwave and no washer or dryer so all of your dining and cleaning will have to be done either outside of the room or by the staff.
Really good place for a short stay but if you are going to be here longer than 3-5 days you may want to plan accordingly.

title: Expected more from something with the Hilton name
text:
Firstly we have never stayed in the financial district before so I was looking forward to being close to a lot of important attractions. 
Price wise it is the same as the hotel that we normally stay at in midtown but doesn’t compare AT ALL. 
I had hoped that with the name Hilton that this would be somewhat of a guarantee for quality but for me, that quality is somewhat lacking. 
The room itself is small, even for NY standards. The air conditioning unit made more noise than the traffic in midtown and that’s saying something. 
After arriving yesterday, severely jet lagged, and before going out for some things, I asked for a small fridge for our room. No problem was the answer - there would be a fee - also not a problem. I bought some things that have to be cooled only to arrive back to hear that there wasn’t a fridge available but I could keep some things in their fridge on the 2nd floor. 
The problem with so many floors/rooms and the elevators had been well documented so you can understand that I wasn’t happy having some things on the 2nd floor with me on the 22nd floor. 
Breakfast is in the adjacent Italian restaurant. What looks romantic in the evening looks completely different in daylight hours. After going in I was told that I had to have a voucher for breakfast and that it should have been given to me at check in. So back upstairs with the s l o w elevator only to hear that it had been forgotten at check in. Back downstairs in the s l o w elevator. The buffet gives the impression it is an after thought. It’s all bit uncared for. The backroom in the restaurant definitely needs a makeover, everything is a bit dingy. Unfortunately that is where the buffet is set up. 
We are here for another couple of days and hope that it gets better.
On a positive note, the staff is friendly, the rooms are clean, the bed is very comfortable and the tv is good but further for me it is all a bit outdated and tired.

title: Average Property
text:
The hotel is located in the main financial downtown, pretty close to the wall street. Let me come to the most inconvenient part, THE HOTEL IS FLOODED WITH GUESTS & IT HAS ONLY 3 LIFTS THAT TAKE AGES TO ARRIVE. The reception is on the 2nd floor, so for registration 1st you need to head to the 2nd floor queuing up for approx 20 mins for the lift then head to your room from 2nd floor to the designated one waiting for the lift again for 20 mins. 

We were in a group, totally jet-legged & it took us 1 hr & 15 mins to go to our room just because of the lift problem. The reception staff is not at all accommodating or friendly, i requested for a room change as i was given a twin room instead of a single king bed. The female at the reception bluntly refused to do so even knowing that i had a 4 year old kid with me.  I had to get my tour manager involved , argue with them & then only they changed the room. NOW THAT's A BAD LEVEL OF HOSPITALITY. 

Coming to the room, the rooms are small & that's ok since its located in one of the upmarket area. The bathrooms were clean & so was the room, housekeeping was good. 
Breakfast spread was decent but worth mentioning was the staff, very humble, very polite & damn hardworking. Wanted to rate this property 2 but rating three for the restaurant staff.

title: Decent and serviceable
text:
Great location and friendly staff, but other than that this place was underwhelming. Room was so small it was comical, and bathroom didn't have enough room for me to even put toothpaste and deodorant down without place one of them on top of toilet.
Entrance was in alley with small marking for hotel, which led to a service looking hallway and 3 elevators. I was informed checkin was on 2nd floor, which was also super small. Just felt odd...

title: Great Value, Especially for Weekends
text: I like to stay here on weekends to be away from the bigger crowds of Times Square and Midtown crowds. The rates are great for the weekend, especially for the location.  Expect delays with the elevators since it's an older hotel with three elevators servicing the entire hotel. (Tall narrow building)  It's easy to get to Times Square or any of the shopping districts on the subway, and in the immediate area of the hotel you have the 911 Memorial Museum, Wall Street/NYSE, Battery Park, the Vietnam Veterans Plaza, Maritime Memorial/Museum, and Stone Street.  Stone Street has a lively restaurant scene and great outdoor seating.  It's a fun place for happy hour or watching sporting events.  You also have Harry's and several other nice steak places nearby if you want to dine upscale.  Great jazz in the cafes, especially during weekend brunch, and a laid back vibe.  Get your Broadway tickets at the TKTS Seaport location where there's barely a line.  While you're over there, check out the wonderful local shops for coffee, home goods and gifts, local hangouts and views of the water.  You can also launch off from this location easily to tours of Statue of Liberty.  It's my favorite area to call home base during my trips to NYC.  I come here for business a fair amount, and it's fun to see how the personality of the area completely changes on the weekends.

title: Fit Financial Decision in Financial District
text:
First time staying at this particular property. I was extremely impressed with the service first and foremost. Everyone was very helpful, and each day we were in New York, someone from the hotel would check in with us via text to see if we were want for anything more. 
Our rooms were very clean. Shower water pressure was on par with the best of fire hoses! You could turn it on low for a gentle shower from the rainfall shower head, or crank it up to have it massage you scalp and shoulders.
The TV was incredibly large and served up all the necessary news or sports if you were so inclined to stay in the room.
Situated a couple of blocks from Wall Street, 911 memorials and Battery Park, it is a perfect respite from the hustle of Times Square and does not include the crazy fares of the upper east side.
We would definitely return to this property.

title: Liked it!
text:
Arrived late in the evening. Staff very helpful. Allen, Tim, Melissa especially nice.
Rooms were clean, but small. No problem as I wasn't going to party there just sleep. I wish the parking was less expensive. It's 40 something floors, so elevators are slow at checkout 
time.

title: Weekend get away
text:
Great hotel that had a really good rate for a Saturday night. The hotel is conveniently located near many NYC sites and also many subway stations.
Staff was friendly and even though the room was small who spends that much time in a hotel room.
Only down side of hotel there was no full length mirror. The shower did not have a lip so the bathroom floor absolutely was covered with water, we put down towels as the water went as far as the sink. 
Look for deals but a good hotel

title: Your basic DT in FiDi
text: Pretty basic NYC 40+ stories hotel. Elevators are horrible - it's not unusual to wait for one for 5 minutes or more to get to a higher floor, so try staying on a lower floor if possible and take stairs. The most outstanding feature of this hotel is its location.

title: Ordentliches Hotel
text:
Ordentliches Hotel, mit einem für die USA guten Frühstücksbuffet.
Die Zimmer sind gut eingerichtet und sauber. Das Bett ist sehr bequem, mit 1,9m Länge aber ein wenig zu kurz. 
Leider ist die Klimaanlage sehr laut auf dem Zimmer.

title: Our USA/Canada adventure
text: We did some travelling NewYork to Niagara and on to Toronto Canada. Double Tree New York was our 1st hotel booked. On arrival we were greeted with a friendly face. The rooms were basic but clean, the hotel in general is tired and outdated. We didn’t eat here so can’t comment on the food. We were looking for somewhere reasonably priced in mid town to lay our heads after days of sightseeing and the location is perfect for that. Situated in the heart of New York very close to the Empire State, Times Square and Central Park. I would recommend the passes for the open top buses to get around and also the city passes for access to multiple tourist attractions. In all New York is a great city to visit and this hotel is in the heart of that city.

title: Dejligt roligt Hotel
text:
Dejligt og roligt hotel der ligger rigtigt godt placeret i den sydlige ende af New york. der er ikke langt til nærmeste Subway. gå afstand til Ground Zero,Brooklyn Bridge.jeg kommer der igen.
kan bestemt anbefales.

title: Fine Hotel
text: Had a great experience especially since Tina from the staff was able to accommodate my request for an early check in. It made my life a whole lot easier. The complementary warm cookie and bottled water were a nice touch. Would stay here again.

title: Decent hotel
text: Great location close to museum Staten island ferry and close walk to Brooklyn bridge. Hotel room small but clean ,beds were really comfy . elevators slow and always crowded .be sure to ask for cookies it depends who's at the desk for them to be offered

title: Great location and friendly staff but only so so room
text: Stayed on business, so location was excellent both for the office and convenient for wall street. World trade centre, battery park ferries and not far from Chinatown, south street seaport and little italy. Staff were also very friendly. Unfortunately the rooms were small and dated. Only one lift was working which meant long waits to get out of the hotel. Not an obvious choice unless you want to be in that part of town.

title: Comodo ma un po’ vecchiotto
text:
Hotel in posizione molto comoda vicino alla Penn Station e al Madison Square Garden.
La metro è poco distante.
Ha alcune camere con spettacolare veduta sull’Empire State Building, da non perdere.
Abbiamo optato per il solo pernottamento facendo colazione in un locale vicino.

title: Great location and service
text: This hotel was amazing and one block away from my client. The room was clean and comfortable, the staff was polite and helpful, and the attactched restaurant was a huge plus. If you are looking for a great hotel in the Financial District, this is one to strongly consider.

title: Muy buen hotel
text: Muy bien ubicado. Tiene cerca dos estaciones del metro y la terminal del ferry. La calle estaba en obra y es un poco problemático el acceder a la calle, pero la experiencia general es muy buena. Lo recomendamos ampliamente.

title: Basic, Average Lodging
text:
Stayed here over Memorial Day weekend (Rm. 4201) and found it to be fairly reasonable.
The price was o.k., considering New York prices, and there were several eateries nearby.
A few items to note:
Rooms come with a mini fridge - nice;
BUT no microwave and no clock radio or closet or bathtub (shower only) and the rooms are VERY small;
Waits for the elevators can be long.

Staff is very nice and the beds very comfortable.  Getting a daily text message from staff is a nice touch.

title: Clean and Friendly
text: Stayed here on business and was glad we chose this establishment. Arrived around 12 and was able to do an early check in and within an hour I had my keys to the room and settled in. The room was exceptionally clean and even received a txt message from the front office and housekeeping to see if there were any issues with the room. Received a follow up txt after checkout which was a nice little touch. Will stay here again.

title: Not what I was expecting
text:
Very surprised to found that the hotel had only 2 elevators for 40 or 50 floors (way too long when waiting for the elevator and hopefully we were only on the 6th floor so we were getting down with stairs)!
Shower not clean on our first arrival (hairs in shower)

title: Beautiful Rooms Great Staff Nice Area
text: This is a very nice hotel! Check in was fast and easy. All staff were very friendly and helpful. My room was very nice. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom was very nice. There are great coffee shops, restaurants, bakeries and bars within a 3 minute walk. There is easy access to the rest of the city through close subway stops. It is only a 4 minute walk to the 1,2 subway, and a 2 minute walk to the 4/5. It only took 10 minutes to walk to the 9/11 memorial.  The Staten Island Ferry, which is one of the not to miss free things in the city, is about a 4 minute walk. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Prima hotel
text: Fijn verblijf in dit hotel. De locatie vond ik perfect! Metro in de straat en veel mooie bezienswaardigheden op loopafstand. De kamers zijn prima, bed voor 2 personen wel een beetje klein maar wel een goed bed. Kamer wordt iedere dag goed schoon gemaakt en elke dag schone handdoeken.
