Zoals veel mensen schrijven zijn er eigenlijk te weinig liften voor zo'n groot hotel, maar nooit heel lang hoeven wachten. Prijs/kwaliteit helemaal goed dit hotel!

title: Adequate
text: Hotel is reasonably priced and located.  Room size are average for NYC.  Largest issue is the elevator situation.  You need to take the elevator from the ground floor to the second floor lobby for checking in and then again to your floor for your room.  That is fine, except there are only three elevators and the hotel has 30 or 40 floors with ~10 rooms per floor.  It can take a solid 5 minutes, which becomes worse during peak mornings, especially on a Thursday where people are checking out.  It isn't necessarily a deal breaker for the property, but something to manage.  Also, in case you were wondering.  The stairs are really convenient as they are very steep, but it is an option.  Mind you not with luggage and also in the mornings there is typically trash bags waiting for collection from housekeeping.  If you do go, I suggest a low floor.

title: 立地よし◎
text:
初めてのニューヨークでしたのでヒルトンという名前と安く泊まりたかったので、こちらに宿泊しました。
立地はよくどこにいくのも便利でした。
ニューヨークはどこにいくのもタクシーで安くて便利なので、地区さえみておけばホテル選びは困らないなという印象でした。
ここから5番街までも歩いていくことは可能です。
ただ、夜はホームレスに声をかけられたりもしたので気をつけて下さい。
隣になんでも買える薬局があるので便利でした(^^)

title: Fantastic stay & superb staff
text: We came to the hotel early for our 2 night stay hoping to just stow our bags in a secure closet until our 3pm check in time. However, Tina at the front desk who was so delightful was able to find a room already prepared for us which was wonderful. This was so nice so we could leave our bags before heading on our tour at 2:30pm on Ellis Island. The hotel was room was very nice, quiet, & comfortable where we stayed on the 24th floor. The location was fantastic as well close to Battery park, New York Stock Exchange, and much more. Thanks Tina & housekeeping staff for making our stay special & very enjoyable. We'd come back in a heartbeat.

title: Clean, comfortable, quiet, great location.
text: Hotel is right downtown, near many subway stops, our room had a water view. We were on the 44th floor so it was very quiet. The beds were very comfortable. Nice bathroom. Plenty of towels. No complaints about the room at all. Halls were a little dingy and elevators small and slow, but that's very minor. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to friends.

title: Good hotel in a good district
text:
Great experience,
The location was so amazing, so close from Subway station and plenty of options for have lunch and dinner. 

Once with subway so close you could be in times square in 20 minutes. 

For this is a great opportunity to stay at this hotel.

title: Gutes Hotel mit guter Lage
text: Wir waren eine Woche in diesem Hotel und hatten nichts zu beanstanden. Sauberes Zimmer mit schönen Ausblick aus dem 39. Stock. Die Lage fanden wir sehr gut! Mehrere U-Bahn Stationen sowie Sehenswürdigkeiten in unmittelbarer Nähe und Nachts sehr ruhig. Nettes Personal das immer hilfreich zur Seite stand.

title: Clean, comfortable and convenient
text: Third time staying  here when visiting NYC.   Close to public transportation,  lots of restaurants, pubs, museums (Museum of American Indian and Fraunces tavern museum) Wall Street,  a Duane Reede, and a great bagel guy on the corner, too.

title: La pire expérience hôtelière de ma vie
text:
Première et dernière expérience avec cette chaîne d’hôtel ! 
Hôtel sans âme dans le financial district, vous avez déjà le cafard en entrant dans le hall d’entrée sombre mal entretenu et sale.

Arrivée à la reception, un accueil ni chaleureux ni agréable nous est réservé malgré un vol de 11h.

Découverte de la chambre : minuscule, triste où on arrive à peine faire le tour du lit et bas de plafond qui donne l’effet d’être étouffé ! La salle de bain est aussi minuscule, il faut laisser couler l’eau 10 minutes avant d’espérer d’avoir de l’eau chaude (36eme étage).

Nous avons décidé de tester le resto italien à côté : même constat : à fuire, cher et vraiment rien d’un italien.

Après avoir quitter l’hôtel, j’ai constaté avec ma banque qu’une caution a été retenu deux fois : une fois sur le montant total et une fois à notre arrivée : à ce jour encore 400 dollars de bloquer sur ma carte qui n’a pas été levé et qui m’empêche de poursuivre mon séjour aux États Unis convenablement. J’ai écrit un e-mail mais il est resté sans réponse.
Je ne comprends pas pourquoi de l’argent est bloqué, nous risquions pas de vider le mini bar puisque inexistant, même ps un frigo !!

Seul point positif : la sympathie des bagagistes à l’entrée ! 

Cet hôtel est clairement d’un autre temps, dépassé, qu’il faudrait revoir entièrement, des chambres en passant par leur technique de management.

title: No Bike allowed
text: Don’t use this Double Tree Hotel if you have I Bike with especially during biking events like the 5Boro Tour. No Bikes are allowed and they have no storage for your bike. The elevators are small and hot. Only 2 of 3 was working when I was there for the 5 Boro Tour.

title: Urlaub mit Freunden in New York!
text:
Sehr gute und zentrale Lage des Hotels!
Gemütliche Kneipen und kleine Restaurants in unmittelbarer Nähe!
Sehr empfehlenswert und sehr gutes Preis- Leistungsverhältnis!
U-Bahn um die Ecke!
Immer wieder gerne!

title: 2nd visit
text: This was my 2nd visit in about a month. 1st one wasn't terrible but wasn't great either. This visit was the same. Rooms are clean and the rates are pretty good for NYC. Front desk staff are rude and inattentive.  If you want a average stay with horrible hospitality this is your place.

title: Terrible staff attitude, rude, confrontative and borderline hostile
text: Staff had an issue they could have handled with grace and chose instead to be outright rude and borderline hostile. I will never return to this hotel and strongly advise you not to stay here unless you enjoy rude and condescending staff.

title: Just Okay
text: The rooms themselves are small (as you’d expect in New York) but are fine. They have normal amenities including a coffee machine, iron/ironing board etc. What really kicks the hotel down a few notches is the completely dirty floors (areas outside the elevators are full of pieces of small trash/dirt etc.) and the elevators are obnoxiously slow - at one point I waited 10 min for one to come. Would I stay here again? No!

title: Clean Hotel, Great Location
text:
My first trip to New York and this was the perfect location for me to maneuver around the city. We spent 3 nights and this lovely hotel that's perfectly located right in the heart of the Financial District.  The Charging Bull is literally around the corner along with  Bowling Green Park which is the oldest park in NY and very historic.  Museums, NY Film Academy the The Twin Tower Monuments, African Burial Ground ... The NYSE... there are so many attractions with in 2-3 blocks. Restaurants and shopping are right there along with local night clubs.
 The hotel itself was well decorated and staffed. We were able to check our bags in early and hit the streets to sight see.  I was impressed by the level of cleanliness and  there where no old moldy smells or odors. Nice hot water  with modern bath design and features overlooking the city makes this hotel  ideal for those wanting to spend time  exploring. 
 I would definitely recommend this hotel.

title: NIce hotel terrible wait with elevators
text: This hotel is located on the Wall Street area, good location near the subway and places to eat.  Fortunately, our room was ready when we got here and were received with a warm cookie and water.  Nice touch.  The room was clean and on the small size.  The worst thing about it is the elevators, only 2 for the entire hotel.  It takes a while to go in and out,

title: A poor reflection on Hilton
text: On Wednesday 4/25/2018 I called to alert the Doubletree we would be a late arrival, someone answered the phone and I told them we would be a late arrival. When we arrived at 11 pm, after using the parking garage around the corner, carried our luggage into the hotel. I went to check in with my confirmation letter and number. The front desk worker said, "Your reservations are canceled."  I said, " Who canceled them?  I just called earlier and told the front desk I would be a late arrival. She said she wasn't sure how they became canceled. I said that I would appreciate it if she had another room. She then came back and said she had 2 double beds for 650 plus fees.I had paid 398 I asked her to match it, she said she couldn't, but she could place us in the room for 650. This was after calling someone at home to ask a price. I then asked if she could please check surrounding Hilton hotels for availability. She said " You can check on booking.com " I didn't book my room through there, to begin with, I went directly to Hilton since we are honors members.  Sadly enough, I asked for a manager, she said its late and none are on duty. I did then go to Booking Website and securing a Hilton around the corner and they were wonderful !! We carried our luggage about two more blocks. This is my second review since the first one appears to be gone !!! I called the hotel manager the next day and asked for a callback, and I NEVER received a callback. Sad, and not a typical Hilton, as they usually are the best !! A just really poor business person would ever send me to a website versus directly to their company.Very sad, this would exist anywhere in 2018 !!

title: Ok, not Hilton Standard
text:
The hotel is in a great location if you need to be in the financial district. Easy walking to Wall Street, restaurants and shopping.

Upon arrival it looks like you are in the basement maintenance area.  2nd floor is the lobby.

Digital check in was easy.  As a Hilton Honors member I picked up my cookie and 2 bottles of water.

I then waited 10 minutes for an elevator with a group of other guests.  My room was on the top floor, so another ride with multiple stops so the cleaning staff could communicate.  Very poor set up.

Be prepared for very narrow hallways where 2 people cannot pass with out turning sideways.  The carpet has seen better days and looks like it needs cleaning.

On arrival my digital key worked great.  The room is small, but comfortable.  Very little space for luggage.  I only had a carry on so 2 larger suitcases would be hard to fit.

The room has been upgraded, but the maintenance is lacking.  The wallpaper behind the chair is worn and ripped, but not replaced. The sink takes forever to drain.  The bathroom is tiny.  It would be impossible if you had to close the door.

For $400 ish a night I would have chosen a different hotel had I known the set up.

The restaurant on the ground floor is good- good food, service and prices.  

The staff are what make you overlook the building issues.  They were helpful, accommodating, and available.

title: Bra budgetalternativ nära tunnelbanestationer och båttransport
text:
Vi (par i årsåldern) bodde på hotellet fyra dagar i april under en lite längre weekendresa. Hotellet kostade ca 1200 svenska kronor per natt, exklusive frukost. I våra ögon ett rimligt pris för en storstad som New York. Vi bodde i ett rum med King size-säng och badrum med badkar. Servicenivån var god, vi fick hjälp med det vi behövde och hotellet kunde ordna transport till flygplats vid behov. Städningen var också bra, vi upplevde både vårt rum och hotellet i övrigt som rent. Väl tilltaget badrum med rejält badkar - härligt! Vi hade inga problem alls med att få varmvatten, som en del andra gäster anmärkt på i sina recensioner. Frukost och room service nyttjade vi ej då der finns så mycket andra ställen att äta på runt omkring i kvarteret och staden. 

På plussidan:
Hotellet ligger i ett lugnt kvarter i The Financial District, man sover ostört och nära till tunnelbana, buss, båt. Man är i centrala Manhattan på 10-15 minuter.
Bra städning.
Hjälpfull personal.

Vårt enda minus är att sängen var för kort för maken som är 1.90 lång, hans ben stack ut över kanten. Man bör även vara observant på att hotellet reserverar en deposit på ca 450 svenska kronor per natt, ifall olyckan är framme. Denna får man tillbaka vid utcheckning, men kan vara bra att känna till.

title: Fantastico
text: Abbiamo soggiornato x una settimana in questo hotel devo dire veramente ottimo. Posizione fantastica x chi vuole visitare la città. Camere ben rifinite pulitissime ma un po piccole x 4. Colazione ottima internazionale con molta frutta, consiglio di scendere presto per evitare file e attese. Personale veramente disponibile, da non perdere i fantastici cookie da chiedere alla reception.  Giudizio personale fantastico.

title: Small rooms but really helpful staff
text:
The room were pretty small. I'm sure standard for NYC. But very clean and all the staff were very friendly and very helpful. Great location for lots of sightseeing and convenient to  the subway.
I would recommend this hotel.

title: Meh
text:
We stayed at the DoubleTree recently for 5 nights. We chose the Financial District because my daughter’s apartment is very close to the hotel. The hotel location is indeed great. There is a Duane Read just around the corner as well as a Starbucks, Chipotle, Broadstone Bar & Kitchen (we ate there twice—it was great) among many other interesting bars, coffee shops and restaurants (it is NYC after all). There were some good things about the hotel and bad things. I think the bad things outweighed the good. While it wasn’t a horrible experience, I’d probably look elsewhere for my next hotel.

First the good. The bed was comfortable. Overall the room was clean. Our room had a nice large LG flatscreen. The price was good. The staff was great. As mentioned, the location is great. 

And the bad. If I could offer only one piece of advice: make sure you get a non-adjoining room. When we first arrived and got to our room, within 30 seconds, the first thing we noticed was the loud talking, TV and singing coming from the room next door. Turns out we had an adjoining room that has a door between rooms. So there’s essentially no sound insulation because of that door. We could actually make out what our neighbors were saying (which included some obscenities—yay!). I immediately went straight down to the front desk to see if we could switch rooms to a non-adjoining room. Unfortunately, they were apparently booked that day and couldn’t switch us. But, we were able to switch to a quieter, non-adjoining room the next day. 

We got a king sized bed and my feet hung over the end of the mattress. I’m 6’1”. This must be a NYC thing because the rooms are so small—the same thing happened at a Holiday Inn Express in NYC just recently. I found that odd.

Another odd thing: the only bedside electrical outlets are up next to the raised bedside lights. If you take a look at some of the traveler photos, you can see the bedside lights I’m talking about. So, in actuality, if you’re charging your phone, camera, smartwatch, what have you, the cord will be hanging down towards the bedside table. If you have a short cord, this could make charging awkward.

As mentioned by numerous other reviews, the elevators are hit or miss—usually miss. In one instance I had to wait about 6 minutes for an elevator. Now, in the grand scheme of things, 6 minutes may not seem like a long time. But take the opportunity to stand there, wherever you are and set a timer for 6 minutes. It’ll seem like an eternity if you imagine you’re waiting for an elevator. By the time the elevator arrived and I got to the ground floor, there were perhaps 15 people waiting for that elevator. 

Also note that the front desk is on the 2nd floor. This is not immediately clear when you enter the hotel from the street. We entered, went to the elevators, then, confused, went back outside and thought maybe the entrance with the front desk was around the corner of the building. We asked a staff member outside and they clarified it’s on the second floor. So we went back in, around to the elevators, and sure enough there is a sign on the wall indicating that the front desk is up one floor. Reading other reviews, we’re not the only guests that had this problem. Perhaps they should put a big floor sign, right when you walk in, indicating that check in is on the 2nd floor. 

One of the worst things was the bathroom. There’s practically no counter space. There’s a small 2-3 inch or so ledge around the raised sink and a small glass shelf above the toilet, half of which is taken up by a tray featuring 3 tiny bottles of soap, shampoo and conditioner (which no one will probably use). That’s it. And the cramped shower (just a stand up shower—not a tub/shower combo) had very low pressure and the door wasn’t sealed properly so after each shower, I was left with a small puddle of water on the floor. And the lighting was horrible. If you’re in to mood lighting I guess it’s OK. But, if you’re trying to do make up or something, good luck!

The air conditioner was loud, dirty and the front grill was hanging on by a thread. I tried to brace it to stop the knocking and rattling, and the grill fell off. 

Lastly, when I checked in on a Saturday for a Saturday - Thursday stay I was told it was actually 2 reservations and that I would have to actually “check out” Tuesday. Not a real checkout. We didn’t have to change rooms or anything. But I had to go to the front desk on Tuesday to “check out” and I guess check back in. All they did was take my key cards, update them, and then hand the same cards back to me. Then I was good until the real check out on Thursday. Not a huge deal, but very weird and a bit of a hassle as I had to make an additional trip down in their unpredictable elevators. 

If you’re looking for a room for one person in the Financial District and can deal with some annoyances, this could be a safe bet. Otherwise, it might be a good idea to look elsewhere if you have that luxury.

title: Definitely NOT up to Hilton standards!
text:
From our initial arrival into an area that doesn't give you any direction as to where the lobby is (on the 2nd floor) until we actually left there was just one bad experience after another!!  We had a parking package that despite confirming on check in and check out I received a charge posted to my AMEX a few weeks later..... so just be sure that you check your bill!

The electricity went out in our room because someone had moved the phone from the side of the bed to across the room and either maintenance or housekeeping never bothered to repair the problem.  The staff was pleasant enough, but the whole property just seemed to be poorly run.  Breakfast was my chosen HHonors benefit but when you got down to breakfast they pointed us off to a mediocre breakfast buffet being attended to by a fairly inept waiter.

The room was small and the bathroom was VERY POORLY appointed.  I'm not sure who designed the bathroom but it had a very low sink with practically no place for 2 people to place toiletries.  There were no towel bars and the shower had no accommodation for someone to shave their legs.  The shower had55 one tiny little corner shelf that was totally inadequate and they didn't even bother to put a foot rest in for a lady to use to shave her legs.  The only forethought put in to planning this bathroom was to save money!

This is without a doubt the worst Hilton property I have ever stayed in my 25 plus years  of being a Hilton member.  My fiance just flatly said "Please don't ever book us into that place again!"

title: Room OK, staff poor
text:
Stayed here in February 2018. The hotel was in the middle of financial district just around the corner from Wall St.

Reception was located on the first floor which was confusing

Reception staff were very poor and borderline rude

Hotel was fit for purpose (a warm, safe and clean place to sleep whilst we explored new york city)

Air conditioning noisy and hard to control

title: Excelente localização, quarto confortável, funcionários gentis.
text:
Estivemos em NY em março e nos hospedamos nesse hotel. A localização é ótima, próximo a três estações de metro, ferry boat para Staten Island, restaurantes, pubs e andando um pouco consegue-se chegar ao WTC museum, Eataly e Century 21.
O quarto era espaçoso,com uma cama enorme. 
Os funcionários foram sempre gentis e solícitos.
Com certeza é uma excelente opção de hospedagem em NY.

title: Vowed never to stay here again... and forgot
text:
There is so much bad to say about this hotel, so it’s hard to know where to start and what to include, so will keep this to the worst attributes: 1. The elevators - you can routinely wait 5-10 minutes for an elevator and they are typically monopolized by staff as no service elevators (smart management would at least restrict employees from using elevators during rush hours); 2. Hotel and rooms are dirty.  Room I had on this stay had what looked like a former guest’s nose pickings on the wall, an old dirty towel hanging from the shower curtain rod, dirty carpet, etc.; 3. Rooms feel shabby - this is a hotel in need of a room renovation - or at least a thorough fix of problems (like the inability to close my curtains. 

Just to be clear, staff I enteracted with were friendly and helpful, so this is a management issue.

title: Truly awful hotel, but great staff
text:
This is arguably one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in. The street entrance is shabby. There are only 3 elevators for 44 floors, and they are very slow and old. Its not uncommon to have to wait several minutes for one to arrive, only for it to be full. Ask for a low floor!

The rooms themselves are tired, dark and old. My 2 nights' sleep were horrible - I'm not sure what was more disturbing, the whining sounds coming from the pipes in the bathroom, or the sound of mice and rats in the air con.

My coffee machine was missing the basket into which the coffee pods are placed.

I simply couldn't get the wifi working and gave up. 

The hotel also wraps its coffee cups and water cups in plastic which is bad for the environment - that needs a policy change by Hilton ASAP.

The only redeeming feature of this hotel is the staff. Everyone from reception through to the maintenance guys, to the housekeeping team was cheerful. How they maintain that in an environment that must be as miserable to work in as it is to stay in I have no idea, but they are a credit to Hilton.

Avoid at all costs.

title: Great place
text: Rooms were spacious for NYC, the beds were comfortable. The location was great, we were able to get anywhere in NYC for very reasonable and not as congested as time square, the service was great.  I would stay there again.

title: Pleasant and Welcoming Stay in Financial District
text: Great location for me - 5 minute walk to my meetings - readily available to everything from a shoe shine to excellent restaurants. Always pleasant staff made the stay even better - room was more comfortable than I would have imagined.

title: Avoid this place
text:
When I arrived, first I thought I was at the wrong place: when you walk in, there is nothing but 3 elevators. As it turns out, the reception is on the 3rd floor which I found very very odd. The reception was however nice and the check-in was quick and efficient so I thought it will be all good. Well, not really.
The 3 elevators are VERY slow. It takes ages in the morning to catch an elevator that is not full yet - which is really unconvinient especially if you got to be somewhere on time.
The room was small which I did not mind but the bed really bothered me. I had a king sized bed but my feet were still hanging off at the end of the bed. I suspect that due to the size of the room, they turn the bed to the side and push the length side to the wall.
At night time, I could hardly sleep as a weird noise was coming from the bathroom (almost like the cistern was constanly filling up with water).
After my first night, they did not clean my room, even though I left the room at 8.15am. The next day, I wanted to put the sign of "Cleaning please" outside my door but there is not such sign in this hotel.
Finally, drinking water does not come with these rooms. I ventured to one of the floors that has an ice machine, hoping that the machine would also give filtered water. No luck there. I needed to go outside of the hotel to get some water.

title: Great location but poor nights sleep due to being bitten!
text: Spent 4 nights here in Feb 2018. Excellent location and the welcome cookie was a nice touch. However I have never been eaten alive so badly during my sleep! Never saw any bugs mind you, but would wake up to an array of bites every night.  Was also caught up in the cyclone and the staff were not particularly helpful with Regis to extending our stay or assisting with flights

title: Convenient but with problems
text:
Stayed for 4 nights with family (had 3 separate rooms) and really wanted to like this place, but the agonizingly slow elevator to get to reception was just the first red flag...

Pros:
- Convenient to subway station
- Relatively quiet, especially on weekends
- Near Battery Park
- Friendly staff
- Decent-sized room, comfortable beds, nice linens

Cons:
- After the first day, housekeeping disappeared and my room wasn't cleaned the remainder of my stay. I was forced to skip one cleaning when I returned to my room after 5pm, and they still hadn't gotten to my room. My sister found one of the housecleaners outside of her room lounging on the hallway floor and talking on her phone...
- No hot water in the shower my last morning; my brother-in-law also had spotty hot water.
- Unclear what you get if you sign up for breakfast since there isn't a dining room. They list "Bar Area" as one of the amenities on their website, but there didn't appear to be one.
- Already mentioned the elevator; it was so slow I always had to allow enough time just to get to the ground floor. I often ended up taking the stairs, which were less than clean.
- Though the hotel's moderately priced for NY, the difference was made up by what I spent on carfare to get anywhere outside of FiDi.

title: Great hotel
text: The location was great. It was close to several subways. The hotel staff exceeded expectations. They were friendly and very helpful. I received texts during my stay asking how my visit was going and if there was anything we needed. The housekeeping staff even left us chocolate! The rooms were small, but very clean. The beds were very comfortable. We were on the 40th floor, and had a great view of the Freedom Tower. The only problem we encountered was with the hot water. We were there 3 nights, and I never got a hot shower.

title: Financial District convenience
text: This hotel is convenient to all the Financial District...World Trade Center, Wall Street, The Bull and more! The room was very clean. The beds and pillows are extremely comfortable! Staff very friendly and helpful. Lots of good eateries near by.

title: Perfettamente corrispondente alle attese
text: Abbiamo ricevuto una stanza perfettamente corrispondente alle nostre richieste e aspettative: per quattro persone (due adulti e due bambini). Dotata di bagno completo di tutto, bollitore per bevande calde, set di cortesia, asciugamani cambiati ogni giorno. Pulizia impeccabile. La nostra stanza era al 23° piano con splendido panorama. Condizionatore regolabile e quindi temperatura sempre perfetta. Gentilissimo e disponibile il personale. Tutti i piani sono dotati di macchina del ghiaccio e alcuni di beverini per l'acqua potabile. Ci sono tre ascensori e non si attende mai più di tre minuti per prenderne uno. Alla reception ci hano regalato biscotti e acqua in bottiglia quasi tutti i giorni.

title: Not Hilton's Finest
text: We booked two rooms here during the week for spring break. Upon arrival we were directed to a hallway that led to the elevators to get to the lobby on the next floor. There was no key card entry for late night arrivals so it seems that just anyone can just come into the hotel at any time. Not the safest feeling. The lobby was clean, as was our rooms. The rooms were pretty small with tight bathrooms also, but hey, this is New York. The hallways were tight with a lot of chipped paint on the doorframes. Not really what you are accustomed to at a Hilton. The location was great for the Subway station and the Staten Island Ferry.

title: Only as a last resort!
text: Look at ANY other hotel first. 44 floors only 3 elevators.  On top of that the employees use them to go one floor.  Doorman offered a flat rate, don’t fall for it as we did, price was double of what it should have been. Uber it and save BIG!!!

title: Only used as a place to sleep
text:
Stayed here back in February with my partner. Hotel was undergoing some sort of renovation so looked shabby, no clear signage. Once we found that reception is on first floor we were greeted by rude staff who struggled with our reservation (a women with white glasses could do with some customer service training), then had problems with our payment as the receptionist found it too difficult to understand that we wanted to pay in cash for the room. 
Room was tiny so luckily we only used it to sleep overnight. Heating system is hard/impossible to control. 
Wouldn't stay here again on our next visit to NY.

title: Hotel muito bom, ótima localização.
text: Hotel muito bom no distrito financeiro! Estação Bowling Green do metro fica menos de 100 metros do hotel. Nas redondezas diversos bares, restaurantes e farmácias. Custo bem mais baixo do que os hotéis da região de Times Square. Atendimento excelente, quartos limpos, cama muito confortável. Outro detalhe interessante é que não cobram taxa de resort como alguns hotéis de Manhattan cobram.

title: Great location, small rooms
text: This hotel is clean and kept up. The location is excellent as it’s near all lines on the subway and walking distance to 9/11 and Statue of Liberty. The room is very small for the price you are paying. The bathroom didn’t have any space to put your toiletries. Elevators are slow. Couple great food/bars nearby. Didn’t hear any outside noise when trying to sleep.

title: Muy bueno
text: Fue perfecto! Tuve problemas con el airbnb y terminé reservando este hotel el mismo día de mi llegada. Me pareció barato, cómodo y que cumplía con los requisitos indispensables de limpieza. El personal es muy amable y super atento. Me sentí con todos. Volvería definitivamente

title: Excellent stay at DoubleTree Financial District New York
text: Upgraded to top floor with Hudson River view! Not many rooms have river view due to many tall buildings. I will be back couple days and will try the city view at that time. Also received Great customer service from Tina!

title: Superb location out of the tourist hub
text: Right round the corner from Bowling Green subway. In the financial district. Exactly what I expected from a Double Tree. Would stay there again. If I really had to moan, the hotel only has two lifts for 44 floors.

title: A very happy stay.
text:
I stayed at the hotel from Friday the 16th to Monday the 19th of March.
I had a horrible journey from JFK to the hotel. I got there late on Friday evening. Had a lovely greeting from the colleague on duty, (name started with a V) gave me a great room on the 42nd floor with a view of Freedom Tower and Empire State Building. Lovely soft bed, clean room, house cleaning was very friendly and polite. When I left the room the door wouldn't lock behind me, reception answered quickly, friendly guy came up straight away, sorted the lock, didn't hover around looking for a tip.
Saturday morning I decide to see how far the window open, so I could take a photograph, wouldn't close afterwards. Mentioned it to reception, sorted when I got  back that night. Guys at the front door, always friendly and very helpful when it came to leaving suitcases.
If I had one small complaint, it would be you did have to leave the shower running for a while before it got hot.
Great area, near the Charging Bull statue, two subway stations, Murphy's Tavern right next door, (no noise problem as far as I was concerned).

title: Below my expectations! won't go back there
text: Since the first day i arrive, i ask the reception to check if can somebody could come to the hotel to see if there was something on the heat, nobody came. when i call the reception they didn't answer most of the time, so i had to go in person to ask things. one day we woke up late, and the maid never pass after, i went to reception to ask why nobody came, they say it was too late to do something, so i ask at least towels, coffee for that day, they just gave me some shampoos and soap. so i found a person who was near my room, he took some towels and gave me some and i had to go to reception to ask for coffee. One of the sheet on my bed had blood or coffee spots, like they were old or not well washed, and when i saw the toilet inside i was surprise when i saw the rust , i thought it was pooh or dirty.. i hope is rust.  For the price i paid, i'm not at all satisfied , i thought just for being Hilton it would be a excellent place, i told that to one receptionist who was very nice and listen to me, she gave me a free breakfast just because i told her, i wasn't happy with the service.i won't recommend this hotel to anybody. concerning the elevator, we had to wait a lot to take it. one of the waiters wasn't nice... well if you stay there.. good luck!

title: Good Experience
text: Good experience, very helpful staff, wonderful cookies, very quiet room, hot shower, strong staff service, and overall good experience.  Initially had the reservation cancelled due to credit card snafu but the staff stepped up and did the right thing.

title: Slow elevators. Very slow.
text: This hotel is fine. It's clean, the staff is friendly and if you need to be in lower Manhattan, the location is great. But, seriously, build in at least 20 minutes extra for your commute in the morning to wait for the elevators. They are incredibly slow, crowded and seem to make stops on every floor. If you are at the 20th floor or lower, I recommend taking the stairs.

title: Un bon etablissement proche de financial district
text: Un pied a terre situe au sud de Manhattan , proche denombreuses visites possibles a qques minutes de l embarcadere pour Ellis Island et la Statue de la Liberté ,mais aussi vers le nord vers Broadway et Central Parc . Tres bon etablissement a recommander

title: Not a bad stay but too much light in room. Waiting for elevator was a pain in the but. Restaurant has limited menu.
text: Not a bad stay but too much light in room. Waiting for elevator was a pain in the but. Restaurant has a very limited breakfast menu. Price was very affordable. Defiantly worth what I paid to stay here.

title: Check in!
text:
Shout out to Vanessa and Venetta for making our check in a breeze!
Rooms are clean and comfortable, location is ideal for business in the financial district. Close to subway and restaurants, would stay here again!

title: Nice Hotel
text:
Location is perfect...near at the Metro station and tourist  spots...staff were so friendly...rooms are clean and bed are comfortable...the only thing is the elevator!it takes a lot of time before you catch it most specially if you were on the higher floor.
WiFi is also good, we really enjoyed our stay in this hotel!

title: Convenient to everything!
text: Clean, cozy, and comfortable, this hotel was convenient to Battery Park, Staten Island Ferry, Liberty Island ferry, and the 4,5,R and W lines. For getting around to the boroughs, this hotel was located perfectly. Also, the staff were really helpful and friendly. In particular, if you need any help with directions or places to go, be sure to ask for Tina! Great stay, and I'll be back!

title: Custo Benefício
text: O Hotel atendeu muito bem nossas vontades - Custo e Localização (metro) - conseguimos um valor bem abaixo da média de hoteis em Manhattan, e com a garantia Hilton, localizado próximo a varias estações de Metro, saída para a estatua da Liberdade e Bolsa de Valores, o único ponto negativo é ser um hotel muito grande, muitos andares e vários quartos por andar, e apenas 3 elevadores, a espera é grande 10/15 minutos, mas para que esta a passeio não muda nada.

title: Convenient stay to see New York
text: The location of the Hotel is fantastic. There are many places to eat and drink in the area, from cheap $3 beers to high-end cocktails at the Dead Rabbit and also only a few yards away from a subway station. The hotel itself is a bit run down, the halls are dated and the lifts need some work. During our stay, one of the lifts was down and it did lead to delays, but not so long that it was a major problem. The king size room was larger than I expected but curtains were not very thick and the window was a bit drafty. The room was clean and changed daily. Very similar to what you would expect from a Travel Lodge in the UK. It is clear that the hotel is resident to people that have been housed there and are not tourists but there was never any bother and everyone was always polite. The staff are very very friendly and helpful. Being able to store our luggage there before our flight was a bonus. For the cheap prices, we paid compared to usual city standards it was adequate for our trip but if you are expecting luxury it is not the place for you.

title: HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE!
text: Stay away from this dive. Staff is ride. Lost reservation and even though I showed front desk clerk their printed confirmation, he couldn't give a damn about helping. Place is a hell-hole. Another giest was trying ti check out early because her room was so disgusting that we were kinda glad that they HAD screweed up our reservation.

title: Refurb needed ASAP! Left hotels 2 days into my 12 night stay
text: Small, no room to move round bed. AC in a bad state. Bathroom door didn’t shut fully. Took over 10mins for sink and shower water to get warm. Lifts took ages and werr slooow!! Lock on door broken. Etc

title: Valentine's stay.
text: Perfect location to WTC and lots of options to eat and see financial district.  Elevators can get slow at busy times but lovely staff and that Doubletree charm is still there including warm cookies! Just wishi asked for a fridge in the room but room and bed were fantastic!

title: Small But Perfectly Formed
text:
Stayed here for three nights on an advance purchase rate which I booked a mere 2 weeks before flying out.  $109 (£75) dollars a night is an absolute steal for the location.  

It is an odd little hotel really, a tiny tower (albeit 44 stories tall) sandwiched in between other office buildings.  The staff were all courteous and friendly, especially Tony at the front door.  You'll get to know him very well because you will be waiting an age for the elevators.  Three tiny lifts to serve such a tall building is almost a running joke in this hotel among staff and guests alike.  You will never get a free run to the ground floor unless in the middle of the night and the problem is compounded by guests floor hopping ro use the ice machines.  Rant over...the elevator service is dreadful.  But to be fair that's the total of the bad news.

The rooms are very small in keeping with the theme of this hotel, which is in a really good location with the Staten Island ferry terminal literally two minutes walk away, whilst the Fulton Center and the WTC are a few blocks to the north where you can access the PATH from Newark and pretty much any Subway line.

Can't fault the cleanliness of the room or the facilities which are all typically DoubleTree.  The hot water in our room (3707) took forever to come through but maybe that was just a characteristic of that particular room.  Didn't try the restaurant but there are plenty of eating and drinking options nearby.  In all a good experience and I can heartily recommend.

title: Upscale, clean, affordable, and smaller than some hotel rooms
text:
I went here for a conference where the tab was picked up, so I can't complain
The decor was upscale, the hotel was close to public transportation, and it was also close to great restaurants, the World Trade Center, The Financial District, and the Battery.

about 8 years ago

title: BED BUGS in the room! DO NOT STAY HERE
text: i got bitten by bed bugs at this terrible dirty old hotel!!!! many not as visible areas in the room aren't cleaned - full of dust and dirt. also lost my personal toiletries in the bathroom. personal items fell down to cracks between bed & chest drawer - house keeping people didn't put them back properly. called to get an extra duvet - didn't deliver, had to call again to remind them. worst hotel stay ever. and didn't expect to be encountering this at a HILTON hotel at financial district in NYC.

title: Dated and strange
text:
Experience from hotels in the U.S is that they are all overpriced and rough around the edges. 

Doubletree by Hilton is no different. Imagine your grandparents bought a hotel in the 70s and miraculously didn’t die before 2003 and did it up again. They had the same dated taste including love for dark “wood” (melamine), stripy carpet and “stone” bath ware. 

There is a sepia tone to the lifts and doorways, which is less nostalgic-cool than abuse-by-nicotine. They are over-worked at peak time leading to audible sighs by the dozen.

What’s super bizarre is just how many strange people it attracts: not foreigners or business people as you might expect but weird locals with pot noodles in their bags, booze on their breath and all kinds of crazy coming out of their mouths. No matter what time of day. 

I can’t speak for the food or the drink because there is no restaurant to speak of in the evenings. The dead flowers and hedges outside do however make for bad vibes on your way to work. 

The rooms are clean (minus the uninvited pube I found in my basin), the shower is fine, the products to shower with are under parr but that’s fine. Crappy furniture and chipped paint, worn away edges to literally every static thing in the place are nothing I’ve not come to expect in America it’s just incredible that my 90s youth perception of what a “Hilton” should be could be so so wrong.

title: Not up to the normal doubletree by Hilton standards
text:
Stayed here for two nights.   Staff were all friendly.   Location is excellent.  Only a couple minutes walk from battery park (visiting Statue of Liberty).   

Breakfast in the restaurant was not very good.  It is typical small- mid size buffet selection but they were often out of key stuff.   You had to ask if you wanted anything.   Including water or a refill.  

Note that checkin /lobby is on the second floor.   Elevators are on the small side.  Only two worked during our time there.  A third was being fixed.   This led to LONG wait times for the elevator - even when not full.  I waited about 15 minutes to get down.   And I was able to get on the first one.   This is especially true in the morning rush time.   Other times the wait was less than 5 minutes.   

Out first room they have us was occupied.   I didn’t make some woman very happy when trying my key multiple times.   Oops.  

I ended up putting my bags in with the bellman (first floor) and went walking around.

When I got my room it was super tiny.   I couldn’t get my suitcase around the bed without lifting it over the bed to the other side which had a sitting chair and a desk chair there.   Get rid of the sitting chair so there is some room.   

The bathroom has a sliding door and is located two feet from the bed.   

The rooms are a bit noisy if you have noisy neighbors or if any talks in the hallway.  We also had the pleasure of having a crying baby on our Hhonors floor.   You could hear the baby like it was next to you.   

For now, I would pass on this Doubletree.   Staff was a bright spot.  Always friendly and willing to help.

title: Extra deposit but a lovely hotel
text:
After doing Camp America my boyfriend and I wanted to treat ourselves to a fancy hotel in New York. When we booked this hotel we got a good price, the location is perfect and the rooms are beautiful. We didn't really have much contact with the staff so I couldn't really comment whether they are friendly or not.
On arrival we got asked for more money for a deposit, which was mentioned on the confirmation email but in small print, I feel that this information should have been more noticeable. This hotel is a 5 minute walk away from wall street and close to Brooklyn bridge etc if you want to walk instead of taking the underground everywhere.
Overall, a lovely hotel in a great location.

title: Tony is the best
text: All of the staff are wonderful. They checked on us multiple times. Tony, the concierge, was fantastic. Kind, patient and helpful. The front desk staff were pleasant and efficient. Rooms were spotless every day. Bravo to all.

title: Small almost boutique
text:
With just 10 rooms per floor, this hotel is more like a boutique hotel. Small rooms and cramped halls, however it is convenient to Wall Street, Battery Park, South Street Seaport Museum, and the Staten Island ferries. 
The room was clean but the hallway was unusually dirty. Long waits for elevators was common.

Tip: got time to plan? The Federal Reserve Bank Museum which houses more gold than anywhere else on the planet and it’s free. It’s very close as is Federal Hall (also free) where America’s first government met before it moved to Philly for 10 years while Washington DC was created.

Tip: a ride on the Staten Island ferry is also free!

title: Soggiorno piacevole
text:
Sono stato con un amico dal 6 al 12 febbraio in questa struttura. Molti dicono di aver avuto problemi di attesa con gli ascensori ma non ho riscontrato questa cosa. Personale disponibilissimo e paziente, ci hanno dato anche una camera più comoda di quella richiesta, senza pagare tariffe in più. 
Pulizia eccellente.
Il Financial District è molto tranquillo e non c’è confusione durante la notte. Posizione perfetta vicino alla fermata di south ferry e whitehall, si può raggiungere Times Square in 20 minuti, così come per tutte le attrazioni principali. 
Dovessi tornare a NYC rialloggerei in questo hotel.

title: Gutes Hotel zu fairem Preis.
text:
Die eher mittelmäßige Bewertung hier bei Google wird dem Hotel nicht gerecht. Es gibt eigentlich nichts weiter zu bemängeln. Es sollte klar sein, dass man zu dem für New Yorker Hotels natürlich kein Luxushotel bekommt. Das Hotel hat aber alles, was man braucht. Lediglich die Straße in der das Hotel liegt hat nicht das schönste Ambiente, was aber auch an den Baustelle in der Straße liegt. 

Die Zimmer sind nicht all zu groß, aber mit großem komfortablem Bett, großem Fernseher, Schreibtisch und Sessel ausgestattet. Im Bad gab es die US-typische Wannen-Duschkombi. Die gesamte Zimmerausstattung war modern und minimalistisch und machte ziemlich neuen Eindruck.

Hevorzuheben ist das stabile und schnelle Internet. Es gab keine Verbindungsabbrüche und Youtubevideos ließen sich problemlos schauen.

In der näheren Umgebung gibt es alles was man braucht. Verschiedene Subway Stationen sind in direkter Nachbarschaft. Die Staten Island Ferry ist in 5min erreicht. An der Ecke gibt es einen kleinen Supermarkt. EIn größerer ist 10min entfernt.

title: Hôtel correct
text:
Hôtel correct avec un bon rapport qualité/situation/prix. 
La chambre correspondait à ma demande dans les étages supérieurs avec une belle vue sur le WTC. Peu de bruit à part la climatisation. Pas très grande mais nous sommes à New York!
Le mobilier n’est pas récent mais la chambre et la Sdb étaient propres. Ménage fait chaque jour de façon consciencieuse. 
Emplacement bien avec station de métro très proche et quartier calme le soir. 
L’hôtel ne fait pas rêver mais il est fonctionnel si on vient pour visiter NYC et pas pour passer du temps dans la chambre.

title: Great location, just needs attention some details (Don't let the Average rating scare you)
text:
For a hotel in Manhattan, known for small hotel room sizes, the rooms in this hotel are reasonably sized.  The desk is minimalist in size, I would prefer a larger desk, but it is workable.

This hotel practices energy efficiency in rooms lighting to a fault.  I couldn't get a confident read on color matches anywhere in the room!  Some hotels only provide one bright light in a room, this hotel managed to provide no bright lights.  Ironically, the best light in the room was the ceiling light over the door entry!!!  I found that to be an odd priority with respect to lighting.  If I was managing this hotel, I would replace some of the bulbs with efficient, higher light output versions.  It would make a big difference.

The bathroom mirror was well designed with respect to providing even lighting without shadows, with long diffused lights on the right and left side of the mirror.  The bulbs just aren't bright enough, emitting more of a glow instead of illuminating the area brightly. 

The sink is way off center from the mirror lights.  The sink is nearly aligned with one of the edge lights, resulting in an inconvenient shadow if you are using the sink (such as one would be when removing makeup or shaving).  

The shower was nice.  My particular shower had a couple of issues, however.  The drain was very slow, so during the shower I ended up standing in a deep puddle (nearly high enough to flow onto the bathroom floor).  The bottom 3 inches of the shower door were missing the splash seal, so that a significant amount of water escaped during the shower and created an inconvenient puddle on the floor outside the shower.

The phone in the room was filthy - the housekeeping staff needs to be trained to to wipe off the phones periodically.

I was awakened at least twice each night by noise in the hallway.  Apparently the door doesn't seal out noise very well and falls short of what other hotels in the class accomplish.

As others have noted, the elevator situation at this hotel is less than optimal.  The building is relatively new, but apparently had a poor architect that didn't think that a service elevator was essential (or centered sinks!).  During the day it is not uncommon to have a staff member with a cart consuming a significant portion of the elevator.  Just be prepared during peak times (such as 8am-9:30am) to wait excessively long for an elevator.

Despite the issues I have listed above, otherwise the hotel does a good job.  The door staff was very helpful and attentive.  The location was excellent.  It was an easy walk any where I needed to go.  I would stay here again.

title: Inexpensive stay in brand hotel
text: $87 a night for Manhattan!!! Rooms were standard Doubletree quality in an interesting area in the Financial District. Restaurants close by. World Trade Center memorial, Battery Park, Ferry, Seaport an easy walk.

title: Good value nice rooms
text: I have a pleasant stay. The staff were very attentive and willing to help. From  entrance front desk cleaning staff. I was in high floor and the view was nice. The bef very comfortable. I would recommend this hotel.

title: Great stay
text: We thought the price was great as was the location. The room was what I'd expect in NYC from a size perspective - not tons of room (we stayed in a king room). The shower is narrow. It was quiet at night, room was clean and comfortable, and staff was friendly. Parking is right around the corner ($40 self, $60 valet). Lots of bars and restaurants in walking distance. The bull and girl statues are right around the corner. The waterfront is within walking distance. Easy to reach the Holland Tunnel. Definitely recommend.

title: KIND OF SCARY!
text: Things to know before you book are... 1. This hotel only has 3 elevators to serve 44 floors leading to long wait times. Also, the staff use the same elevators to take loads of garbage down to the ground floors, to move furniture from floor to floor, etc. This means elevators are sometimes full of staff rather than guests and they don't exit the elevators to allow guests to use them.   2. There are only ice machines every 3 or 4 stories so you have to either wait for elevators or use the stairs to access an ice machine unless you are lucky enough to be on a floor with one.  I was using the stairs to go to another floor to get ice when I came upon a group of malodorous people having some sort of meeting in the stairwell. They grumbled as I squeezed by to go up the stairs. I did not use the stairs again and I warned my wife not to move about the hotel without me being present.  3. I noticed unsavory looking people outside the hotel smoking while sitting in nearby doorways or sitting on the steps of the near by subway station. I later found myself on the hotel elevator with some of the same people!??  4. As you'd expect, the bathrooms are small with only a small glass shelf above the toilet. If you are not careful, items can fall in the toilet.  5. My final advice regarding this hotel is you may want to check on the internet regarding this hotel as you may find some interesting things about it that staff can't tell you.

title: TERRIBLE
text: Dirty and old. They only thing about the hotel that was good is the free cookie on arrival and the service for your bags. The lifts take FOREVER and the caliber that stay in this hotel is not what you go on holiday for. Put me off ever going to another Double Tree again, can't believe Hilton put their name to this.

title: Flying Visit
text:
Location is everything - amenities a bit tired.
Lifts are very slow so get down to the lobby early or you can wait an age.
Otherwise its a pliant enough experience for the heart of the Wall Street district.

title: Nice place
text:
We got a great deal on a three night stay at the Doubletree, and it was worth every penny. The staff is very nice, the hotel is in a great location around the street from the Battery, the statue of liberty can be seen after a short walk, and there are several restaurants close by as well as a very convenient Starbucks and Duane Read around the corner.

We were staying on the 32nd floor, so word of warning, if you're staying on one of the upper floors you will have to wait anywhere between 3-10 minutes for an elevator depending on what time of the day you are trying to travel. 

Also, the seal on our shower didn't work, so we had to soak up the water on the floor after each shower, which was a hassle, but not a big deal and I doubt it's a problem in every room. We didn't bother to complain about it while we were there.

If you're a man over 6 feet or are traveling with a man over six feet tall, you may want to find other accommodations. My fiancé is  6'7, and his feet were hanging off the end of the king sized bed. We have a queen bed at home and it's not a problem, so the beds at the Doubletree run shorter than normal and you should be aware of that. I also was not a fan of the feather pillows because they don't hold their shape, but that's a personal preference.

The hotel is convenient to the Staten Island Ferry as well as the Whitehall and Bowling Green subway stops. Also, I was there with my family who were staying at a different hotel close by and the Doubletree staff were nice enough to give them cookies too. 
We had a room overlooking the river, which was great. Everyone was so nice and so is the hotel.

title: Correct
text: Ne pas se fier à la rue pas très accueillante ni au sas pour accéder au premier niveau pour juger l'hôtel, cela ressemble à l'entrée du personnel. Des le niveau 2(la réception) les choses s'améliorent.  c'est propre c'est confortable le personnel est charmant (comme beaucoup de personnes à New York), c'est idéalement situé au sud de manathan à deux pas de la statue de la liberté, du pont de brooklyn, wall street . Très proche du métro ligne rouge verte et jaune donc très pratique pour se rendre uptown. Bref pas mal pour un budget correct.

title: Nice Room with a view of New York Harbor/Hudson River
text: We had a great time at the Doubletree Financial District.  The room was smaller than what we are used to, but quite frankly, it was done well and we loved the view of the river. We were on the 41st Floor, so we were able to see the boats go back and forth and the sunsets over the river were beautiful. For the money, we thought it suited our needs.  We like the fact that it is close to Battery Park and walking distance of the Freedom Tower, Trinity Church and Wall Street.  They did accomodate our request for early check in.  We plan on going back there soon.

title: Top Lage und super Ausblick
text:
Wir waren gerade 6 Tage in diesem wirklich gutem Hotel.
Es war alles sauber die Mitarbeiter sehr freundlich und hilfbereit sogar ein neues Zimmer mit schönerem Ausblick habe ich sofort auf Nachfrage bekommen.
Zimmer 4103 hat wirklich einen grandiosen Ausblick auf das One World Trade Center und auch die Größe und Ausstattung ist sehr angenehm.
Die Fahrstuhlproblematik ist nicht so schlimm wie manchmal beschrieben natürlich muss gewartet werden aber das war zumindest jetzt im Januar nicht das große Problem. 
Auch die Lage ist sehr gut und eher ruhig das ist sehr angenehm wenn man Abends aus dem belebtem Uptown in Downtown ankommt.
Tolle Möglichkeiten zum Einkaufen, Essen und Frühstücken gibt es direkt ums Eck.
(Tip Essen/Trinken: Murphy's Tavern direkt nebenan)
(Tip: Frühstück: Flavors hier gibt es für faire Preise ein super frisches Frühstück)

Wir werden beim nächsten Besuch von New York wieder dieses Hotel buchen.

title: Great Location and Comfy Room
text: Overall was a great stay for the price I paid. Wish the rooms were a little bigger and that it had a tub, but still good. Didn't really enjoy the food from the restaurant that provided the room service. The area I stood had great tourist attractions. Would stay at a Double Tree again.

title: Frequent trips to NYC
text: Great area if you are doing business in the financial district. Great choices for breakfast and lunch. Some options for dinner but gets a little slow after 6pm due to this area being business oriented. Have a few places to go and get a couple of drinks also. Parking is a little on the higj end....but that is just Manhattan.

title: Basic Hotel Accommodations in NYC
text: We selected this hotel because it was in the Financial District and close to an event that we were attending.  The room was small but very comfortable and provided what we needed for a short stay.  The staff was professional and responsive but not very friendly.  The breakfast was poor in selection of food and quality.  The elevators were slow but adequate.  Overall, comfortable and clean at a fair price.

title: So unfortunate
text: The cost for parking was ridiculous on top the additional charge for USING your car! a joke! Rooms, small, dark. Area not around great places to eat nor did I feel safe walking alone at night. Yea, I know its NYC, but really...Took 45 minutes for them to get me my car from Valet parking? To park myself was just a few dollars less and farther away. Not a good stay and left for something in Jersey City that was far better, cleaner, larger, accommodating, and only $20.00 to park my car ALL WEEK as I was there for work.

title: Caught a deal. Good experience
text: I absolutely love the double Tree. However the elevator service was not the best. There were only 3 elevators for over 40 floors and one elevator stopped working during my stay. Other then that the employees were pretty nice. Room was small but manageable. Overall good experience, just minor things to improve on. Would definitely return. Also microwaves or refrigerators would be so helpful! Limited rooms with those items!

title: GREAT DEAL, DECENT AREA
text: Tina at the desk was always helpful!! Friendly, and great at giving us directions... Thanks, Tina!! The beds were very comfortable. Our room was on the smaller side and one of the elevators was down making for looong wait times to get the elevator but other than that. We had a good time

title: хорошее расположение и всё
text:
Совет N1 - при бронировании пользуйтесь ресурсом прайслайн 
т.к. можно взять номер на 20-60 % дешевле официальной цены) мы так и сделали . В Америке это работает прекрасно, в Европе хуже.
Совет N-2 - окна не на улицу! Что было не удачно -окна на улице и 5:30 с нами проснулся весь город, желтые такси сигналили не переставая, а когда нужен отдых и надо выспаться необходима  тишина .
Что было хорошо- из такси встретили, багаж взяли,сопроводили до номера.
Итак, Priceline - это аукцион, где вы являетесь единственным участником. Идея аукциона построена на том, что в ряде дорогих отелей часто пустуют номера, но отдавать их по дешевке для уважаемых отельеров - плохой тон, поэтому они номера отдают с большой скидкой не напрямую, а через аукцион.
Чтобы начать участие в аукционе надо указать даты заезда, город (район) и звездность желаемого отеля и предложить свою цену. Ответом будет "Да" или "Нет". Если «Нет» - вы можете продолжать повышать цену. Если "Да" - с вас снимут деньги и назовут отель, в котором вам предстоит остановиться. Отель вы узнаете только после списания денег, возврат денег невозможен

title: Overnight business stay
text: Office is located a few blocks away.  This hotel is very convenient and reasonably priced.  Staff is always pleasant.  I have stayed here multiple times and the experience has been consistent.  I would recommend this hotel.

title: 2nd stay at this property, not as pleased as 1st time
text:
This was my 2nd time staying at this property.  I was not as impressed as the first time.   I was greeted upon arrival on Sunday, 1/14/18 on the street level by a long line of people waiting for the elevator.   Some had been there for a while.  In a building that is 44 stories there has to be more than two elevators working especially in the evening when many people are arriving. Because of the hotel's layout with check-in on the second floor, that means two waits to get up to my room.   After a while I gave up on the elevator and made my way with heavy suitcase, laptop, and another item and schlepped up the steps to the 2nd floor lobby, where yet another several people were camped out waiting for the same elevators.

I was checked in quickly since I had bypassed those who were still downstairs waiting.  My Hilton Honors Diamond status was recognized with 2 water bottles.  Although I had checked in a day ahead and selected a room on the 30th floor, staff had upgraded me to the 44th floor, which I believe is the highest.

The room was again what one would expect in NYC.   Tiny with best use possible made of the space available.  Bathroom leaves noplace to put down any toiletry bags or the items themselves.

Good night of sleep and minimal noise from outside at that altitude.  However, the heat could have been a little quieter.  Controlling the temperature of the room was fairly easy once I got the hang of the thermostat.

In the morning, I could not get hot water for a shower.  It was ice cold despite the fact I ran it for 20 minutes.  One negative aspect of the shower is that where the only door is placed, one has to put their hands through the flow of water to turn the shower on or off or adjust temperature.  That made it more uncomfortable since it was very cold.

When I checked in, the front desk assured me that breakfast would start at 6 AM. I even verified this knowing it would be a holiday, and they said yes it would be open.  So around 6:30 I took another elevator ride to the ground floor lobby, to find the restaurant closed.  Back upstairs again , and then I went down again at 7 AM and it was open.  I was able to partake of the buffet quickly and be on my way.  The food was good, and I appreciated it being on the house.

Upon check-out, I told the front desk about the water issue, and I was told that it was known that the 44th floor had a problem and that maintenance was addressing it.  That would do me no good, since I was already leaving.  I did not complain about the elevators, since the evening crowds waiting for it had to be witnessed by the staff the night before.  I did receive an apology for the water temperature as I scratched the dandruff out of my hair and heaved my luggage back down the stairs to the ground level to avoid one more elevator wait.

There  are many hotels in this area, and generally those in the financial district are better priced than Midtown.  If you have nothing to do but wait for elevators, this property comes recommended.  Once you do get to the room you paid for, it is comfortable.  It's also easy to get to from subways in the South Ferry area.

title: Great Hotel
text: I stayed at this hotel for two days with my friend during December. The hotel is nice, cozy and comfortable. The services are great, too. What I like about this hotel is that you will receive warm cookie for each and everyone of you whenever you do your check-in. The only problem is that the room is a bit small.

title: Great hotel and location; excellent customer service
text:
You are far enough away from the NYC chaos but also close enough to get back to it. Great spot with lots of subway stations around it and excellent ammenities. 

Great customer service as well. My girlfriend and I arrived a little early and were in a pinch with a show on Broadway at 2 p.m. Vanessa was outstanding and helped us get a room and also we were treated with welcome cookies. Thanks to all, highly recommended.

title: Mediocre hotel. Would not recommend
text: The rooms are small and cramped. There are over 40 floors and 2 working elevators.  Takes 20min to go up or down via elevators. My room was not cleaned. The only came in to make the bed. Not worth money.

title: Very reasonable
text: We usually stay at the Hilton a Times Square but opted for walk near the ferry and museum. Reasonably priced for Manhattan and quite convenient to subway. I would give a 5 plus for the hotel front desk. Sheniece fabulous went above and beyond!!! Friendly patient and knowledgeable. I stayed on 44th floor, bathroom decent size. Remember it’s New York. My only complaint is that no hot water in my room which is major. They offered to change rooms which is a hassle repacking and I was trying to make a show. They deserve a 5 for customer service

title: Great Location
text: We were able to use the subway a lot because there is a station right across the street.  The staff was friendly and helpful when needed.  I saw many being helped with transportation, we did not need that service, but if it was a need, I feel confident that it would have been handled professionally.

title: Great hotel
text:
My wife and stayed at this hotel 30 Dec thru Jan 6 2018 and were very pleased,with the accommodations . 
We were at this hotel during the winter storm that hit NY during this time period and our flight was cancelled. The hotel was very and helpful in extending our stay a couple days. This really eased our minds at that time.
The staff was very welcoming us to NY and were always willing to assist us in our stay.

title: Excellent Rooms and location!
text:
We booked this hotel for 13 nights during the Christmas and New Year period.  The hotel is on Stone Street and has a subway station less than a minute walk which takes you pretty much to mid-town and upwards.

We chose to walk as much as possible and managed most of our destinations.  

The staff in the hotel and restaurant (breakfast buffet) were courteous and delivered an excellent service.

The gym facilities were decent for this type of hotel.

The elevators took time to arrive and sometimes we had to wait for over 5 minutes during the peak morning periods which was a bit painful, but we managed to use the stairs as part of "exercising".

I would recommend anyone staying at NYC to visit this hotel because the rooms were not too expensive and it was in a fairly quiet part of town - it may also be because were were there during the Christmas holiday season! might be buzzing in the summer I am sure.

title: Consigliatissimo
text: Ho alloggiato in questo hotel dal 23 dicembre al 2 gennaio ed è stato tutto favoloso! ubicato davvero bene ad un passo dalla linea gialla (e non solo), senza nessuna necessità di chiamare taxi. Le stanze sono un pò piccole ma sono dotate di un'estrema pulizia, materasso molto alto e comodo con riscaldamento impeccabile; toilette accessoriata con ottimi prodotti da bagno, fono compreso e sostituzione giornaliera degli asciugamani (molti in dotazione). Stanza dotata di tutti i comfort necessari (phone, frigobar, bollitore, cassaforte, ferro da stiro...).Personalmente lo consiglio.

title: Taille de la chambre non conforme
text: Nous avions réservé une chambre avec 2 lits double (4 adultes) pour un séjour d'une semaine. A notre arrivée, agréablement surpris car pour la 1ère nuit, nous avons eu le plaisir d'avoir 2 chambres séparées et communiquantes. Notre chambre était petite et les lits en 120 et non 140. Heureusement, la situation idéale dans le quartier de Wall Street et à 2 mn du métro a permis de passer un très bon séjour. Personnel d'étage très agréable, il n'en est pas de même pour la réception.

title: Satisfaisant
text:
Séjours 10 jours  en famille de 8 personnes avec 4 chambres.
Réservation de 4 chambres identiques mais à l arrivée: 2 chambres plus grandes que les autres sur-classement  ou declassement???? Nous resterons dans le doute....
Demande de grouper les chambres partiellement effectuée,nous étions  tous au même étage mais certain à l opposé de l immense couloir.
Hotel très bien situé (proche metro), calme dans l ensemble.chambre propre et très bien chauffé (new york en décembre très froid) 
Personnel à la réception fait son job mais pas plus.(personne ne parle français)
Intervention équipe technique très rapide pour problème de mitigeur de douche.
Nous avons pas pris le petit déjeuner à l hotel car le prix est un peu élevé: 25 dollars le buffet.
Possibilité  de boire et manger dans un rayon de 50 mètres. Evitez  la boutique THE MILL onéreux et surtout vraiment pas aimable.
Surtout ne pas prendre le wifi (15 dollars par jour) qui est un peu élevé. Gratuit dans le hall.
Photos de notre chambre du 11 eme

title: Worst Hotel
text: This hotel houses homeless people, I felt very unsafe.There was always sketchy people in the elevator and the entrance of the hotel.The hotel is very dingy and dirty I was highly disappointed.Staff could not answer simple questions about joining Hilton Honors, parking, or restaurants they basically didn't know anything.There was no doorman when I arrived just a couple of rough looking teenagers hanging out by the elevators,I will not return and I do not recommend.

title: Great place to be
text: Great hotel and view , good service and the added restaurant is a bonus , they greeted us with cookies as the Hilton way, the valet greeted us and gave us pointers on places to visit and also took care of our car before it was parked

title: problems adjusted
text: After a bad check in experience and poor staff performance, our bill was generously adjusted.  We were made to wait for our room to be cleaned and then we were forgotten.  Evidently the cleaners did not respond and the second shift of desk personnel were snippy and dismissive.

title: Bon hôtel proche de Time square
text:
Un hôtel de qualité, un service impeccable autant que discret.
Bien situé à 10 minutes à pied de Time square, proche d'une bouche de métro et pas loin de commerces de bouche, notemmment d'un Dunkin'Donuts.
Le seul hic l'accès aux ascenseurs à partir de 10h et vers 17h.
Une souchette serait agréable pour la toilette du bas du dos car le seul pommeau de douche demande d'être très souple.....
Le bruit de la climatisation est un peu fort

title: Comfortable, and Cookies are great as always but annoying to go up and down
text: I stayed at this hotel with my fiancee over Xmas break.  The staff was fantastic and as always the fresh baked cookies were a huge treat (especially after coming in from the cold).  My only qualms with the hotel are the fact that it is so tall and not wide so there were only three working elevators.  We often had to wait soooo long to get up to and down from our room.  The bathrooms were also on the smaller side. I wish they made the room itself smaller and had a bigger shower stall and more counter space.  As a fairly broad shouldered individual I couldn't turn around in the shower without bumping into the door or the wall.

title: Beware of the elevators.
text: We usually stay in Times Square during our numerous visits to the big Apple but this time decided to stay in the FiDi. The rate was good, staff was friendly and the restaurant was fine. Unfortunately the 44 floors of guests proved too much for three elevators and we were forced to use the stairs. Next time we’ll stay central and avoid the traffic/timely Uber rides. Time is money.

title: Great hotel!
text: The rooms were nice and clean, they were small but that is what you are going to get in NYC. The staff was super friendly and helped out however they could. It was a simple and quick check in and check out process. There were 5 subway stops within a 2 block radius which made getting anywhere pretty easy.

title: Worse hotel stay everq
text: I stayed at this property from dec 1st-3rd. Soon as we got there around 11am we wanted to store our luggage the bellman wasn’t there 10min later he shows up and we are off to roam the city. St We got back to check in around 4pm it was about 15 people on the ground floor waiting after waiting around 20min we walked up to the 2nd fl lobby it was around 20 people waiting for elevators. This hotel has only 3 elevators for 49floors and the cleaning staff took over one of them to take out trash at such a convenient time of 330. That showed poor customer service by them not to get off and let guest go their rooms. Fast forward to later that evening I go to wash my hands and the water is scalding hot I burn my hands call the desk which she was very nice she called maintenance and couldn’t get problem fixed they changed rooms and the next room the water is ice cold and this time it takes them a hour to fix thru all this we miss our dinner reservations. The next day more of the same mess with elevators. This was my gf first time to nyc and this hotel left a nasty taste in her mouth because she couldn’t get to her fave restaurant. Needless to say I wouldn’t recommend this hotel if going to nyc I’m going to my normal Doubletree on 52nd and Lexington I would advise others to do the same

title: cleanliness lacking
text: We love the Hilton and have had wonderful experiences with it's cleanliness and Freshness... hoping the Double Tree would be the same. Well... the service was good but the stench of "cleaners/air fresheners" was enough to put us off permanently! (we HAD requested no fragrant cleaners/fresheners because of Asthma)  We smelled urian in the bathroom and had to keep our window open WITH air-conditioner on the entire time. Do feel fortunate we had windows to open though! At the price we missed the refrigerator.

title: Losing my support - lifts ridiculous and inhabitants unsavoury
text:
Location is good so have to cut it some slack. However, the average waiting time for a lift was over 5 minutes, sometimes 10, when the first one is full. There are some extremely scruffy (not that big a deal) but also very fragrant smelling guests now seeming to be in the same lift as me between 9am and 8pm. Earlier or later and fortunately do not come across them. Is the Hilton housing homeless people?

Spending 17 days in such a hotel is not a good experience.

title: A question about credit card
text:
I'm sorry 
I would like to know if you accept all credit card like postepay Evolution MasterCard that is a prepaid credit card with IBAN...
Or is it possible to pay the caution Also by cash.
We booked and paid everything before but I know that it is necessary to pay a caution and I don't know how much is it
Thank you

title: Excellent room and very helpful service
text: The room was a great size and tastefully appointed with modern but comfortable flare. In particular I want to point out the staff, from the folks working the baggage area, to the receptionist. They were incredibly helpful in a number of ways that went above and beyond what they needed to. Gave me a big warm fuzzy feeling about NYC in general. Thanks!

title: Excellent Rating
text: Absolutely wonderful hotel; very close to  metro.  Parking garage only 1 block away.  Met by baggage greeter at the door, who assisted with luggage and brought up to the room.  Room maid was very nice and professional.

title: Look further
text: This property has seen better days - from the peeling paint in our bathroom and the out of service elevators to the staff that cannot communicate.  Very disappointing - only plus is the proximity to attractions in the Battery.  We requested a room away from the elevator and were placed directly adjacent to one and the service area where clanging dishes sounded at 4 a.m.

title: Exceelent stay
text: Love it the price was great for NYC Room was just the right size  and very comfortable I would defiantly stay here again if I need a place to stay when I visit NYC big enough for 2 people  and location was great, Staff was very accommodating

title: Nice rooms and great staff...but
text: Be prepared for the slowest elevator service you can imagine.  44 stories and only 3 lethargic elevator cars.  If it's winter, be patient waiting for hot water.  On the plus side, the rooms are small but well appointed and comfortable.  The staff is outstanding and helpful.  The restaurant and bar are exceptional.

title: Great location but not the DoubleTree experience I was expecting
text:
This hotel was just ok... It's a tall building with only a few rooms per floor on the upper floors, but it did lack some expected features like a mini fridge and an alarm clock in the room. It was on a weird street downtown that GPS and Uber had an impossible time finding, so I don't expect a quick pick up. Taxi cabs do come around on occasion though and the hotel is on the corner of an R train station and a block and a half from the Bowling Green train station. The elevator situation is a mess... There's only 3 elevators and they are slow to put it mildly. What's worse is the reception area is on the 2nd floor, so your first impression of the place is a long wait just to get to the 2nd floor to check in, then a long wait to get back on the elevator to your room. There's 44 floors so forget about taking the stairs!

The good things about this hotel is it's location for everything else. You're walking distance to the famous wall street bull, freedom tower and everything else in the financial district.

title: Elevator Hell
text: I've given you this several times. Your elevators suck. Your employees are constantly taking them to the cellar - even when they have no reason to do so (they could walk a flight of stairs unless they have something too large to manage). You know this. If you don't know this you are in the wrong business. The guy who checked me in could not have cared less that I was unhappy about my 27yh floor room. He checked the computer and did nothing other than refuse me based on that.

title: Not up to Doubletree or Hilton standards
text: While not awful, this property just does not meet the standards I've come to expect from a Doubletree or Hilton hotel. The room - I won't call it a suite, because it was NOT - was small even by NYC standards. A suite means, to me anyway, two rooms. This was basically a room with a sofa bed and a king bed.
