Very disappointing, considering 2 beds were cheaper. The room itself had ratty furniture and a toilet seat that nearly came off. The sink and shower were nice, as was having a fridge. The Junior Suites are on low floors, so don't expect a view. Being low also meant very full elevators at times when going down. Staff were universally polite and pleasant. The people were, by far, the best part of the hotel! The cookies were a close 2nd! If my wife and I traveled alone, I would consider this hotel again, but for 2 couples, it wasn't a very "suite" deal!

title: Very pleased!
text: From the moment we checked in we knew we'd chosen the right hotel. The staff was extremely helpful, considerate, and friendly. The location is ideal for experiencing anything in the city with access to the subway just a few steps from the hotel, as well as plenty of great pubs and restaurants just a block away. The room was clean and the view of the river and Staten Island Ferry was super! It made for the perfect hotel for our anniversary trip, with a nice complimentary bottle of bubbly to get the celebration started!!!

title: Congested is an understatement
text:
Pro:
Room was a little spacious for NY standard, standing shower, bed and pillows were very comfortable.
Nice TV - good channels. Quiet, at 44th floor at least.

Con:
Customer Service - The DoubleTree Hilton page says we will get welcome cookies - none.
When we booked the room 1 month prior, we asked for a quiet room with a view. We got a beautiful view of....buildings.
I called the hotel right after booking through TravelZoo to mention that we did submit a request that we will be on our honeymoon. The hotel said it's not in their notes and will get that added.
Also that we might be arriving around 9am, can we check in early if a room is available - the answer was absolutely!
When we called from the airport asking the status of the room, we spoke to LaTonya and she was very curt and dismissive - we don't have a room available and there is nothing she can do about it, and hung up.
When we arrived at 12pm, no honeymoon notes as well. We checked in and went up to the 44th floor, only to find the key card was not working. So, another 15 minutes waiting for elevator, down to 2nd floor lobby, and... just too tired to even explain.
And we got a plate of fruits for our honeymoon. Fruits. Really?

Structure - What you see in the page is NOT the entrance of this hotel, it's the WINDOW of their restaurant.
The entrance is on the side, congested. And the restaurant is congested, the lobby is on 2nd floor (strange) and you guessed it, congested.
3 elevators for 44 floors and they are not programmed to run simultaneously. So, unless you wake up super early and return super late, expect to wait at least 15 minutes for the elevator.
Not to mention the running elevator will stop at all the floors where people want to get on, and the worst thing is if you want to go to the lobby, you have to get off on 2nd floor and wait another 15 minutes to get to the ground floor. 
With large bags, the elevator can squeeze in 3 people.

Cafe - they are very partial towards the business patrons rather than the tourists. No one really paid attention to us. The coffee was good though, never tried the food, cos the place was congested.

Heating - the room was overly warm at night. We had the air conditioning down to 65F, but it did not help. We got up a couple of times at night to get water as the heat made our throats very dry.

Room - the carpet was very dusty, like it was hastily vacuumed and only on the major area of the room. My husband bent down to pick something that rolled under the bed and could not stop sneezing afterwards.
The coffee area only had 1 creamer.

Bathroom - I liked the standing shower, but figuring out the water temperature was a pain. It was either freezing cold water, or scalding hot shower. We never got the happy medium. we took scalding hot showers.
The shower gel and shampoo were Lemon Verbena scent and were in very tiny bottles, which were alright.

Tools - the hairdryer worked great, but there was hair on the comb that was in the little sack the hairdryer was in, so, that was gross.

Accessibility - Great! Right down the street Staten Island ferry, Bowling Green Subway station, Statue Cruises. It takes 15-20 minutes to get to Times Square. There is Chipotle and a pharmacy right around the corner.

All in all, I would say, the cons outweighs the pro and I am not sure if I would book at this hotel again. I would however, recommend this hotel for its great rate.

title: Gita organizzata
text:
Abbiamo effettuato una gita a New York con mia moglie e ci siamo trovati ad alloggiare in questo hotel .
Hotel situato praticamente al centro di Manhattan a pochi passi da Times Square dal Moma e da tutte le attrazioni di Manhattan veramente carino accogliente e pulito personale sempre a disposizione e gentile Ci ritorneremo

title: A great view from 42nd floor
text: The rooms are good from US standards, don't expect them the same like India.  But yes 42nd floor provided me a great view.  Food is same all 7 day, when it comes to breakfast.  But yes the location is awesome, close to Wall Street, Charging Bull.  If its work awesome place to be.  Has a Subway station Whitehall street within 30 seconds.  Starbucks, Dukkin Donuts... coffee shop, nice pubs all within the vicinity of the hotel.

title: Showing it;'s age....
text: This hotel is quite run down, the elevators are very slow and very small, no water was lfet in my room after cleaning, so I had to request it be delivered, there was no cold water in bathroom, making showers very tricky, there was paint peeling from the ceiling, and outside is a noisy construction area. The room was also very small.

title: Location is good. That is it.
text:
We stayed here for business at NYSE. Hotel is located just a couple blocks away so we could easily walk there. Staff was also very friendly and helpful. However reasons to avoid this hotel far outweigh the positives:
*rooms are extremely small. Expected for NYC however it seems like they have made the "king" sized bed shorter to accommodate the small room. I am only 5'7" and my feet were hanging off the end if my head was not right at the headboard. 
*showers are very tiny. Husband had to shower sideways. 
*no counter space. Sink took up the entire vanity top so all toiletries have to go on toilet or shelf below sink. Not convenient when applying makeup. 
* shower leaked all over bathroom floor and onto carpeted area outside of bathroom. 
*elevator situation was horrible. We needed to change between events and had to wait in line  for over 15 minutes. Some people in our group walked up 25+ flights to avoid elevators. 
*i think other people have mentioned this but I do believe they have long term section 8 or equivalent residents living on some floors. 
*street level entrance looks like a service area. You have to take the elevator (or walk) to the 2nd floor to official lobby. Very frustrating to people trying to check in during the peak elevator time. 

I have stayed at the Ritz in battery park for not much more than the cost of this room so consider that if you don't mind walking a little more.

title: Small, clean room
text:
I visited NYC over the summer, and I thought the rates were very fair for that time. The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of great restaurants. And of course, with it being in Manhattan, you can easily access the rest of the city by subway for sightseeing.

The service was also really friendly. No issues with housekeeping. The room was average - it was pretty small, but very understandable considering how sparse space is, especially in Manhattan. 

The only real complaint I have is how slow the elevators were. If you're on a lower floor, you would be doing yourself a favor by skipping the elevators completely and just take the stairs. Anyone on the upper floors - good luck. Waiting a full 15 minutes for the elevators should not surprise you.

title: Pleasantly Surprised!
text: I booked this online and was pleasantly surprised!  I have been to NYC quite often and this hotel find was great.  The staff meet us with a  smile and Latoya who worked behind the desk offered great customer service.  The Lobby was clean and decorated wonderful!  After I checked in we were offered fresh baked cookies and free water.  We went up to the room and had a beautiful view of World Trade Tower and was close walking distance to the pier for the statue of Liberty Boat Tours.  Although the room was a little on the small side it was clean and was great for the money.  When we checked out they offered to hold our luggage while we walked around the city some more and Tony and Alex went over and above to make sure they held our luggage AND even took care of calling us a cab when we left.  Very very nice staff and will definitely stay there again!

title: Mixed Bag...
text: I had a pleasant 2 night stay over a weekend, but this property definitely has pros and cons.   The pros include competitive weekend rates as compared to mid-town hotels, a friendly and courterous staff, and good location with easy access to Metro lines, Staten Island Ferry, and attractions in lower Manhatten.   The cons related the overall design and condition of the building.  The entrance is very under whelming...in fact I initially thought I was using the service entrance, as the dim and narrow space contained linen/service carts, and some checked luggage.  Fortunately a friendly staff member pointed me to the second floor lobby for check in.   As others have noted, the elevators are small, and it appears there are only two available to service guests for a 40 story building resulting, in long waits during peak periods.   Finally, the condition of the room left something to be desired.  While modern in decor and generally clean, it was definitely well used, with damaged bathroom and lighting fixtures, peeling ceiling paint, and torn curtains.   These items are not unusual for a well used hotel frequented by business travelers, but still sub-par to other Hilton properties I've had experience with.   If you can get a good rate, than still probably worth it, but during peak periods when deals are scarce it's worth spending a bit more else where for better conditions.

title: Disappointing
text: The rooms were nice and very typical for NYC rooms - small but clean and our room was updated and fine.  And the great subway access is hard to beat.  However, there are not enough elevators and everyone was complaining about the long waits and "hitting every floor" rides.  The breakfast was not good at all - including milk that had soured.   It is also obvious that some of the rooms are rented as a sort of hostel or Section 8 type of housing.  I applaud the effort but it sometimes makes for unusual elevator mates.  The staff does it's best - all were courteous, but this hotel just misses the mark. All in all, a mixed stay.  You could do worse but you could also do better.

title: Don’t waste your money
text: This property is in a good location but incredibly overpriced.  It is at best mediocre.  The bed was great and the room was generally clean, but could not get anyone to answer the phone in room service for 2 days (the restaurant was fully staffed and empty when I went down after trying to make a breakfast order).  The unforgivable sin is the housekeeper letting herself into my room twice while the “do not disturb” sign was hanging on the door.  I’d like to believe that unless I’ve overstated my reservation or there is some emergency (I hadn’t and there wasn’t), the staff would respect my desire to not be bothered.

title: Thanksgiving stay
text: We stayed here for 4 nights over Thanksgiving.  The reception staff on arrival were very friendly.  Our rooms were a good size and nice and clean.  The location was great... it was nice and quiet in the financial district over thanksgiving.  We could walk easily to the subway at Bowling Green or South Ferry.  The Staten Island ferry was a short walk away, as was Battery Park, Wall Street, the raging bull, 9/11 memorial and One World tower.  It's easy to get a subway uptown.  The only disappointment for us about the hotel was the breakfast. I've stayed in many Hilton hotels including Doubletree and this was the worst breakfast I've had.  Food was mediocre, facilities are dark and dingy, and the staff unhelpful... tables not set for breakfast, having to ask for food to be topped up and cutlery to eat with, no tea for two days running! (There was a store at the end of the road where someone could have popped out and bought some teabags!) I would advise finding somewhere else to eat breakfast, but the rooms comfortable.  Our check out receptionist also had a poor attitude which was a bit disappointing, but the bell boy was very helpful about getting us to the airport. Would stay here again but definitely not have the breakfasts.

title: Great Customer Service
text: I left the hotel early in the morning and forgot my Bluetooth headset.  I called the hotel and they had found it.  When I asked if they could return it via mail, I was told no problem.  In the past when I have left personal items in a hotel getting them back was always a challenge.  I was very happy with this customer service

title: Excellent location for financial district, but tired & old
text: Looks like the hotel has seen much better days, in need of refurbishment and refurbishing. That said, the room was comfortable and everything worked. Excellent location for business in the financial district.

title: Lovely Hotel - good location
text: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights over Thanksgiving.  Hotel staff are really nice and very helpful.  The location is very good, close to 3 subway stations and there are some nice bars and restaurants nearby.  Walking distance to Staten Island ferry station, 9/11 memorial, Wall Street and Battery Park.  The lifts are a wee bit of an issue if you are using them at peak times but outwith those times we had no problems.  The rooms are a good size, clean and well kept.  Would recommend this hotel and would happily stay here again.

title: Très bon Hôtel
text:
Nous avons séjourné 3 nuits dans cet hôtel. La chambre est bien entretenue, propre, silencieuse (20eme étage) et la literie est très bonne. L’accès au métro est facile d’accès depuis cette hôtel et vous avez des restaurants et bar très sympa autour. 
Toutefois le seul bémol est concernant le petit déjeuner. En effet à part du café et du jus de fruits, il n’y a pas de thé ni de chocolat chaud. 
Le buffet est pauvre en viennoiserie. dommage pour ceux qui n’aime pas le bacon et les œufs brouillés. 
Enfin le personnel devrait être un peu plus à l’écoute des clients.

title: Hôtel bruyant et personnel tres desagreable
text:
L hotel est classique, bien placé vs le métro mais il est bruyant et mal isolé. 
Le personnel est très désagréable et le petit déjeuner est une horreur. 
Les plats sont visés et mettent un temps fou à être rempli. Le personnel aussi bien à la réception qu' au resto n en a rien à faire du client. 
Nous l avons fait dans le cadre d un voyage organisé de 4j mais à déconseiller a titre perso

title: Ottimo
text:
Un hotel con camere splendide Pulitissime, bagno accessoriato con ottimi prodotti da bagno, letto King side confortevolissimo.
All'arrivo nella hall offrono un mega cookie caldo (!). Buonissima e varia la colazione.
Vicinissimo alla metro e con i dispenser del ghiaccio in vari piani

title: NOT A REAL HILTON/DOUBLETREE
text: Choose another property if you don't want to stay in a hostel No reception area, lack of elevators mean you may have to wait 15 mins to get one, then spend 10 mins getting to the lobby stopping at most floors on the way up/down

title: Enjoyable Stay
text: Overall enjoyable stay. Rooms were always clean and tidy. Appreciated the modern and sleek decor/ bathroom.  Business district is quiet at night, unlike tourist attracting areas of midtown or Times Square. Had no issues that other guests did of homeless despite coming in and out of the hotel many times...so either I didn't encounter any or I just wasn't able to discern them from normal guests. Overall enjoyed stay with boyfriend and would definitely stay again!

title: OLD and lack of service
text: I am not sure why the Doubletree brand does not value HHonors members. My family stayed here and I can not understand why even the suites get no service. In a room that accommodates 4, you will get 2 towels and despite the request,  you will need to call for the extra towels every day. My biggest disappointment is that the hotel is aware of who book thru Hilton and who is part of their loyalty program. There was no water in the rooms as part of the Gold HHonors program and asking for any type of service seemed to be an inconvenience for the hotel. When I called to raise the complain, Andreanis was very quick to say that she was not responsible and was not her the one to point the finger at. I am sorry, you work for a brand you represent the brand. After this experience and after almost 10 years as a gold HHonors member we are switching brands. Why be loyal when experiences like this are now more and more frequent.

title: Nice Room---Absolutely No Service
text: This Doubletree knows how to move people in an out of their hotel quickly---and how to keep their rooms clean and well-presented. But there is no service of any kind. Reception does not answer phones, maintenance does not come to fix things. It is a second rate operation---but well worth it if the price is low. The fact that the hotel manager wastes his time responding to these reviews--instead of helping to provide service---is good enough example of what a poorly run operation it is.

title: Decent location, albeit remote from centre
text:
Stayed for 1 night as had meeting in Downtown 9-10 Nov 2017. However, come evening, it feels a bit isolated in quite downtown when the Midtown central New York comes alive hence a bit of a travel. Hotel OK but furnishing and upholstery seems dated/ageing. Hotel is regarded as 4 star but not to the high standards seen in Europe and Middle East. It treads on the same path as the American airliners where service standards seems to be somewhat different from the rest of Europe and the Middle East. 
No refrigerator in the room which seems to be odd for a supposedly a 4 star hotel. 
There are only 2 lifts/elevators which is not sufficient and seems to take ages to arrive (expect to keep 8-15 mins on hand just to come down or go up in busy times).
Breakfast is good if not the best, but a word of caution - entry for breakfast seems to finish 15 mins before the closing time hence best to be there with good time on hand.

No concierge but ground floor staff can assist with odd queries.

Overall, staff are great and polite.

Tip. Close to 2 subway stations, Bowling Green and South Ferry so one need to choose carefully which one to walk as they are in two different directions/can take two different routes which may involve unnecessarily interchange at later point hence save time.  

Also Duene Reade pharmacy and US Post office nearby.

title: Good Location with Friendly Staff
text:
We stayed overnight at the hotel before our cruise.  Being in the Financial District it is in a good location for many attractions.  Staff member Wallace, was extremely helpful and gave us the directions we needed.

Rooms are generally not available until after 3:00 pm but reception staff were helpful and did their best to find us a room and 30 mins after arriving at the hotel we were able to check-in and get out and explore Manhattan.

Our small room was situated by a lift and also an “in demand” ice machine, consequently the exterior noises contributed to a poor nights sleep and I was pleased we were only there for one night.

Buffet breakfast the next morning had a reasonable choice but food was not very appetising.

title: Netjes
text: Hotel is netjes op 50 meter van het metrostation, alwaar men makkelijk richting alle zijden van New York kan gaan reizen en alle top attracties kan gaan bezoeken op 20 minuten met metro van central parc. Hotel is een Beetje basic en weinig mooi uitzicht maar wel rustig voor new yorkse begrippen.

title: Good location and comfortable
text: Overall, very nice experience. The room/hotel was smaller than expected. The hallways were pretty narrow, but manageable. Our single King size bedroom had a door connecting to the room next door. I wish we knew we had that because we wouldn't have chosen to have that if we knew beforehand. The elevators were slow for the amount of floors there were, but there's not much to change that without remodeling the entire hotel. The location was great though. We liked being in the Financial district and it was pretty quiet at night which was a plus! Staff was friendly and helpful as well.

title: Horrible service
text: I was double charged for my security deposite and when brought to the attention of the staff they stated i checked in in correctly and it was not their fault they took my card AGAIN and charged it. On top of that they were rude and would forward the calls coming from out room or hang up the phone. The room was expensive and TINY and any issue that were had were received with attitude.

title: Double tree failing again
text: This was our second double tree stay in America this month and what a let down. Firstly have to say the bell man are great and the staff are  a credit to the hilton brand but the rest of the place where do I start. Lift up to reception only two lifts very small and very slow which after a flight and long taxi ride not great. Always queues for lifts. It is evident this hotel houses homeless which a lovely to give those less fortunate a place to stay and very profitable one for hilton but you do not advise paying guests of this!! Check in was prompt then another slow wait for the lift to our room floor 23.. very dated decor rubbish on the corridor which was still there the next day. The room it's self dark and small. Bed a reasonable size but very dusty, dated and just not what I would call Hilton or double tree standards. Air con and heating were so loud. Also loud work going off outside the hotel across the street very late at night. Location wise good near subway and ferry and battery park. Also an Irish bar right next door and lots of other bars and places to eat. Lots of homeless people congregate with the homeless guests just outside of the hotel. We have been loyal to hilton for many years as usually hilton offers great hotels but lately they have just been a let down and not worth the honours benefits which are pretty poor anyway. Hilton spend some money and  live up to your brand thinking of trying Marriott, radioson blue or Riu hotels in future

title: Good Hotel and Close to Public Transport!
text: I stayed here when spending five days sightseeing in New York City in February 2017. I stayed in a superior room with a city view and it was great. Reception will give you free warm cookies every day - particularly nice when it's freezing cold outside!! My room was modern and well-equipped. It was nice to have a coffee machine in the room so you could make fresh coffee each morning before braving the cold outside! It took about 40 minutes to get from the hotel to Times Square and it's not far to the nearest metro station. The restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel is not operated by Hilton (as far as I'm aware), but I decided to go there one morning for breakfast. If I'm honest, it wasn't good. The buffet breakfast was not cheap, the selection was very poor and the quality was bad. I didn't return there again. As I say, I don't think the restaurant is operated by Hilton, but I'd recommend going elsewhere for breakfast. But the hotel itself is good and I'd recommend it!

title: Horrible Hotel
text: This was one of the worst experiences I had. These were the issues I faced * The air-conditioning was loud that the engineer had to replace the fan, filter, etc. Eventually I just switched off the fan. * The water was burning hot. The hotel sent the engineer who had to fix the water at-least 4 times to make sure I do not get burnt with scalding hot water. * The 1st night, it seems that the window was left open which was making a knocking sound and I could not sleep at all. Eventually they fixed the problem at 1.00 PM * The second night I was locked out and it took 30 minutes to enter the room * The 1st day room service was not done till 2.00 PM until I requested

title: Review
text:
Just back in Ireland after spending 4 fantastic nights at the DoubleTree by Hilton. I would definitely recommend this hotel. The staff were very attentive to our needs, hotel was very clean, room was beautifully furnished and very comfortable. The  food was beautiful, a wide variety of foods were availabe to choose from which made dining there a wonderful experience. The hotel is very  central to shops cutting down on the need for taxis. 
Raymond Lynch

title: New York's Nicest Homeless Shelter
text:
The DoubleTree Financial District is basically a huge homeless shelter. The city has, along with the DoubleTree's owners of course, contracted to house dozens or hundreds of the city's homeless. 

I have nothing against the homeless, and feel pity for them, but for the DoubleTree to charge paying guests $400+/night, when many are staying for "free" is an outrage.

Elevators are always slow! The homeless tenants clog them day and night. The rooms are always smelling like cigarette smoke (coming in from bathroom vent system).

Don't stay here!

title: Great hotel, great location
text: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights.  The staff were friendly and the welcome cookie is delicious.   My room (27th floor) was spacious although the bed was quite small.  The hotel is within a few minutes walking distance for 3 different subway lines and Battery Park is very close by.  restaurants and bars too.  The member of staff called Alan was exceptionally friendly and helpful, a pleasure to chat too.

title: Consigliato!
text:
Hotel in ottima posizione ad un passo dalla fermata metro (linea gialla che porta direttamente a Time Square in 15 minuti), vicinissimo a Battery Park dove partono i battelli per la Statua della Libertà. Situato in una zona piena di ristoranti/pub/negozi.
Stanza pulita (pulizie giornaliere con cambio di asciugami), calda ed accogliente con tutti i comfort necessari (phone, frigobar, bollitore, cassaforte, ferro da stiro...).
Noi avevamo una stanza al 43esimo piano vista Freedom Tower!
Unica pecca: ascensori troppi lenti!
Per il resto mi sento di consigliarlo per il buon rapporto qualità/prezzo.

title: Good hotel if your by yourself and plan on only going to the hotel to sleep
text:
The reception is inside a restaurantes kitchen, the elevators take ages (ask for a low rise floor) and rooms are VERY small 
Good hotel if you don’t plan on being at the hotel during the day, it’s just for sleeping

title: This location used as a HOMELESS SHELTER
text: We had read about NYC hotels (even $600 per night hotels) taking in homeless people in exchange for taxpayer money, but haven't experienced it personally. Until recently. 25% of the hotel is rented to them, and they ride in the very slow elevators with paying ($339/night for us) guests. I told the manager that if I wanted to stay with homeless people, I would sleep on the sidewalk for free. The people are rough and strange (they ARE homeless people, so it's to be expected). Guests should be warned BEFORE they BOOK at this hotel. The location is great, but there are some very, very serious drawbacks to this hotel. We will never stay here again. What is Hilton thinking? Do they not realize the liability of housing homeless people with their guests? WOW.

title: New York - Financial District
text: Stayed at the Double Hilton - Financial District.  Good location close to Statue of Liberty and 911 Memorial.  Easy access to subway.  Took subway to Times Square.  Amazing Times Square.  Got there early to take part in taping of Good Morning America.  Lots of shops and places to eat, some different than home, some the same.  Have a good vacation.

title: Not Recommended
text:
I stayed here for 4 nights spanning Saturday to Wednesday (leisure and work).  Room 4410. 

I'll start with the Pros: 
1) The bed is amazingly comfortable
2) Staff is extremely friendly and accommodating
3) Great location for exploring the FiDi and lower Manhattan. Close to subway stations and Brooklyn Bridge
4) Delicious cookie upon check in - which was really nice after a long cross-country flight
5) View was amazing! Hudson River view. 

Cons: 
1) Elevators are small and extremely slow (3 elevators 44 floors and no separate service elevator for the staff, so elevators are sometimes full with carts). I intentionally picked a room on the 44th floor so at least I knew there would be room to get on the elevator. One trip up took 17 minutes (10 minute wait and 7 minute ride)
2) Horrible smoke smell piped into my room - it smelled like someone was smoking a cigarette and weed in my room at the same time. Gross and unhealthy. 
3) Housekeeping did not leave new toiletries. I wasn't about to brave the elevators to go back to the front desk to get more, so had to forego washing my hair since no shampoo or conditioner
4) Room and bathroom are very small - difficult to maneuver around with two people in the room  

I read previous reviews, so I knew about the elevator and the small rooms.  I can live with that - I'm in NYC so those are realities.  What tipped my review to only two stars is the horrible smoke smell and the lack of toiletries. As a business traveller, showing up to work smelling like cigarette smoke was gross. 

I am a fan of Hilton hotels and stay at the Conrad fairly often.  I won't be staying at this hotel again.

title: Genial
text: El hotel está bastante bien situado, a dos manzanas de Times Square, hotel moderno y muy limpio, aseo muy nuevo, la habitación estaba bien de tamaño a pesar de viajar con un bebé, teníamos vistas desde la habitación. El servicio fue excelente

title: Average Hotel but very convienient
text:
Stayed there on Oct 27 and 29 Oct and again on Oct 31 till Nov 4th. 
Rooms was average and remember to bring along your toothbrush and toothpaste. Constant leak after shower till the room door. 
Hotel is near the subway which is just across the road. 
Had 2 very helpful bell staff which i need to compliment, Allen and Wallace. Whenever you need help or directions, just ask 2 both of them and they will find ways to assist to the best way. Thanks. 
Overall no fuss hotel which is simply good for a good rest after a tired day and also a very convienient place to stay. Food and attraction are all plenty and nearby.

title: Not up to Doubletree standards
text: So this hotel has a good location and that is ALL it has going for it.  We are here for the NYC marathon.  We have stayed at many Doubletrees and ONLY stay at Hilton properties and have been Diamond Hilton members for years, which means nothing at this property.  My husband has our profile set up for high floors away from the elevators.  We are supposed to get upgrades when available.  When we had the audacity to ask for an upgrade, were told there were none.  We were given a room on the 30th floor (out of 44) which not only is directly in front of the elevator, but also is right next to the housekeeping closet.  When housekeeping is cleaning on one side, and slam doors,  it actually shakes our headboards.  When they are cleaning on the other side, or other customers come and go, it shakes the TV.  I actually had to move the pillows about a foot from the headboard to avoid the reverberations.  Aesthetically, no better.  Looks like a Hampton Inn,  There is so much caked and visible dirt in the air conditioner filter that we will be lucky not to contract Legionnaires disease....   The leather chair is filthy.  No microwave.  No mini-fridge.  No frills.  No offer of breakfast or executive lounge.  Hilton will get these complaints directly as well, but they don't seem to care much these days.  I have never written a hotel review, so this should tell you a lot!

title: ホテルは良いけど兎に角うるさい
text: 部屋は綺麗だし、広いです。スタッフはフレンドリーでシンプル過ぎるくらいのサービスがわずらわしくなくてとてもよかった。問題はシャワーのたびにバスルームがビチョビチョになることと、毎晩1時～4時くらいに数回ゴミ収集車？が爆音をたてること。折角寝付けても毎晩この音に起こされてしまうので眠れませんでした。部屋には耳栓が置かれていたから相当文句があるのでしょう。高層階だと聞こえないみたいですけどエレベーター15分くらい待つと嘆いていました。私は6階なので待つときは階段を使いました。女性一人夜12時くらいまで出歩いても問題はありませんでした。

title: No microwave
text: The hotel was ok. Location was great. Just don’t expect to save leftovers or takeout. Very disappointed that there was no microwave in the rooms. But I can say there are many good restaurants around the hotel.

title: Disappointed in NYC
text: Front desk lacking in help and availability!  Had a problem in the room and could not reach the front desk for over 15 minutes - what if it was an emergency?  It was 9:30pm so someone should have been available. On another note - cookies were always stale:-(

title: Perfect location & comfort
text: The location is what I needed. It's close to Wall st, battery park and literally two steps from the train R. The trains 5 and W are also very close. The room was comfortable the all the service was efficient. I can say that I would put a mini fridge in the room for the basic stuff. The elevators were fast but I often waited for them.

title: Walked down 32 floors
text:
We stayed for a quick weekend getaway.  Arrived Friday and waited a long time for the elevator to take us to our room on the 32nd floor.  Trying to leave hotel Saturday morning,  we waited over 10 min for am elevator.  We could hear the alarms going off in one elevator, and if another elevator door opened , the car was overstuffed with guests and luggage.  There was no response from the staff, no notice posted on the entry and when we reached the front doorman (after walking down 32 floors), he had no idea that there was any issue.  We also had very noisy plumbing overnight.  

Otherwise,  the room was clean and adequate.

title: Good location, cost, but unacceptable elevators
text: Location in the Financial District was good.  Close to a number of different subway trains.  Room was small, but clean, modern, and comfortable. Bathroom was also small with a narrow shower, no tub, and little vanity space.  Elevator service was extremely slow with waiting times of up to 15 minutes!  In a high rise building this is unacceptable and I would not stay at this hotel again.  If you must stay here stay on a low floor so you can walk down the stairs.

title: Très bonne situation pour prix relativement raisonnable
text:
Y avons passé 8 jours pour visiter New York en mars 17 : très bonne situation car plusieurs stations de métro au pied de l hôtel’ en 20/25 minutes vous êtes au cœur de NY. Hôtel à 2 min à pieds du point de départ des ferries pour la statue de la liberté, ballades et vue magnifiques matin comme au coucher du soleil. 
Commerces et restaurant aux pieds de l hôtel.
Chambre petite mais confortable. Ménage fait régulièrement, personnel très aimable.
Par contre petit déjeuner de l hôtel à déconseiller, vraiment pas terrible et cher.
Ascenseurs parfois un peu long, mais bon....on passe plus de temps à visiter la ville que l hôtel!!

title: Suitable accommodation
text: The hotel located in the centre of Financial District, we needed a place where to sleep, therefore did not pay too much attention to tourist attractions. People at the reception were a little bit slow, but OK. The room was also good, nothing special. We had a dinner downstairs in the Italian restaurant: candle light, Italian music, Italian-speaking waiter :), good wine, tasty food, we really enjoyed it.

title: Not great ;(
text: We got to the hotel at 4 PM when check in time is 3 PM and they did not have any rooms ready until 430 which was quite a disappointment. We were on the 43rd floor which is normally not a problem although the elevator situation is terrible. Everyone was complaining about how slow the elevators were and often times we had to wait over 10 minutes to get up and down floors. For that reason alone we will never stay there again. To be fair the rooms were a nice size, they were clean and it’s in a good spot, near everything.

title: No Stars
text: The air conditioner leaked making the carpet wet. The door lock was not working properly, I had to insert my key numerous times to gain entry.  I was told by maintenance that is how these keys work nothing is wrong. There were only two elevators for 44 floors so when they got to the 18th floor they were full. I had to walk the 18 floors to get out.

title: 最悪
text: エントランスでロビーは2階との表示をみて荷物を預けるためによると、エントランスのクロークに預けるように言われ戻る羽目に。しかも、44階まであるビルなのにエレベーターはたったの2機でなかなか来ない。その上、観光して戻ると、荷物のクロークには誰も担当者がおらずロビーの受付で事情を尋ねるといつチェックインできるか、14:30ころかなという曖昧な答え。客を待たせてウェルカムドリンクもないし、最悪です。次にニューヨークに来るときは絶対とまりません。

title: Nice hotel, congested entrance
text: Hotel entrance come is on the side street, but is hindered by Construction in the adjacent building. Also the parking deck used by the hotel is not close to the hotel, so carrying more than one piece of luggage could be a challenge for one person.

title: Great Location
text: Easy access to points of interest - ground zero and 911 museum and statute of liberty - lots of food choices and water front dinning - shopping  - safe !  Rooms are small as typical for NY and up to date options for business travelers. Subway nearby and Uber was great.

title: Think it was a horrible stay. Taking a shower the water ran out into the room and the entire bathroom
text: Horrible stay. Bed was uncomfortable we couldn't get more pillows. Water from bathroom all out into the room. The room was so small and so narrow. Told the restaurant was open till 11 we went in at 10:05 and were told they were closed. It was an all around worst stay we ever had. Owe and a fist fight outside our room in the middle of night in the hall by our door.

title: arnaque sur facture
text:
Séjour complètement payé par agence de voyage ( Nouvelle Frontières) .
A l'arrivée prise d'une caution avec la carte bancaire. Remise des clefs a la fin du séjour a l'heure prévue et mauvaise surprise a notre retour par la facturation d'une nuit supplémentaire !!   ( l'hôtel nos annonce par la suite qu'une valise serait resté dans une chambre !) Avec l'empreinte de la carte ils font ce qu'ils veulent .

title: But for the elevators....
text:
The hotel is fine -- yes, the rooms are small, especially the bathroom, but the elevators unfortunately define the experience.   The waits are always long.  The elevators are always full, meaning too often you have to wait for another elevator.  And in the mornings it seems there is always a Hilton maid and their "suitcase" (the hallways and rooms are too small for normal carts....) in every elevator.  And we were there over a weekend -- I an't imagine how bad it is before/after working hours on a weekday.

Oh, and although it wasn't the hotel per se -- if I was the hotel manager I think I would have sent someone from maintenance to clean up the broken bag on food garbage 50 yards from the front door.  It was starting to really smell after 3 days....

title: Bon emplacement
text:
L'emplacement de l'hôtel permet d'accéder rapidement à de nombreux sites touristiques de New York à pieds.
Pour les sites plus éloignés, le métro est au pied de l'hôtel. 
Les chambres sont correctes et propres, par contre très mauvaise insonorisation, on entend vraiment tout ce qui se passe dans le couloir!!!
La vue de notre chambre vraiment pas extra...547...vue sur les centrales de froid!!! Il est vrai que l'on y passe peu de temps mais une vue sur Lexington Avenue aurait été plus sympa.
Pas de restauration dans l'hôtel en dehors du petit déjeuner.  
Au bar de l'hôtel, on ne sert pas de café!!! Uniquement des boissons fraîches!!!
Dommage que le personnel à la réception  ne parle pas du tout le français. ..Et ne fait aucun effort pour nous comprendre!!!
Par contre le personnel d'étage très poli et souriant.
Mention toute particulière pour Julio (Groom), pour nous donner les bons plans restau... location limousine...
Ne rien réserver à la conciergerie de l'hôtel,  ils se prennent une commission de fou!!! Ex .: place pour un match de basket au Madison Square Garden vendue 150 $ à l'hôtel, vendue 50 $ au Madison!!!
Dommage de devoir payer 15 $ par jour pour avoir la Wi-Fi dans les chambres!!! Wi-Fi gratuite uniquement dans le hall d'entrée.

title: Horrible room in a good location
text: Traveling with 2 boys (6 & 8 yrs), we booked a room with 2 dbl beds on a high floor (quiet, scenic) -- for their first visit to NYC, including Statue of Liberty, etc.  I booked directly through HHonors, paid months in advance and checked in using the app earlier in the day before our arrival.  As things go, our flight was late and we did not get to the hotel until late (11pm?) with 2 very tired kids -- to be greeted with the news that our reserved room was not available, "but we can upgrade you to one of our junior suites" (HA!). And to add to the pleasant moment, he volunteered to our 2 tired and hungry boys that they did NOT have any warm cookies for them, but they could stop by the desk tomorrow... (why even mention it?!!)  Then, we went to our "upgraded" room -- on the 4th floor, in a corner next to all the elevators, with only one bed and a pullout sofa -- which had no sheets or pillows -- and a close-up of a construction site outside the window (no sleeping in after that long nite of travel!). We were offered zero compensation for the inconveniences (other than a late check-out by 1pm) and no warm cookies on the next day -- nothing to thank us for our understanding and patience.

title: weekeinde New York
text:
geweldig hotel eigen shuttle bus die je in de buurt weg brengt 
op de kamer koffie/senceo apparaat en magnetron en ijskast dus heerlijk koffie met warme melk kunnen maken 
hotel ligt rustig gelegen en het is makkelijk te voet naar metro 10 min of watertaxi 10 min lopen om dan naar Newyork over te steken binnen 5 min met watertaxi midden in Manhattan
personeel erg vriendelijk en behulpzaam mochten we ooit weer naar New York gaan gaan we zeer terug naar dit hotel

title: Gutes Hotel mit sehr schöner Lage
text:
Die Lage des Hotels ist hervorragend. Essen und Zimmerausstattung sind sauber. 
Frühstück ist typisch amerikanisch. Leider keinen Aufschnitt, was mir als Europäer ein wenig gefehlt hat.

Das Personal war immer freundlich und zuvorkommend. Im Frühstücksbereich etwas abgekühlt.

Die Größe des Zimmers kann  man in meinem Fall als klein bezeichnen. Die Aussicht aus dem 44ten Stock allerdings sehr sehenswert.

Alles in allem ein gutes Hotel.

title: Business trip
text: Poor experience. Room and hallway never vacuumed. Desk chair too filthy to sit in.  Tiny room and bathroom even by NYC standards.  Plus-staff pleasant and good restaurant. This hotel fell well below the standards I expect from a Hilton facility. Elevators were very slow, room was poorly maintained with dirty, frayed furniture.  Little to no sound proofing making easy to hear people in adjacent rooms. Cracked sink in bathroom. At $250 + taxes per night felt more like an upper-end motel.

title: Very happy with stay at DoubleTree - Financial District
text: The location was good for many tourist sites & subway, the rooms were bigger than I expected and very comfortable, staff was always pleasant & helpful, and the arrangement with the parking garage was a big plus.

title: Free cookies won't make up for a bad experience.
text:
When traveling to New York City, I've come to expect small rooms. However, the bathroom at the Double tree on stone street was beyond tiny. I had to shower sideways not to hit the glass enclosure. There is a sink on a pedestal, but no room for a cup, dock kit, let alone a tooth brush. 
The elevators are a big mess especially in the mornings. Seems the cleaning crew love to occupy it, delivering vacuums, dirty laundry and other items while leaving no room for guests. Waits can take ten minutes or more. 
Speaking of housekeeping, while spending their day on the elevators as if they were theme park rides, they failed to clean my room twice while I stayed. 
With new competition just around the corner, I can't imagine staying here again.

title: After thought of Hilton Hotels - I will not stay in this Hilton Hotel again
text: The staff were not too friendly.  The room was not city view at all (I requested for city view) - I was looking into other high rise buildings.  The elevator was very slow that I had to take the stairs from 33rd floor going down.  There is no refrigerator in the room to store anything like bottle of water.  The room was very warm even when the thermostat was adjusted.  The business center is ok.  If you are one of those that love staying at Hilton Hotels like myself, don't stay here.  I don't recommend this location.

title: Good hotel - let down by elevators!
text: I’ve chosen this hotel several times as it’s close to our office, but the location is also great for transport and sightseeing. The rooms are always clean and well presented, as you’d expect from this brand and the hotel is generally quiet. The entrance from the street is always disappointing, straight into the elevator bank with reception on level 2. The only issue with the hotel is with the ineffective elevators for this size of property, it’s not unusual at peak times to wait 10-15 mins for an elevator to arrive and then they stop at almost every floor (I was on 37) on the way down - I’ve never felt that elevator issues could spoil a hotel, but this one comes close!

title: Business Travel
text: Excellent would use this location again. The hotel is clean and located close to restaurants and attractions. Staff was friendly I use this hotel often when I need to travel to the city for business..

title: Not a relaxing stay
text: Stained bed linen, noises air conditioning, elevators that couldn't cope with the number of guests, dirty bed linen. Normally I would give a hotel the benefit of the doubt but for the amount we paid and the fact this hotel is part of a large chain the standard of this hotel really was poor

title: Don’t think I’ll stay here again
text:
Pros - I arrived at 8am and they had a room available for me to checkin. Location is good. 

Cons - room feels dark and dank. Many flies in the bathroom. I noticed a small dried blood spot on my sheets when I checked in and was there even after two days which made me wonder when the sheets were changed at all (and if they were changed before I checked in!). I had to ask the receptionist to request for it to be changed and they did. Breakfast is one of the worst I’ve ever had in a mid priced hotel. I’m just glad I didn’t pay for the room rate with breakfast and went elsewhere for breakfast the rest of my stay

title: Good business hotel in New York
text: Rooms are size wise and in terms of facilities what you should expect in this price range, house keeping is quite OK. Same applies for the gym. Did not use the breakfast but that was in previous year more or less OK.

title: Highly recommend gem
text: Hotel with easy access to subway lines in short walking distance.  Nice recreational sites close by including access to Liberty Island.  Wall Street just a couple blocks North in walking distance.  Starbucks right around the corner.

title: Good Manhattan hotel for a weekend visit
text: We booked the DoubleTree Financial District for a weekend visit to see a Broadway show and do a little sightseeing.  Rooms are small but well laid out.  The bathroom is small but has adequate shelf space next to the vanity sink.  Water pressure and temperature were fine.   As others have noted, the air conditioning unit has a noisy fan; it also drips water on the floor which makes the carpet feel uncomfortably damp to bare feet near the window.  The view from our 40th floor room was pretty cool.  We had a corner room on the City View side (01 thru 07) and the new World Trade Center buildings were right in front​ of us, with glimpses of buildings further uptown and a bit of the Hudson River.  Elevator noise was not an issue and our elevator waits were not too bad.  Considering this was the lowest priced decent hotel room in Manhattan for our visit, we were happy overall.  Room Service did forget the coffee with our breakfast order, but brought it quickly when we asked.

title: Poor elevator service.
text: I waited 15 minutes for an elevator before I took the stairs down 6 flights carrying my suitcase. There were 3 elevators available but only 2 were operational.  Now I realize I should just have called a bellhop.

title: Room
text: The room was clean. And the service is always very good when ever I stay there. But they did have a problem in the room with the bathroom. The door did not close correctly which flooded the bathroom floor.

title: Lovely Hotel in the heart of Manhattan
text: Excellent service,small but excellent room and very comfortable bed. The staff were friendly and professional. The warm cookies on arrival was a lovely touch. The location was perfect for all the sights.

title: Great location and very clean
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights in August and was perfect for a short stay. The location was great right near 2 different subway stations. Very close walk to the staten island ferry and battery park for a good view of the statue of liberty. I booked this through hot wire and would definitely recommend as it is cheaper than other websites. 

Great stay and friendly staff.

title: Terrible Hotel
text: We will not use this hotel again.  The rooms were shabby and dirty.  There were flies coming out of the bathroom sink in one of the rooms. The hotel did not meet the standards we have seen in other DoubleTree Hotels.

title: Reasonable accommodation in downtown manhattan
text: Although Doubletree has better properties but probably it's closeness to Financial hub of N.Y. makes up for it. There was a lot of feedback on here about slow lifts, however I did not find that an issue. Being on business I needed to be close to office so it worked, however I don't think I will book it for leisure.

title: Good stay financial district
text: A great stay in the financial district Close to restaurants and sites fairly easy to get transportation I was there during UN week extremely busy area but walking distance to Empire State Hudson River and East River

title: Mold and Mildew Stench due to a Wet Floor
text: Evening Manager Miguel lacked integrity and assigned us an room that was not fit to accommodate anyone. He clearly doe not care about his job. He then left to go home.  Pauline was left to fend for herself with one problem after another.  When I left there was a man yelling at her but it was not her fault.  Miguel just neglected to be a leader and left her standing in chaos.  The two security guys did the same.  I was disgusted and disappointed in so many ways that evening. Pauline provided a different accommodation at a nearby hotel to save the weekend getaway.  Thank you Pauline!!!

title: 狭い
text: 良い点は地下鉄の駅にも近く、夜遅くても安全でした。悪い点は部屋が狭い。近くに遅くまで開いているデリやデュアンリードなどの店がないので夜遅くにホテルに戻るときは飲み物など買ってから戻るほうがいい。ホテルにも飲み物、スナックは置いているけれど、セルフレジが故障していてフロントで現金で支払わなければいけなくて不便だった。ATMも滞在中、ずっと故障していた。

title: Need to improve cleanliness
text: poor cleanliness in 1st room they gave us; 2nd one is better but carpet is sticky as well; and shower water temperature is not stable all the time; the staff in restaurant had rude attitude when we had breakfast

title: Love the location and the warm cookies :)
text:
I've stayed here twice for the cleanness and the proximity to my destination.
The other positive elements:
- Welcoming staff
- warm cookies
- The proximity to some attractions (by foot): battery park, ferry to the statue, the bull, Wall Street, Stone Street, 911 Memorial, Brooklyn Bridge
- Proximity to restaurants and bars

Some suprising elements:
- Lobby is on the 1st floor - not on main street
- Elevator is slow
- Corridor are narrow and dark

Also, a good way to measure your experience is when something wrong happened...

I will come again.

title: Nice hotel, difficult to find
text: Nice hotel, noisy air conditioning unit, hard to find but clean rooms and good bathrooms.  I would try to reduce the noise of the air conditioning unit and try to let one open the windows. the room has nice comforter.

title: On Top of the World
text: I had to head to New York on a moments notice and booked this hotel. We were given relatively small, but amply outfitted room on the top floor. It was an excellent stay. I cannot get over our view. I’ve posted a photo of the view.

title: Mixed Experience - Some Good Things and Some Really Poor Things
text:
On the positive side; great location, friendly staff, clean room and comfortable bed. 

On the negative side; the room is pathetically small (woefully small), there are no counter tops whatsoever in the bathroom, the shower is very small and the room does not have any space to use a luggage rack (without moving furniture around). They have used the very little bit of desktop space for the coffee maker and accessories, therefore, there is virtually no desk/work space.

The breakfast for a Hilton Gold member was inadequate. We stayed 2 days and they offered the same scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and pancakes each day... no variety to speak of. 

For the price paid and the discomfort of the minimalist space, I would NEVER stay here again. Hilton needs to sell this property to a lesser quality branded hotel and stay the course with their typical properties.

title: Hotel
text: Our Double Tree room was very clean, quiet at night and the staff was very helpful. The lower Manhattan location was ideal for travel on the subways. The nightly room rate was reasonable considering we stayed in New York City. I recommend the Double Tree Hotel in the Financial District.

title: Плохо и дорого.
text:
Отель достаточно старенький. Узкие извилистые коридоры. В некоторых местах потрескались обои и облупилась краска, сильный запах моющего средства от ковролина. В лобби всегда очень людно и шумно, там же расположен бар. Номер обычного размера, потолки низкие. У встроенного шкафа оторваны обои и плинтус. Вид из окна 16 этажа на какие-то крыши с огромными баками (вероятно воды). В номере нет минибара/холодильника, кофемашины или чайника, тапочек, халата, шапочки для душа  и ложки для обуви. Не было даже приветственной бутылки воды. Пришлось поздно вечером идти в магазин.  По телевизору не показывают ни одной программы на русском языке.  Я бы оценила уровень отеля максимум на 3 звезды. Он явно не стоит 350 долларов за ночь (без завтрака).
Завтрак -  30 долларов с человека. Мы не брали. Wi-Fi платный. Отель снял с карты 700 долларов за две ночи. При этом на следующий день не прошел платеж по нашей карте из-за отсутствия средств и в выписке мы увидели, что отель заблокировал еще 700 долларов. Непонятна политика некоторых отелей. Они считают, что люди могут обойтись без этих денег в поездке?! И надо рассчитывать, что за каждый отель придется платить дважды?
Заказали такси в аэропорт. Минут за десять спустились сдать номер. На check in стояла отдельная очередь из 11 человек (!!! ). Хорошо, что время до вылета мы рассчитали с запасом. После посещения остался неприятный осадок. Я бы этот отель не порекомендовала. 

눇При заселении угостили горячим печеньем. Было очень приятно после долгой дороги. 
Расположение отеля неплохое, это пересечение Ленсингтон авеню  и 51 стрит. Близко к вокзалу/автовокзалу. Кровать и подушки в номере удобные. У противоположной от окна стены стоит маленький диванчик вместо кресел. Замечательные  белые полотенца. Есть утюг и гладильная доска. Очень внимательная девушка в справочной службе отеля и молодой человек на службе вызова такси.

title: Good location, nice hotel
text: Small room, but clean, with nice amenities. We were on the top floor - never had any issues with the elevators - but ran into some people that said they waited 15 minutes for an elevator to stop for them. Good view & good location. Right in the middle of the financial district. Within a block of several subway stops. Charming bars and pubs just around the corner - a little slice of OLD New York.

title: No refrigerator?!
text:
This place is simply not worth the price. I usually stay in Midtown but decided to stay at this location because of meetings nearby. I was very disappointed in this hotel. The location is pretty good but that's about it. The rooms are cramped, as is common w/ NYC hotels. Decor was pretty disappointing for a place charging $300-$400/night. Also, this hotel doesn't have any refrigerators in the rooms and doesn't even enable guests to store food in the hotel's refrigerator for free. I asked and they said its $30/day to use their refrigerator!

I will never stay here again.

title: Double Tree Inn in the Financial District
text: Not realizing it was UN Week in New York, I had had a difficult time finding a hotel reservation. I found a Double Tree Hotel in the Financial District. I like that area of Manhattan because with the Stock Exchange close by there is extra security in the area.   The front entrance was dreary. The hotel staff were friendly. The elevators took forever. I finally discovered that they didn't work if you want to go up, so I had to go down first before going up. The hotel room was reminiscent of hotels in the early 60's: dark, clunky furniture and tan, tan, tan color everywhere! The bed was extremely comfortable and if you want to have a place to sleep for a night, it did meet that requirement. I did expect cockroaches to come out when I turned out the light, so I slept with the light on. Needless to say, I found another hotel the next day.

title: Lousy Experience
text:
I am a long time Hilton user with over 1,000 room nights at more than 100 Hilton hotels worldwide.  This was the worst run hotel in franchise that I have experienced.  Let's start with the good, however.  Good location and nice bed.........that about covers the positives.

The lousy experience started upon check in.  The usual chocolate chip cookies the DoubleTree is known for were cold and hard.  Worse, the hotel which should have at least 5 elevator banks has 3 and one of them was offline about a third of the time.  We got our keys from the front desk and waited 5 minutes for an elevator.  We open 'our' hotel room on the 19th floor only to find a nice, older Chinese man that must have been given same keys a few minutes earlier as he was unpacking.  We apologized, waited another 5 minutes to get elevator and got another room on 20th floor.

The housekeeping person on our floor was abysmal and we had to tell front desk to have her come twice after not cleaning the room when we were out at brunch and walking around for 4 hours.  Front desk personnel were consistently surly and housekeeper did not speak a word of English.  I emphasized that girlfriend was sleeping one afternoon and not to disturb her.  When I came back I was told she was removing the sheets when my girl woke up.

The clientele also seemed very down market despite a price of $340 a night (including taxes) hotel was charging.  My girlfriend who is Brazilian and doesn't have a mean bone in her body, asked why there seemed to be so many 'homeless' folks in the hotel.  Gym was sparse so it was also hard to work out frustration with the hotel staff.  Unless you want an 'econolodge' experience at a Conrad price, avoid this hotel.

title: Good location for lower manhattan
text: This hotel is well located for access to the financial district in lower manhattan. Check in was quick and efficient. Rooms are well appointed and very comfortable. Corridors on the small side. The wait for the lift can be long though so do allow time to leave the hotel if you are on a deadline. I haven't eaten here so can't comment on the restaurant.

title: shame on you
text:
we made a mistake when booking this hotel and booked for one night instead of 2. when we tried to book another night we where told it was fully booked as it was the 9/11 memorial on the extra day we wanted. we tried elsewhere to find alternative accommodation but everywhere was booked. the gentleman behind reception who was very helpful (sorry we did nt get his name) said to come back later on and he would get us something. he was true to his word he managed to get us 2 rooms (we were looking for 3) and he at least had the decency to looked ashamed when he informed us it would be double the price of the previous night. i find it disgraceful that the hlton would rip off what is still a very emotional day for America. shame on yous.

we took the $400 a night rooms or we would have had to go outside the city, something we did not wish to do as we don't know the area or cut short the stay. the hotel itself is clean and rooms are spacious, the staff are nce and helpful but OMG the bar, first of all its expensive and to top it all off the bar man did not wait for a tip which he would have received but added 15% to every round we bought, considering he only served us at the bar (not at the table), this is his job  and we took empty glasses u to him to clear the table i think this was shocking, then the bar closed at 11 oclock. we had been in new York from 8am - till 9.45 so were looking to relax and unwind with a few beers ..not in this hotel you wont.

overall cant fault the rooms but was it value for money? not a chance, shame on the Hilton for clearly making money out of a disaster, if and its a big if i ever venture back to new York i certainly wont be booking this hotel, in fact it has put me off booking any Hilton.

title: Disappointing
text: Great location and nice, clean well appointed rooms, some with nice water view, but beware of elevator service and be prepared to wait a long time. We previously had poor experience for breakfast in the restaurant so we avoided it this time.

title: Good location, some drawbacks
text: This hotel is ideally located for those travelling to the Financial District for work, it is clean and comfortable with all the amenities that you'd expect. WiFi is present throughout but doesn't seem to be free, although codes are provided.  It can take a long time to get to or from your floor as there are only three elevators and they're often very busy.  The bathroom sink did not have a plug, making shaving a slightly awkward experience.  We had breakfast included, it is adequate but there are better options nearby for similar or lower prices.  The entrance does seem rather run down and gives a bit of a negative impression, but the lobby and rooms are much nicer.  Would happily stay here again.

title: Allow extra time for the elevator!
text:
Stayed just one night as we were attending a wedding in nearby Battery Park.
The hotel is conveniently located in downtown Manhattan. A few subway stations (different lines) within walking distance. Also within walking distance are a few different food outlets. There's a drugstore next door (not open 24/7).
Only a few rooms on every floor, so the room is quiet.

When staying here, do allow additional time to cater for the lack of elevators. There are only 3 elevators covering many floors. Housekeeping and porters also use the same elevators, so it does get a little bit crowded at times.

Rooms are small, but that's not unexpected in Manhattan. Reception staff are efficient and polite. Special mention goes to one of their porters, Tony, who took one look at the number of bags we were handling, and immediately made recommendations for our transportation to JFK airport.

title: Great Location
text:
Stayed here for 7 nights earlier this month. Really chose the hotel due to its location being near to where my sister lives and the fact that you can walk to so many places - Battery Park for the ferries, South sea ports, China Town, Little Italy, Brooklyn Bridge, Freedom Tower and the memorial pools and the Occulus. Also very near to subway station where you can catch trains to Brooklyn, Central Park, Times Square etc all reached within about 20/25 minutes by train.

 I was slightly disappointed upon arrival at the look of the hotel - its above a restaurant with 'net curtains' at its windows that looked like they needed a good wash!! The hotel reception is on the second floor. We arrived at 2pm but sadly our room wasn't ready so we were told to leave our luggage and return an hour later. This meant taking our luggage back down to the ground floor where concierge looked after it for us. Upon our return an hour and a half later our room still wasn't ready and it actually took around a further 30 minutes or so until it was. The gentleman called Will on reception gave us a voucher to use in the restaurant below the hotel as an apology for the delay which was very nice and we used it one lunchtime and the food was very good. 

Our room was on the 35th floor with a view of the East river in between a couple of buildings. It was a very small room, the bed was very comfortable although the furniture was rather dated and although we were supposed to have a sitting area there was only one rather shabby desk chair. The room itself plus the bathroom were very clean and was cleaned every day to a high standard. I am a light sleeper so sadly I was kept awake by the ice machine in the corridor very near to our room  which would make noises during the night as it made ice. You would then get inconsiderate hotel guests wanting ice at ridiculous times of the night/early hours of the morning. Although being 35 floors up you could also still hear car horns, traffic, dustcarts, builders working etc during  the night plus guests who don't give a second thought to letting their room door slam shut. Perhaps the hotel could look at ways of having the doors shut slower or quieter as that's very annoying. After three nights of being kept awake by the ice machine I asked if we could change rooms. Will once again helped us out and we were able to move to a room on the 6th floor where there was no ice machine. We did loose the view but I needed to sleep so it was worth it. This room was bigger with an armchair in addition to the desk chair which I had been expecting in our original room. It was also a room which had a connecting door to another room and I did hear the occupant of that room return around 1am one night and then make a phone call. I could hear her on the phone for about 20 Minutes. As previously said I am a light sleeper so maybe I'm just unlucky but again it's just another guest who doesn't consider their surroundings. 

On a more positive note ALL the staff were really friendly/helpful and the different concierge would always welcome you upon arrival or wish you a pleasant day/evening when you went out. Will was extremely helpful. The lift situation as mentioned in other reviews was a little annoying but once we moved down to the 6th floor if it arrived and we couldn't get in then we would just walk down. This was no real hardship and we would have done the same even if we had been up as high as say the 10th floor. 

Overall the hotel was adequate for our needs and I feel that wherever you stay in a city like New York you will hear noise from outside.

title: Great Place In Downtown!
text:
This was my first time in New York with my mom. We wanted a hotel from a Manhattan but not from straight center and we ended up choosing DoubleTree Hilton Financial District.
The price was surprisingly low compared to other Hiltons which was great for our budget.

When we reached the hotel after 13 hours of traveling we were happy to notice that our room had been upgraded to city view room with an AMAZING view to the One World building on the 43rd floor. There is a coffee maker on each room and beds are super comfy!

Reception was nice, the staff was friendly and very helpful (special thanks to Alex ). Our flight back to Finland was at 21:50 pm and we got the late check-out for free untill 14:00. You can get late check-out for 13:00 with Hilton Honors, which I highly recommend! Wifi was fast. 

The hotel is located to the very bottom of the Manhattan which is nice and calm area. There is a subway station right next to the hotel for the R and W metros which go straight to the Time Square in 15 minutes and back. The subway seems complicated first but when you get used to it it's the best way to get around. 

This won't be the last time I visit New York and I'll definetly come back to this hotel! Thank you for a wonderful stay you provided! ^_^

title: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel New York City - Financial District
text:
Habitaciones pequeñas pero al estar todo el día visitando la ciudad cuando llegabas a dormir no importaba mucho por que las camas son cómodas y grandes, la habitación limpias, sencillas y el precio razonable para la ciudad de NY 80 euros la noche del 1 al 8 de enero de 2017. El hotel se encuentra muy bien ubicado próximo a Wall Street y al Battery Park, en la esquina hay una estación del metro.

Excelente atención en la recepción, el wifi funciona perfecto, el personal es correcto.

Lo único malo fue la limpieza de los cuartos de baños, encontré varias arañas en el techo, y no habían limpiado bien el cuarto de baño ya que había pelos en el suelo de mujer, el primer día que llegue.

title: Needs updating
text: Comfortable bed, was quiet at night,  but the room was old and needs updating. Carpet felt worn and could be more plush.  The coffee pot could be cleaner. The sink only had hot water upon arrival and when we didn't notify maintenance, cold water in the shower quit on last day as well. We reported the problem on departure.

title: Conveniengly located Hilton with standard fittings
text: I had a standard king room which was of adequate size for Manhattan. I had complimentary breakfast being a hilton being a hilton gold member. The breakfast spread is very limited and didnt look appetising so didnt l eat there. I wasnt offered any room upgrade which I usually get offered being a gold member. Also, please note that there is no Exec lounge. The hotel gym could have had a few more items in it, but ok as hotel gyms go in Manhattan.

title: Great location to explore Manhattan from
text: All the amenities expected in an ideal location; next to several subway lines and Staten Island Ferry terminal. Concierge very helpful with taxis and commute times. The one disappointment was the variety at breakfasts; specifically very limited cooked buffet selection, otherwise all very good.

title: Güzel Konum, az güvenlik
text: 4 farklı metro hattına yakın, iş bölgesinde. Oda, yataklar temiz. Yardımsever çalışanlar. Bazı odaların çok güzel manzarası var.  Biraz güvenlik sorunu olabilir. Kahve makinesi pratik değil. Az bilgilendirilme. Yüksek katlarda asansör bekleme süresi uzayabiliyor.

title: Financial crime
text: Poor hotel with soft mattresses, poor heating with terrible breakfast. Breakfast staff unfriendly and too busy texting to serve. As a gold member I got far from gold standard service. Not up to the standard I would expect from Hilton

title: Small, stuffy, EXPENSIVE Hotel
text: I stayed at the DoubleTree FiDi hotel for business for two nights, and although the staff was amazing, the hotel itself was not. It was old and not the best upkeep. Towels in my bathroom had slight stains making me not want to use them. The room was very small and the hotel itself was oddly laid out.  Bellmen were very nice and check in and check out was a breeze.

title: How are they in business?
text: The furniture in the room is cheap- the type you buy from Target in a box and assemble yourself. The dresser drawers won't stay shut. There was tv remote in room. Maintenance came to room in middle of night uninvited. Room keys are disabled before your stat ends.

title: Smallest room since Europe
text: What you see is not always what you get! Paid an extra $10 a night to get better view, higher floor and more space. Got the higher floor but not much else! No breakfast available and one choice of restaurant.

title: Perfect Location
text: Staff were very helpful and location was definitely in the best place for my needs.  There were a few negatives to my trip but they were minor to me.  The first was there are only 3 small - medium elevators that caters to 42-44 floors worth of guests.  The wait time could take forever or some times you may be stuck waiting on just one elevator to go up and down.  The second was the house cleaning staff would ask to service your room, and when I responded no thank you, they still came in to realize that I said no thank you.  I mean I could have placed the do not disturb sign up, but I just didn't need my room serviced.    These are really minor to me but some other people may find them more serious.

title: Whitehall station 2 mins walk to DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Financial District
text:
NY metro links is fantastic. 

The nearest station to DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Financial District is Whitehall station. Use Stone street exit to get out of metro and once you are on the road level, cross the street and Doubletree is 2 mins walk away. 

It is about 5 minutes walk to Bowling Green station and 7 minutes walk to South Ferry station.

The hotel uses Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries and there is a coffee machine in the room. It does not provide daily complimentary mineral water. 

As with DoubleTree - Hilton culture, you get the welcome warm cookie and mineral water.

title: Gets the job done
text: So here's an interesting hotel. Everything about the room was nice. Comfy bed, easy to control temperature, water plenty hot. Two issues though: apparently DND signs are suggestions as the first day my room was cleaned despite the sign on the door. Not the worst thing in the world though, but still, come on. Second, as mentioned by others, the elevators here are a train wreck. I waited 9 minutes one day and I was only on 25. I can't imagine what life was like on 33...which I was originally supposed to be on and then was switched for some reason. It's to the point where if you can get up to your room without making a stop it's like winning the lottery.

title: Do NOT stay here
text:
Hands down one of the WORST hotel experiences I've ever had. 

Arrival: When I arrived I was not allowed to use the cart to bring my luggage to the lobby, on the second floor after taking a ride of the SLOWEST moving elevators ever. When the first elevator arrived an employee with a towel cart took it, while I struggled to hold the weight of all of my things. 

Hot cookie? No thanks. The hot cookie you get in arrived...mine was cold and burnt. 

Room: I felt like I was at a dingy motel. The water was scalding hot and burnt me when I tried to shower for a black tie event. Barely an apology from the front desk and no offer to fix it for our one night stay. 

Literally nothing in the room. No hotel pens or overpriced water you can buy. I had to go or and buy water so that there was something I could wash my face with that wouldn't melt my skin. 

AC - had it as low as it would go and the room was still too hot.  

There are so many nice places to stay in NYC - even if you have to pay more GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. I have never felt so strongly and been so disappointed in all my years of traveling. 

There was one nice employee - Tony working Valet in the front. He should probably be working at the Ritz and not here, where service is not their business.

title: Thumbs up
text:
Had a fantastic time here. Massive bed, very clean, beautiful view. Very happy. Thanks for making our stay brilliant :) 

It's right next to a delicious steak house and a Starbucks round the corner. Also it's minutes walk from the statue of liberty :) staying here puts you right where you want to be and if your traveling any where don't take a taxi, use the subway. So easy to use and very regular :) price was perfect considering we went a week before xmas, can't wait to visit again :)

title: Excelente ubicacion
text:
Habitaciones pequeñas pero cómodas y muy limpias. El hotel se encuentra muy bien ubicado próximo a Wall Street y al Battery Park. A media cuadra hay metro.

El personal del hotel es super amable. Y la vista desde la habitación era muy linda. Probablemente vuelva al hotel en alguna oportunidad.

title: Comfortable Stay
text: This hotel was in a great location. The staff was very friendly. Checking in took a long time, and there was a little confusion about something on my account. The comforter was also stained and turned down towards the bed. Overall it was quiet and comfortable. We had trouble connecting to the internet, but I think that was the same for the area.

title: Serious elevator issues
text: Decent hotel. Room was fine. Clean, no noise issues. If you want to be downtown the location is fine. But there is a serious issue with the elevators. The hotel layout is a little different in that there are a small number of room but a large number of floors. And only 2-3 elevators. You can have long waits for elevators. People in our party waited 15-20 minutes to get an elevator. Some people rode them up just to ensure that they could get one coming down. Plan ahead.

title: Great Hotel!
text: I stayed at this DoubleTree for four nights and I had a great experience! I booked the hotel at an amazing price for New York City and am completely satisfied. The location was great being steps away from Wall Street and the Statute of Liberty. However, it is a fairly far subway ride away from other attractions such as Times Square and Chinatown, but since New York City is such a large city, the transportation time is reasonable. Check-in was not a problem, and it was especially welcoming how the doormen greeted you upon arrival each time you went back into the hotel. I noticed that the room size and elevators were an issue in some reviews, but in my experience, I did not have much of a problem with this. The elevator wait time was around 2 minutes average for me, with the most being about 5 minutes. The rooms were small, but for staying in NYC and for the price, it was completely fine. Although small, the rooms are nice and clean, and this is what I am mainly looking for in a hotel along with location. Given the opportunity, I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to future guests if they don't mind the elevator wait or room size.

title: Posizione super, spazi ridotti
text:
quando abbiamo prenotato questo albergo avevamo delle perplessità circa la posizione, invece poi si è dimostrata vincente! Assolutamente comoda per Lower Manhattan che è parte indispensabile per una visita turustica a NY eassolutamente a un passo dalla stazione della metro da bar e ristorantini.
Ho delle perplessità sugli spazi: la nostra stanza aveva un unico queen size che è insolito per gli USA, ma sospetto che possa essere invece uno standard per questa città verticale.
Ottima l'accoglienza e la pulizia.

title: Cigarette Smell
text:
My room smelled like wet cigarettes. I called the service line and was told I would have to bring all my stuff to the lobby and wait an hour (maybe longer) for someone to clean my room. This was not possible for me as I had a business dinner to attend, the staff said it was the only option, they couldn't move me.

I had a horrible night's sleep as I was congested and was dealing with a headache all night. 

I've stayed at this hotel many times for both business and pleasure and have seen first hand the slow degradation in quality and experience.
