I will not be staying here again and will be recommending to my travel manager that we no longer have thus DoubleTree listed as a preferred hotel... There are plenty of other nearby options.

title: Perfect place to stay!
text: Wonderful staff and services! Location, location, location! The staff is overly accomodating, friendly and the hotel is immaculate! The restaurant was an experience in itself - the food was fabulous and the service was even better!

title: Disappointed
text: This hotel being a Hilton brand had me fooled.  I stayed here thinking that it would be like all of my other experiences at Hilton's and it wasn't.  The furniture was old.  The elevators took forever to come and then they were hot.  The hot water didn't work all of the time.  You could be in the middle of a shower and lose hot water.  The worst was when the AC went out and my family was forced to sleep in a room that was over 85 degrees during the night.  My infant and children were extremely uncomfortable. I was told that no one worked in maintenance overnight so we would have to wait until the next morning.  No offer to move us or anything just basically tough it out.

title: Great gem downtown
text: Super clean hotel in a quiet location downtown. Granted you're about a half hour subway ride from the heart of the city, but if you want something for a good price and don't mind the location, this is the place for you. The elevators are a little slow but that's the only downfall. Friendly staff, solid internet, and they really do give you a warm cookie!! (They have nuts in them though, so be careful.) :)

title: Couples trip
text: The room was small but it served its purpose.  The staff was very accommodating and friendly. It is located in a very touristy area with lots to see. The 911 memorial is a must see. We only had one issue which was a leaking AC unit.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: The Doubletree Hotel on Stone Street in the Financial District could not be better situated for tourists.  It is within walking distance to numerous sites, including the ferries to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Staten Island and Governor’s Island.  It is steps away from the famous Wall Street “Bull”.  Just down the street is the magnificent Alexander Hamilton Customs House which houses the Smithsonian’s Native American Museum as well as the wonderful NYC branch of the National Archives.  You can walk to the NY Stock Market, Fraunces Tavern, Bowling Green and the “Museum of Jewish Heritage, A Living Memorial to the Holocaust” on Battery Place.  The subway on the corner will deliver you to Times Square and the theater district in less than a half hour. Just a short walk away is South Street Seaport where you can purchase deeply discounted Broadway theater tickets for same day evening shows and “day before” matinees.  Lots of restaurants are nearby including convenient breakfast stops just around the corner as well as numerous breakfast carts practically in front of the hotel.  Like most NY City hotels the rooms are small, but they provide all the amenities you’d expect in addition to the warm chocolate chip cookies provided at “check in” by all Doubletree Inns.  Popoo

title: Weekend Visit
text: Spent Friday-Saturday-Sunday nights there visiting family nearby.  Price was very reasonable.  Employees very friendly and very helpful.  One caution: our king-sized bed seemed shorter than most king-size beds, possibly an accommodation to the typically smaller NYC hotel rooms.   Hotel is two blocks from the Stone Street historic area which has many places to eat and relax, even on weekends when most of the financial district is very quiet (strongly recommend the Stone Street tavern for dinner and for brunch).

title: Hotel bom e em frente ao metrô
text: Reservamos este hotel através de um aplicativo que não revela o nome no hotel até que você compre. Ele apenas te informa a categoria e a localização aproximada, mas o preço é inferior a outros sites. Foi uma surpresa porque o hotel fica em frente a uma estação do metrô, bem próximo a todas as atrações da parte baixa da cidade e com boa condição de higiene e limpeza. Não é um hotel velho e de decoração bem atual. Os lençois, quarto, banheiro, tudo estava limpo e com bom serviço diarimente. Não estava incluído café da manhã. Muitas opções de comida na região durante o dia, a noite é mais restrito. Caso este comentário tenha sido útil, clique abaixo no 'obrigado'.

title: Will not stay again
text: Average hotel, but my complaint has to do with the slowness of elevators. Our room was on 34th floor and each time we wanted to go down to the lobby or back up again, we had to wait between 10 and 15 minutes for the elevator. When I complained to the reception staff, they said yes, elevators are a problem but they can do nothing about it. Obviously, it's impossible to walk up and down 34 floors so taking stairs was not an option.We won't stay at this hotel any more because of this.

title: Easy weekend in NYC
text: Hotel provided an excellent stepping off point to see the city.  Close access to Wall Street, Battery Park and Statue of Liberty and fast trip to everywhere else by subway.  Very clean and comfortable hotel in the heart of the financial district.  Small rooms, but clean and modern.  Breakfast was OK, nothing to write home about, but convenient.  Not bad for family, but can't comment too much on amenities as we spent most of the time outside the hotel.

title: Nice Location
text: The location of the restaurant was nice.  We enjoyed the city view, but the elevators made the stay unpleasant.  Seemingly only one of the three elevators was working at anyone time.  We stayed on the 40th floor to get a city and almost every time we took the elevator, only one was working and we nearly stopped at every floor, both going up and/or down.  It is unfortunate because this is what remembered about the hotel.

title: Elevators Need Improvements
text: For a 46 story hotel building it only has 3 elevators which is also shared by the cleaning and maintenance staff.  During the busier hours, e.g. mornings and afternoon, you can spend up to 15-20 minutes waiting for the elevator.  Once a fight nearly broke out because another guest had been waiting for a while and by the time it arrived it was full and they tried to pushed their way into it.  This is worse than taking the 6 train during morning commutes!

title: My best stay in FiDi to date
text:
Of 4 different hotels I've stayed in for business in the Financial District, this one was definitely the best one. It's located very close to battery park and the raging bull, at the southern tip of Manhattan, so it might be a bit of a walk (5-10) minutes from your point of business, but it's worth it.

The room was small as standard in the area, but not so small you can't move around in it. The hotel is designed nicely, the room was clean and reasonably quiet, and the bed was pretty comfy. Staff was of course pleasant and WiFi was acceptable. The surprise was the price - much cheaper than even a holiday inn express in the area, and you can't possibly compare the quality of Hilton and that.

The disadvantages were minor - no breakfast, slow elevators (or not enough of them), the area isn't very pleasant or clean (no area in Manhattan is, really) and the WiFi could be better. Overall would stay there again if I needed to be in FiDi.

title: Super Lage, gute Ausstattung!
text:
Ich besuchte 9 Tage New York im Februar mit meiner Mutti. 
Das Hotel war super, es hat ein sauberes, geräumiges Doppelbett, einen Wasserkocher, wo wir täglich Tee und Suppen warm machen konnten und eine Klimaanlage.
An der Rezeption war man immer freundlich und kompetent, ich konnte hier auch mein Rückflugticket ausdrucken lassen.
Einzig die zwei Fahrstühle, waren sehr langsam und unterdimensioniert für die vielen Etagen. Am Abreisetag mussten wir sehr lange auf den Fahrstuhl warten (Ca. 30 Minuten) da auch viele andere Leute heute abreisen.
Wir haben in dem Hotel kein Frühstück gebucht.
In wenigen Minuten ist man an der Ubahnstation, an der Fähre zur Freiheitsstatue oder am Freedom Tower.
Für meinen nächsten NYC Urlaub würde ich dieses Hotel wieder buchen!

title: DoubleTree by Hilton
text: Останавливались с мужем на один день, номер очень понравился: большая удобная кровать, хороший душ. Не понравились грязные полы в номере и то, что с утра к нам сначала стучалась, потом открыла своим ключом дверь клинер(пока я оделась, чтоб подойти) неужели у них нет информации о заселении номеров.

title: Hotel ok but beware of crazy card charges !
text: Stayed for 6 nights for a friend's wedding. Hotel itself was great - rooms are clean, great location and in hotel staff are friendly. However - their charging system is crazy. 3 days after leaving the hotel, Doubletree still have £1700 preauthorised on my card - despite having paid for the room. Once you've checked out, getting in touch with someone at doubletree who can help is impossible - no one answers the phone, and if they do they are super aggressive and unhelpful. Such a shame - would never stay at a Hilton group hotel again when it seems their policy is to bankrupt guests !

title: Awesome Experience
text: It was an awesome experience, first time in NewYork all the fun and craziness with friends, one of the best hotel experience in Double tree Hilton, amazing staff and good house keeping, travel guidance system, Room was tidy. refreshments were great, all round was a great experience, we really loved it.

title: Fijn verblijf in New York City
text: Dit is een perfect hotel als je in New York City wil verblijven. Gelegen in het Financial District op wandel afstand van maar lieft 3 Subway stations waardoor alles in Manhattan goed bereikbaar is. Ook zijn er een aantal bezienswaardigheden op wandel afstand zoals Castle Clinton waar je de ferry kunt nemen naar liberty en Ellis Island waar het vrijheidsbeeld staat (5 minuten wandelen) Ook op 5 minuten wandelafstand is de gratis Staten island Ferry, zeker doen is gratis met een mooi zicht op de skyline van Manhattan en het vrijheidsbeeld. Ook Wallstreet is op amper 5 minuten wandelafstand. Het hotel zelf heeft mooie kamers met een goed bed en nette badkamer. Er is gratis Wifi. Voor de normen van New York is het een vrij rustige buurt met enkele goede restaurants in de buurt zoals Broadstone tegenover het hotel. en 1 straat verder de legendarische Fraunces tavern die iets prijziger is, maar hier kwam vroeger de eerste president van de USA Georges Washington over de vloer.

title: Good locational in  Lower Manhattan
text: I've stayed here many times and have always found the staff and hotel a great place.  Unlike many hotels in Manhattan, the desk clerks usually let me check in several hours early.  The room is always clean.  Easy walking distance to all the sights in that part of town.

title: Gutes Hotel im Financial District
text: Gutes Hotel im Financial District, unweit der Wallstreet und dem World Trade Center. Sehr kleines Zimmer. Personal beim Frühstück könnte aufmerksamer sein. Ansonsten aber völlig ok. Preis war auch ok.

title: Good location near Wall Street with lots of elevator wait time
text: This is a good business hotel conveniently located near Wall Street. The rooms are clean and well appointed, wifi is good.  The restaurant (in the same building but not run by the hotel) was excellent -- I was pleasantly surprised.  If you want a different option, Fraunces Tavern is nearby.  An irritating thing about this property is that the elevators take a long time to arrive, and have no lights or bells to indicate they have arrive, or which way they are going.  So it's easy to miss them, extending the wait time.  Service personnel seem to spend a lot of time in the guest elevators.

title: Very nice stay.
text:
We were here for 7 nights and had a lovely stay.

The hotel is in close proximity to a subway station, bars and restaurants. It is also within walking distance to Battery Park and the Seaport areas.

The hotel staff are very friendly and will be happy to help if you do have any problems. All you have to do is ask and you will get service with a smile. They will always aim to please. When we checked in we were given warm cookies which are delicious and a nice touch I thought. You can also have complimentary bottles of water every day too.

We were not comfortable with the first room we were given as it was very small. I know it's to be expected as we were in NY however it would have felt, in our opinion, very claustrophobic for a 7 night stay. We asked for a bigger room and the hotel very kindly upgraded us on the second night once a bigger room became available.

The second room was lovely , very spacious and clean. We had a view of the river which was an added bonus. The room was cleaned to a very high standard every day.

The concierge staff are fantastic! They will answer any question you may have or sort out taxis for you.

We didn't eat at the hotel at all as we like to go out to explore the local area and we found some amazing places to eat. 

Would we stay here again? The answer would be yes without a doubt! 

* Not a hotel related issue but a little word of warning.....

Thankfully the hotel booked us a taxi through Uber on our way back to the airport. This was much cheaper than the traditional yellow taxis they have waiting outside of the airport when you land! The Uber price includes any toll or tip fees. The yellow taxi we were advised to get as it is a 'set fee' is not so set after all! The taxi driver insisted on a 25% tip on top of our fare. We travelled from Newark to the Financial District. We were made to feel very uncomfortable by the driver and did end up paying just so we could get out of the cab! Please don't get caught out like we did. A $125 taxi fare is not a good start to a holiday. Uber was around $80.

title: A one-time hotel
text:
My daughter and I stayed here for one night and that was the best part about the stay – that it was only one night. When I made the reservation I was not told that we would have to drive a block away and park our car in a garage and pay $80. Had I factored this into the room rate I would've just stayed at a better hotel with a garage in their building. What a major pain it is to walk in pouring rain with a heavy backpack and laptop bag and pocketbook (in  90° heat ) wading through a sea of people to get to the hotel and then again when we headed back home. 
We had a double room and it was fine. The best part about the room was the water pressure in the shower. IT WAS THE BEST. It felt great after a long day walking around the city. 
We had some room service- club sandwich and shrimp cocktail- it was okay. 
I hated the whole layout of the hotel.  The reception desk is on the second floor. The elevators take forever to come because it's a 40 something floor building and pretty old. 
 Next time I'm going to do a little more research and find a better suited hotel.
